Dear local newspaper, Many people throughout the world use, or own computers. Although there are many people who think computers are good for you, others could say different, pointing out potential downsides. While you are on the computer you can become more social by talking with friends or family who live far away. Also, while you are on the computer you might not notice it but; your hand-eye coordination is improving as you type and navigate, and finally, you are able to search with a click of a button, instead of searching your topic through dozens of books at a library. Computers have very many benefits. One being chatting, or talking online to friends, and family. You might have a distant friend that you haven't talked to in a while. With a computer you are able to re connect with your buddy through email or a message. If you have an account that is safe to chat on, you might be able to make new friends from different places. That would be good for you, socially, expanding your circle. It is always good to have friends, and stay in touch with family to maintain strong relationships. Some people find it hard to play a piano because they cannot look at the music and have their hands be doing something else. On a computer your hand-eye-coordination improves over time because, you are searching a topic as your hands are typing on the keyboard. Also, this is a great memory exercise for your fingers as you learn. You eventually memorize where all of the keys are located without looking. People without computers have to search through many books to find information on their topic, which takes a long time. Others with computers, just have to type in their topic and all the information they need is right in front of them on the screen. You are able to see pictures of your topic or even video's that provide more context! Not many books that I know, can search a topic, show you pictures, and videos of it with one resource so conveniently! Many people debate the fact if computers are good for you or not, weighing the pros and cons. If you ask me, computers are great for people. It allows people to be social, and talk to old friends; it also improves your hand-eye coordination, and finally; it gives you the option to search a topic without all the hassle of searching through dozens of books in a library. So now the question is up to you; are computers good for people, or not? The answer depends on how they are used.

Dear Newspaper People, I think that computers do benefit society for a few important reasons. Computers make work easier they can do things people can't like solve difficult problems, and kids like playing games on them for entertainment. Computers make work easier and neater for everyone involved. Typing is often faster than writing by hand, and is always easier to read for the recipient. Studies have also shown that people who use computers to do work finish faster and have up to thirty percent more free time to do whatever they want, like hobbies. Computers also have e-mail, which allows you to send work that you have done to your boss without printing it and wasting paper, which is good for the environment. Computers can solve difficult problems that people either can't do, or don't want to waste their time doing manually. If you need to solve a complex math problem you use a calculator or a computer program. So you don't have to figure it out yourself with pen and paper. I have to do a lot of math problems for homework and I think it is much easier to use a calculator to check my answers. My last reason why computers are good is that kids like playing games on them during their free time. A lot of people say that kids shouldn't play computer games but some of them are educational and teach valuable skills. Even non-educational games help kids to have fun and have something to look forward to after their work is done for the day. A majority of kids say that they are happier when they have something fun to look forward to, and happier kids do better work in school and at home. I hope that after reading this you will understand how much computers contribute to society by making tasks simpler and providing enjoyment.

If I was applying for a professional position of a job, I know I'll type my resume to make it look neat and professional. In conclusion, that's how computers are so helpful, beneficial, important and fun to our society.

Dear Local Newspaper, My name is Emily and I am a concerned citizen. I believe that computers do NOT benefit society at all! In my opinion, they make our town worse. People spend way too much time on their computers and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. All of these things are harms computers are doing to our society and it's time to make a stop to it! First of all, people are on the computer way too much. Teens are on social networking sites, adults are in chatrooms, and kids are playing computer games. Instead of that, people should be playing outside, or going for a walk in the park. Did you know that a large percentage of adults are overweight? If people cut back the amount of time indoors, we could probably bring that number way down. Also, who knows what teens are doing on the computer. Computers have good things but they can also be bad. For example, in chatrooms who knows what kind of people are in there. Children need to be careful about what they say or show on the internet. Instead of playing games or talking to their boyfriends and girlfriends, teens should go outside and exercise. Second, more citizens need to enjoy nature and the beautiful scenery around them. We're all so busy running to check our e-mail, we don't notice what a beautiful day it is outside. On a nice summer or spring day, people should take their kids to a local park or pond. This reminds me of last spring when I went to my cousin's house. My aunt only allowed us to watch one hour of TV a day, that included the computer. We were outside every single day, even if we were just staring into the clouds. This kept us active and helped us enjoy the environment. My last reason why computers are badly affecting society is that computers take time away from interacting with family and friends. I know what you're thinking, when you're on the computer you are talking to family and friends, but it isn't the same. Instead of instant messaging, call them. Maybe even invite them out to talk face to face. That reminds me of my sister. When I get home, she will normally be on her phone. Now, instead of getting up and coming to talk to me she will text me "What's up?" or "How was your day?" Computers help people communicate, but they also take real communication away. As you can see, I have given you three reasons why I strongly believe computers are badly affecting our community. Not only our community but everywhere! You need to open your eyes and understand that people spend way too much time on computers, they allow people to not enjoy nature, or interact with their families. Please I'm asking you to understand that our society will crash if we don't fix this issue. So what are you going to do about it?

Dear Editor, I think computers have a positive effect on people. Where would we be without them? Computers teach hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about any subject they want, and allow people to communicate with each other, no matter how far away. Obviously, computers are beneficial. I think computers have a positive effect on people. They teach hand-eye coordination, as I said earlier. I know people say that when you are on the computer, you spend less time exercising, but the computers help you with your throwing skills in games. Hand eye coordination also applies for if you want to be a surgeon or a doctor. You need to have steady hands and be ready to do whatever is needed. See, they do have a positive effect. I think computers have a positive effect on people. They give people the ability to learn about anything they want on the internet. Say you want to be an engineer when you grow up, you might want to learn anything and everything you can to be successful later on in that career. What about a doctor, you would want to know how many years of college and med school are required to get your medical degree. A computer helps you learn about those things. It can also teach you about tons of other subjects. Again, how could they not be positive. I think computers have a positive effect on people. Another thing they can do out of a hundred others is let you communicate with other people no matter how far away. Mail can go anywhere with enough postage, yes, but email is free and gets there in less than a minute where mail can take weeks to go far. For example, what if you came from another country. You wouldn't want to lose touch with people you grew-up with. With a computer, you could use Skype to see and hear the person. Talking on the phone or mailing letters doesn't even compare to that. You could never lose touch! Computers help people do all kinds of things. In conclusion, computers have a positive effect on people. They teach hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about any subject they want, and allow people to communicate with each other, no matter how far away. There are no bad reasons that could top any of these. They make sense. So, what do you think? Do you think they are good for us, or do we need less computers?

Dear newspaper, I feel as though internet or computers act as an advantage in society rather than a problem. They help with school work, like projects or email, making research and communication seamless. You can even take college online now, accessing lectures and materials from anywhere. People also use the internet for media or to simply catch up with friends, sharing photos and messages instantly. One of the most important reasons to have a computer is for school oriented reasons, like having a project that you need to get notes for or making a powerpoint presentation with images and charts. One other great reason is for the teachers, whose computers can help them teach a class in a way that is both fun and easy to understand through interactive software. The new uprising in computer use has brought about new ways of getting a college degree, offering flexibility for many students. Now you can even just simply get in bed, turn on your laptop, and take college classes right on your computer, saving time and travel costs. I don't know about you guys but I'd much rather take college in the own comfort of my home than drive to a campus all the time. Another great use for the internet is email, which makes our lives a lot easier now that more people use it for quick messages. It can send us school alerts like an early dismissal or a way to catch up with old high school friends, keeping everyone connected. Another great reason for the internet is for entertainment or just to have fun and relax after a long day. A large percentage of people that have computers use them for media or fun reasons, like gaming, or to go on to youtube to watch videos. Please add this article into your newspaper so that the computer can be put out there as a helping aid, and not something that is going to make the whole world obese because that's not just from computers. It's the people who use computers who felt that they don't get exercise, not the computers themselves. So why put them out in a bad way when they offer so many clear benefits for education and communication.

Have you ever had the time completely fly by while you're on the computer? You go on at a certain time and all of a sudden it's seven at night, with the hours slipping away unnoticed. People should spend less time on the computer because they should be outside, it takes away time with your family, and there are other ways to look up information. You should be outside, enjoying the fresh air and playing sports, not stuck inside all day with your eyes glued to a screen, missing the sunshine. When you're on the computer all day, you're just sitting there without moving your body at all. Seventy-two percent of kids who spend all their time on the computer are overweight, which shows the impact on health. Being on the computer on a beautiful day is like blocking out the birds' songs on the first day of spring, ignoring the world's natural beauty. Nature is amazing, and you should be outside enjoying it, not cooped up in a stuffy room leaning over a man-made machine. People should spend a lot less time on their computer to experience life more fully. When you're on the computer, time really flies by and you lose your whole day to it, and wouldn't you rather be doing something more fun and active? You can be alone on the computer in a dark room, isolated from those who care about you. You should be with your family and friends, creating memories that last a lifetime. Computers are going to be around for a long time, and when they die down it will only be because something better came along, but your relationships are irreplaceable. Your baby brother won't be a baby forever and your grandparents might not even be there tomorrow, so time is precious. Don't you want to spend as much time as you can with them, talking and sharing stories? You're changing too, so you might be off to college or have to move far away for business, making these moments even more valuable. "They grow up so fast. They're adults in a blink of an eye," my grandma said to my mom, highlighting how quickly time passes. Almost a majority of parents feel that same way, wishing for more family time. So, don't spend all your time alone with a machine, be with your loving family and cherish each moment you have together. People should spend less time on the computer because there are other ways to look up information and learn about new places that are more engaging. There are so many books in the world, about any topic you can imagine, filled with detailed knowledge. Using books to look up information is better than typing the word into google because it's important to learn how to use an index and find the book on the shelf, building research skills. A trip to the library may not be your cup of sunshine, so if you want to learn about a place, why don't you go to that place for a real adventure? If you're doing a report on a distant location for school it would be a lot of fun to go there for a few days to learn about it firsthand, immersing yourself in the culture. And you can take pictures with your own camera, not just a picture you found online, creating personal souvenirs. It would be a really fun family trip, bringing everyone closer together. Even if you're doing your report on a place as boring as a nearby town, you could still probably have a lot of fun, hanging out with your family and exploring new sights together. In conclusion, people should spend less time on the computer and more time being outside, with family, and at really fun places. Why would you want to stare at a screen all day when you could be having this much fun and building lasting relationships?

Dear Local Newspaper, Hello! I am an eighth grade student at Jefferson Middle School. I was reading your paper and I notice you had an article on how people are spending too much time on the computer and not enough time going outside, getting exercise, enjoying nature, and that it doesn't benefit society. I completely disagree with these comments. let me explain my point of view... Having computers definitely benefits for all students in their academic work. Sometimes kids forget their text books at school and cannot complete assignments. But if they have a computer, they can just google the information needed for their homework. That way they get their homework done, and don't have to take a zero for a missing assignment. Another thing is, I am sure you have heard of a website called, study island. If you haven't, it's a website for all the students in the district to take online courses for math, reading, and science. They are time consuming, but they count for a huge chunk of our grade which is very important. So, if we get an A on study island we get an A in one of our classes for that assignment. Not only does the computer help students but it helps me in a kind of personal way with my hobbies. I love the piano and want to learn how to play. But, there are no instructions in my area for lessons. However, there is a program on the computer called synthesia which is very helpful. It helps you learn all kinds of songs on your keyboard or piano by showing you which keys to press. The piano helps my hand-eye coordination as well as it teaches discipline and dedication to practice regularly. Now, synthesia isn't the only free instrument learning program available online. There are many others for different instruments! This helps people who can't afford lessons, and learning an instrument can help you achieve things later in life like joining a band. Now, one thing you said in your article is that people aren't getting enough exercise because of sitting in front of a computer all day. This is not completely true for everyone. In fact, most people go on the computer researching diet plans or local gyms to improve their health. How do I know this? Well one day when I went on google the top search of the day was, "weight watchers diet plan" which is very popular. Also, my mom uses an online video workout website, for her bad back and it helps her feel better. So not only does the computer help for diets, they can help physical therapy also for recovery. So with this letter I hope you realize that the computer does benefit our society in many ways, yes, we should not spend too much time on it and balance our activities. But, online learning sessions can be time consuming for good reasons. It helps many people figure out the right diet and workouts so they can stay happy and healthy in their lives.

Dear @CAPS1, I agree that computers are a benefit to society. The computers have a positive effect on people, such as improving hand-eye coordination through various interactive tasks. It helps you learn about other countries, religions, and other things from the comfort of your home. You can communicate, meet other people, and chat through computers, breaking down geographical barriers. Do you spend all or most of your freetime sitting at your computer? People are spending too much time on computers, leading to several negative consequences for our society. Obesity is a growing problem in today's society, and this is directly linked to the sedentary lifestyle fostered by computer use. There is absolutely no exercise involved with being on your computer, as it requires continuous sitting. People need to get outside and go jogging, play active games, or ride their bikes to counteract this. Cutting back on computer time would significantly cut back on the obesity problem in our society. Furthermore, top scientists and researchers say that it is extremely important for people to interact with others face to face. Throughout our whole lives, we will have to interact and socialize with others, and these skills are vital. If you don't develop these skills, you won't be happy where you end up. Talking to people over the computer is nowhere near close to the richness of talking to someone face to face. We also need to get some fresh air. Go experience nature. Being out on the beach, hiking in the woods, or even just sitting on the swing in your backyard can be the most refreshing experience. Fresh air clears your mind and relieves stress. Time magazine says that kids who spend time outside receive better grades than they would if they were inside on the computer. People need to relieve stress, and going outside is a perfect way to do that. It is time to click turn off your computers and get out of your chair. Go get some exercise, go interact with friends and family, or even just go outside and get some fresh air while relaxing. People are wasting too much time on their computers and it's flushing our society down the toilet, so just turn off your computer and reclaim your life.

Dear Newspaper, People are spending way too much time on the computer and it is not right. They should be exercising, and interacting with friends and family in person. Having a computer also distracts them from schoolwork and important responsibilities. Computers normally have effects like this on the people that use them, pulling them away from a balanced life. Instead of sitting at the computer all day, people should be out getting exercise. Our country is one of the countries with the most overweight people, and computer use contributes to this. Many teenagers are inside all day at the computer waiting for their friends' screen names to pop up so they can talk to them online. They don't need to be completely gone, but while they're waiting for their friend they could be exercising nearby. All they need to do is put on some fun music and start dancing around, that will get them the exercise they need for the day. They also could do ten pushups and twenty curl-ups, or even more if they wanted to, turning waiting time into productive activity. Having a computer affects the owner because they don't have a lot of face-to-face conversations with friends and family. You can call your friend up and have them come over your house instead of just messaging. If they can be at home on the computer for hours then they probably can hang out in real life and strengthen their bonds. Instead of videochatting with your cousins in another state, plan for them to come visit you guys one day. That way you can actually talk to them and see what they're doing too, creating lasting memories. You could also play board games, hide and seek, etc., which is much more fun than online interaction. The last but definitely not least effect that computers have on people's lives is it distracts them from school. Once you start talking with one of your friends online, it's pretty hard to stop and focus on homework. Many people don't know how to stop so they don't do the homework they were supposed to do, or they didn't study for the big test the next day, therefore they end up failing it. Some kids will do homework and be on the computer at the same time; the homework is probably wrong because they weren't concentrating on it hard enough. Having a computer affects your life in many different ways, some positive and some negative. Some ways are it "stops" you from exercising, it doesn't let you have face-to-face interaction with friends and family, and it distracts many kids from school, which is a significant concern for our community.

Wouldn't it be great to use computers in everyday life? In this country we can. You can use it to talk to people you never thought you would see again, rekindling old friendships. Looking at places far away is always an option, offering a virtual window to the world. You can even simply use it to help with homework essays, making studying more efficient. Locating and researching information, even about different countries and different continents, is possible to do on the computer. You can buy plane tickets, reserve hotel rooms, and even reserve tables at restaurants in different countries by just a few clicks. Another thing is, you can research countries, towns, and cities with Google instead of having to go out and get books from a library. Reading about and talking to people from different countries is always an option, broadening your horizons. Being able to talk and read about people and visit countries just by clicking a button is pretty amazing. Computers also allow us to talk and communicate with people when there is no other way to connect. The computers give people the ability to talk and see people they thought they would never communicate with anymore. An example of this is my father hadn't seen his father since he was two, but he started communicating with him and we were able to see him and chat with him through web chat. So these web chatting websites; ooVoo, Facebook, Myspace, Skype, etc., are allowing people to reconnect. This advantage is allowing friendships and family relationships to continue, is that really bad? Computers can help people with their homework and essays. For instance, they can type and print their essays instead of having to write it all out on paper. This helps because first it makes their work neater, and it also can be changed quicker and easier. They also can get information about what they are studying quickly and more efficiently. Instead of searching for a word in a big heavy dictionary they can use an online dictionary and just have to type in the word. Online dictionaries also have pronunciation help and different languages. This helps so much so they can get their work done faster and then have time to exercise, enjoy nature, or interact with family and friends. I hope you will take my opinion seriously and think about it; is using computers for daily needs really that bad? They clearly offer significant benefits that enrich our modern lives.

Dear Local Newspaper Editor, I am writing to you about my opinion on the effects computers have on people. I believe that there can be both good and bad effects. Computers make things easier for people, but we are also becoming too dependent on them. Man-kind should use books for research also, not just computers. Computers are very helpful for people in many situations. For example, if you really wanted to see a certain movie but you don't want to stand in a long line, people can go to movie tickets.com and purchase their tickets online. Then, once you get to the movie theater, all that's left to do is walk over to the kiosk and redeem your tickets quickly. Another example is that computers allow people to pay their taxes conveniently. There is special software that is able to be downloaded onto your computer for this purpose. Once the software has been installed, it will usually lead you, step by step, through the process of paying your bills correctly. It's much faster and much easier than paying "manually" with paper forms. These are some really good effects that computers have on people. However, computers also have their flaws. Over time, computers have caused most people to be lazy and less active. Some people have become too dependant on their computers for every task. Business owners, or businessmen and women in general, are constantly on their laptops or blackberries checking emails. Everywhere you look there is another adult on the internet or e-mail, even during meals. Not only adults do this though; students are becoming more dependant on the internet as well. For every assignment practically, students use Google or Bing to find answers. Sometimes they use Wikipedia or other similar sites. Students should just take the time to use their textbooks more often. The student body would rather watch television, play video games, or text than do homework. This is understandable because homework can be boring but it all pays off in the end for your education. Taking the extra ten minutes to use a textbook won't kill anyone. No one has died yet from using a book instead of Google. Also, in using a textbook, you will understand how to do whatever you're doing more deeply. That isn't so bad, is it? Computers, as you can see, have both good and bad effects on our lives. It's easy to use the internet for homework but that doesn't really help you learn the material fully. Making purchases is fun though, and it saves gas money and time. I hope you and the readers of this paper see my point of view about the balanced use of technology.

Also you can make plans with one of your friends on something if they live really far away or something like that, which is very convenient. It is a valuable tool for modern life.

Dear School Board Members, imagine life without computers. There would be no quick access to information, no easy way to socialize with friends, and no secure way to keep your health records or other personal information safe. Without this technology where would we be? I believe that the world is benefiting greatly from the advances in technology today. As a student, computers are a crucial element to allow me to get my work done efficiently. Without the guidance from grammar checkers, word processors, or other applications, it wouldn't be possible for me to reach my full potential on assignments. How could a student be so certain their grammar is perfect on their homework without asking a teacher? There is a way. It is called writing tools. However, the only way to access this is through a computer. These tools allow you to check your spelling, grammar, and punctuation with just a click of your mouse, saving valuable time. Computers are an essential learning tool for the school system today. Not only are computers used to educate, but they are helpful in the real world for many professions. Many businesses rely on the work of computers entirely for their operations. In fact, according to a local business owner, "In our job, we continuously work with clients and manage projects; this wouldn't be possible without the effort of our typist on the computer." Many businesses and companies around the nation are relying on the advances in technology, so why change anything? We should continue to progress in this growth. A significant percentage of business in our town say they would have to close down if not for computers. With so many businesses doing this, our economy would drop severely. This would not help our community. We all know computers and other technology are great sources of entertainment. What you may not know, however, is that they supply a great amount of knowledge to the average person. For example, lets say you finished watching a special on the discovery channel about a foreign country. You want to know more, so you pull out your smartphone. All you have to do is log on to the internet and search for more facts. Within seconds, you would have your information readily available. People may not believe so, but it is true that you can learn a great deal of information from various forms of technology. You can have all the resources you'll ever need right at your fingertips. Computers supply so much more then just entertainment; they are gateways to knowledge. All reasonable people would agree advances in technology are extremely helpful to the public. There is so much guidance for our daily lives through computers, and we should embrace these tools for a better future.

Computers have helped people tremendously over the past years. Thanks to computers, scientists have found cures for diseases, and jobs have become easier for many. I believe that computers have a fundamentally positive effect on people because they educate individuals in their professional roles and offer free communication channels. If someone were to travel to a new country, they might use a computer to learn more about that nation's history and culture. Another thing they might do is go to a website that could help them find affordable travel options or lodging. If a child is doing a school report about a country in Africa, they can go on the computer to find out key facts and statistics about that country. Computers educate people about places all over the world; you can visit a news website that has videos and written articles about current global events, helping you learn about what is happening. My grandmother would tell me stories about her work in an office before they had computers, now my dad works on a computer in his office and he tells me stories about his day. When you compare the two different decades, it seems like computers help out a lot within the modern workplace. Before computers, store clerks would have to do math on a pad of paper when giving change back to people, but now transactions are processed quickly by punching numbers into a computerized cash register. I think computers have significantly helped people with their jobs. When you talk on the phone to someone, it usually costs you money per minute. When you just want to see someone, it can cost you money to get on a plane. With computers, you can send emails or instant message people without any costs. If you want to see a friend for her birthday but don't have the money to fly halfway around the world to see her, you can video chat with her online. Computers help people save money by enabling free communication with friends, family, and even co-workers. Computers have been very helpful ever since they were invented. They help people learn about places all over the world and about anything they want to learn about. They also make jobs and work easier and help people save a lot of money by talking to people on the computers instead of on the phone. Computers have improved dramatically over the years; the screens used to be so small and you would have to press all these buttons just to open a program, and now computers can be as big as a flat-screen television and can be turned on with just a push of a button. Who knows what computers will be like fifty years from now? They will likely continue to evolve and provide even greater benefits to society.

Hello, I decided to write in to the paper on the topic of computers, and how they benefit society. Computers are powerful machines, and can be used for completing otherwise menial and boring tasks efficiently. They benefit people in many ways, like they are very useful in business, helpful in education, and connect friends and family together. Computers are useful in business and are an extremely important tool in a common workplace today, and make work get done much more efficiently than if they didn't have computers. One reason computers are so useful in the workplace is because they can store far more data than could ever be put on paper files. Also, they can do jobs and processes very quickly, which is important for meeting deadlines in the workplace. They can also be used for sending important information quickly and without much trouble via email or internal networks. These are all valid reasons computers are beneficial in business, and help things get done smoothly. Computers are important in today's schools and educational programs because they can help students work in a more efficient fashion. "A significant percentage of all surveyed students said they would rather type a paper for school than write one by hand, and this shows that they value them in their education," said a professor at a major university. This shows that computers are important to students, and are used for their benefit. In addition to students writing papers, computers are being used by teachers and school systems for grading, maintaining attendance records, and creating lesson plans. The teachers at my school are using interactive whiteboards, pieces of hardware that are directly connected to computers, and can be used instead of traditional whiteboards, and I see that students are getting more involved in class, and focused, because this computer technology is being used. All of these applications are reasons computers are helpful in educational processes, and should continue to be used. Many people want to be able to talk to their friends and family when they are bored, and because of computers and social networking websites, and instant messaging programs, this is made much easier. "A large majority of teens have at least one social networking site they visit on a regular basis," said a psychologist, who specializes in teens. This shows that people use these sites, and that they like them for staying connected. Families that are separated because one member has moved out of the house recently might want to communicate with one another, and because of computers, they can. There are multiple ways that they could use their computers to keep in touch, like instant messaging systems mentioned before or through video calls. Being able to communicate with one another makes these people happy, and benefits society by maintaining strong relationships. Overall, being able to communicate through computers is an enjoyable thing for many people, and is important to society today. To conclude, computers contribute to society in ways that make it much better for everyone. Whether it's through helping businesses be more efficient, giving students the ability to work faster, and in a way they prefer, or if it's helping people stay in touch, computers are always benefiting society. These machines hardly ever slow people down more than manually doing the work would, and the positive influence they have far outweighs the bad they do, making them indispensable in our modern world.

Dear The Editorial Board, "Thump, thump, thump," goes the floor. "Look, oh here comes Pete." "Seriously, is he getting fat?" "All he does is play on the computer all day long." This is a common scene in an increasing number of teenagers' rooms throughout the country who are playing on the computer too much. This behavior needs to stop. "Excessive playing on computers is one of the worst things that they can do with their time," said a member of the international health committee. There are always going to be obese people around the world but in the past decade the nation has doubled the amount of obese children in all of the region. Statistics show that over a third of the American population is obese and very much so. The future of America is all obese lazy kids who only want to sit down in front of a screen all day. A high percentage of children who don't experience nature at a young age never fully appreciate it. Since they play on the computers all day they don't ever use nature, they won't care for it and litter and pollute even more. Just children playing on the computer can be very bad for the environment like it is bad for themselves. Not only do the computers hurt the children and the environment, it hurts the family and friends; children who are on the computer all day aren't spending enough time with their family and friends. Families are supposed to be close and they can't be if someone is playing on the computer all day. Just a couple of weeks ago a teenager stated that he got grounded because he was playing on the computer so much he didn't talk to his mom in two weeks. A notable percentage of people who get divorced happen because of the arguments over the amount of time spent on the computer, according to a researcher from the Yale marriage research center. If children knew that they might cause their parents to divorce they might stop playing on the computer so much. Therefore children shouldn't spend that amount of time on their computer because of the health risks, the environmental disconnection, and their families' well-being. So its up to the people really, do you want a nice physically fit nation where every family is close or a rundown obese hole in the wall that is "called" the United States? The choice seems clear for a healthier future.

I believe that computers have good effects on people. Computers allow people to stay in touch with long distance friends or family members easily. Computers have educational games for kids that help them learn, and, also, people can learn new things through online resources. My first reason is that, computers allow people to stay in touch effectively. If someone in their family lives a long distance away then they could always use e-mails to talk regularly. That way they won't lose each other due to distance. Also, sometimes, friends move away and you always want to keep in touch with them. Another thing is that, if they want to send photos to each other, they can use e-mail attachments for instant sharing. Also, because sending photos through regular mail takes forever, email is much faster. Please, let the people stay in touch through these wonderful tools! My second reason is that, computers have games kids can play. The games kids play could help them learn more about subjects like math or history. Sometimes watching television doesn't help with active learning. If they actually play the game and see what they're doing, then they will get smarter through interaction. That's what we want for our kids, right? Also, kids have fun playing these educational games, which makes learning enjoyable. Do you really want to take this valuable learning experience away from them? My third reason is, computers help people learn new things every day. Like, they could go on the computer and learn what's happening in the world through news sites. People can learn new words they never knew about by using online dictionaries. Also, pictures on the computer help with visual learning, too. For example, if someone is traveling somewhere, and they don't know the price of a hotel, they can get on the computer and check it out quickly, right? So, in conclusion, I believe that computers are a good use of technology. They help people stay in touch, help kids learn by playing interactive games and help people learn new things about the world and more. So, I'm saying, please, keep the computers in our lives. They are not a waste of our time but a valuable resource. Trust me on this, as they bring more benefits than harms to our daily lives.

Dear Editor, In the past ten years, advances in technology have completely changed the world and how we live. Technology makes people's lives much easier and helps keep more and more people connected throughout the world via the internet. More jobs are created in the tech sector and these innovations help speed up ordinary events such as filing taxes, sending messages, receiving news, and teaching students. However, many studies have proven that too much use of technology can make teens and adults addicted to the internet and their devices. In this addiction, many people can lose valuable time with their family, time to exercise and enjoy the outdoors. Since being part of the generation growing up in the new technology era, I have had a first hand experience with the benefits of the new technology. I believe that this technology is a great help to society today despite some drawbacks. Many more jobs are being created because of this technology boom. For example, think about how many people could be employed if a new computer system was created from scratch. There would be thousands of people working on many things such as the founder, manager, creator of new ideas or just working at the new company's retail store selling the products. Running a business or a corporation is a very difficult job to do, requiring coordination and efficiency. But because of the advances in technology, running a business can become much easier and not as much time is wasted on manual tasks. With the new technology, people can send emails within seconds instead of running around the entire office giving out paper memos, which saves time and resources. Also for businesses, their stocks and company performance can be updated every minute on financial websites. These advances will make companies easier to run and make them more efficient in a competitive market. With the advances in technology, average people can be updated on the news around the world every minute through online platforms. Also when it comes time to pay taxes, you can fill them out and pay online without visiting an office. None the less, there is more entertainment open to everyone, from streaming movies to playing games. Through today's new technology, people's lives are made much easier on a daily basis. They can work faster from home, get more errands accomplished online, learn more through educational websites, connect to people around the world via social media, and be caught up with local and international news as it happens. Technology is benefiting society in numerous ways and will hopefully continue making life easier and more connected for future generations.

Dear local newspaper, my best friend, Alex, was once a nerd with no hand-eye coordination. However, after he started to use a computer regularly, now he has better hand-eye coordination than me. The computer not only teaches hand-eye coordination, but it also gives people the ability to learn about far away places and people, and allows millions of people to talk on line with others. My friend wasn't the only person who learned hand-eye coordination. About seventy percent of people learn hand-eye coordination using a computer. It might take some months to learn, but once a child knows how, they will be outside for hours practicing what they've learned. Who would not want to learn hand-eye coordination? In addition, the computer gives people the ability to learn about far away places and people. A computer engineer, Dr. Evans, says, "One in every three people learn about places and people through the internet." Learning will take a few hours, but you will be educated. Why would someone think we are spending too much time on the internet if we are being educated? Additionally, don't you have a friend who lives more than a hundred miles away from you? If you do, then a computer will solve your problem of communication. My friend, Sarah, lives five hundred miles away from me. We communicate using Hotmail, Yahoo, and Facebook. The best thing of all is that it is free, unlike a telephone. Furthermore, a computer specialist, Ms. Garcia, says, "I learned hand-eye coordination using a computer. Most importantly, I was able to hand in my essay on time because of the information a computer provides and I was able to communicate with my family." I didn't want to tell you this, but I was also a nerd with no hand-eye coordination and I learned just like Alex learned. We aren't spending too much time, we are just being educated and connected in a modern world.

Dear Newspaper, In today's world we are dependent on computers. Modern computers have become the most helpful source of technology. We need computers for so many things, and they benefit society immensely. They can help people talk online, they're educational, and they improve hand eye coordination. It has been amazing how computers help us so much. We need computers like we need water; if we didn't have them, how would we survive? Computers have become the glue to friendships. They help keep friendships strong when you don't see the friend constantly. I have a friend that moved to California last year. It was way too expensive to just call or text her. So as a result, I keep in contact with her through the computer. Everyday we email and use Skype to keep in touch. Those services cost very little per year. If I were to call her, each call would cost a significant amount. If it weren't for the internet I seriously know that our friendship would collapse. Computers have been so helpful for many people with this same problem. Computers have become the number one source to find information. They have become more popular than the library and text books combined. So many essential resources are on computers. Text books, calculators, and even homework are online. Many people say that computers aren't educational, but scientists say it can move a students grade from a C- to an A+. Teachers say the same thing too. One of my fellow students said that computers changed his life. He used to be forgetting to write down his homework, but he looks online and he has all of it. Now he knows what pages to read from the science book. If you don't think that computers have changed students lives, well think again. There are also games that improve hand eye coordination. Many sports teams like the Wildcats use this. It has increased their hand eye coordination by twenty percent. The team says if it wasn't for the hand eye coordination game, then they would have never have won the state championship. This game is also free online for anyone to use. Everyone that has used it said it really improved their reaction time. The games are also fun and non violent. They have games like baseball, hockey, and hurdles. This game has made a great improvement on people's lives. If we don't have computers then our hand eye coordination will decrease by fifteen percent. Would you want to be the person to take away computers? In conclusion, computers have made a great impact on today's society. Computers are educational, you get to talk to friends, and improve your hand eye coordination. Computers have made a big improvement on how we live, and it's for the better. If we didn't have computers then friendships would break, grades would decrease, and hand eye coordination would plummet. We need computers; they have been so beneficial to billions of people across the globe. Many people depend on computers. So if we take away computers then you'll be letting many lives down. No sane person would want to take away computers. Computers have benefited society in so many ways.

Dear Local Newspaper, the opinion for using "too much" computer time is an outrage. I think people should have more ideas for alternative activities. Such ideas include exercise, socializing with family and friends, and lastly, "you time" which means to do whatever you would like to do indoors but without computers. For exercise you can do any sport that you like outside. For socializing and spending time with family and friends you can have a nice family reunion at their house or just hangout with your friends. For "you time" you can draw, or read a book. There is a lot of ideas instead of "computer time" all the time! With exercising you can go outside and play sport such as basketball, soccer or baseball, etc. You could even play hide and seek with your friends or even tag. Anything that keeps you moving out of the house instead of using computers! If you exercise everyday such as a "workout" to get fit you will definately manage that instead of using "computer time". Exercising is a good idea instead of using "computer time!" Socializing with family and friends is a good use instead of "computer time" because you can finally have the time to spend time with them like talk to them, play games or eat dinner together. That's called "socializing". Your family and friends will love to spend time together by eating dinner together and have a nice conversation. You could also play any board games such as "Monopoly" too. With your friends you can go to the movies, have a sleepover or play outside. Many good little ideas to do with family and friends instead of using "computer time." The last idea for instead of using "computer time" is doing "you time" indoors. WARNING! But without computer time! You could do something quiet like draw a nice picture. That's something nice and quiet to do instead of using "computer time." Or you could even read a book too. Maybe you have to catch up on your nightly reading for language arts and you want start reading your goal book. If you choose to do "you time", you will definately manage to undo that useless "computer time!" All of these ideas for not using the computer are very easy. It's not healthy to sit around the computer all day! Instead you can exercise. You could also socialize with family and friends. Lastly, do "you time", but don't use a computer!!! If you want to achieve a goal you can manage that by choosing these healthier and more engaging activities.

Computers have caused many people to lose money, friends and time. In fact, since computers became widely available, lots of people have been spending way too much time on them. This can cause people to loose time and friends. Computers and technology today have had a very strong influence on very many people. Spending too much time on computers can cause you to loose time and money. For example, my oldest brother was very large at the age of twelve or thirteen because our computer started working, but this had a positive impact on him, he started participating in sports such as basketball and lacrosse and found that he was very good at them and followed lacrosse through highschool. While doing this he saved my parents money. This is one reason how computers have had a negative effect on people. The new technology has caused people to loose lots of time when they could be doing other things that would help them in life. For example, many people in the neighborhood spend half of their day on computers, and not getting the exercise they need; a primary cause of this are video games played on computers. This is another affect that computers can have on people is loosing touch with friends. For example, I used to be friends with a person, but then he did not talk to me for almost the entire school year because he was always on the computer, which made me think that he did not want to be friends but actually he just dedicated almost all of the year to the computer. Since we resolved this I have been over to his house about five times this year as opposed to every weekend. This is another way computers can change your life. The time has come to decide whether to have a computer or not. In my mind I believe that it would be best for everyone if we did not have such reliance on computers, but if you do have one, then we should have a certain time limit on computer use. In your home, so you and your family members don't loose family time, exercise time, or friends. Overall, I think that it would be best for everyone if we had a time restriction on computers to avoid spending the whole day on them.

Dear Editor, My name is John and I do not believe that computers are very beneficial to our society. Computers do not benefit us because they are stopping many people from exercising and living a healthy life, playing sports, and enjoying the outdoors. Computers are stopping many people, particularly the younger generations, from exercising. Now a days instead of hitting the gym many people are home on the computer talking to friends or playing computer games. As a result many people are not as healthy as they should be. It's also recorded that any person who is on the computer for large amounts of times are hurting their eyes, resulting in an increase of people wearing glasses. If people were to go and start doing things besides the computer they will live a happier, healthier, and better life. Unfortunately, many young people are not getting into play sports. During this decade many sports games have come out for the computer. Now instead of pushing themselves to work hard for a sport, kids either play with no heart or don't play at all. The reason for this is because they can instead work extremely hard on their custom teams in video games. Also the computer is not the only electronic stopping kids from playing sports; xbox, playstation, and other console systems that play games distract kids. I myself, had been caught thinking more about an xbox game then my own hockey game! Not only are these electronics pulling kids in like magnets but the parents are allowing their kids to play video games or stay on the computer for hours on end. Many of us don't know what its truly like to go outside and camp or to spend time with their family. I came from a close family and many other families are very close, so its natural to be doing things with your father or brother or whole family or cousin. However not too many families are as close as they could be so they do not do something together. If some fathers took their sons fishing or camping, it would get them away from computers and the father/son bond will become stronger. These are my reasons sir and they should be thought over for quite sometime. Just remember that many people need to exercise, many need to play sports, and many families need to experience the outdoors together to build stronger, healthier lives.

Dear Local Newspaper, I think that using computers is a good thing and it does not affect exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. Here are three reasons to support my opinion: people learn more on the internet, children at school can go online to find what was for homework, and how the internet does not affect everyday life. My first reason why I think using computers is good is because people learn more on the internet. You know what people say, you learn something new everyday. Well, if you are wondering about something or if you're thinking about something, the internet can help you find what you're looking for. @ORGANIZATION1 is a great site to find what you're looking for. It also has its own images if you need a picture for a project you are working on. My second main reason for why using the internet is good is because if you are a @CAPS1, you can go online to check what you have for each subject. If you are a @CAPS1 and you don't want to do homework at recess the next day from being sick, you can go online to your school's website and click on your teachers' names to see what you have for homework. This way you can still have time to go outside, play with friends, and interact with family members. My third and final reason for why using the internet is good is that it affects everyday life, in a good way. If you don't have a t.v. and you have no idea what the weather is like, you can go online to see if it's going to be snowy, or rainy. This can tell you if you need a jacket or a rain jacket, if you need to use a shovel or hold an umbrella. The internet can be useful in everyday life. In conclusion, I think using the internet is very good and will not affect your exercise, or interacting with family. To support this I stated, people learn more on the internet now, children can access homework if you missed a day, and how the internet affects your everyday life in a good way.

Do you remember the last time you looked something up on the computer? Many people use computers, but not everyone agrees that this benefits society. Those who support advances in technology believe that computers have a positive effect on people. I support computers because they help with writing, looking up information and provide communication. One reason I support computers is because they help with writing. You can tell I do not have the greatest handwriting. To help this, I type almost all of my papers. Computers can also help people with spelling and grammar. There are even systems now that let you say something and @CAPS1 will appear on the screen, which is very helpful for getting ideas down quickly. This is just one reason I support computers. Next, computers are beneficial because of the information they can provide. Before computers you would need to go to the library and find around ten books that might not even have what you're looking for. Now you can find hundreds of articles on any topic in minutes. The amount of information out there is unimaginable and easily accessible. I think computers are a great piece of technology because of the information they can provide. Finally, I believe computers are a benefit to us because of communication. One form of communication that came out recently is @CAPS2. @CAPS1 is a website that lets you send messages to a friend, share pictures, videos and many more things. E-mail lets you send letters to people via internet instantly, which is much faster than traditional mail. I could go on forever about forms of communication on the internet. This is the last reason I support computers. Computers are a great benefit to society. They help with writing, communication, and everyone could benefit from computers.

Dear Newspaper, Computers have been a great learning source and I think it's time we give them some credit instead of worrying over them. I will be telling you about how I think computers are great. One reason they are very helpful is that books don't always have all of the information. So if you need to know a fact or need more information for a project you can go on the computer and it's all right there and you will have known more facts then when you started. The second reason is that you can be almost anywhere and have access to a computer and you might not have a phone but you can talk or send a message. Not everyone has a phone but computers are a secondary way to have a conversation with someone, which helps people stay in touch. Another reason is its not always sunny outside and when it is a rainy day you have a fun way to play and learn without having to be outside. The computer doesn't replace the outdoors or exercising it is just a pastime when you don't have the opportunity to be outside, offering activities for indoor days. I hope you liked and understood my reasons and will take them into consideration when going over the topic of computers in our community.

I think computers help people out because you can learn about other things like @CAPS1 you want a job you can look it up on the computers. Also @CAPS1 you have a problem they will help you out. @CAPS1 you want to go somewhere you could go and be on the computer and look how it is and @CAPS1 you like it you could go @CAPS1 not look somewhere else you want to go. It really cool to connect with others. I think the computer isn't bad for people computer help them a lot with learning and having fun.

Dear local newspaper, Computers are they a good benefit for society or a bad benefit for society? What do you think would you enjoy always being on the computer? I wouldn't, so this is why I believe that computers have a negative impact on society. First reason why I think computers have a negative impact is because you can become addicted to always having to be on the computer. Becoming addicted to the computer leads to serious consequences. For example you spend less time exercising and that isn't healthy for your body physically. Not exercising leads to many things like being over weight, health problems, diseases like diabetes, and many other things, but usually these are the main problems. You can avoid this by turning off the computer and just go for a small walk, but because of what computers have to offer now these days people won't do this. That's one reason why computers have a negative impact on the society. Another reason for why computers have a negative impact on society is because you won't spend as much time with your friends and family. Even if you don't know this if you spend more time on the computer than with your family and friends this affects them in many ways. They can feel disappointed worried about you, even concerned. When you are always on the computer you're ignoring your family and this hurts them emotionally. Think about how would you feel if you had a best friend you always hung out with. You two did everything together, and then all of a sudden your best friend suddenly stops calling you; or visiting you and hanging out with you. You would feel disappointed because you loss your best friend over a computer. These things can happen if you go overboard when using the computer. This is why I think computers don't do good they do more harm in my personal opinion. The final reason why I say that computers aren't way good is for a main reason safety. These days computers have all the websites like @CAPS1, @CAPS2, twitter, and others. There are so many kids who chat with people they don't even know. Also they're posting pictures of themselves without even thinking that this is a dangerous thing to do. Once you post those pictures they will always be there no matter if you even try to delete them. Another thing when you're on the computer people don't even think about their safety and that's how things happen. For example you can think you're talking to a friend but as it turns out you were talking to some stranger. Then you go meet up with your friend when it really wasn't. So you see safety is a real big problem with these computers. That's why I believe computers have a really negative impact on society. As a result, do you still believe that computers are a good benefit for society or bad benefit? My opinion still is the same and I'm sure that there are others who believe the same. So this is why I think that computers are a bad benefit for society, and that computers can lead to more harm than do any good for people who use the computer.

Dear Newspaper, As computers become more and more a part of everyday life, people begin to question whether or not they have a positive impact. Computers are a technological wonder that has a positive effect on people. The world wide web, unlimited socialization, and simulations are just a few of the benefits of computers. The internet provides access to the world wide web. Infinite amounts of information can be found on your computer. "In almost every school, students rely on the internet to gain information," stated the education secretary, @PERSON1. Also, search engines provide access to thousands of information-loaded pages. In addition to unlimited information, the web holds thousands of different web pages. With these, people can learn about other people's opinions or spend time playing games. The web is only one thing out of hundreds of great things about computers. Socialization is a huge part of the modern lifestyle. Web cams on computers allow people to talk with friends who live miles away. No longer will people have to take an airplane to talk with friends on the other side of the world. Also, instant messaging and email are the main communication systems for thousands of people. It is the most efficient way to talk to friends. In fact, I became reconnected with a lot of people I hadn't talked to in a long time by getting email. Everybody loves talking with their friends and family, and this is made easier by using computers. Simulations are a huge benefit of computers. Many simulation programs are used to help people in their lives. Many professions use simulations on computers to help learn how to do their job; nine out of ten medical schools have the use of surgery simulations as part of their training course. Also, simulations and gaming on computers reveal interest for many people. I myself have a greater interest in history now after playing many historical-themed computer games. Also, many games and computer simulations have helped many people learn new things; there are countless learning games and simulations that are accessible by computer. Simulations add huge benefits to owning a computer. As technology advances, people are opened up to many possibilities such as information via the web, unlimited socialization, and simulations. The benefits of computers are many and the problems few. So, how can you keep up in a world where computer users hold the advantage if you deny the benefits of computers? Computers affect people in a positive way, providing tools for learning, connection, and growth that are essential in the modern era.

Computers. One of the much enjoyed pieces of technology. But it is also one of the many distractions. Many people ponder if computers are really beneficial. I am one of those thinkers. I think that computers don't always benefit society. They have many, many distractions such as Facebook, online games, and even inappropriate images and videos. My mother always says to me, "If you're having trouble finding information, go on the computer," because she knows that there is all the information in books on the internet, and more. And it's just one click away, case closed on that, the computer has positive effects on you because it gives you quick and reliable information. In addition, computers have positive effects on you when you're trying to have fun. For example, social media. Social media is used by teens and adults, and for one reason only, to socialize with friends via computer. If you want to know what your best friend is up to, the best thing to do would be to go on a social media site and ask. A recent study shows that in a family of five, four of them use the internet to communicate and socialize with friends. Obviously, this is how computers have a positive effect. In conclusion, whether you're bored at home and it's a rainy day, or if you have to write a research paper you saved until the last minute, a computer will be there for you. Positive effects computers have are that they are quick and reliable, and they are fun to use.

Dear The Editor, There has been an argument whether computers do or do not have a positive effect on people. To conclude, computers have a positive effect on people. Did you know hand-eye coordination can be helpful at times? Well, it is true because if you are in distress and the phone is broken and you don't have a cellphone then send an emergency e-mail to one of your friends informing them to call for help and since you have hand-eye coordination you can type without having to look down. Finally, with hand-eye coordination it can help you can join the army because if you spot a threat you can aim and shoot quickly without having to take out the gun after threat attacks. To conclude, computers teaches hand-eye coordination. Have you ever wanted to go to a foreign place? Well with computers you can do that you can just search the place and see what the place has. In summarization, computers have a positive effect on people. It helps them have hand-eye coordination, learn about new places, and lets them talk.

Computers teach you hand-eye coordination. When you type with a keyboard, you have to know where each letter is. This makes it possible to look at the screen to recognize my errors. Without the internet, we would be very behind on important news updates around the world. My last reason why computers have a positive effect on people is because it is efficient for work and they help the environment. Computers help the environment because you are not using as much paper. Throughout the year, @CAPS2 use billions of sheets of paper to write letters. With computers that number goes down into the thousands. Why you may ask? Emails don't require paper. They are electronic, which means no paper. They are also environmentally friendly because newspaper companies are going out of business. Due to online newspapers, print news is becoming less and less popular. Computers are efficient for work because it is so easy to make presentations. There are so many programs to use, that making a big presentation could take minutes. That is why computers make work easy but help the environment at the same time. As you can see, computers have many positive effects on people. Let me ask you this question again. Has your computer ever crashed when you needed to do a big project? Now you know that computers make life efficient. What would you do without them? So now it's your turn, go out and buy a computer because you will be thankful you did.

Good judgment comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgment, a quote from my uncle's dad. Computers haven't been around all that long for the public, so the public has little experience. Therefore, the public also lacks good judgment in using computers and the detrimental effects are starting to show. Computers have caused damage to people! To begin with, computers can be a health issue for people. In studies in the United States, six out of ten students who spend their time (five or more hours) are wearing glasses because of the bad physical effects the screen has on your eyes. Furthermore, computer games are made to be addicting, which causes people to sit in front of the computer instead of exercising. This may be one of the biggest causes of obesity in America! My little brother used to be addicted to a flying game, and he sat in front of it for hours every day and started to get fat. As soon as he stopped playing it and going outside more he immediately started to lose fat. Therefore, people need to move around more instead of sitting in front of the computer. To continue, my second argument is about detrimental effects computers have on the environment. First, computers need electricity to run. That electricity comes from power plants. Over seventy percent of America's power plants are coal, petroleum, or natural gas based. When people turn on the computer because they are bored, it wastes electricity that doesn't need to be used. Furthermore, scientists suspect humans are now a major cause of global warming. It is common sense that those power plants burn their respective fuels to create electricity. In other words there is a definite connection between computers and global warming. Also, the power plants release pollutants into the air that can eventually cause acid rain. To end with, my last argument is about people's skills. In a school survey, children who used their computers for more than four hours per day didn't know how to cook or how to even light a match! There is a definite connection between the two as most people just put something in the microwave to eat to be able to go back to the computers as fast as possible. The matches are lit by parents to light fires or candles, but what happens when a natural disaster strikes like in California or Florida? How will children be able to fend for themselves? The only way to cook would be with fire. There wouldn't be microwaves to cook canned food with. Furthermore, how would children be able to even start a fire without knowing how to light a match? Evidently excessive computer use could have very detrimental effects in a natural disaster, even to adults, so we need to stop it! Do you want America to be thought of as lazy and unhealthy? Should the environment, our only home, suffer because of a few bored people? How will we handle a major natural disaster? In conclusion, people are spending too much time on their computers, and they need to stop! People are becoming unhealthy, harming the environment, and losing important life skills. We need to all come together and cooperate to keep people healthy, to retain our life skills, but most importantly save our one and only beautiful Earth.

Dear Mrs. Johnson, Parents these days are telling kids to go outside instead of vegging out in front of a computer. Computers can but promote bad habits. Internet and computers are designed to suck in your brain, and attach you to all the websites and neat little things. It is more effective just to go to a local YMCA or community center to work out. I swim on a swim team for a YMCA. I love swimming better than going on the computer. It satisfies my personal needs of exercising. I lost fifteen pounds by just swimming for a month. I will run on the treadmill to help me burn off stress or anger. Gyms are way better than computers. I know most of us have seen something inappropriate on the computer. Yes, computers give people jobs but there is no need to post pictures or messages that will hurt people's feelings. I know the other day I saw a really mean comment that made me feel bad for the victim. I know YouTube is trying to stop inappropriate content, so hurray for them. Once you give something to the internet it is lost forever. Yes, computers have ways to keep in touch with friends but it is better to call or visit in person. Like my coach always said, "Call more, it builds character!" Whenever I get the chance I call my best buddies instead of using the computer. Kids these days can be mean without trying. You disconnect yourself from your family because computers attract users, and there are times where you don't pay attention to others around you. Sixty percent of kids do not do their homework because of computers. Thank you for your time. I think computers are bad and everyone would be happy without them. They help the obesity level in the nation, let cyber bullying and inappropriate content flow around the internet and lastly block you out from the world. I.S. someday computers are going to take over the world and you will be sorry you didn't listen to me.
