Dear Local Newspaper Editors, As our technology advances, so do our lives. Computers are a perfect way to better our way of life in ways that are beneficial to us and future generations. The use of computers, and the internet alone allow us to learn about the way of life in other places on Earth, talk to people faraway, and express ourselves creatively. Computers give us a bright future filled with possibilities. First, many people, actually a large percentage of the world's population are generally stationary, and live in a local town or city environments. This is why computers are so helpful because they give us a way to research other places around the globe. We can create an interest in other cultures, and shape our opinions as we discover things about other places. From there, we can look at different topics in a wide spread point of view. In doing this we will connect to other ways of life. A famous philosopher and poet once state "We learn about ourselves through the discovery of others." Furthermore, another particularly handy function of the internet through computers is that we can communicate with people who live far away, when we couldn't visit otherwise. A recent study showed that actually a majority of use of the computer is communication with sites like Facebook or Twitter. A scientist in California, Dr. Evans, says that humans tend to enjoy communication because it gives us a sense of unity. This is why so many companies are realizing that sites for social networking, video calls, and instant messaging are gaining in popularity." And this is true. It is enjoyable to video chat, talk, or email others. Without computers, this couldn't be possible. Lastly, computers give us the chance to express our ideas like never before. Now, stars aren't only made in Hollywood, but now you can make yourself famous on YouTube or Instagram. Just ask a famous singer, who's voice reached out and caught the attention of a major record company. Now, everyone knows his name and listens to his music. Like him, the more wordy folks can express themselves by blogging their opinions. " About half of computer use, " says a contributor to computer weekly, " is using blogs and videos to state one's ideas." We can persuade others to think as we do and discover things that we have discovered. Self-expression is very important to society, and this is why computers have such an affect on people. Therefore, it is clear, computers have a positive affect on people and society. They allow us to learn about faraway places, communicate with others, and inspire the world around us with our ideas. Welcome to the future.

Dear People of our town, How many hours a day do you spend being active? Now answer me this, how much time do you spend on your computer? Too many individuals today are sitting down in front of a computer, laptop, etcetera, while not enough are lacing up their shoes for a jog. Computers are ruining us; they deter our social skills, damage our health and cause us to be lazy. They are unbeneficial to our society and our well-being. To start with, millions of people sign up for social media sites, online forums, and other websites like these to reconnect with people. Do you realize what this means? Now no one has to get in a car and go visit anyone else. There is no longer a need to interact with other life forms in person, nor is there a want to. Let's say there's a woman sitting on her couch. All of a sudden her face lights up with the thought of her friend Sarah. She gets up to go start the car, but her eye catches on the computer screen. She bites her lip, trying to decide whether to go see her, or have an online chat. Feeling lazy, she sits back down. Do you really want that happening to everyone? It's too late; it already has. Moving along, I'd like to take a moment to talk about our physical health. As most of us know, fresh air is good for us. Imagine this, you're walking through the woods on a trail. The crisp, cool air, tickles your skin, and breathing it in just makes you smile. Your entire body feels energized from the trekking. With passels of days like this ahead, you can't wait. Now imagine this, you're sitting in front of a computer, in a hot, stuffy room. You back aches from being in this position so long. Plus you think you're getting a cold and you have a migraine. You'd get off, but you have another app request. You don't feel like moving back to reality. Which do you prefer? Above and beyond all this, there's exercise to worry about. I mean, when's the last time that you yourself went on a bike ride? I'm sure you know that it's good for your body if you exercise, but you're too busy on the computer. I think it's safe to say that half of our community would rather update their social media profile than get up and move. It's crucial to our health that we get active and stay fit. To sum up, a lot of us are pondering whether or not to spend more time on the computer. Well here's your answer, "Don't." Not enough people are interacting now a days, they're spending the best years of their lives stuffed up in a house, and most importantly, let's face it, they're getting fat. Computers are taking over our lives; it's now, or never, make the change to a better and more satisfying lifestyle. Please everyone, turn off the computer.

Dear Local Newspaper, over ninety percent of people in town use the computer for at least five hours each day. The people are spending way too much time and not benefiting. Computers have an effect on people but in a negative way. People get addicted and distracted and can't get work done. Many inappropriate things are written on computers that children and adults shouldn't read. Lastly people stare at a computer screen all day which can cause brain damage. Effects from computers can be very negative and not beneficial at all. With children at school and adults at jobs, there is most likely a lot of work to get done, but computers can make a person not get the work done. The other day in class the teacher was collecting homework, but fifteen out of the thirty kids in our class didn't have the homework. When the teacher asked why the kids didn't do their homework, they said that they were on the computer and forgot about the homework. When the children and adults don't get their work done then grades could be dropped, or people could get fired. The effect is very harmful, and all this happened just because of the addiction and distraction of computers. Since some internet sources are very social, and not all people are kind, mean and inappropriate articles and language could be read. Many children don't know a lot of bad words and certainly no one wants them to be exposed to learning more, so why let them go on the computer and read about these bad things? Adults already know more about the harmful language, but why influence them to write the bad things or comment using mean tones. If adults and children aren't exposed to these bad uses of language then our world could easily be made up of better and kinder people. Studies show that if a person stares at a computer screen for at least three hours a day, then in about two weeks time the person's brain could be damaged. The screen of the computer interacts in some way with the human brain and if stared at for too long the screen could permanently damage the brain. A university student, who studies computer mechanics, quoted, "Please help prevent brain damage by limiting the use of computers to only what needs to be done. The mechanics to make the computer screen are not healthy for you!" Who wants to have a damaged brain? Surely this effect could be very serious. So, in the end people should know that computers are not beneficial. Computers affect people for sure, but not in a way that people would want to be affected. Addiction and distraction from the computer could cause important work to be ignored. Children and adults do not need to learn or be influenced by inappropriate language on the computer. Brain damage could be a serious problem that could be caused by something as simple as looking at a computer screen. Please try to prevent all these negative effects by limiting the use of your computer. It is very easy to stay clear of any negative effects but it is your choice whether to do so or not.

Everywhere you look people are using computers. Just about everyone has one. Some say that computers are bad for you but they can really benefit society. Computers are used for research, socializing and almost all of our government work is done on computers. One of the main things that computers provide is research information. If you want to find out anything, you can find it on the internet. It is an efficient way to study or find information for school. Before the internet and computers, it would take weeks to find enough information for a paper or business work. This was because all information was found in books. Books did not always give you the information you needed; whatever was written was all you got. Because of search engines and websites, you can type in whatever you want to look up. It is much easier to log onto a computer and type in a question than search an entire book to find an answer. Computers are the best way to research a topic. Computers are also used to socialize. You can chat with almost anyone on the internet. Being social is one of the most important parts of life. It has been proven by science that social people live longer than people who never talk to anyone. Phones only give you audio and that doesn't give you the same thing. Video chat can allow you to show someone a picture or an expression. Computers allow you to see people that you can't see otherwise. For example, if you have a relative that lives far away and you can't visit him or her, you can see them through video; so socializing through computers is one of the best ways to talk to people. Our government is mainly run on computers; without them, it would be very difficult to be aware of an oncoming attack or threat. The government uses computers to store their legal files of court cases, laws, etc. It is much easier to transfer files digitally than actually sending a paper copy. The stock market is also run on computers. You need them to see how you are doing financially; computers are essential to our government and economy. Although some experts say that computers do us no good, computers benefit our society very much. They help us research, socialize and they help our government and economy. Computers are essential to our way of life.

Before people started using computers to research topics and ideas, they would use books and newspapers. They would have to shuffle through piles of pages and articles in newspapers, which was a very inefficient and disorganized way to do research. Now we have the computer; the computer allows you to recall endless information and topics with a simple search. It is not possible to lose an article or essay with information because it will always be in the same place online, allowing for guided and efficient research. There are also websites called online databases on the internet; all you have to do is type in a keyword or phrase, and you have instant research on whatever you want information on. All this takes time off of research and puts it on whatever else you would want to be doing, whether it is writing a paper or doing a presentation. The computer allows for quick and beneficial research that saves effort. The computer hasn't been in use for that long, and it is already helping society expand and grow in knowledge. It provides a social aspect where you can talk to friends and family across distances. You can provide yourself with the latest news and stories, and you can do quick and easy research for school or work. A computer, without a doubt, has a positive effect on society and we as people. The experts can say what they want, but the computer is and always will be a benefit to society for communication and learning.

There are so many different sides to this computer problem, but ultimately it's simple: computers ruin our lives. Now think about it, how many hours do you see your kid on it? Computers mess up kids' grades. It stops people from taking a car ride to a relative's house. Also, people don't ride their bikes a lot anymore. Computers are an outrage. It first starts off with grades. The parents tell their kid to go and start their paper. They say okay, and then they are down there on Facebook. More often than not, kids and parents abuse the computer. In fact, over sixty percent of America uses it, that might seem like a small percent but that's more than half the country. I don't abuse the computer because I need to keep my grades up. Most students have a C-average because studies show it's because of computers. Also, if your son has a laptop, they're not doing work if that is what you think. I have computers, but we have books for a reason, no spam, pop-ups, or distractions while working. Like one time I was working on a project, a pop-up came up and read 'traffic rush free to your computer'. So dumb me downloads it and my parents caught me playing. Has this changed your mind? Since you probably haven't changed your mind, here is another thing why computers are bad: your car. All guys love cars. Computers are holding more than forty percent of people back from working on or driving their cars. The only person it hasn't affected is my dad, he works on his cars day in and day out. My grandmom said something interesting to me the other day, "your dad comes up to visit me more than my other sons, my other sons are crazy for computers." People go bananas for computers today. Lately, I have seen less and less people outside anymore. There is only one reason for that: all people are shaved in their basement in the dark, so when the light turns on it burns their eyes it's so bright. Come on, did this change your mind yet now? Well, since you are still reading on that means you cannot make up your mind. Well here's this: people are starting to not want to ride their bikes anymore. That is Facebook's fault; this is what they think, "I can talk now, why do I need to ride to talk in person?" That is ninety percent right for what they are thinking. Because we took a test of all the kids who have Facebook, and that's what around all of them said. I know, it's amazing. A stay-at-home mother said, "my son is gaining weight, all he does is eat and go on Facebook. When he's not on during the day, I catch him at night too." That is a sad story for that mother. I ride my bike a lot; this is a real-life story: once I was sitting around doing nothing really, and my mom said we are riding bikes for ten miles. I got up and did it too. That had to change your mind, or nothing will. So, in conclusion, I have no more ideas against computers and why they are bad. But just remember your grades, your cars, and your weight. So please, change your mind.

Dear newspaper, I think computers are good; this is because you can learn things about faraway places using them, you can also hear about the most recent news, and you can communicate with people. In school, a lot of the research projects on other places focus on other places around the world. When you use a computer you can read articles about the place and also get pictures and use them in a slideshow or photo story. The computer can keep you up-to-date with the news too! There are news websites that post minute-to-minute things about world news and tell the world what kind of disaster happened in some faraway place on the other side of the world. A lot of the time, families are spread all over the world; you can chat with family or friends that have moved through a simple chat room and you can catch up on what has been happening in each other's lives, and that's a good tool for family to stay in touch. Therefore, the computer has lots of benefits that a lot of people all around the world can use, from learning about a faraway country to chatting with a cousin that lives in California, and also knowing what's going on in your own hometown. It connects us to information and to each other in ways that were once impossible.

There has been a lot of discussion of whether computers affect people in a positive way or in a negative way. I believe that computers affect most people negatively. I think this because people lose their "people skills" by talking through the computer, computers can also lead to danger, and because people tend to forget about their priorities in life. From what I know, most people that use computers use them to talk to friends and other people around the world. Instead of hanging out with their friends, they talk through the computer, and if that is what they do more than hanging in person, then they won't recognize the facial expressions given to them by certain people. While talking in person, you get the full-on experience of communicating with them. You get the tone of voice in addition to the facial expressions. You also get the body language which you can't get from on the computer unless you are using a webcam. Computers have led to many dangers. These dangers affect every user and their families. There have been many cases of young teenagers being tricked by older users into showing them parts of their body or making the teens believe that the older user can relate to their problems and are the same age. Sometimes the teen is persuaded to leave their home and neighborhood to meet the other user. Also, another type of danger is cyberbullying. Cyberbullies lower your self-esteem. The bullies call you names and pick on you and sometimes make you feel suicidal. If we hadn't any computers then none of these dangers would be occurring. With computers, people have lost their judgment in top priorities. Some computer users tend to forget about the important things in life such as family, school work, and their own health. Some people would rather stay on the computer than hang out with family and friends. Others tend to choose not to do their homework and work on their social life on the computer instead. Since they are on the computer a lot, they seem to ignore their health. They don't exercise as much and don't eat as healthy. So in my opinion, life without computers would be good for everyone. People would still have the people skills they had before, there wouldn't be as much danger, and people would focus more on the important things than their online social lives, leading to a healthier and more connected society.

Dear Editor, I think computers do have a positive effect on people, but I don't think computers are the reason people don't exercise or enjoy nature. People make their own choices in life. The computer is just there. If somebody chooses to be on the computer instead of spending time with their family, well that's their choice and problem, not the computer's. Me, for example, I love working and playing on the computer. Even though I'm on the computer, I still do things like talk to my family, I play basketball, and I chill with my homies. Now that's my choice to do all of that. I can easily just sit up in my room and be on the computer all the time. There is nothing wrong with doing that because that is my choice in life. Nobody should be able to tell you to get off the computer because that is your choice in life. If you want to be on the computer instead of going outside, that's your choice. Only you know what is best for you, and the computer itself is not to blame for how people decide to use their own time and manage their own responsibilities and relationships.

Dear editor, I have heard that some experts are saying that teenagers spend too much time online. I thoroughly believe they are mistaken. With the use of the internet, people can learn about faraway places without spending money to go there. Our military uses the internet to talk to their family and friends stateside. Also, it helps us acquire great hand-eye coordination. If someone was planning a trip to Europe, they would check the internet often. Firstly, they would check out sites to go to in Europe. Second, they would check and compare hotels in Europe. Thirdly, they would check the weather in Europe. Finally, they would check airports for flights going to and from Europe. Without the internet, planning vacations would be close to impossible. People not only use the internet for pleasure but for communication purposes too. They use web cams to talk online to people in faraway places. It is a fast, free, and convenient way to communicate with other people. Our military uses web cams to let the soldiers talk to their families. How would you feel if you were a soldier fighting for your country and the means to talk to your family is out there, but you could not use it? It is cruel and unjust to keep soldiers from talking to their families. The internet also gives us something useful. It helps us build hand-eye coordination. Hand-eye coordination is used in many things. In basketball, you need to be able to look up and dribble at the same time. When you are driving, you need to be able to look up and still be able to steer the car. Without hand-eye coordination, many more accidents would happen from careless errors. The internet helps people make the world a safer place. In some aspects, the experts are right. We should go out and enjoy nature, but we also need to enjoy and use the internet as well. Some people use it for pleasure and to build hand-eye coordination, while others use it to talk to their loved ones or use it to plan vacations. No matter who you are or what you do, the internet plays an important part in modern life, offering tools for learning, connection, and safety that we should not dismiss.

Dear local newspaper, my opinion on the effects computers have on people is a positive effect. Three main reasons are that people learn more about cultures, places, and some people work online. My first reason why computers have a positive effect on people is because they help you learn about cultures around the world. Learning about cultures is very important because if people travel they need to know how they can respect each other and understand different traditions. My second reason why computers have a positive effect on people is because they help you learn about places around the world. Learning about places is very important because you could get lost; it also helps you by telling you which places are famous to visit and how to navigate them safely. My third reason why computers have a positive effect on people is because some people find jobs online; other people work online, which benefits people in a positive way by offering new opportunities. In conclusion, computers have a positive effect on people because they help people learn about cultures, places, and jobs around them, making the world more connected and accessible for everyone.

To the Editor, there are many people in this world that think always being on the computer is good because they can talk with people online and learn more about the world. But, then there are people who disagree with them. I am one of those people. Spending too much time on the computer can really affect your life. People stop exercising, don't enjoy the beauty of nature or life, and they aren't spending enough time with their family and friends. So, I hope that while you read through this letter, you take some of this information into consideration. First of all, when people spend a lot of time on the computer they aren't getting all of the exercise that their body needs. They become lazy and don't want to do anything. This is very bad because it will affect your health and the rest of your life. People might become overweight and since they got lazy from always being on the computer, they won't go out and get the exercise that their body needs. People need to enjoy their life! By always being on the computer, they won't be able to. There are so many fun and healthy things you can do for your body. You can go play sports and have fun while getting exercise. Many people do this and try to encourage their family and friends to do it with them. But, some of their family and friends are too lazy to do anything because they are always on the computer. Instead, they stay inside the house all cooped up and don't get enough fresh air. This is a horrible thing to do to yourself. Your body needs fresh air, so start enjoying your life a little more people! Finally, people might lose contact with family members or their friends because they are too busy on the computer playing games. I know I wouldn't want to lose a friend to the internet ever again and I don't think anyone else would want to either. I once lost a friend or two because I didn't talk to them as much as I used to because I had been too busy on the computer on social media, various websites, and games. I felt horrible because I didn't realize that I had been doing that. I really wouldn't want anyone else to lose contact with a family member or lose a friend because of the internet. Its horrible and you don't feel like yourself anymore. Once again I would like to tell you that always being on the internet is not good. You can become lazy, not want to do anything etc., people aren't enjoying their life to the fullest and you can and might lose contact with a family member or lose a friend because you spend too much time on the computer. I hope that after reading this, you realize that being on the computer is not always good for you and that balance is key to a healthy and happy life.

To the editor, It's a beautiful day. The sun is shining, the birds are chirping, and a lazy breeze is flowing through the trees. But you don't notice any of it because you're plopped down in front of your computer tapping away on instant messages or email. With modern technology, this is a common scenario. Experts are concerned that excessive computer use can harm your health, hamper your social skills, and cause you to be disconnected from nature. While computers are helpful in our lives, too much of one thing is never a good thing. As mentioned, computers can have a negative effect on your health. Computers cause people to be lazy. They would rather send instant messages and email than go outside and exercise in the cool, crisp, fresh air. In fact, statistics recently released by the National Health Institute show that computers are the number one leading reason for obesity. And weight problems are not the only thing computer users have to worry about. Too much time in front of the computer will also take its toll on your eyes. Even local doctors have pointed this out. "Ever since computers have become a common household item, the number of children I have seen with eye strain has gone up about twenty or thirty more kids every year than the year before," says Dr. Evans of the City Medical Association. And if that isn't enough, typing too many text messages and emails day after day can give you repetitive stress syndrome, also known as carpal tunnel. Carpal tunnel used to be more common when typewriters were big, but dwindled down once computers with newer, easier to type on keyboards came around. But excessive daily use of computers is causing doctors to see more cases of carpal tunnel crop up. It is clear that if you want to stay healthy, computer usage should be limited. Secondly, too much time spent on the computer can negatively affect your ability to communicate with others. Computers are helpful when you need to talk to someone far away, but people have gotten so used to it that they sometimes find it awkward to talk to someone face to face. Their eyes look everywhere except for the person, they shift their weight back and forth and struggle to find the right words to say things that should be easy. This awkwardness can also ruin previously close friendships. Friends will talk to each other endlessly through messaging, but have no words for each other when they meet face to face. I remember last summer, I didn't see one of my friends at all; we just messaged each other daily. When we saw each other at school, we found it hard to carry a conversation and it took some getting used to talking face to face again. And this isn't the only way friendships are put on the line by computers. Personal and meaningful conversations can sometimes be interrupted. You're on the phone with your friend and you're telling her about something important that you need advice on. A few seconds after you begin talking you're interrupted by a loud notification sound! followed by a "hold on, so and so just messaged me." Clearly, computers can seriously harm social skills and personal relationships. Another reason to watch how much time you spend on the computer is that it can cause you to become disconnected from the natural world outside your window, missing the simple joys of a beautiful day.

Dear local newspaper, Computers are being questioned if they are good for our society or not. I would have to say that they are good and bad; you really can't pick a side. They are good because children and teens can get the information they need for projects taught in school, it allows people to chat with others in different places, and it helps hand-eye coordination. I just can't, because I can relate to both sides. For example, one of the good reasons about computers was that you can chat with other people around the world. I can relate to that because when I live here in Springfield, Illinois, my mom and stepdad live in Orlando, Florida, so I don't see them much but thanks to the computer I can chat with them whenever I want to. Honestly, I wouldn't know how my life would be like if I didn't have a computer and I wasn't able to connect with them now. Although, I can also relate to one of the bad things about computers, which is that people spend too much time on them. I can relate to that and so could a lot of other people as well, because when I get home around four o'clock because I go to an after-school program, I go straight on my laptop and stay on until around six. When my grandma gets home at seven pm, she always comes in and says, "You're on that thing too much, you'll ruin your hands!" in her concerned voice. So in my opinion, I believe that computers can be good for our society and bad; for me there is no single side to take. Others might feel the same way, and others might not. It's up to them to make a choice, so ask yourself, "Do you believe that computers are good or bad for our society?"

Dear City Newspaper: Have you really thought about how good computers are? Computers are so helpful today almost everyone has one. Computers are wonderful; they are great ways to find information, they connect people from all over the world, and offer many educational opportunities. Hopefully at the end of this letter you will agree with me. Firstly, they help people find information. Computers are great ways to find information; with Google and other programs like it the whole world is at your fingertips. In my school, surveys show that ninety percent of all students use the computer to help them research for school projects and assignments. With computers you can view many different websites from all around the world about a topic and you can even find online books that you can use. This is one way computers are a great thing, but there are two other great reasons. Secondly, with computers the whole world becomes smaller as people begin to know more and more people through the computer. More than seventy percent of people email, message, or video chat on a daily basis. Isn't it great when you make a great friend in college but you find out he/she lives halfway around the world, to know that you can still keep in touch with the computer? Did you know that many people in the military use video chat to keep in touch with their loved ones back home? Computers are great because they connect people and allow them to be together even when they cannot be together physically, but there is still one even better reason why computers are good. Finally, computers offer many opportunities like education and jobs. Today there are many single parents, more than in any other time according to the National Census Bureau, and the number is still drastically increasing. With this economy, some of those parents could really use a better education to help them bring in more money for their families, but when can they find time to go to school with work and then the kids? Now there are many online college courses you can take to get the education you have always wanted. With Craigslist and other online ads, many people can post job offerings while others can email those people their resume to try to get the job. By seeing ads posted online, people can apply easier from farther away. Computers open many great opportunities for people. Computers are very cool machines that many people take for granted; they help give people information, as well as connect people from around the world and offer many educational opportunities. So City Newspaper, I hope you can try to understand my view on why computers are so great.

Dear City Times, after reading your article about advances in technology, I would like to offer my opinion about this controversial subject. All around the world, people are using computers to do all sorts of things; whether it's for games, the buying and selling of items, or talking with people in different countries; the possibilities are endless. This is, however, not necessarily a good thing. Many people become addicted to computers. Especially adolescents, who enjoy the games that computers offer. From personal experience being addicted to computers, I can honestly say that I was under almost complete control by that computer. My grades started to go down, I stopped interacting with my friends and family, and I had trouble focusing on things. Many parents watch their children go through this and are sometimes helpless to stop it. This poses a large problem for parents who worry about their child's well-being and future. My word of advice; don't let your children become addicted to their screens, as it can truly take over their lives.

There are some effects computers have on people that I agree with and disagree with. There are many people in the world that use computers every day and some that use it sometimes. Also, it always gives you information every time you use it. I would think that computers give a positive effect on people. Computers can have their likes and dislikes, meaning not every time you need information the computer will give you the right answer. There are some websites that give you the right stuff you want to know and others that do not fill your mind with positive things. That is one thing I do not like about computers. Do not think that is too bad because computers have a lot more fun advantages. One of the most common and used things around the world is instant messaging. Instant messaging is when you are communicating with another human being over the online web. Many people use this to get in touch with a close family member or a friend. There are some names for instant messaging like WhatsApp, Facebook Messenger, Skype, Email, and many more! Yes, the computer can be very addicting but once in a while you need to get off and maybe get some fresh air. For some people, I agree that they stay on the computer too much and become very lazy. This is one disadvantage that can cause you to stop exercising and seeing friends and family. There is no problem if you go on for an hour a day, maybe more, but too long is not good. There are so many things you can do on the computer I can't name them all: gaming, social media, educational programs, shopping, and even buying things off the computer; those are many of the activities you can do on your computer. I love going on the computer from time to time doing many things I have talked about. Also, if you do not have one, then reading this might persuade you into getting one. My opinion is that they give you a very positive effect on your life when used in a balanced and mindful way.

Dear Local Newspaper, My opinion on the effects of computers is that some people are spending too much time on them. They are good to be on for a while but not all day. So my first reason why I think spending too much time on computers is not a good thing is because it's better to be outside doing other activities with other people. Instead of being on the computer, you could hang out with friends and do some sports or something else, and if you're on the computer all day you will start to lose some friends. My second reason why I don't think it is good to be on the computer all day is because if you're not exercising you will start to gain weight, since you are sitting all day just on the computer. So it's good to go outside and go for a walk or you could go to a gym so you could do exercise, which is good for you and will keep you healthy. I know someone who is on the computer all day and he really does not go outside because he says that computers teach you a lot, and they do, but it is not good to be on it all day. My last reason on some bad effects of computers is that some people could use these computers for bad things. They could be going on some bad websites and that will just make you be on the computer even longer; you could even become addicted to being on computers because you're doing nothing else. And some people have cameras on their computers and some people use them for some bad things, so that's why it is better not to be on a computer all day long. So these were my reasons for some bad effects computers could have on people if you don't go outside to do some activities or to hang out with some friends, which is ultimately better for your health and social life.

Dear Local Community Leaders, I do agree that people should stop spending most of their day on the computer and start to exercise more or spend time with friends and family. The computer has the ability to let you learn about faraway places, but instead of sitting behind a desk and learning about somewhere faraway, you should go outside and see it for yourself. Also, our country is one of the top nations that has overweight people, and I believe that the computer has something to do with this because most of the kids in our school have a Facebook account and about a significant percentage of those kids are on Facebook for at least an hour. This is why people should stop using the internet for most of their day; they are not getting the exercise they need, which is why our country is one of the top in the world that has most overweight people. The internet does allow you to chat with family and friends, but you still need to hang out with your friends outside so you can exercise by playing sports or just going for a walk down the block. If you don't, you will not have a healthy relationship because sometimes they might not even be on the computer for you to chat with them online. Also, if you don't go outside and enjoy nature and play with friends then you will become very lazy just by sitting in a chair all day and you wouldn't care to do anything anymore, which is detrimental to your overall well-being.

Dear Newspaper, I would like to tell you about computers; without them this world would fall apart. For example, some people's jobs are to fix them, make them, and sell them. Also, some people work from home and need the computer for their jobs. Without them, so many people would be out of jobs and getting paid less. Also, kids need them for education reasons; for example, if you had a broken finger and couldn't hold a pencil, you would have to type. In addition, what if a student needed an answer to a question and there was no one to help them? They could go online and get the answer and learn. There are many ways a computer can help a person; for example, they could need directions or someone's phone number or answers. Also, you can buy things online; what if you live too far away from your favorite store? You can fast order it offline. Also, I believe kids should get off the computer and go outside and exercise. Today there are too many overweight people; if people went for a walk instead of sitting on the computer all day, there wouldn't be as many overweight people. In addition, people need exercise; without it people would get fat, lazy, sleepy, and some sick, and angry, with depression. It would be to everyone's benefit if people would exercise more. In addition, without computers a lot of people's lives would fall apart, but people just need to exercise more and everything will be fine, creating a healthier balance.

Computers are mind-blowing in what they can do. They can make or break someone financially. They also can produce amazing graphics that artists can't produce. Computers are also great for recreational activities, and they also can take your life away. I'm not talking about a real life, I'm talking about the activities you do away from home. Now let's see the benefits and problems; we have come so far on how we handle money. We used to put it in chests and hide them; now all we do is click and type in a security number. People can also invest in items, but investing is tricky; you don't always win. You can win small or lose big. They say modern computers today are advanced. The screens are made of a liquid crystal formula that hardens. The lights in the back pixels do most of the work to bring stunning graphics to life. On computers today, people make money by selling graphics they made on computers. So this would be another plus on what a computer does for a human. I went to a school to learn how to produce great graphics. All teens, kids, and adults have used a computer for recreational activities. On today's computers you can play games, watch videos, and listen to music. People do this to enjoy themselves. Some people can get in trouble for fooling around on the web, but there is nothing wrong with being stressed out and just playing some games for a while. Personally, I like to go on YouTube and find funny videos after school. I used to own a YouTube account and get many views. The worst thing about computers is they can ruin plans or someone's social life; some people get addicted and can't stop being on the computer until it is taken away. For example, some people play World of Warcraft, get addicted, and can't stop! I had a problem when I had to check YouTube a lot. Well, I hope you readers understand. No matter what happens, I think computers benefit us more than the problems they cause.

Dear Editorial Board, Computers are a sought-after item in this day and age, and we are making advances in technology every single day. Social networking sites like Facebook and Twitter are all over the internet. Computers are good to some extent, but some kids find the computer essential to their life. Using computers too much will have a bad effect on society. Snacks like Oreos, and other common treats are sparks for people to be eating while on the computer. Now when you're sitting on the computer daily and for hours eating these snacks, you are begging to become overweight. A significant percentage of children are overweight and that is unhealthy. A colossal piece of this percentage use the computer daily. There is no doubt obesity is a problem, and computers are making it worse. The people that love to use the computer definitely have some sort of social network account, whether it be Twitter, or Facebook. Kids think they are immune to getting in trouble while posting messages or putting up pictures of themselves. In one case a girl was actually killed because of nasty messages posted about her. There have been other cases in which girls have sent nude pictures of themselves to their boyfriends and other people saw it. Their lives will never be the same because they were using the computer too much. Soon we will become the leaders of our communities and we will get to make the decisions. If we are not getting to know our outside world and we are not learning how to be social without the internet, who knows how we will end up. We will be the ones in charge and all that important stuff. Instead of typing away we should explore the world and learn important things. Hopefully, as a society, we will become less dependent on computers and we will fix this problem by spending less time on them. Computers are a great thing but they should not be a substitute for going outside with friends and playing baseball, which is vital for a balanced life.

Computers and the internet were a technological breakthrough. It exposed to the average world, things that were never thought possible. But as these things advanced over the years, they've become an addiction so bad it's begun to threaten people's lives. I've been given a choice to side with the addicting computers, or to oppose them. The only clear choice is to oppose them. First off, computers have caused the world a decrease in exercise. Studies show a significant number of people who use a computer do not exercise regularly. With less exercise throughout the world, nations are becoming more over weight. This is a huge problem in the United States; computers are a main cause for why the population is over weight and unhealthy. By cutting down computer use, we can get our world back into great shape and bring exercise and health back. Nextly, I'm sure you've all heard of online predators. It's scary just to think about, and as computer technology increased, online predators' numbers went up. I remember a couple of years ago, I was watching the news and a story came on about a normal teenage girl being killed by someone she met on Myspace. Tragic things like this still go on, and the rate at which they happen is increasing. By putting people on computers you're putting them at risk of death; this is an extreme problem computers have caused. This is the last effect computers have, out of many, that I'm going to state: time on the computer is time taken away from family and friends. This can ruin relationships in and outside the family. I'm sure you know many people who have become extremely addicted to online games. The more they play these games the more they pull away from everyone they knew and loved. Computers are a leading cause in dysfunctional families because they steal the user away from the outside world. These people need to get their families and friends back. You have to act now, before it's too late and computers have over taken the world. If you know anyone who has fallen prey to a computer addiction, do what you can to help get them back. We need to cut back on any kind of computer use fast. Hurry, it's now or never before this digital dependency causes irreversible damage to our society and personal lives.

Dear school board, I strongly believe that computers are a big benefit to society these days. There is so much to learn on a computer, and it is a lot more fun to learn off of a computer than a book. For instance, let's say a student had to do a report, but he couldn't get his hands on any book at all. All the student would have to do is type in a few words on the internet and hundreds of websites pop up about any topic he wants to learn, providing instant access to a wealth of information. Another reason that a computer benefits society is the ways it provides to keep in contact with family and friends if they live too far away. Like me for instance, I live far from my friends, and the only way I could talk to them outside of school was on a computer. We would be able to talk in a chat room or on a game. The same goes with family. Let's say your children go on vacation and want to keep in touch. All you would have to do is type as much as you want and click send and it's at the other computer instantly. But, if you were to write a letter through the mail, it would take maybe a week or two to reach your child or the other way around. But, most of all, there are so many cool things you can do on a computer. There are a bunch of games to play, or videos to watch. You can make music and make money off of it. My favorite would have to be the computer programs. Flash macromedia is the best though; you get to make your own animation clips or even a movie. Computers are really fun to play on. A computer has so many advantages in today's society, which I'm very thankful for. I am grateful for computers and all of the great stuff they allow us to do, which is why I believe they are a significant benefit to our modern world.

Dear sir or madam, computers play a big role in our world today. For example, people use computers to get information, talk in chat rooms, and mainly to talk to friends and find friends. I think this technology is messing people up. My first reason for thinking computers are messing people up is because of the information that is on the website. For example, people post and blog lies about people online. This ends up ruining many lives because it starts rumors and gossip about people. Also, the lies that are being posted could interfere with many lives, causing real-world consequences. Another reason computers negatively effect the lives of people is the dangerous chat rooms. This is not good because you're not familiar with the person you're talking to; the person could have posed as another person and be very hypocritical. The result of this could be very unpleasant. You might give them your number, address, or other personal information, and the outcome could end up in death, kidnapping, or cyber bullying. Lastly, I want to talk about the false information that is given to thousands of people online. In other words, the "you have won a prize" or "is your computer safe?" These things are placed on either side of your screen to get money from you. On the other hand, they attract the reader's attention. For example, these passages are set up to copy down your number, get your account number, and then take your money. This doesn't help our people because it's only there for your money. In conclusion, from my visible standpoint, I don't prefer computers as a magnificent way for people to spend their time, given these significant risks and deceptions.

Dear editor, you may have heard that there are up-sides and down-sides to using a computer. However, there are many more up-sides. For example, you can communicate with people, conduct business, and you can use it to learn. A computer is a big need in today's growing technological advances. Communication is not as easy to do by phone anymore because people are always busy and on the computer. You can use computers to meet people from different countries, and by doing this we can learn what life is like for them. Through social networks, such as Facebook and Twitter, we can make plans with friends and stay connected. Computers are an important communication technology that bridges distances. Today most business is conducted over the internet or on a computer. The global stock market is all computerized today, and that is a major trade way. A lot of business transactions and presentations are done on a computer for maximum efficiency and speed. Computers allow us to conduct business with foreign countries without having to go there, making them a huge advancement in the business world. Furthermore, computers help us learn a lot about, just about, everything. Search engines let us type in keywords and find multiple websites on that topic in seconds. Computers let us research so we get correct information with just a click, and this research can be used to write essays in school or for personal knowledge. Computers help us to learn in school and outside of it, making education more accessible. A computer is a huge technological advancement with many uses. It may have a few down-sides, but it has many more up-sides that enhance our daily lives. Computers allow you to communicate, conduct business, and learn, and life would be much slower and more difficult without a computer to speed things up and connect us to the world.

In my opinion, having computers is a very nice thing and does good in our society. I think this because of three reasons: first, it allows people to relax and wind down after a long day of work. Second, it allows people to communicate with their friends, and third, it helps with schoolwork and makes things much easier. These are only a few of the reasons why computers do good in our society. First off, I'd like to say that after a long day of work, all you want to do is relax. Television gets boring and you just want to sit and play games on the computer. Well, that's a great way of winding down on a rough day. You can go on YouTube and watch funny videos or go on Facebook and comment on your friend's new photo album. Your personal computer can be used to do many things for entertainment. There are many games, such as online puzzles or strategy games, that can be a lot of fun. Do you see why the computer is a good way of calming down? Other than winding you down on a rough day at work, the computer also allows you to communicate with friends and family. Instant messaging is a good way to talk to friends and plan get-togethers. Or, you can just have a simple talk; Facebook and MySpace are great websites to keep in touch with old friends of yours, and you can even make new friends. A lot of teenagers and adults have Facebook because it gets so engaging that you can't get off it. As you get older, you don't talk to your friends that much and soon you don't have many friends at all. Social media prevents that so you can always talk to them; you should always keep in touch with friends. Most importantly, you use the computer for school work. Without it you can't get pictures off the internet or type an essay that's due. Furthermore, you can't search for words on a dictionary website. Some teachers require you to type out essays and others don't, so you need a computer if your teacher requires you to type things. I go on my school's website to see if I have homework due, and that helps me out a lot; some teachers even put extra credit online. All in all, computers are good for society. First, you can just calm down and relax after a stressful day. Second, you can talk to old friends and keep in touch with new ones. And third, and most importantly, it's very useful when it comes to schoolwork and looking up information. Now you must understand when I tell you that computers are important and very useful in our modern society for these compelling reasons.

Dear Editor, Can you imagine a world where technology controls human interaction? Its not such a far fetched idea. Some people might see this as a great advancement in how we connect. Not me. I think that computers detach people from reality, create false personas, and has no physical benefit. This is what i think the computers effects have on people. First of all, Computers detach people from reality by replacing real-world experiences with virtual ones. Its a lot easier for someone to sit on the computer, browsing aimlessly on some social networking website, than go out and actually meet new people in person. Sure you can send all the friend requests you want, but theres nothing that compares to a first impression that you get from meeting someone in person, with all the nuances of face-to-face communication. The computer can also have an affect on family members and the time spent with them, reducing quality interactions at home. Secondly, the computer creates false personas because online, people can present idealized versions of themselves. If i had a facebook or other social media account, it would be very easy to say something false about myself, or someone else, without immediate consequences. The computer dosn't know better, so it doesn't verify the truth. This allows people to gain, "friendships" with others that dont know the real you, based on deception. I find this as a real problem because it can eventually lead to shaky or unsteady relationships when the truth emerges. Lastly, I think that the computer offers no physical gain, as it promotes a sedentary lifestyle. This nation is in a severe heath crisis with rising obesity rates. With things easier to get now a days like fast food, and drugs, I don't think that computers help our physical well-being; they often contribute to inactivity. People need discipline to use technology in moderation, and theres a time and place for everything, including computers for work or study. However those that aren't disciplined might use them more than they need to and that isn't good for their health. So can you imagine a world controlled by computers? I think that little by little, thats whats happening, with screens dominating our lives. Slowly taking away the human element from our daily interactions. I think the effects will be severe, detaching us from reality, creating false personas, and offering no physical gain, leading to a less healthy society. I don't think its right, but I hope I've persuaded you to think my way about the negative impacts of computers on our lives.

Dear editor, I am expressing my concern to you about the side effects new technologies, such as computers, have on humans. Studies show that an average person spends in total many hours a day on the computer, almost double what they should be spending on it. Dr. Smith from the technology society says that if this increase in time spent on the internet continues for more years, most people will completely lose contact with family and friends outside of the social computer network. The average weight of a person has increased significantly over the years. Statistics show that the main cause for this dramatic increase in weight is due to the excessive amount of time spent on computers; in addition, people do not have as much time to exercise. Teenagers need to exercise three times a week for thirty minutes each. Yet the average adolescent only spends ten minutes a week exercising not including gym. All of these numbers must change and a way to start would be losing the computer because people are spending too much time on them and less time exercising. Secondly, computers are affecting the time people get to go outside and enjoy nature. From my personal experience, nature is a beautiful thing to be a part of, but nowadays I spend way too much time on social networks such as Facebook and others. How often do you go outside to take a walk, go for a bike ride or something else? A study done by a researcher shows that the average person has only spent a total of a few days outside in the past two years after receiving their new computer. This must change; people need to enjoy what this world has to offer. Thirdly, computers have affected the interaction between family and friends. An expert noted that people have only been interacting with family at mandatory times such as school meetings. Family and friends are of major importance in everyone's lives. I love to sit down and talk with my mom over a steaming cup of hot chocolate. A large percentage of people nowadays do not spend any time with family and many people use computers to interact with friends. It is vitally important that people stop using computers so much because before you know it you will have lost all communication with family and friends. Computers help people lose communication and interaction with family and friends. In conclusion, I urge you to make the right decision by quitting using computers excessively and in return you will be a much happier and stronger individual. Computers and the internet have changed the way the world works today. From stocks to instant messaging, people have based important decisions in their life based on what they have read. Although some people believe that computers are pulling people away from the beauty of nature, relatives, or exercise, I believe that technology is only helping the world on a day to day basis. One example is conversation; many people have close relatives that live over seas, cross country, or even across town. The internet helps them speak to others that they normally couldn't have a conversation with. On several occasions, my family have planned trips together even though we live across the continent. What could have taken months by letters in the mail took as little as one hour to do over the internet. Another way to speak to friends or family is a website called Facebook. Facebook is a website that allows you to speak to, message, or send pictures to others. Other websites like this are Twitter and Instagram. A large percentage of people have an account on one of these websites. One other way to speak to others, more for business reason, is instant messaging. Multiple servers provide instant messaging, such as AOL, Yahoo, or MSN. "AOL is my personal favorite," says a reporter of the local newspaper, "Technology has helped me endlessly if I need to contact someone on short notice." That is one reason why I support the use of computers. Another reason I support the use of computers is because a vast majority of all students rely on the internet for research papers and other assignments. "Even though I still use books," a college student said, "The internet is so much faster and the articles are more up to date." Search engines are most popularly used, such as Google or Bing. Many computer users with internet access have used Google at some point. Another handy program provided by all computer companies is a word processor. This program is used for everything from research papers to writing letters. This program also has a spell check, a punctuation check, and a grammar check for mistakes. The main reason I am writing this paper is because experts have been complaining that people have been spending too much time on the computer and technology has been distracting them from the important things in life, such as friends, family, and nature. However, from the examples explained in this paper, I have shown that the internet increases conversation and curiosity of how the world looks and operates. As for exercise, it is common sense to spend at least one hour working on personal fitness.

Dear Editors and Readers, I am writing this letter to state my opinion on the effects computers have on people. And there are three of them: identity theft, cyberbullying, and addiction. Now I will write one paragraph about each. My first reason why I feel that computers have bad effects is identity theft. Many people in the U.S.A. have their identities get stolen for listing private information online using a computer, which can leave that person in a lot of debt. How are we going to encourage people to use computers when they are at the risk of getting their identity stolen? If this is happening to innocent people it needs to stop; we must not encourage this online behavior, so say no to computers. I understand it really is interesting to learn about people from different countries, but there are some cons. Talking online to people you don't know and have never seen or met in person is risky; they can pose as someone famous and bully you for their enjoyment. It has been proven that when children, and even adults, get cyberbullied it can lead them down the path of depression and even suicide. Now I find it quite feeble-minded to give up your life for a computer, so again I say no to computers. My last reason why I say no to computers is because people become addicted to the excitement of the computers, which eventually leads to division from friends and family because you are lost in the computer world; also you forget about your hygiene and some people even forget to eat. This thing they call a computer is a drug, a drug that makes you forget about reality and everything else you used to think of and brings you to computer land. And I say no to computers. I have given you my opinion and three supporting reasons why I feel the way I do, which were because of identity theft, cyberbullying, and addiction. We should say no to computers for the good of our society.

Dear Newspaper, I strongly agree with experts on computers. Those who support advances in technology believe that computers have a positive effect on people. They say that computers teach us hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to learn from faraway places, and even allow people to talk with others online. These effects are true but there are many other bad effects that they do not like to say. Computers also affect people's vision as you are really close to the screen; computers are really addicting for many people all around the world and having them do barely any exercise is moving many people toward a big problem nowadays, which is obesity. Computers also tend to take a lot of time away from people's lives. The way I see it is that although computers have some positive effects on people, you can achieve those positive effects in a better way that can keep you fit too and let you see places with your own eyes. For example, you can get practice with hand-eye coordination by simply getting a friend and passing tennis balls back and forth quickly, so at the same time you are exercising too. Also, a computer can have you talk with your friends online, but why not talk to them by phone if they are far away and then go outside to catch some fresh air? And if they live close by, why not talk to them in person instead? Or if you want to learn about a certain faraway place, why not visit the place instead? There are many things you can do that a computer can do, but better. But yet I am not saying a computer is all bad at all. I agree that there are both good and bad effects to computers, as well as most things in the world we live in. In my opinion, I honestly think there are more bad effects than good effects for computers when you consider the overall impact on our health and daily lives.

I personally think that people should not spend so much time on the computer. One reason why people shouldn't spend so much time on the computer is because they spend too much time on them and not enough time exercising. Another reason why is because people aren't enjoying nature. Finally, my last reason is because people are spending less time interacting with family and friends. My first reason why people shouldn't spend so much time on the computer is because they are spending more time on them than exercising. People will end up getting fat if all they do is sit around on their computer. People should be running or going to the gym instead of going on the computer. Even if you have your own equipment at your house to exercise on, it's still better than going on the computer and not getting any exercise at all. If people spent as much time exercising as they spend on the computer, then the average weight of a human would go way down. Another reason people shouldn't spend so much time on the computer is because they are spending less time enjoying nature. People should be outside getting fresh air instead of being inside on the computer all day. I personally would way rather be outside playing baseball and getting fit than being inside on the computer getting fat. Even if you look at nature via computer, it still won't be the same because you actually aren't outside experiencing it yourself. If people would spend as much time enjoying nature as they are on the computer, we would be living in a much more healthy and clean world. My last reason why I think people spend too much time on the computer is because they are spending less time interacting with family and friends. People could be in a dark room all day, isolated from everyone they care about, just because they are on the computer. That to me just isn't right because they are avoiding spending quality time with their friends and family; instead, they are spending time with their computer. If a person spends all their time on the computer then everyone they care about will gradually be slipping away, even if they don't know it. So as you can see, it would be much better if people spent more time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends than spending more time on the computer. Even if you don't spend a lot of your time on the computer yet, you will gradually spend more and more time on it every day until eventually it's all you do, which is why we must be cautious now.

Dear Editor, This is a letter telling you my opinion about computers. Yes, people do spend a lot of time on computers, and it is because computers are very helpful in many ways. Computers help us with our job, school, work, etc. For example, in science class: I am in fifth grade and my teacher gives us homework; every Monday, we have to do an assignment where we find facts about anything you want to write about. A lot of people look up bears online and they do their assignment about bears. For jobs, secretaries always have to use the computer for everything; in our school, secretaries and teachers use computers for attendance and grading. They check your attendance, grades, phone number, and schedule. For communication, my dad uses the computer to talk with our family from another state. We talk to know how they've been and to know what is new. Like a week ago, I was chatting with my cousin and she told me her dog had three puppies. My family also uses the computer to order things. My uncle went to a ticket website and he ordered two tickets for a show. He also orders his flight tickets on his computer to go visit our family. Well, my point is people use computers a lot because they are very helpful in many ways. It is not good to just be on the computer; it is good to go outside, enjoy nature, live your life, and exercise not only to be in shape but for your health. I hope you enjoy and understand my opinion on computers. Thank you for taking your time and reading this; I really appreciate it and hope it provides a clear perspective.

I believe computers are a benefit to society. Computers help hand-eye coordination; they make it easy to learn about different places and allow people to talk and video chat. Computers teach hand-eye coordination when typing and eventually you get so good you don't ever have to look down at the keyboard. You can search for anything on the internet and if you want to learn about a country you can search it and find out all new things you never knew before. Maybe you want to go on vacation to another country and can't decide which country to go to; you can go on the computer and look up tourist attractions in those countries to decide which area you want to go to. Dear editor, Have you ever wanted to know something so badly that you can't focus on anything else? Have you ever tried to find that information and had an "ah-hah!" moment? What did you use to search for this knowledge? You probably used a computer. All you need to do is type in your request, hit "enter" and viola! Your screen fills with choices of information sites. Computers help so many people with everyday questions. Our country has gotten smarter because of computers. You can converse with friends that have moved across the state, country, or even world. At every click of your mouse there are new things to learn. You can even use the computer for your personal enjoyment. Computers have opened up so many opportunities the world needs to take. When I was four years old, my best friends at the time moved to Florida. I was devastated. At first, we tried writing letters to each other. Then, as we grew older and became busier and busier, our connection with each other halted. As technology and computers have advanced, my friend and I text, e-mail, and instant message each other all the time. It has made our long distance friendship easier and closer. Because of computers, you can communicate with friends you thought were long-lost. You can also meet new people with one of the many social sites available. How would you like to talk with someone all the way down in Australia? World communication has also opened up many business opportunities. Since the economy is failing, computers will open job spaces, help college students study for their future career, and hopefully help to improve the lives of many people. Communication is needed for many things to make our world better for generations to come. Instead of going to a noisy arcade, why not play exciting games right in the privacy of your home. Any game you can think of can probably be found on the internet. From a simple game of solitaire to an advanced level of strategy, games for any age and difficulty level can be found. Now, some people think that all kids are going to do is sit in front of the computer and play games. There are going to be some people that will refuse to go outside, spend time with their friends or just read a book. There will definitely be some people like that. I can't help it. What we can do is allow all those that refuse to go outside to do so. I know many people who spend and budget their time wisely and still have a great time. We can also encourage kids to use exercise programs on their computers and video games to improve their health. There are many fun games that help you to be a better and healthier person while still having fun. The computers we have in our homes right now are equipped with so much information that if you tried to take it all in you would be overwhelmed. Google, a popular search engine, gives you the power to look up anything you could ever want to know from the vice president's birthday to the price of eggs in China to how wide the Amazon River is can all be found with the click of a button. This knowledge helps with homework assignments incredibly. Most reference books are out of date and information is inaccurate, but computers are updated so frequently, you have all the facts all the time. I think our country has gotten much smarter because of computers. So whether you want to talk to your long-lost friend in Australia or talk to an expert on osprey in Alaska, you can find your answer on the computer. While you're at it, play a couple exciting games and learn about the best movies ever released in the last decade. Have fun and learn lots!

Dear Newspaper Editor, Many people are now using computers. However, everyone is entitled to their own opinion about them. Some people don't like them, and then there's people like me who do like them. Computers can let you communicate faster, you can play all sorts of games for entertainment, and it provides vast information. Nine out of ten people love what computers can do for them. Unlike sending and writing letters to people, instant messaging is a much faster and easier way to talk to another person. Sending and receiving letters can take days or weeks, on the other hand, instant messaging takes only a few seconds! Even better, it's free! Instant messaging is not the only way you can communicate with friends or family, there is also video chat. Video chat is just like talking on the phone but you can also see the person you're talking to. You can be talking on video chat with someone from another country, and guess what? It's also free! When you make long distant calls, it can be very costly, but video chat won't cost a penny out of your pockets! Not only is a computer good for communication, but you can also play fun and entertaining games! Everyone enjoys playing games, whether you're one or eighty-two. There are countless websites on the internet and among them there are game sites. Most game sites have virtual games that you can play online for free! There's one player, two player, and party games. This means you could play alone, with a friend, or the whole family. Everyone can join in and have a great time. Also, computers could be used for fun and they can be used for work. The internet holds endless information. It's like your own personal library at home at a touch of a finger! Whether you're doing research on a project, looking up a fact, or just want to be informed, the internet can help you with any subject. All you have to do is search the topic you need whether it's cooking a certain dish, learning about space, trying to spell a word, or anything you can think of, and it'll all be there for you, and once again, for free! In conclusion, computers are useful for many things and these are just a few examples. I hope you think of computers the way I, and millions of other people, do. As you can see, computers have improved the lives of many human beings.

Dear School Board, Computers are a new technology that keeps on getting better and better. They can do many things like help you learn something new and see new or old friends. The computer can teach us many new and exciting things. There can be a lot to learn too. Not everyone can go to big universities so it is easier for them to use an online college. There are many other things you can do on the computer like visit with some friends. I have friends, everyone has friends either new friends or old friends. Back then before computers if you wanted to talk to your friend you would have had to send a letter. With a computer you can now send a letter faster then before. It's now called an email. You just type what you want and click send it off to your friend. Not all use an email, some use instant messaging. An example of that would be AIM or Meebo. I moved from Ohio to here and I have friends I don't get to see much. I bet there are many people that have that same issue. Well with the computer you can now see people! You can video chat and see them. For instance Skype is a way to see your friends like that. It's an easy and fun way to stay in touch with friends and even your family. There is still more that a computer can do. Another thing it can do is play video games. They are so much fun to play and what I am talking about is video games.
