According to Dr. Evans, an economic expert, every hour you spend on the computer, you raise your electricity bill by a few cents. The average teenager spends several hours on the computer everyday. I believe that spending too much time on the computer could be a bad thing. You have economic loss from the electric bill, health loss because you won't be able to exercise as much, and community loss because you won't spend as much time with your community. Financial loss is something that many people are concerned about. If everybody spent one less hour on the computer, they could save money off their electric bill. In a survey, seven out of ten people said they would do anything to save money. So if they spent less time on the computer they would save lots of money. In addition to financial loss there is also a health issue. Many people are talking about how Americans are becoming obese. Part of this is due to spending too much time on the computer. Professor Smith from the National Health Institute says that, "the obesity in America is a problem, if people spent less time on the computer and more time exercising, that problem would be solved." Currently, a significant number of people are obese. If everyone spent one less hour on the computer, it would become a smaller number. Although health is a problem community is a bigger one. People never talk to each other face to face anymore. They all talk on social media or through text messages. Communities are spending less time together in real life than on the computer. Dr. Evans, an expert on human behavior, says that when people spend less time on the computer, they spend more time together. It's a fact that when people spend more time together, they have more fun. So, I would say that spending less time on the computer would be beneficial to our community. It would provide financial, health, and community benefits. These are all important things that we lack if we spend too much time on the computer.

I do not believe computers benefit society. Many people spend their life on their computer instead of exercising, going out with friends, or spending time with family. A majority of teenagers will agree they spend at least several hours a day on their computer, which is unnecessary. Why is there so much obesity in the world nowadays? Because of a lack of exercise. And who is the number one culprit? Computers of course. In order for more people to maintain health, there needs to be a lot of physical activity. When someone can sit around all day clicking a mouse or typing keys in, how much exercise are they really getting? Plus, there are many different disorders in the world. A large percentage of individuals will agree that with more exercise, these sometimes painful disorders could be avoided. Too many people are choosing their computer over exercise and it causes them many health problems that could've easily been avoided. Secondly, everyone would agree that friends are essential in life. But now people are talking to their friends online or in computer games instead of going to see them. Online there is much more drama which often breaks up friendships. Also, online you cannot meet new people or make as many new friends as you can in person. In real life you go out and have many more friends, which makes life in general much better. Finally, you wouldn't want families to become distant, would you? Well, this is one of the many effects when the members of a family do not get together which could weaken them as a family. Plus, husbands and wives could not talk very often, often leading to separation or divorce. This could make a child have to decide between parents. Exercise, friends, and family are essential in life, and computers put those in jeopardy. So take a stand and end this reign for good, stop the overuse of computers before it is too late.

Dear Local Newspaper, Spending too much time on the computer is never a good thing, whether you are doing work or things for pleasure. I strongly believe this because being on the computer too long will mean that you are spending less time exercising, interacting with real family and friends rather than on the internet, and being on the computer too long can ruin your vision. Nowadays, with all the great advances in technology, people are always glued to computer screens. Let's face it, once you go on the computer, it can get pretty addicting with all of the fabulous things you can do, and when we get addicted, we don't feel like doing other things like exercising. Studies show that a large percentage of kids who use his or her computer for more than several hours a day are obese. The cause of this problem is obvious, and it is kids being addicted to computers. Since they are so addicted to computers, they do not want to go to the gym or engage in physical play. Another example is that in school, kids have a choice of what electives they want to take. Many kids would rather choose the computer programming class rather than physical education, which also cuts down on their exercise time. Computers are wonderful things, but when they start affecting your health and physical fitness, they become enemies. Interacting with others on the computer can be looked at as a positive, but it is not since it affects the way you interact in real life. For instance, some people develop a habit from only interacting through the computer that makes them anti-social in real life. Furthermore, some kids can be the most pleasant people to interact with through the computer, but then when you see them in real life, they are the quietest people in the world. This happens because they are more comfortable interacting through the computer and have lost their abilities to interact face-to-face. Interacting through the computer is great if you have family and friends in other countries, but you shouldn't do it so much that you become uncomfortable interacting in real life. Your eyes are one of the most important parts of your body. Most people do not know this, but being on the computer too long puts strain on your eyes, which is bad. This strain only leads to unpleasant things. For example, if you are addicted to computers, then there is a large chance you will get glasses someday in your life. A recent poll was taken, and over a majority of people who use their computers for more than a few hours a day have gotten glasses. Another example is that over time, the strain builds up to the point where even with glasses you can hardly see. Imagine a world where your vision is so bad that it is like your eyes are almost closed; that's what happens to people who use their computers too long. Local newspaper, you may think that computers are one of the greatest inventions ever, and you are right; however, you shouldn't use it too much, as moderation is key to a healthy and balanced life.

Dear computer company, computers have a negative effect on our engagement with the real world. Why would you go outside if you could play life-like games on your computer? Dear The Computer Times, Your resources, your entertainment, and even your communication with people might be fading. Perhaps you know a large portion of people think this technology is harming our society. Well, I will say I think they don't fully understand the many benefits that computers bring us. Computers act like teachers, instructing us without us even knowing it. Hand-eye coordination is a perfect example of a skill they help develop. Plus, we use computers to learn about distant places we might want to travel to, or to have a conversation with friends or family living far away from us. The computer is an extraordinary piece of technology. First, I'd like to say that everything you do physically uses hand-eye coordination, from making dinner and riding a bike to driving a car. And unfortunately, not all people are the best at hand-eye coordination. One of my friends, John, had horrible hand-eye coordination. So for his birthday, I decided on getting him a computer. It's been one month since he had his computer, and when he was trying to hit a baseball at his son's party, he managed to hit the ball seven out of ten times where he used to hit it one or two out of six. This is a tremendous increase in only one month! Just something as simple as a computer improved my friend's hand-eye coordination a tremendous amount. Secondly, the computer can help you learn about far away places like the Arctic or the Sahara Desert. Do you really want to travel up to the icy cold and piercing winds of the Arctic just to learn about it? For some, I'd say they might like that, but what if you can't travel to the Arctic due to money or difficult flying conditions? I want to be able to study about polar bears and the glaciers without needing to worry about such hardships. A statistic from the National Institute of Travel states that "eighty percent of people would love to experience the thrill and excitement of the Northern Lights. But out of those eighty percent, only twenty percent said they'd actually travel to Norway to see them". So you can see that sixty percent of those people wouldn't go, whether it be due to money or the cold. They clearly said that's why they love the computer; they can experience the Northern Lights without needing to travel into the bitter cold. Lastly, what better thing to do on the computer than connect with family you've never met before or don't get to see often? The editor for the Springfield Local states, "My parents live over five hundred miles away. I rarely get to talk to them now because I can't afford to travel that distance often. So I use my computer; my parents and I now communicate fifty percent more than we used to. I love the computer; it helps keep me close to my loved ones." As you can tell, thanks to the computer, he talks fifty percent more to his parents than he used to! In conclusion, the computer is a gracious device that is extremely beneficial to people. It teaches us hand-eye coordination, lets us learn about places we otherwise would never learn about, and allows us to have conversations with friends or family that we generally don't get to see often. Now, you go out and make sure that anyone who says computers are a horrible invention understands exactly why computers are so important for our modern lives.

Dear newspaper, I think that using your computer too much is bad for one's overall well-being. Some people spend way too much time on the internet, which leads to several negative consequences. Many people are too focused on the internet, and they neglect their normal daily activities. Also, the computer is bad for people because they will be on the internet all night and get no sleep, leaving them exhausted for the day ahead. A lot of people spend too much time on the internet, and since they are always online, they don't spend a lot of quality time with their families. This causes the internet-addicted person to lose important relationships with their family and friends. Not exercising is another common result of this addiction. For example, my stepbrother is always on the internet now; he doesn't talk to anyone because he is so preoccupied with his game. Another problem people encounter with the internet is being too focused on the virtual world. When you are too focused on the internet, you forget there is a whole world out there that needs your help; most people won't do their chores or make a meal for their family. These people also have no time for the outdoor activities they used to enjoy. Internet addicts usually don't get any sleep, and they have no time to study at night because they spend all their extra time on the internet. During the day, they will be very tired in school or at work, and the internet will be the one to blame. Last month, my mom made a Facebook account, and she is constantly on it. When she is online, she ignores everything around her. My mom goes to school, and she tells me how she never has time to study because she is always on the internet. She also stopped reading the Bible in her spare time to go online. The internet is a bad thing to get hooked on; you lose relationships with your friends and family because you never get off the computer. People usually don't exercise or do their chores, which shows this is not a very good addiction to get into and can significantly harm one's quality of life.

Dear Editor, The effect that computers have on people is not a positive one. Being on the computer instead of exercising has had a huge effect on people's health. Some people are overweight because they eat and then do not exercise afterward. My sister works on the computer all day, and she says three or four ladies at her work are unhealthy because all they do is go on the computer and eat granola bars, which are usually healthy. If others spent at least a half an hour outside to get some fresh air instead of using a computer, most of them would feel a lot better. Sure, computers also teach hand-eye coordination by playing video games, but when in real life will you need to know how to shoot a dragon or dodge candy that's falling from the sky? This is just an example of unneeded information and skills that keeps people wanting to go back on the computer. Another thing you can do on the computer is communicate with others. When computers weren't invented or even that advanced, people were more than happy to give one another a call. Now with computers, people email, instant message, or even use Skype, a webcam website. What even happened to cellphones? You can take them anywhere, proving that computers are not the only, or necessarily the best, tool for communication.

Dear reader, Lately, people have been debating whether or not computers are actually benefiting society, especially now that the majority of households now own one of these helpful machines. Computers help people with everyday tasks and are no doubt doing more good than harm. Imagine how impossible it would be for most people to do their jobs without them; life would become much harder for the people living on this planet. Think of the successful schools in our country, and then think of which of those schools don't have computers. Computers are the easiest way to look up information, something important when children are learning. Whenever someone needs to know something, they just google it, which comes in handy when researching for that huge project due next week. People have never been so knowledgeable. Computers are not only important for school but also in the workplace, where they serve almost the same essential functions. Now that computers are so common, people can conveniently type up a paper and submit it to their boss or teacher, saving time and effort with a more professional result. Computers also serve the important purpose of communication; using email or instant messaging, one could communicate with someone on the other side of the world without that enormous phone bill. Some parents see this as dangerous because you could be chatting with a complete stranger; however, it is also opening your eyes to new cultures. Now it's possible to learn about life in Japan first hand. If computers were no more, it would be extremely hard for a regular person to interact with someone from another country; it's almost like isolation from the world. There are many out there who take great interest in learning other languages, and computers provide a better way than just sitting in a classroom listening to someone talk. As a person on this planet, do you really want to be kept separate from others just because they don't live close enough? A main concern about computers is that no one will want to read books and anything else; however, a recent study shows that after computers became widespread, more people have begun to read. This proves that just because there is now something fun and new, it doesn't mean everything else is trash; people will still continue to do things they always did, just with something new on their list. In addition, it is the option of everyone whether or not they want to spend their time on the computer. If someone doesn't like the idea, they've no right to take it away from someone else; computers were created to help the human race, not control it. If a person doesn't want one, they don't have to get one; everything is up to them, and that is the way it should remain. The next time you see a computer, don't think of it as some sort of obsession that's keeping people from doing other things they could be doing, but as a universal device that allows them to broaden their horizons and learn things they probably wouldn't go to the library to look for. Computers aren't holding anyone back, but pushing everyone forward, whether at work, school, or even the house; they benefit everyone, everywhere, and are a fundamental part of modern progress.

Dear Local Newspaper, Computers are important for growth. They teach us skills like hand-eye coordination, they allow you to talk online, and learn about faraway people and places. When you play those games you keep your hand on the mouse or keyboard and your eyes on the screen. It helps you to not look down. Dear local newspaper, This world is filled with electronics. These days the computer is the latest hit. But even though it's popular, is it really the best item to have? Many children and even adults are hooked onto the computer. It is taking away their life. Four out of five people each year are losing interest in going outside to play. That's not how you should spend your life. We all want our children to be active and healthy, not be a couch potato. Each day, more kids are getting addicted to the computer. Now, every time a parent needs to punish or "ground" their child, they take away the electronics. What ever happened to grounding them from going to hang out with their friends or just playing outside? Another horrifying conclusion that the computer does to us is rip apart us from our loved ones. Kids are more worried about their online games or social media than spending time with their family. They would pick the computer over someone who has been in their life forever. This computer is splittling families apart. Now, more families only spend time with each other when they eat dinner together. Also, rather than talking to their parents about a problem, kids are going to websites for advice. More people don't enjoy doing some things now because of the computer. Not many like going out and enjoying nature. Some don't like reading anymore because they rather play games. Some people don't even want to pick up the phone and call for a pizza. Also people who look for jobs don't go to the newspaper anymore; they go to the internet! The world is revolving around electronics. We need to end this before our kids or grandchildren start getting out of shape and start relying on the comuter for everything. Do we really wan't to destroy this world and lose bonding with our families? I say, make life better and get rid of computers before they consume all our time and relationships.

Dear Newspaper editor, I think that computers are beneficial for everyone. First of all, you can learn about places that are around the world in a single click. Newspaper and Readers, Computers are a very large part of our lives and society. However, there are still people who think that computers do harm. Actually there are many positive effects that computers have on people. Among those effects are ease of communication, ease of gathering information, and ease of finding entertainment. Computers have far more positive than negative effects. Computers have made communication easy for people. There are so many different means of communication using the computer, which are all free. For example, instant messaging, email, video chat, chat rooms, and other social networking sites, are all there and help you communicate with friends and family. The positive effect that this has on people is that it allows them to stay in touch with people whom they might not otherwise due to financial or convenience issues. Being social is healthy for people and therefore communication is a positive effect of computers. Information is far easier to acquire when a computer is used. For example, if a kid needed to know about the climate of a region for his social studies project, instead of having to get in his mom's car, drive all the way to the town library, spent time looking for the book, he could just log on to the internet and go from there. This is a positive effect on him because it saves him some time and effort. Furthermore much more useful information can be found on the internet as well, such as: flight times, prices, restaurants, stocks, weather, news, and basically any fact that you need to know. All of these things make having a computer a very positive thing in somebody's life. Computers are a great source of entertainment. In this economy, I know we all could benefit from not having to pay rental fees for movies and big prices for video games. Internet gaming is very amusing and you can find many good games for free. In addition to that, there are websites who offer free movies and television shows to be streamed right to your computer. These things are a great solution to the rising cost of entertainment. Saving money and enjoying good entertainment are both positive effects on people, and both offered by computers. I hope now that readers of this newspaper will now understand how good computers are next time you are looking for a late fee on a library book or movie, remember that the internet and your computer have offered an alternative that is both convenient and cost-effective.

To whom it may concern, Computers are beneficial to society. They promote learning, coordination, and even general welfare. It is true that computers can be detrimental to a person's health, affecting the amount of exercise and interaction a person gets, but the positive effects of computers more than make up for this. People learn much of what they know from the computer. Among an infinite number of things a person can learn from them are definitions of new words, scientific theories, algebraic equations, history, law, any number of languages, and much more. Computers, when used for learning, can teach people things they might not learn in school, but on their own time, computers exercise the brain, and teach it to think beyond the boundaries of a standard classroom. They also teach the brain how to better direct the body to face its needs. Coordination can be very hard for some people, and this can be a problem. Without coordination, people wouldn't be able to catch a ball, avoid certain dangers, or even stand. To help improve this people need practice. They can get this practice from exercise like catching a ball, threading a needle, or using a computer. Using the mouse on a computer can help with hand-eye coordination in that it forces the brain to direct the mouse to a certain place on the screen, in order to accomplish what is needed to be done. At first, this process can be excruciatingly slow, but over time, as the brain gets practice, this coordination improves and the process speeds up significantly, the person will be able to use the computer faster and more efficiently. This will help them play games, learn, or even help people when they are in need. Helping people is very important in this day and age. That's why it is important for people to find out news quickly so that they can help. Computers allow this. For example, on the day of the deadly earthquake in a affected region, most of the world found out within the hour from computers. News sites broadcast it, social networking sites talked about it, and people talked to each other online about it. This rapid spread of the news saved many lives as people immediately dropped what they were doing and rushed to help. Computers affect people in that they help to send out news and stories causing them to want to help people. Many websites also are adept at donating money while playing a game. For example, some sites donate grains of rice for every question answered correctly, and they have donated over a billion grains of rice. Obviously, computers and sites like these have to have a positive effect on the world. Overall, one would think that computers have a mostly positive effect on the world. Despite limiting exercise, they encourage learning, and the exercise of the brain. Computers also help people with their coordination, which is very important. Finally, computers promote a world where people want to help each other, and a world where people keep up with current events, whether they like it or not. Thank you, editor, for considering my side on the positive effects computers have on the world and its people.

Dear Editor, I feel as though computers have good effects on people. Throughout these next paragraphs I will be giving you all of my reasons on the things that computers help people do. I will be talking about how computers give people good typing skills, how they give information to people, and how they allow us to socialize. Over ninety four percent of people today own a computer and feel as though they have learned many things from it. I bet you didn't know that! My final reason why computers have a good effect is how they help us socialize. If you need to talk to a friend but don't feel like calling them you can just go on to a website and chat with them. There are so many that you just can't choose! Did you know that there are over one million of these kinds of websites? There is Facebook and Twitter just to name a few. This also gives people the chance to socialize with people from all over the world. This in return causes people to have better social skills. Maybe they will become more friendly and become more outgoing. This is all because of one little thing and that little thing is the computer! So as you can see computers have many wonderful effects on people. They help people get better at typing, give lots of information that people want to know, and help them get better social skills. Thanks for reading this and taking in the information I have shared.

I think computers have shaped our society to what it is today. Computers help people learn, give people a pastime, and all of that can be managed in a certain space of time so you still have time to go outside. Computers help everyone learn. It makes things easier by typing up essays because you could type it faster and it's easier to make changes. Also, it's cheaper to buy a computer and go on the internet and look up foreign countries than actually going there. Another example, is that a computer teaches you hand-eye coordination from typing and using the mouse. Finally, computers can teach you life lessons by reading articles another person wrote. Computers give bored people pastimes. One example, is that you can play computer games during rainy days or when you can't go outside. Also, you can talk to friends through Facebook or AIM. Another example, is that you can talk to distant family in another country by using programs such as Skype. Finally, you can order stuff online instead of wasting gas and going to the store and the things you might order you can play with outside. A lot of people say computers keep kids inside but don't know that there are ways to prevent this. One example is you can use shut-off timers that keep anyone from going onto the computer for too long. Also, many people learn how to manage their time on the computer. Another example, is that parents can make rules that their children aren't allowed to play games on the computer on certain days and/or times. Finally, you can keep the computers in the family room so that children don't play with it all night in their room. Those are just some of the many reasons why computers help us. They help us learn, pass the time, and it can all be managed during a certain amount of time. Now reading this I hope you believe that computers benefit society in many positive ways.

Dear Editor, In many ways computers are helpful but, I don't support the use of them. The advance in technology has really taken away from peoples lives all over the world, some examples of this are lack of exercise, too much time inside, and not enough time spent with family and friends. Continue reading for more on how computers don't benefit society. As you know, when you use a computer you usually sit in a chair to do so, correct? Well, this activity is doing only one thing, not keeping you healthy or in shape. I'm sure that you want to be healthy, and to be healthy you must get some sort of exercise through out your day, and sitting on the computer is not helping you one bit. So as you can clearly see, so far using computers is not beneficial to our society, continue for more cons of using computers as much as they are used. Believe it or not, using a computers is unhealthy, and not beneficial, in more than one way. The reason for this is because, not only do you not get enough exercise, you won't go outside as much. You may be wondering as to why not going outside is unhealthy, but it is because you don't receive the needed amount of fresh air that you need to not be sick. Could you imagine the amount of people that would be sick if everyone used the computer for the majority of their day? Well, lets just say it wouldn't be fun to count them all. Now that you know two ways that computers are not beneficial to society, keep reading for one last way. As you probably know, it is a hard task to keep a big family close to each other, and using computers isn't going to do anything to help you. So, why use them? Trust me, spending quality time with your family and friends can be just as much, or even more fun than playing your favorite computer games, and in my opinion your family should be the most valuable thing in your life, so don't lose them for a computer. Now that you have finished reading, I would like to thank you for your time reading this letter concerning how lack of exercise, too much time inside, and not enough time with family, shows computers are not beneficial to society.

Dear Editor, I believe that computers are one of the most useful things that we can have. First, computers are good for communicating. Students can contact teachers through email if they have a question about an assignment. Computers also are useful for teaching. People use the internet everyday to get information on their favorite sports teams or on a new recipe they saw on television. Finally, computers help us get work done easier. Student and employees use software for everything from writing a paper to creating a presentation. Furthermore, computers are extremely essential to our everyday life because they help us communicate, learn and finish work. Every year, thousands of students go to college, and thousands of families move away from each other. Computers are one way of communicating to our loved ones in far away places. Parents send messages via email to their children at college. Families speak with each other through video calls. Computers are what makes all this possible. Not only can we use computers to make contact with our families, but we can also use them to speak with our teachers. Whenever a student is sick, but wants to get their homework finished, they look on their teacher's website. Here, all the homework for the class is listed. Also, if a student has a paper due the next day, but their printer is broken, they can email the paper to the teacher. This allows the student to get full credit for their work. Email is not only useful for handing in projects, but also for asking questions about the assignments. If a student has a question about an assignment, he or she can ask a friend or the teacher. Then, the student will be able to successfully complete the project. Computers are one of the most useful ways of making contact today, but communication is not the computer's only purpose. The average person goes on the internet ten times a day just to get information. Computers provide a plethora of knowledge for people's use. Search engines like Google or Yahoo provide answers in less than one second. This is much faster than going in the library and spending an hour looking it up. Website text is not the only thing that provides information for eager learners; websites also provide pictures to further the persons understanding about a topic. For example, if a person is living in the city, and has lived there all their life, but is reading an article on a website about an animal native to the jungle, they would not know how to picture it in their head. Articles and books may provide a description, but nothing really gives the person a solid picture. The person could go online and search for a picture, which they will surely find. Finally, computers keep the brain active. While searching on a website, a person could piece together information from different sites to create a better picture, and, therefore, have a more complete and thorough understanding. In order to do this, however, a person's brain must constantly be working. This helps develop skills later on such as problem solving. Overall, computers are one of the most useful and common of the learning devices. Many people say that computers are useful. They agree with this by saying that work gets done so much easier and faster on a computer. On average, computers complete work fifty times more efficiently than people do by hand. This is because of programs such as word processors, spreadsheets, and presentation software. These programs allow people to correct spelling and grammatical mistakes while at the same time creating a neat looking presentation. Studies show that a high percentage of people with bad spelling or grammatical habits corrected their mistakes quickly through these programs. If people constantly make grammatical or spelling errors, then having them underlined will show them that this is not the correct way to punctuate or spell something in a sentence, thereby improving their skills over time.

Dear @CAPS1, A recent study by scientists shows that too much sitting down, especially in front of computers, is dangerous to your health. This is only one reason why I think that, although they are useful, computers are not entirely beneficial to our society. They hinder us from exercising, interacting with nature, and spending time with family and friends. Exercising, as we all know, is necessary to remain a fit and healthy human being. But how is this possible with some people going to work every day and getting shut in their offices at their computers all day long? Too much computer time, even for kids, can lead to obesity and overweightness. Also, like I mentioned before, scientists have concluded that too much sitting is bad for you; it isn't how the body was built to work. If you have seen WALL-E, one of @ORGANIZATION1's most recent movies, you understand it is easy. The humans in that movie, after relying on computers for so long, became obese and fat and had no muscle. This is an exaggeration, of course, but minor visions of this are going around the world. Going outside to do activities instead of sitting at a computer is a sure way to be healthy. The next thing that computers restrict us in is our ability to experience nature. Even simulations don't cut it; if you wanted to see a frog or some other animal, you can't just @ORGANIZATION2 it, you have to look for it in the real world. Developing a connection to nature can really nurture the soul and is fulfilling. Instead of exploring a computer, explore the world as we know it before it's too late or you're too old. Learn how to do something by doing it yourself. Instead of hiring someone to make something, make it yourself. Do it to learn it; don't just sit at a computer website to hire someone! Get up and get outside! As you become more dependent on your computer, you become less dependent on family and friends. It causes a rift between family members. Your family might not be able to help you when you're in need. If you're an adult, and you're on the computer all the time for something other than work, then you're not supporting your family; you have no income, no life, and no future. Why would anyone do this to themselves? Imagine this: You have nothing except your laptop. You're alone and have no family relations. Nobody wants to be that kind of loser living on the streets! You have nobody and nothing except for your computer, and you've wasted your life away. Too much time on your computer means that everyone suffers. To sum it all up, computers may be useful, but every single cloud has a dark lining. Computers stop us from exercising, interacting with nature, and being with our families. So get outside and live your life!

Imagine a world without computers; chaos in war, even the clutter on your desk would be overwhelming. The chat you're having with your best friend on AIM wouldn't be happening. The report on the library might not get done because all the books were checked out; in fact, we wouldn't have NASA or any space program without computers. I know if this happened I wouldn't be happy. Companies almost completely rely on technology; you can't just send a letter and have it arrive at the office in five minutes. Communication through the computer is very popular. A significant percentage of the world uses AIM or another chat service; in a study done by a university professor, a notable number out of every student doesn't talk to family on an AIM service. A quote from the professor said, "It is a good thing to stay in touch with their families as well as keeping up to date on current events." If computers are taken away, information is gone. It's all lost in some pile of papers. One time my computer crashed and I had a report due but all the books were gone. That report was done late when they were fixed. Now thanks to the new computer system, we are much more organized and NASA is running rovers on Mars. NASA runs completely by computers. Look what they have given us today. A large portion of all household appliances come from NASA's work. A comment from NASA implied, "There would be no cars or phones without us, their computers too." And that's true; are they going to take away cars and phones as well? We need you, the people, to decide. The people who made this country what it is today must decide if you think we shouldn't have computers. I don't, and neither should you.

Dear local newspaper, Computers have a lot of effects on people. Some effects are that it takes away from family and friends, you don't really have a social life, and you don't get enough exercise. Computers take away from friends and family time. I did an interview yesterday with a local teenager; and I asked, "When you go over your grandma's house what do you usually do?" The teenager said, "I usually use the computer." But why do you want to use the computer while you're there? You're with your family; you're supposed to spend time with them. Play a game like Monopoly, or play cards. Those are fun and a great way to interact with your family. If your family member doesn't have those games, bring them! People think that because there is Facebook, AIM, e-mail, and Myspace that you're interacting with friends. You really aren't. I asked my friend what they thought of those things and they said "They are great interacting websites." They really aren't. They are just websites on the computer. While you are on the computer you're not really maintaining a social life. Your town holds activities or has a fun place you could go to. Your town likely has a gym, community center, or a library. Go there and hang out with friends; interact with them. Going to school, going to the library, and hanging out with friends are great ways to interact with people. People don't think about the fact that you're sitting in your computer chair and not moving. While you're sitting in the chair you're not exercising, and if you keep sitting there you're gaining weight. You might get fatter because you're stuffing your face with Cheez-Its and not exercising. I asked another person a question; it was what do you do while you're on the computer? They said "I eat.." Eating isn't bad, but if you're not really paying attention you eat more than you need. Your town has rec leagues of sports such as soccer, softball, and baseball. Join a team instead of playing on the computer and snacking. Get active! Computers aren't the greatest things in the world. You don't stay fit with them, you aren't very social, and you don't really spend time with your family. Computers don't really help you grow up and be mature for the future.

To the School Board, The use of computers per family has increased greatly in the past ten years. In that same time, people are getting fatter and they need more exercise. If you use the computer it might break or not work properly. Computers are a big waste of time and a bigger waste of money. In the past decade, many people have gained a lot of weight. They do not do regular activities like going to the supermarket because you can shop online. Studies show that if you go to the supermarket or a store you are likely to be less fat than if you shop on line. Another reason why computers don't give you exercise is because of Google. If you wanted to see a picture of a beautiful mountain you could just go to Google and type it in. It is a much easier way to see sights, but if you walk you could burn up to several times as many calories then if you just look it up. Another reason is you can get addicted to a game. Let's say that you have basketball practice at four o'clock. If you go on the computer at three then you could easily get addicted to a game and forget you have practice. You would be stuck on your computer mindlessly typing away on a computer game that doesn't help you anywhere in life. When you don't go to practice you will not sweat and therefore gain extra weight. Scientists say that if you actually play a sport you can lose a significant amount of weight compared to if you didn't. Before there were computers, life was simple; no student forgot their homework. But now they use their computer, and many things can go wrong. First, the printer can break. Last year my printer stopped working multiple times so I could not do my homework. My teacher said that forgetting my homework affected my grade by over a letter grade. Another reason why handwriting is more convenient is you are capable of doing writing during school. Last year with my teacher, I had to write a prompt. She told me to go to the computer lab and type it but all the computers were taken. When I got downstairs she told me I had to write it so I got a low grade because she could not read what I wrote. Every other kid got a higher grade, but since I was not use to writing it affected my grade. Another reason why computers are inconvenient is when you need to do research. My parent got rid of our books a while ago because of computers. So one day when I was home alone I had to research a topic on the computer but there was a power outage. I could not do my science project so I got a poor grade on it. That grade brought my average down from an A+ to an A-. The only reason I got a bad grade is because I depended on the computer for research and it let me down. If I had better handwriting I would have gotten a better grade. The final reason is because they are a waste of money. Most computers cost a lot for the computer and installing. There is no need for them because everything computers have, a library can give. The library has books so you can research with books instead of computers. In my house, several people in my family have a computer but few of the computers are used once a week. They are extremely expensive and there is no need for them. Also my dad works at a computer store and he says that the computer people are overcharging by a considerable margin. With that extra money you could buy many books and magazines instead of a computer. That is why computers are not useful. People are not getting exercise, so they gain more weight. It is much less convenient than writing by hand. Finally, they are a major waste of money. The decades without computers were much more useful and everyone lived happier.

Dear Editor, "Teen at Local School killed in a horrific accident" is the title that flashes across the screen. Then another, and another. What is supposed to be a few minutes grows into an hour or two that take away from your family. I can see why this issue brings up many conflicts; as computers can be very helpful. However, I feel that more often they negatively impact the general public. For one, there are many sites out there that portray false information. Plus, computers begin to consume the rest of peoples' lives. When it comes to these technological devices there are pros but the cons can easily outweigh them. To start, computers are loaded with viruses, scams and internet predators. So easily someone can steal credit and information by placing offers that seem "too good to be true." If you listen to your instincts, then you'll know that they are. But, many people who don't know any better fall for these traps. In fact, a surprising number of people have been scammed some time in their life. I can clearly remember when someone I know thought they were buying a pair of boots. Later that day, they got a call from the credit card company warning them about the purchase. These days you have to be so careful when you're on the computers. When my friends and I were learning about evaluating websites in computer processing class we came upon a site that seemed reliable, and accurate. We were all shocked when we learned that everything about it was fake. Computers can put people who may not know any better at risks. I strongly feel that sites like these and many others have a negative impact on the public. In addition, computers steal much of peoples' time to the point where family, doing homework and exercising is limited. I can understand the effects of too much exposure to computers because I see it everyday with my younger brother. Once he begins his video interactive games, homework is pushed aside. The only words from his mouth are, "Please, just one more game!" I suppose you can infer how this turns out: one game turns into two and so on. It isn't only children either. Many of my own friends are updating status or pictures on social media for three hours every night. Isn't there a point where we can draw the line between going on for ten minutes and letting the computer control your life? When surveyed, the majority of students said that they spent at least two hours on the computer every night. When games and instant messaging starts to take away from studying and exercise there is a huge issue. Computers take away peoples' free time and can negatively impact their grades and fitness. So, I ask you to consider the benefits of computers; but also look for the negative effects. You will realize that there are more than you would believe. Support me on this by limiting usage of computers and by helping the public see the dangers that these technological devices can bring. Computers can harm relationships, finances and your personal life more than you would think.

Dear newspaper, Some people say that computers don't benefit society. But I think different. Computers benefit society more than you would think. They help people learn and make work much easier. They help prevent accidents, and they save lives. Computers help people learn and make work easier; it's a fact. You can type, you can plan your schedule. You can make a presentation or check your email. All of those things make work easier, and there are tons of more things you can do. As I said before, they can help people learn. You can learn trillions of things on the internet. You can learn about everything on the internet and it is quite amazing. You could get a medical degree on the internet. Making work easier or helping people learn aren't the extent of the computer's abilities. Computers can prevent accidents in anything that moves. For example, cars; millions on the road today and some can practically drive themselves, and that is all done with computers. Also planes; the only reason the pilot is there is in case something goes wrong. Same thing with trains. Furthermore, many systems are completely computerized; all the humans do is tell the computer what they want it to do. Almost everything that moves within its own power has been computerized at some point in time, and that makes the world safer for everyone. Finally, computers save lives; it's completely true. In hospitals without computers, people would be dying every day. They use them to keep records, record vital signs, and assist with surgery. In surgery, computers help by only having to make a tiny incision and can be much more accurate than human surgeons, which saves lives. Also, computers can make sure that an operating room is completely sterile, which reduces risks of infection. As you can see, computers benefit society a lot more than you might think. They help people learn and make work easier. They prevent accidents, which reduces people going to the hospital. And if they do go, they are almost guaranteed a survival. So what do you think about them now?

You've got mail! That cheerful sound greets me from my computer, which is filled with emails from distant relatives and friends. Without computers, I would not be able to keep in touch with these people as efficiently as I can with this technology. In the past few decades, technology has been drastically advancing, resulting in these incredible machines; with computers we can type faster, communicate with distant relatives, and find information like never before. Because of this incredible invention, computers have allowed us to do remarkable things that are truly astonishing. To begin, we have thrown away typewriters and purchased computers. Now like never before, we can type faster, improve hand-eye coordination, and edit our papers without the help of a peer. First of all, with the extreme amounts of typing needed for colleges, most occupations, and everyday lists, computers have made this a faster and easier process. I am sure most of the things you have to type for work or school are written using a computer. Secondly, we have gained amazing hand-eye coordination skills. Furthermore, by typing and reading at the same time, we have trained our eyes to do many complex things similar to playing the piano. Lastly, now with spell check and grammar tools, we are able to edit papers without using someone else's help! The computer can sense problems in an instant, which is even more effective. Without a doubt, the typing documents aspect of computers is a primary one reason why we need them around. Another reason is because of communication. Thanks to many wonderful communication applications such as email clients, instant messengers, social media platforms, and video chat services, we can now communicate with a surplus of distant friends and relatives. For example, with both my sisters at college it was hard for me to communicate with them; however, due to these platforms, I can see their pictures, instant message them, and even video chat! Without computers, being able to see their pictures and what they are up to would have never been possible. Secondly, email has created a fast, easy way to update people on schedule changes, ideas, and even sales and specials offered by stores! Snail mail is no more with this extremely efficient way of communication! Clearly, the communication aspect of computers is an explicit reason why we need them in our lives. Last but not least, computers have allowed us to access information like never before. We can now find facts and figures faster, easier, and with hundreds more opinions, within seconds; thanks to popular search engines and other resources, we can find the information we need. Not to mention, the process is exceedingly simple: type in exactly what you are looking for and you will be brought to exactly what you need! Thirdly, there are many more options and sites to choose from. For example, if you were to type in a certain animal there would be an overdose of pages pertaining to your topic. Now, it is possible to find exactly what you are looking for! There is no question that computers have made searching for information easier and faster, which is exactly why we need them in our everyday lives. Conclusively, computers are an astonishing invention that has opened countless doors for today's society. Without computers we would not be able to type documents as quickly, communicate as effectively, and find information in such a streamlined fashion. However, because of this invention, computers have allowed us to do incredible things. People all across the country are experiencing the efficiency of using computers, and now we can too! It is evident that computers are effective and are advancing technology in our society for the better.

Nevertheless, computers take away "bonding" time from family and friends. Adults and children alike are lacking social needs. They don't verbally and physically interact with their "online friends." And they wonder why families these days are turning out the way they are; the source of the cause is computers. Anyways, people spend too much time on computers; if people didn't waste so much time on computers they wouldn't be losing jobs like dropping flies. The unemployment rate is high because they suppose they "don't have enough time," when all their time is devoted to computers. If they took out the computers in their lives, they would have plenty of time to do such important tasks. No one wants a "stay at home" unemployed loser as themselves. In the end, computers are not a benefit to our poorly run society. They cause obesity, corrupt social needs, and eat the people's time away. You might think computers allow others to "chat" online with their "online friends," but they don't provide our physical and verbal social needs which results in a low self-esteem. If newspapers keep publishing articles about the "benefits of computers," people will soon stop believing that nonsense and eventually stop purchasing these newspapers. Nobody wants to read lies, do they? It is clear that we must reassess our dependence on this technology.

Dear local Newspaper, I have heard that there is a controversy over if computers benefit our society. Based on my opinion, it has become clear to me that they have been beneficial because they help us keep in contact, complete our daily work, and give everyone a fun time. If we were in a world without computers then our society would be completely lost. First off, one contributing factor is that computers help us keep in contact. Any one person can simply send an email by a click of a button. However, if this device was not around, we would have to use postal service or the telephone, both of which cost money and take more time. Why wouldn't you want a computer? What happens if a hurricane is abroad, and a family has no idea of its presence? All they need to do is check their email or the internet to realize what danger they are in. Calling somebody is risky because they could not be able to answer for any reason. In a situation like this, computers became essential to everyone for immediate and reliable information. Clearly, the ability to contact others and access vital news is a great reason why computers need to be kept. Secondly, computers help us complete our daily work. Almost everyone works during the week, and if you do not realize it, we get most of our help from computers. Let's say that a man or women is at their office and they need to create a power point in order to share the companies new brand. All he/she needs to do is turn on their computer and begin to work with a blink of an eye. But without this device, what would they be able to do? How would they complete their work efficiently? The need for a desktop, tablet, or laptop is obviously great when you work, as they are fundamental tools for modern business. Lastly, computers give us the ability to play games and browse the internet freely. When I go home, usually I go straight to my computer like most teenagers do. I can easily check scores or last nights games, listen to music, and play solitaire by myself. I dont need to turn on the television and wait through all of those tiresome commercials. I don't need to grab a CD and throw it into a boombox. I don't need to grab all the playing cards and set a game up. All I need is my computer for instant entertainment. Without a doubt the fun and helpful computers such as games help us out and provide relaxation. Although some say that computers aren't needed they help us throughout our lives. Based on my opinion, it has become clear to me that they are beneficial because they help us keep in contact, complete our daily work, and give everyone a fun time. All of these facts lead to one final solution, which is keeping computers in our society.

Is this really how we want our future generations growing up, looking blankly at computer screens? I know I don't want that. I know this from personal experience. The point is you can't replace family and friends with a computer screen. It's not right and it harms our real-life relationships. My next argument against computers is about our bodies and minds. The best way to take care of those things is through nature. Unfortunately most people aren't getting outside for a bit of exercise due to computers. In fact almost half of all individuals say they spend more time on the computer than anywhere else. This is not a good way to spend time. We need to solve this issue before more people make the switch from nature to computers. Fresh air, trees and birds are much better than a screen, a couple clicks, and the hum of a machine for your health and happiness. My third and final reason is about addiction. So many people are getting addicted to the things they are finding on their computers. Addiction is a very serious matter that we need to fix. All of this is pointing to laziness too from lack of interest in anything else. I know this from personal experience. When my brother first got his computer he literally locked himself in his room for days. All he did for almost a week was socialize online and beat his personal best score on a game. This is not the way to be treating a device; it should be a tool, not a trap. So, as I know you can all see computers don't have a positive impact on our society. First of all computers are over ruling family and friends. Also, nature is becoming less and less of a priority with the computer in mind. Lastly it's becoming a worldwide addiction that is hard to break. Thank you for deeply considering all the arguments that I have to offer. I know it majorly helps people keep in touch globally, but there are other ways to do it, such as mail or meeting in person, which are often more meaningful.

Dear Local Newspaper, I think that computers have a positive effect on people. There are many ways computers can have positive effects on humans. First, computers bring people together and let people interact with each other. They let people talk to each other in real time. Computers also let people learn about new things, as the internet has so much information available instantly. Computers also let people do things that they can't do without computers, making them essential tools in modern life. So, overall, computers have a positive effect on people.  Computers let people interact with each other in various ways, effectively bringing people together. People can use the internet to send emails to each other, which is much faster than traditional mail. When you need to write a letter to someone, it might take days for them to get it, but with email, they would receive it the second you send it. There are also websites like Facebook that let you talk to your friends; websites like that connect people across great distances. When you and your friend can't meet in person, you just have to get on your computer to chat. Computers also have web cameras, which let people talk to each other face-to-face virtually. You can see them, which lets people see the other person's facial expressions and hear their voice clearly. This experience is better than talking on a phone or writing a letter, and that is why computers are a positive effect on people.  Computers also let you learn about new things whenever you want. To find something out or if you have a question, you can go to the internet for answers. If you ask someone else, they might not know the answer, but a computer often does. Computers let people see pictures and videos from all over the world. If you wanted to see a picture of ancient art that you are learning about, you can go to a computer and type it in; computers let people see pictures that they couldn't see in real life. Videos let you watch things like something funny to cheer up your day. If you love a show on TV and you missed it, you can often find it on a computer. That is why computers benefit people positively by providing endless learning and entertainment opportunities.  Computers also let you do things that you couldn't do without them, enhancing productivity and creativity. When a teacher asks me to type a paper, I always do it on the computer because it is so much easier. If there were no computers, I would have to use a typewriter, and if I made a mistake, I would have to type the whole page again, which is very inefficient. Computers also allow you to play music easily; you can put a CD in and it will play the music, or you can stream songs online. Computers allow you to do things that simply couldn't be done without them, making everyday tasks simpler and more efficient.  Computers benefit society and have a positive effect on people. They let people interact with each other and they bring people together from all over the globe. They let people talk to each other instantly, no matter the distance. Computers also let you learn about new things, expanding your knowledge with a few clicks. They also let you do things that you couldn't do without them, from writing documents to managing complex data. Computers have many positive effects on people, making our lives more connected, informed, and efficient, so I hope you agree that computers benefit society in a profoundly positive way.

Dear Local Newspaper, The effects computers have on people are positive, in my opinion. I say that it is positive because what if you're in a rush, and you don't know if you need your rain boots or not? You can check the computer for a quick weather update! I say that it is positive because without the computer, how would most offices run their business? It's too much of a pain to keep everything on paper files, which can be easily lost or damaged. Especially in schools, because the teachers don't keep their grades for students in a filing cabinet anymore! They keep them on the computer, which is much more organized; they'd need a huge filing cabinet otherwise, which is impractical. I could understand why some people think computers have a bad effect on people. They might think that it takes away time from nature, friends, and family. But so many people take their laptops to the local park to sit under a tree on warm days and go on the computer there, blending technology with the outdoors. Especially students do this; they do their homework under the leaves to help them relax while still being productive. Also, people whose family or friends live in other states, they may not have the house number, or they don't have time for a long conversation, they can e-mail them, or use social networking like Facebook, or Myspace to look on their profile pages and say a quick, "Hello, how are you doing?" to stay connected. Local shop owner Mrs. Smith says, "I barely have time for myself! So when I want to say hello to my sister in California, I usually say hello on Facebook because I know how she loves to talk my ear off!" This shows how computers help maintain relationships even with busy schedules. I remember one morning, when I was rushing before school, I had no idea what type of outfit to wear. I checked the local news casting website for the weather forecast and thank god I did! I would have gotten stuck in a downpour without an umbrella, but the computer helped me stay dry. Computers are also good for if you want to catch up on any news, or just relax and play some games you can, offering both information and leisure. So, if you're wondering about the weather to see if today will be a good day to sit under the trees in the park and catch up on typing that report with your partner, then go ahead and use your computer. But don't forget to e-mail her and ask her first, since you lost her phone number, showing how computers provide practical solutions for everyday problems and help keep our lives running smoothly.

According to a recent survey by the National Tech Institute, 8 out of 10 people surveyed in Springfield agree that the use of computers benefits society. I personally concur with these 8 people; computers have a positive effect on people. There are multiple reasons why I think the use of computers really benefits society, including that they can teach good hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about faraway places and people, and even allow people to talk online with other people. Once again, I do believe computers can have a positive effect on people, enhancing various aspects of our daily lives.  First of all, it's a proven fact that most sports and physical exercises involve hand-eye coordination to some extent. The computer can help teach people from a very young age good hand-eye coordination through interactive activities. When a person uses a computer, they have to keep an eye on the screen but still be able to use the mouse or keyboard accurately. This takes a lot of coordination; if you think about it, people don't even love to look at the mouse or keyboard when they are typing, they just know where everything is through practice. People who disagree with what I'm saying often use the excuse that when people spend too much time on the computers they aren't getting enough physical exercise. However, I believe that is not entirely true. The hand-eye coordination people learn on the computer helps to improve their skill and coordination in sports; for example, in baseball, a person has to be looking at the ball to catch it, but at the same time they have to move their arm to catch it. That is where the hand-eye coordination developed on the computer helps, proving that computers can benefit society through teaching people this valuable skill.  In addition to this, over 75 percent of teachers at Lincoln High School believe that computers can be used as a great tool to help students learn and explore the world. Computers give people the ability to learn about faraway places and people they might never encounter otherwise. They give people access to information about a foreign place or people through online encyclopedias or other resource areas. On the computer, one can go to a search site and type in any place in the whole world. Then all they have to do is search, and they have dozens of websites with information about that place and pictures, making learning dynamic and visual. We are a society that is advancing in technology, and people are learning faster and more efficiently with the click of a button. In addition, I think it's also a vital tool in schools; teachers can have students do projects about different countries or people, and the student can easily find the information on the computer. Computers benefit society in the way that they can teach about different locations and people, fostering global awareness and curiosity. Computers can help people become interested in these different topics and may even inspire some people to go to these faraway places or learn about different cultures firsthand.  Finally, 9 out of 10 people asked had some kind of way to contact people online, whether it was through email or Facebook, highlighting the role of computers in social connection. Computers allow people to talk online with other people, bridging distances effortlessly. In our modern society, it is very important that a person has friends, and computers are a great way to keep in touch with friends, especially if they live very far away from you or if you haven't talked to them in a while; connecting with them on the computer is a great way to maintain relationships. Those who disagree with my opinion believe that spending time on the computer means less time with family and friends. I believe that is just the opposite. Since we are living in modern ages, families understand that when a kid leaves for college, they might be going far away or even across the country. Having a computer allows that family to chat through video calls, providing an easy way to keep in contact and talk with each other regularly. People talking to each other online is just another way how computers benefit society by strengthening personal bonds.  It's now or never to recognize the benefits of computers! They can benefit society in numerous ways. They teach people hand-eye coordination, a skill that can be used all through our lives in various activities. Most importantly, they give people the ability to learn about faraway places and people, expanding our horizons. Lastly, they allow people to talk online with others, keeping us connected in an increasingly globalized world. We are living in a modern time; society is advancing every day and computers are a huge part of it, driving progress and connectivity. They are having a positive effect on people by making information accessible, fostering communication, and developing essential skills for the future.

Dear local newspaper, I disagree with the overuse of computers because people should be enjoying spending time with family and not on the computer doing nothing; do you agree with me so far? First of all, if you waste all your time being on the computer, there is nothing productive you can get done, as I have noticed many children are on the computer every day right after school, playing games instead of doing homework. For example, my cousin is on the computer everyday doing nothing but wasting his time on pointless activities; are you still with me? Secondly, children should be studying on the computer, not playing video games and going on websites that are not allowed; more than 60 percent of students and children are on the internet playing video games and doing something that is done everyday, which is unproductive. Also, I have seen many kids playing games on the computer for hours, which hurts their grades. Thirdly, students will never learn anything if they waste their time because the computer is for studying, and many students don't use their time wisely as they should; also, many students should be using computers only sometimes, not everyday. I have noticed that so many students don't learn from computers because they are not studying for tests; more than 50 percent of students fail classes because of computer distractions and misuse, which is a serious problem.  First, people should be spending time with family and friends because they are the most important people around us, not computers. Are you still with me? Secondly, friends are the most important people I ever had because they care about and love you like you're their family, but what if you just waste your time on the computer; how will you know all your friends? For example, my friend is always on the computer and never goes to see her friends, and her friends don't come to her because she never cares about them, only the computer; do you get what I'm saying here? Thirdly, family is also more important than just being on the computer because they care about you, and you have to at least spend some time with family. For example, many families stop spending time with each other because the computer is more important to them, leading to weaker family bonds and loneliness.  Lastly, helping your community is a good goal because you make your city look better; you don't want it to be messy. Also, many people quit helping with community service around the neighborhood because they are too busy on computers; for example, I have seen trash on the ground and no one picks it up because they don't care, showing how computers can reduce community engagement. Finally, going out, doing sports, and staying fit is very important for health and happiness. First of all, playing sports is fun and improves your health, but people never play sports anymore just because of computers; for example, a significant number of people stop playing sports due to screen time. Secondly, going outside is very important because it is good for your physical and mental well-being, allowing you to enjoy fresh air and real social interactions, which computers cannot fully replace. We must prioritize real-life connections and activities over excessive computer use to lead healthier, more fulfilling lives.

Dear editor of my local newspaper, More and more people use computers, but not everyone agrees that this benefits society. These boxes can be harmful to their users' eyes. In addition, they lead to less interaction with “real” people. Finally, they lead to a very unhealthy lifestyle. Computers are harmful to our society. For starters, computers are harmful because they are very bad for our eyes. Between certain years, doctors saw nearly a significant increase in eye problems that resulted in either surgery, glasses, or contacts. This can be directly associated with the overuse of personal computers. Also, studies have shown that common citizens who use these contraptions for over four hours each day end up with an extremely deteriorated vision by a certain age. Finally, a particular company stated that overuse of computers has led to a very negative effect on the eyesight of their workers. It can be seen how work gets done faster; however, the cost of medical treatments actually surpasses the little extra profit gained by modernizing. Secondly, computers are harmful because they lead to less time being with “real” people. To begin with, studies have shown that people simply don’t learn as much about their peers by talking to them through a box. Also, a study by a specific organization has shown that there are roughly a notable percentage fewer conversations at social gatherings than just a decade ago. This is alarming because at that rate people might never get to know each other and the world might become an electronically based workspace. Finally a social relations professional stated that people end up with a lack of understanding when they can’t feel the emotion a person has when he or she is speaking. Sure, you can video chat, but that still does not convey the real feeling behind a person’s words. Finally, computers are harmful because they lead to a very unhealthy lifestyle. To begin with, the lack of fresh air obtained by sitting indoors all day is very bad for lungs and can lead to premature breathing problems. Also, average people get a considerable percentage fewer workouts, according to a particular publication, which is likely influenced by the overuse of computers. Finally, the obesity rate has risen from next to nothing to over a specific number in the past ten years. Research showed that the majority of the obese patients spent excessive time on their little boxes of technology. While you might feel that this is not completely due to computers, it has been proven time and time again that these machines are the main reason behind the world’s currently unhealthy lifestyle. Personal computers have a very negative effect toward the society of today. This technology has resulted in very poor eyesight in the general public. In addition, they lead to a much lower amount of social interaction. Finally, they end up forcing people into an unhealthy lifestyle. So, let the word out that computers are bad for society, and try to make the world a better place to live by encouraging more balanced habits.

Dear editor, I believe that using computers is a good thing. They can help you learn about subjects or places you think are interesting that you don't know about. They can help save the environment. These are the reasons why I think using computers is a good thing. First, they can help you learn about new subjects. Say you are doing a report for school on a particular organization, but you didn't know anything about them. You could just go sit at your computer, enter the name in a search engine, and press enter. There you have hundreds, even thousands of entries about the subject. You could sit forever and learn all about these magnificent creations. You can learn about any subject on a computer, at anytime. You could even learn about a computer and all of its history! Second, they can help save the environment. People are always using paper and paper comes from trees. When we cut down trees we are harming our environment. We are depleting our oxygen supply and destroying habitats of animals and insects. If everybody used computers more, we would be using less paper. We could use them to send documents and papers; we could bring them to appointments and for various tasks. Computers could even be used for school work. The teacher could assign the homework, email it to the student, the student could fill it out and email it back. Sure we would still have to use paper for some things, but we would be using it way less. People could also use less fossil fuel for travel by communicating via the internet with tools like video calls. Thirdly, computers could help us advance into the future. Computers can help find ways to do many things such as develop better medical treatments, more efficient travel, and even improve every day life. We could find better ways to treat serious medical conditions with the help of computers. We could find ways to treat cancers and maybe even the common cold. Computers could also help us find more efficient ways to travel. They could help find a more efficient fuel or help design new transportation methods. They could also help us explore deeper into space and find more planets and galaxies. Computers could also help us with our every day life. When you get up in the morning, imagine being able to wake up and have a hot shower, your breakfast, and your work equipment all ready within five minutes. That really would be the future of computers. Those are all of my reasons for having computers, from school research to space exploration and beyond.
