Dear, @CAPS1 of the @ORGANIZATION1 @CAPS2 has come to my concern that many people are debating on whether computers benefit our society or not. Some people think computers are the lives of many people, but I have to disagree with those who say that. I think that computers benefits our society in three ways, they bring people together, they offer many websites to research a topic, and they let people shop at home. One way that computers help us is that they bring people together by using the internet. Many families do not live close to other relatives, making it hard to see them. But with the internet, people can use social networking sites such as facebook or myspace to keep in touch with one another. Distant relatives can talk and share pictures with one another to keep in touch. Also, the internet can help bring couples together and potentially lead to marriages. How @MONTH1 times have you seen those @CAPS3 harmony commercial that claim to have brought two singles together to make a happy couple? Another way that computers help today's society is that they offer many places to conduct research on a certain topic. There are so many search engines on the internet that lead you to numerous websites to help you find out what you need to know. Also, researching a topic on the computer is so much easier compared to going to the library and reading books. When using books, to research a topic, you need to find the right book, read the whole thing or at least most of @CAPS2, and find what you're looking for. But with the internet, you just type in what you're looking for, click, and go. Lastly, computers let you shop online and lead to a better shopping experience. By shopping online, you skip the long lines at retail stores which means less time walking to get your product. For example, many people rush to stores early in the @TIME1 for huge sales on "@CAPS4 @DATE1." A person could be left waiting in line for hours to get a product. Why wait outside for so long when you could just buy the product in the comfort of your own home and get the product delivered right to your house? Also, many websites offer special deals for shopping online so you can even save money. In conclusion, I think that computers benefit our society in three ways, they bring people together, they offer many websites to research a topic, and they let people shop at home. A world without computers would be so much different than the world we live in today.

To: The @ORGANIZATION1 can be a big part of people's lives, however, some don't realize the negative effect these pieces of technology have. Dear local Newspaper, People spending time on the internet is a good way for people to connect with one another. But it can also be a way for people to get in trouble with things online like looking at inappropriate content, communicating with strangers they shouldn't be talking or typing to, or even encountering predators that could be online. Many kids and adults go on the computer either when they're getting out of school for the day or if they are getting off work for the night; they are just there on the computer to check up on things. For the kids, it's either for their entertainment, for chatting with friends on some kind of messaging program, or they are even playing a game online. Three fourths of kids under age ten go online more than adults age thirty because of their interest in what is on it. People sometimes say, "oh, I only go on the computer to check up on things. It only takes me a few minutes", But they are often lying. Most people don't just go on for a couple of minutes; they're on for more like a few hours, and that affects their relationship or connection to one's family and or friends. A specialist at the community center says, "people spend hours on the computer looking at whatever they want and most people do that and it has to stop for the sake of the person's family and friends." The specialist also said, "It's like an addiction". Do you really want to have an addiction? I didn't think so, so instead of just sitting there staring into a screen for hours a day, go outside and have fun with your friends or family, go to the mall, the beach, or even just take a walk in the park. Nothing can beat the feeling of being with friends or family and just having fun.

Computers are great tools and a great piece of modern technology. Almost every family has them. About ninety percent of my class has computers. So many people have them because they're helpful and are another current learning resource. Also it's a great way to keep in touch with friends. Although they can be time consuming, they make up for it in the long run. First, they are helpful because it's quick and easy to get from page to page. It's especially helpful for work because instead of calling a bunch of clients, you can send them all emails in under a few minutes. They also help with school projects or planning a vacation. You can find great low prices on travel agency websites on the computer. This is great because our country is having a bad recession and we need to be saving every penny. These are some of the few reasons why this modern technology is so helpful. Next is that it's a great current learning resource. You can find articles on anything happening right at that moment or a couple days before. Sometimes the articles in books are old and outdated. Those outdated articles don't have accurate, more researched information, but computers do, so you can compare your information. Also there are online schools that are affordable. So if you want to get more of an education but you have to work too, this helps a great deal. A computer can be used for many things like learning. Computers are definitely the best way to keep in touch with friends and family that you aren't able to see very often. I know what you're probably thinking, is that well isn't that what phones are for? No, because what if that family member or friend doesn't have a phone? Well then they can use their computer to stay in touch. They can use email, Facebook, AIM, and so many more. A computer helps me stay in touch with people I haven't seen in a while. Okay, now that I've stated all my reasons why computers are a great resource, I just want to remind you that they're helpful, a great learning resource, and a great way to stay in touch. Computers are now an important piece of society. Computers are a whole new track and it should stay that way.

Dear Local Newspaper, Computers and other technology are the best thing that ever happened to the world! I hear that computers affect people, well I don’t agree with that statement. Here are my three reasons why. Computers and other technology make life way easier. Talking to family and friends without spending money is a huge benefit. If you control the amount of time you use on a computer then you will be fine. Please keep reading to hear my great ideas. To start off, computers and other technology make life easier. Think about it: we have access to our bank accounts, stores, research, school, etc. See, instead of having to go out shopping for food you could just order it online with no trouble. We can now shop for clothes and other household items. It's so easy just to look at a list and pick what you want instead of waiting in a long line. For example, I went to the store to pick up a few items for a party. There was a long line, so I just got online, picked what I wanted and had it shipped to me in less than two hours! It's cool to not have to even get up to get what you want. I know you sometimes have that feeling since you don't wanna get up, but you feel you have to go shopping. Don't computers make life so easy? Secondly, you can talk to family and friends without having to spend money. This is awesome because you can text, video chat, and email for free. Computers have so many websites to talk to your family and friends like, Skype, Facebook, Myspace, Yahoo, and even Oovoo. Mostly, all those you can video chat and voice chat for free. All of those sites you can text for free and stay in touch with your loved ones. For example, one day I didn't want to spend my money to talk to my friend. So I just video chatted with them, and it was ten times better because it was free. Even calling people long distance is way too much money, so why not just video chat? I know you wouldn't wanna spend hundreds of dollars on a phone call bill! Please keep reading. Thirdly, if you control the amount of time you use on the computer or other technology devices then you will be fine. If you limit and set a time on the use of your computer, everything will be wonderful. You can tell yourself to get off the PC and get a work out or talk to friends in person. There's no way you could be addicted to something if you have a limited use of it. If you're the type of person that is easily hooked on something, then maybe you shouldn't get a computer. Like my mom gives me a limited time on the computer; my laptop has to be off by a certain time on a school night. And by ten o'clock pm my laptop has to be off on the weekends. There's always ways to not be addicted. You just have to know when enough is enough. It's not the computer's fault; you just have to control yourself. To wrap this up I would just like to say thank you for having the time to read my letter. My reasons are, computers make life easier, you can talk to family and friends for free, and if you control the amount of time you use on a computer then you will be fine. Thanks again.

Dear officials at the school board, have you ever been so bored that you spent the whole day on the computer talking to friends and relatives? Some experts are saying that computers are having a negative effect on people in our society, while others argue that they are very helpful. However, the use of computers has been taken to an extreme level and is having a negative effect on the community. Some reasons I feel this way are because of the social limits computers are putting on people and the amount of time people spend on them. My last reason is that computers are affecting the general health of people today. People should be educated on the negative effects computers bring! Firstly, computers are greatly changing the way people communicate. Instead of talking to people face-to-face, teenagers and adults find themselves 'texting' or "emailing" their friends and colleagues. This is causing many bad-habit forming. People are becoming less able to talk to others physically and might even be using terms like "LOL" and "BRB" instead of real words. This problem is causing a huge gap in the social workings of humans and is harming them more than we know! Secondly, the amount of time wasted on the computer is unbelievable! If someone logs onto the computer to search a fact or "Google" something, they might get caught up in other programs and spend hours on the computer. This time could have been used for more productive things instead. A recent poll shows that the average person from ages fifteen to twenty-five spends over two hours on the computer each day! This fact is quite amazing because these people could have been getting more things accomplished in this time. The amount of time wasted on computers is a huge problem that needs to change! Lastly, humans' health is being affected drastically by the use of computers. As the obesity rate is rising, these people are just sitting on their computers watching it go up. During this time, they could be exercising, going to the gym, or even taking a walk with friends. Teenagers could be playing outdoors but find themselves too busy on their computers to enjoy the fresh air. Whenever I talk to my friends, they usually say they are on Facebook or Oovoo instead of outside or playing with their siblings. The obesity rate will keep rising if these people don't realize that staying on computers all day long is a part of the problem! In conclusion, the use of computers has gotten to a point where it is hurting society rather than helping it. I feel this way because of the social flaws it is teaching people and the amount of time wasted on computers. Another major reason is because of the extreme health issues computers are contributing to. If the average person tried to limit the time they use their computers, they would notice a positive change in their life-style!

Dear Editor, Experts say, "Seventy percent of teenagers spend three hours or more on the computer daily." The recommended time limit is one hour. By spending more time on computers people aren't exercising. Secondly, those people aren't enjoying life and nature. Lastly, the use of computer puts a strain on social skills between friends and family. Surely the effects of computers can't be good. First off, people in this country aren't exercising as much as they should. Obesity and diabetes affect over thirty percent of the population. Both of these diseases are lethal. If you spend fewer hours on the computer, these diseases wouldn't spread nearly as fast. When will you get off the computer for an hour and go outside or to the gym and exercise so these won't affect you? Secondly, nature is a marvelous thing. Sure, camping in a tent and catching dinner isn't for everyone. But, there are many ways to experience nature without "roughing it." You can go to the park or to the aquarium. Sit on your back porch and go bird watching. All of these are great alternatives to sitting at the computer screen, looking at pictures of nature. Lastly, people aren't spending enough quality time with family and friends. Yes you can email, instant message, Facebook, and Skype family and friends, but it's not the same as in-person interaction. People are becoming less friendly and more isolated, mainly because of declining social skills. We need to practice the art of social interaction without a computer. In conclusion, computers do have a negative effect on people in the long term. People aren't exercising. They aren't enjoying nature. Finally, their bonds between friends and family are weakening. This is a growing problem which must be put to an end. Thank you for your time.

The amount of computer usage has been significantly growing over the years. Adults and children are spending huge amounts of their time on computers. Though these devices often seem entertaining and helpful, well, that is not all true. Computers are being used for more than just work; it seems to be the people's new way of communication. Communicating with others has always been a great part of our lives. There is not a person in the world who has not had some form of communication with others. Though computers seem to abuse the privilege of communication, for talking on an online chat site is easier and more convenient for people. The people in those chats are not always who they claim to be. This poses a huge danger on those sites, especially since children of all ages are now using them. These children do not always know who they are talking to, but because it's online they say anything that comes into their mind. The way we talk to people in person is not the same online. When communicating with people on the computer the writer tends to shorthand things. Such as the word "you" would be spelled "u". These quick changes happen without thinking and become a natural habit. These changes quickly become a part of our daily communication and writing. So instead of seeing the sentence "What did you think about her project", we will see "wat did u tink bout her pro." Because of this, many children's grades could be affected, for their spelling will soon become poor and their vocabulary will be limited or all in slang. This vocabulary change could be prevented if computers were not used as much. Today we are seeing less of people going outside. No one ever needs to go anywhere if all their communication can be done at home. This isn't just hurting ourselves but also the environment. The less time people spend outside the more energy is being wasted inside homes. The times we do go outside is for simple tasks such as taking out the trash. This is hurting our environment! There are not as many people taking care of our planet. People are not taking the time to make a garden, plant some trees, or simply pick up some trash on the side of the road. If we would all just take the time, maybe only ten minutes a day to help our environment, it would be helping our bodies and also helping our planet. This would reduce the amount of people using computers and change the way we see our civilization today. So please help yourselves and the earth; stop talking on the computers and get out and do something productive. The computer will always be there, but we only have one of us and one of our planet. We don't want to destroy these over a simple piece of technology.

I think we need our computers. If we don't have computers we won't be able to connect to our family that could live in another state or country. I know how there is texting now, but some people don't even have phones or anything; how can you connect to them? You can't call; it might not be free with the phone plan you have. If a family member comes and visits you, they would probably email you about it, but if there are no computers they can't tell you when they're coming. Are they going to show up unexpectedly? They might not even be home, and if they show up without them knowing, they are out of luck. And we exercise on our own time; we pick what time and we do it, and if we play a sport we're enjoying nature. Some people might have jobs that take place outside, too. There are nerds that are on computers all day long, but I'm sure they enjoy nature; I don't know about exercising, but they have a car and everything; they drive and things. Also, about the exercising, everyone has to exercise to stay in shape; I'm pretty sure people don't want to be fat their whole life; they want to look good and feel good about themselves. If it is a holiday or something and people want to send them something to wish them a happy holiday or whatever, they're not gonna be able to see them in person if they live so far away unless they plan to meet each other, but even if they do that, they're gonna want to email them, not call where it costs money, and texting only comes with certain plans for phones, so all there is left is emailing. Sometimes, people will moan that you're always on the computer; if you're not, don't worry, at least you get to email your family that you don't ever see. These reasons are my opinion that we should not get rid of computers and other such things.

Most adults believe that computers are just a waste of time and are sometimes can be addicting or bad for health. Well, it's true it can be bad, but it matters how you use it. There is one thing about the computer that is amazing. That is socializing with friends, family, or even strangers. You know when your parents say never talk to strangers? Well, you can do this safely and harmlessly over the computer, and you also learn a lot about life or other people's lives outside your small little town. There is another great perk with computers, and that is keeping in touch with family or friends that live far away. My sister went to college for six months, but the thing was it felt like two weeks because I was able to communicate and see pictures of her every day. The last but probably the most important part is getting ahold of people you actually really need to talk to, such as friends, teachers, or even people you never talk to in school. With these three advanced ways to socialize, it will always feel like you're never alone, which is an awesome thing. There are many other things the computer is used for other than social life, and that is actual important use, stuff you need to know or want to find out. Here is one example: everyone has forgotten their work at school or your office at least once in your life. Well, with being able to just grab all the papers offline is easy. Just go to your teacher's home page and just print your homework. It's that easy; just one click and that saved you a twenty-minute ride to school. How about when you're up at night wondering what the weather is going to be like, maybe sunny, cold, or even a glorious snow day? Well, instead of waiting to find out you can just go on weather.com and see everything: maps, forecast, or what is going to happen hour by hour. Just like weather, people always want to know breaking news. Why watch a two-hour show when you can just get to the point of what's happening in this world we live in? I mean, the parents have to open their eyes and see this is a beautiful thing. We should be proud of the fact that humans have created something so complex and interesting. There is one more topic that I know you're going to absolutely love. I mean, right now you're grading this in your office; well, you can be grading this at home on your comfortable couch, with a fire crackling and all the peace and quiet in the world. People work from home all the time; you can run a business from your very own living room. My father owns a company and works from home most days. It's absolutely wonderful that he is able to take me out, spend time with the family, and most importantly doing the things he loves, and guess what, you can do this too. Like I keep saying, it's only a click away; here is another topic: online banking. Do you really want to drive to the bank and sit down with that boring accountant and spend hours there? Well, now you don't have to waste your time; you can type in a couple keys and boom, you're on your way to see your information. That was faster than two hours, I'm guessing. Yes, I believe that computers are a good use of time and will also help a lot in the future. So the next time you log on to your computer, do some of these things and trust me, you will think exactly what I think.

Dear Readers of the Local Newspaper, More and more people use computers, but not everyone agrees that this benefits society. Those who support advances in technology believe that computers have a positive effect on people. They teach hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about faraway places and people, and even allow people to talk online with other people. Others have different ideas. Some experts are concerned that people are spending too much time on their computers and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. I agree with those experts because many people take the computer seriously and always want to be on. Though the frequent users think there is nothing negative about using the computers, there is, such as increased light bill payment, obesity, and, like the experts said, "less time interacting with family and friends." First, frequent users of the computer cause a high light bill because if the user is constantly on, then the computer must constantly be on; when the computer is constantly on, it causes the light bill to increase. I can connect to that because I used to be a frequent user of the computer and my guardian would yell at me because of it. Ever since I had brought down the habit of being a frequent user, my guardian has stated the light bill has decreased. Another reason why frequent users of the computer must decrease their habit is because of obesity. Obesity is when a man or woman is overweight. My imaginary friend is a frequent user in my imagination. He is like many others; he never exercises with his friends because he is constantly on the computer. Last but not least, frequent users begin to slack on interacting with friends and family. As I stated in paragraph two, I used to be a frequent user. I myself wouldn't accept invitations to go to the movies with friends, and I wouldn't help around the house. These were the main three things I wouldn't do. Then I learned to not abuse the computer, not waste my time on it, but I also learned to be responsible with it. That's what I think many frequent users should do, too. In conclusion, being a constant user is not healthy because it may cause obesity, increase your light bill, and means you won't spend time interacting with loved ones.

If it wasn't for computers, I'm sure kids would be outside getting exercise. Computers are a serious issue. Have you ever found yourself in front of the computer screen, on a beautiful day outside? I have, and while I was on the computer I could have been outside enjoying nature. I think it would be best if you unplugged those computers for a day and just went outside and got some fresh air! If everybody keeps this habit of staying on your computers all day and not going outside, we might turn into a world of couch potatoes! I'm sure you don't want that. Lastly, I remember multiple times I said I would do something with my dad but I didn't because I was on the computer. Many people can agree with me. They are on so much they don't enjoy nature anymore. Also, they aren't interacting with friends and family. I think after reading this you can see computers aren't good for our community.

Dear newspaper, People are spending too much time on their computers. They are on the computers when they should be exercising, leading to a more sedentary lifestyle. Firstly, the people who are constantly emailing people, facebooking people, or on myspace aren't getting exercise. Now, more than ever people are becoming very obese. It is very unhealthy. We need to get people moving and exercising. Secondly, People need to enjoy nature. Everyone is so caught up in their computers, they don't sit back, relax and take in nature. People don't get that the earth is polluted. Once animals are extinct they are not coming back. If they got off of their computers for a minute they could see the animals before they are gone. Computers are the wall between inside and going outside to look at the world. Finally, the computers are getting in the way of seeing family and friends. Everyone is so caught up in the newest computer they don't see their friends or family. I know some people who when its time for dinner, they walk down to the kitchen. We need to get people off their butts and away from the computer. Why does everyone have to sit in front of the computer anyway? It is time to reclaim our lives from these machines.

What I am going to tell you could change the way you think about computers in general. Dear School Board, I think that being on the computer too long is bad for people because, you could get obsessed with the computer. You could get in trouble, and it could effect your education. Dear Local Newspaper: Computers have become a major part of peoples lives. The effects computers have on people are only negative. Nothing good comes out of using a computer. This is because computers are time consuming from other activities, computers are not always working which leads to people getting angry, and using computers is bad for your health. I know you have a difficult decision to make but after reading what I have to say, there will be no doubt that you will agree. Using computers is very time consuming. People don't realize how long they have been using the computer. Once you start using it, you're hooked and it's hard to stop. A poll was taken and out of a group of kids, many of them said they felt groggy and had headaches, after using a computer for two hours. The way computers make you feel is not enjoyable. But while you're using the computer it's entertaining, for example, you're on a social media site and you're talking to your friend and you're laughing at them & enjoying yourself, but it's not the computer that's making you happy, it's the person; you might as well see them in person. Therefore, computers are time consuming & should not be used. Computers are not reliable, they have minds of their own. Many people do always rely on their computer and when it doesn't work it causes the person to get angry or frustrated. Computers have a vast impact on people, but they shouldn't have to. A doctor at a university says that a high percentage of people's frustration & anger is caused by non-working computers. If the use of computers was lowered, anger that people have would lower and would lead to other positive things as well. Furthermore, computers are not reliable and cause people to get angry. My final reason is that, computers cause health issues and cause people to be lazy. The obesity rate is higher than ever and people sitting on the computer all day is not helping. A significant portion of obesity is caused by the use of computers. A health expert at a research institute says that a majority of people who don't use computers are much healthier because instead of using computers they exercise. Therefore, computers cause health issues. In conclusion, computers effect people because they are time consuming, you can't rely on them and it's bad for your health. Therefore, computers have negative effects on people and their well-being.

Dear Community, Imagine one day being able to talk to anyone in the world by simply pushing a button. This has became possible with the computer. I support the advances in technology because computer can help hand eye coordination, it is easy to learn about faraway places or people, and the computer enables you to talk online. This is why I support the computer. First, the computer benefits society because it develops hand eye coordination. Did you know that nine out of ten people who use a computer have improved hand eye coordination. A prominent tech creator, "The keyboard is the most important part of the computer because it builds hand eye coordination." This reminds me of when I got my first computer and had no hand eye coordination. Now I can type with my eyes closed. I understand how you might think that computers cause people to not get enough exercise, however, the computer can improve your hand eye coordination. This is why I support the computers. Next I support the computer because you can learn about faraway places and people. Did you know that nineteen out of twenty students use a computer when they need to learn about a place or a person. An educator stated, "The way students study is much different than it used to be, now students use computers." This reminds me of when recently I had a report to do on a historical figure and all I needed was my computer. I see how you might think that enjoying nature is important, intelligence is even more important. This is why the computer supports our society. Finally, I support the computer because you can talk to the world instantly. Did you know that ninety-nine out of one hundred students talk online to stay in touch. The creator of a popular instant messaging website stated, "There is no doubt that this service is the easiest way to stay in touch." This reminds me of when I went away on vacation and still stayed in touch with my friends through messaging. I understand how exercise is essential to your body, however, talking with friends is important too. This is why I support the computer. In conclusion, I support the computer because it supports hand eye coordination, you can learn about faraway places and people, and you can communicate with people around the world. Now that you know why I support the computer there should be no doubt that you will support it too.

Computers are very enhanced pieces of machinery that provide significant benefits. With this high-powered object comes knowledge of many different places and what is happening around the world, offering immediate access to global events. Next, typing is a universal way of writing that is much faster than hand-written pieces, allowing for efficient communication and document creation. Lastly, online gaming is a convenient and fun way to relieve stress by interacting with other users around the world. There are thousands of news stories, every day of the year that do not ultimately get covered because of limited air time on news channels. To quickly and simply get your news from around the world you can visit a website and look at hundreds of stories at the click of a button. To add to that, you will get more in-depth news for there is no limit on room or space on the website. There will even be areas on the website to donate to those that need assistance. Patrick Millin, founder of the Global Aid Network, stated, "Online donations bring in billions of dollars in aid to people who otherwise would be in deep trouble, and the main source of all of this money is from internet websites." Without the internet, millions of people would not even know about these people who desperately need help. Typing is a quick and fairly simple way to write, that saves people valuable time. Teachers often assign writing homework, which takes about twice as long to hand-write other than type. Using typing would save you this time and allow you to continue on with other important tasks that are needed to be completed. Furthermore, typing is a mandatory class for many freshmen and previous experience is very helpful to the teachers and students. "I've had many students," says typing instructor Mrs. Gable, "and the ones that excel not only get an 'A', but also cut their homework time in half." Stress is a common problem in all age groups, and a computer is the best way to relieve it. Interactive games with people around the world will broaden your spectrum to other cultures. You may use your typing skills to talk with others, and share your opinions with them. "The results of a September study seemed a shock," says Dr. Evans at the National Research Institute, "but people who use computers an hour a day are much more culturally advanced than the others." To add to that, you can use video chat to talk to people in foreign areas. Friends, family, and exchange students are able to talk and see you through video chat. This greatly reduces parental worry for their children living in a foreign country, demonstrating the profound and positive impact computers have on many people.

Computers are good because people can find what they need and they are fun. They allow users to ask questions, find places, and get things for a good price with ease and efficiency. This accessibility makes daily tasks simpler and more convenient for everyone involved. The ability to quickly locate information and compare prices online saves both time and money, which is a significant advantage in our fast-paced world. Ultimately, computers serve as powerful tools that enhance our ability to navigate and manage our lives effectively.

Dear Readers, I believe that spending time on the computer has its pros and cons. For the good things, people are able to do research, talk to people such as friends and family, and also the computer can help you learn about anything you need to know about. I also think that there are some cons. People spend way too much time becoming distracted, you ignore your family without even knowing it, and if you are just staring at a computer screen which can permanently damage your eyes. I'm going to start with the good things about how computers have effects on people. The computer is great if you have to do research. If you need information on anything you can search it. Like if you have to do research on a certain project or subject the computer is the fastest way to get the information you need. Another good thing is that you have the capability to talk to people such as friends and family. To me that is very important and I'm sure for you it is too. That's what I believe a few of the good things are. Now, I'm going to talk about the bad things. I firmly believe that people are spending way too much time on the computer, without knowing how long has gone by! You just stare at the screen, which is not good for your eyes. It can permanently damage them. One last thing I would like to mention, is that when you are on the computer they tend to ignore their friends and family which could be a big problem. These were just a few examples about how the computer has an effect on people, highlighting the importance of using this technology in a balanced and mindful way.

Dear Health Council, I believe that people should be able to go on the computers and still be doing productive things. For a good reason such as communicating with far away relatives. Another reason is, if you need a healthy work-out or healthy eating tips, you can just print them out. And my last reason is if you're going on a far away trip but you don't know the way, you can just print out directions easily. Say if you have a relative that lives all the way in Australia but you can't call them because you live all the way in the United States. And if you call them, it'll cost you about five dollars per minute. What you can do is you can contact them over the computer using a webcam. And it's way better than just calling them because you can actually see them. Or if your on a business trip away from home, you can check upon your family. My second reason is, you can stay fit while being on the computer. You can look up healthy "yoga" poses. Or you can also do fitness lessons while watching them off of your computer. And if you're on a diet, you can look up healthy recipes. You can also get affordable work-out equipment that'll make, or keep you, nice and slim. My last reason is that if you're going on a long journey away from home you need to know the way. But, what if you don't know the way? You can go on the internet and look up directions. And that is way better because at least you aren't wasting money on a expensive GPS device. And it is more efficient and quicker. And the best part is that you don't have to keep looking at the device and program stuff. With the maps on the computer, you can print it out and actually keep it. Those are all my reasons to why people should really go on computers. There are many things that a computer can do which is really good. You can communicate with relatives, stay fit and healthy while on the computer, and get reliable maps. I hope that this opens up many people's eyes to the positive uses of computers, encouraging a more productive and connected lifestyle.

Should there be computers in our society? Yes, there should be; computers are good things and are a good help. I can give you three good reasons why: paying bills, social media, and research. This is why computers are good. My first reason why computers are good is because people need to pay bills; it's easier to pay your bills online than to do all the paper work, and it makes it faster for people and computers are really good for them, that's why we need computers. My second reason why we need computers is because people have social media like Facebook. And that's a good way to talk to friends, and get new friends and its fun to have Facebook and just interact with people and that is why computers are good in society. My third reason why we should have computers in our society is because of research and the need to get information; a computer is really good help for that, they are great help for research like a specific topic as the computer has all that information readily available. In conclusion, having computers is really good because of paying your bills, social connectivity, and research capabilities, so people need computers for these essential modern tasks. I have told you all the good things about computers, and now perhaps you can consider their value in your own daily life.

Dear local newspaper, It has come to my attention that computers have positive and negative effects on people. In the past there have been more negative effects on people. In a survey taken in several magazines, it showed that a large percentage of people have negative effects with computers. In my opinion, I think computers have a negative effect on people. First, people are not interacting with family and friends. It is very important to have interactions with people. When on the computer you are not really interacting with anyone. You just sit there staring at a screen. In a survey taken at a local community center, it showed that a significant number of people are on the computer and not interacting with the people around them. Parents do not see their kids as much because they are always on the computer. Parents would love to see their kids move and be active. Interacting with their family and friends will be healthy for them. Computers take them away from hanging out with family and friends. Secondly, people do not get to enjoy nature. People on the computer might not go outside because they are so involved with the computer. Staying in one room doing things for hours on end is not healthy; every once in a while people need fresh air. Learning about nature is more beneficial when experienced directly. If you do not enjoy nature you do not know what is going on in the world around you. Nature is all around us and why would you miss out on it. In a survey taken in a local magazine, it showed that many people are on the computer and miss the outdoors. While people enjoy computers, nature is being neglected. Lastly, people are spending too much time on their computers and less time exercising. Exercise is important for the mind and body. Our bodies need to stay healthy and fit. The lack of exercise is increasing fast. The more people get computers the less people exercise. America is over weight already and people on computers mostly just long to become over weight. People would rather play on the computer than get exercise for a healthy body. Dr. Smith, a local doctor, has seen more people become over weight and not exercise as much as they used to. He says computers do not provide exercise. He recommends that people use their computers less as computers are doing more harm than good. In conclusion, I think computers have a negative effect on people. My three reasons are that people are not interacting with friends and family, not enjoying nature and getting less exercise. I urge you to be aware of the negative effects on people. The newspaper's important decision is up to you.

Dear Editor of the Daily News, To start off I would like to give my opinion on using computers too much. Although I use a computer a lot I still have fun with friends and play sports. But too much time on the computer can cause you not wanting to get exercise or maybe getting sick easier. Spending so much time on the computer can cause a kid to be shy in the outside life. Exercising is very healthy for kids and adults. There are way too many people on computers doing anything you can think of for hours. Staring at a computer screen for a long amount of time will not keep you fit or in shape. People should have a minimal amount of time of sixty minutes each day and then get some exercise. This way you would get time for being on the internet and still doing what's good for you. I shouldn't feel bad about the people who waste all their time on the computer but I do. To see them getting gross and gaining weight from lack of exercise makes me want to help them; no one should put themselves into that kind of situation. What I've noticed about people who stay online a lot is that they get sick more often. From sitting there like lazy bums they do not get fresh-air. Not getting enough fresh-air can cause a cold or for some people with health problems to get very sick. They need to think twice about what they are getting themselves into. I would rather be having fun and getting nice fresh-air than sitting on the computer about to be sick. It can be a different story if you went home sick from work or school and went on the computer, but being sick from the computer is gross. Even though it is hard to say, people who are on the computer often are shy in person. If someone gets in a fight on the internet that can cause them so much pain to not even talk. Interacting with people is very nice and touching. But being shy and lonely because of a fight on the computer or from being on it too much, is something to be ashamed of; you should not have to be that way because of one thing. Get out in the world and do not let things like that get to you. To finish this off, it would be nice for people to take care of themselves and not stay on the internet for so long. Remind yourself to have at least sixty minutes to yourself and to do what you want but get some exercise also. Do not forget about staying healthy and going for a jog once in a while. You should not focus your life on your computer. Thank you and have a great day.

People are probably on the computers chatting, checking their e-mail, or making a website, or they are on YouTube. They are probably looking at or buying a new truck, or they are looking at the history on all the wars and how they were started. These activities keep them indoors and disconnected from the physical world and the people in it, which can lead to a more isolated and sedentary lifestyle over time.

I think computers work well because they help people with their own work. But computers do make people addicted because you mostly could do anything, but mostly computers were able to be used for help like work, maps, and finding out problems; for school it helps them with math, science, social studies and a lot more things. But people abuse it like their video games and they do not even go outside; they do not talk to their friends or even see their friends; it is mostly not having a life. And people do not feel like going to school because they are over-tired and they just want to use the computer all day without stopping. And so I think that people are just too addicted to computers; they do not use it for the right reasons. Then people get sick; they could get headaches or they feel like puking. And they do not get to see other things like go to the park, see a football game, soccer, baseball, volleyball, or even take their own dog for a walk at the park. A lot of people buy computers for games and entertainment, or more mature people buy computers for their work and to find where places are, so the computer helps a lot but it addicts a lot of people. And computers do really break often because people could download a game or something and then it gives it a virus. So you mostly spend about one hundred dollars or two hundred dollars to fix it. And new computers come out and they cost a lot, and they are different just from brand to brand and they go about more faster. And when people's computer breaks some go crazy and feel like doing some crazy stuff. They do not feel like they have friends; they only stay in the room forever and they never go out at all, and if they do come out of the room they instantly do not respect their parents; they do whatever they feel like doing and then they act out and get into troubles. Welcome to the 21st Century. In this day and age, numerous advances in technology are being made every day. The one advance that has stood out above the rest is the invention of the computer. For just one invention, the computer has many capabilities: internet access for educational purposes, keeping people in touch, and opening people up to new aspects of life. The computer has helped mankind with various discoveries about our world. As far as many can see, this piece of technology has positive effects on people everywhere, every day. The new trend in schools all around the globe is the addition of computers or a computer lab. The reason for this is that this technology takes learning to places it has never gone before. Whether a student has to write an essay about the presidency of Abraham Lincoln or obtain background information for a science experiment about paper towel absorbency, a computer can aid them in finding the information they need. Programs like presentation software allow students to present their work in a new and efficient way. For children that are home-schooled or adults that want a college education, computers let them learn what they need to from online schools. It is also important to note that they can keep in touch with friends after school hours. Computers are able to help them with this. How many times has it been said that communication is key to a healthy relationship? Computers, believe it or not, are an easy way to maintain contact with far away people. Some friends and family keep in touch completely by computer because they do not live close enough to visit daily. If one is cautious and uses internet safety techniques they can make new friends with common interests through computers. This contact with new people is just one way that a computer can broaden one's horizons. Computers are like keys; they open doors to new places and ideas. The use of this technology can help people in discovering so many new things they have never known before. Computers can help open people up to unique genres of music they have never listened to before. On the internet, there are many video tutorials that teach people different skills for free. In one's spare time, they could use a computer to research the people of ancient Egypt or the pyramids of Giza. Any way a computer is used has the potential to have a positive effect on someone. In the 21st Century, computers are essential to every day life. It is imperative that you decide whether you are for this remarkable piece of technology or against it. It is astounding what you could learn from just hopping on a computer. Especially keep in mind that computers are for more than just entertainment: they are for education as well. So what are you waiting for? Discover how great an impact computers can have on your life with just a click of the mouse.

Dear editor, I understand that some children and adults love going on the computer, but they don’t know what the bad effects are. When you're at a young age, anything can happen, and while you're on the computer, even worse things can happen. You could do bad things over the internet, won't exercise, or have time for your family. First of all, what I mean by bad things is that your child can go on bad websites, talk to strangers, or get harassed. When a child first gets, for example, a Facebook account, most of the times the people who request them as a friend are unregistered child molesters and or sex offenders. They would probably act friendly to get the kid comfortable, and then they would end up kidnapping them. Also, you could harass people or get harassed yourself, and you can go on inappropriate websites. Secondly, you won't get enough exercise, and this can lead to health problems. A child who stays indoors basically misses out on physical activity, which all kids need. This lack of exercise can contribute to health issues like diabetes, high blood pressure, and childhood obesity. Lastly, your child won't have family time. Now with more technology coming out like cellphones and laptops, kids would rather hang out with their friends and not with their families. I could understand the whole cellphone thing, but you need to make more time for your family. The reason I think going on the computers all the time is not good is because you can do bad things by talking to strangers, face harassment, and go on inappropriate websites, you won't get enough exercise and can suffer from health issues, and you won't have enough family time mainly because of all the new technology that has come out. It is important to be aware of these dangers and to use technology responsibly.

Dear editor, In my opinion computers are wonderful to society in many ways. They can keep memories we can't keep forever like photographs, documents, and type letters. Computers also can give you dieting tips and advice from live locals. But, most important of all, family that you miss can talk to you for hours without a phone bill. To begin, a computer can give you helpful tips on things you didn't know, so it can also be a learning center. For example, if you're extremely stressed out because you have a huge paper to do but have no facts, there are millions of websites you could go to find your answers on. The next day you get your paper back and there's an A stamped right across it. Another helpful thing about computers is that you can talk to your family members all the way in a different city, town, state, or even continent! You may miss them a lot, but you can always see them or type to them to let that sad feeling melt away for a little bit. Every one in two Americans says missing or not seeing a family member is like letting a little piece of your heart fall off. Everybody knows what it's like to have a memory that you could never forget, but what about those little memories that photographs, websites, and written work seem to slip away from the brain. Computers save all of that so the "I know what it's like to lose a little part of life that you have lived," exclaims one user. This is exactly why computers are beneficial in many ways. I hope you are thankful for the mind, tips, and family connections they provide.

Dear editor, Have you seen someone with a smartphone emailing their co-worker or a person with their laptop at a coffee shop? Well, I can say I have and know they need it and it benefits them. People everyday use a computer for their work. Also, you can keep in touch with friends and family. Plus, it's the start to a new improved future! Whether you use a computer to get the latest gossip or for a job, the computer is now an important part of people's lives. My mother works on the computer everyday at her job; though it may not seem important to you, it is to my family, who needs the money for food and bills. Half of the workforce uses computers for jobs for money just like my family. Recently, a major computer company took a survey to see how many people use the computer for work. A whopping amount of people use the computer for work. That large percentage of people benefit from using the computer. They depend on their email to get to their boss or their layout of their statewide meeting to save so they can get the raise they deserve. You, the newspaper, even uses computers to write your articles for the paper. More than half of businesses and organizations benefit just from working on the computers. Everyone says family is the most important thing, right? What can you do if they live far away? Well you email, video call, instant message, or call of course. Some experts claim, "People are spending too much time on their computers and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family." Video calling is and was originally invented to keep in touch with family. So the experts have no reason to claim that because people use the computer to keep in touch with families. Even people in the army use the computer to communicate. Using the computer isn't as bad as people think. Look out! The future is coming! New technology greater than my knowledge is coming. Computers were the start and people haven't stopped since. Sure, of course the computer has a couple downsides, but what thing or invention doesn't. No one can stop what is coming; you just have to learn to live with it and move on. Computers are the beginning to something good so don't stop something that could be even better! Next time you go outside look for that guy in the business suit emailing on the smartphone or the girl in the coffee shop and smile, knowing they are benefitting from it, whether it's for work or for keeping in touch with a relative, or maybe someone with the next big idea for the future. Take a chance on the computer, stop the negativity, and a pleasant surprise will come your way.

Dear The Local Newspaper, I do believe computers effect people, but in many different ways. Also, depending on how long you are on the computer for. In my opinion, computers are good for many reasons. I will tell you some of the reasons why I believe this. Hopefully, after you read this you'll think about it more. One reason computers are good is the communication. There are many different web sites to go on and talk to friends and family. If you had a family member far away, this could be a good way to talk to them. This also is a way to see your friends with the latest technology; you can video chat. Video chat is a way to see and hear your friends by a little camera. It is a very good way to keep in touch with people you know. Another reason is that you can get a lot of information from the computer. There are so many websites that provide answers to all your questions. Websites like online encyclopedias and libraries recommend other sites to go research. You can learn a lot from computers. The information provided on the computer can really teach everyone something. Lastly, a computer can help you with many things, such as online classes, matchmaking, jobs, and so much more. You can find things to do by just typing it into the computer. The economy is very bad, but you can look for jobs online. Then once they find one you're interested in they'll tell you. It's a very good and helpful way for you, and it's so simple. Computers are an amazing and new technology. They keep coming up with more and more innovations. So why not use it? It can teach you something and help you, and also help you stay in touch with family and friends. Don't take it for granted, but use it well. It's only a click of a button. I hope I made you all realize what a computer is really useful for, and maybe even changed your minds or gave you a different way of thinking about computers.

Dear Editor, Technology has been advancing at a rapid rate for many years now, making life much easier for everyday people. It helps out in many ways, for example, to keep in touch with relatives, to learn new information, and to keep you safe and updated. Computers are vital to everyday life and we need them. A huge purpose of computers is to keep in touch. With new programs like social media and messaging apps, it leaves you with all sorts of new opportunities to keep in touch and have fun with your friends that were not previously available. Email as well is a great tool to keep in touch with family that are far away, opposed to the good old letter which may take a week in the mail. Another huge reason why we need computers today is to be able to research foreign places and learn facts that without a computer you would never have even heard of. With computers, it makes it possible to go online, look up a destination, research it, and plan a flight there a week later. It is also a great tool to learn new things that you did not know previously; it is a huge step up in the education process. Computers also provide us with extreme safety and security as well as breaking news. Imagine how much simpler it would be to be able to be at home and go on the computer to check the best route home, opposed to not having that information and consequently sitting in traffic. With modern day technology all that is possible. They add great safety and protection to average people like you and me. In conclusion, hopefully your mind has been changed on the topic of computers, or if you already were in support, that as well is great. Now you are being asked to spread the word about how great computers are and how vital they are to ensuring a better future. I understand that some people do not enjoy electronics, but it is up to you to set them straight! Computers are great tools for moving ahead and we should cheer for them, not trash them.

Dear local newspaper, I've heard that some people think that computers do not benefit society. But I believe they do. Computers help us learn information of all types, from simple facts to complex subjects. It's a good source of entertainment, providing a wide array of activities. And last but not least, computers do not drastically change the time we use exercising, enjoying nature and interacting with family and friends. Computers are a great resource in our everyday lives so why not use what we were given. Consider Google, yahoo, Facebook and the local library. What would we do without them. They help us figure out small things like a quick and easy way to get rid of a stomach ache or a funny joke to tell at the office the next day while you are in the staff room drinking coffee. They also help us when we want to know what to do when your newborn has a cough and a small sneeze, you know the tough stuff. These are the kinds of things you need to know and not everyone can go out to the library every time you have a question. The information on the computers is endless; why not use it from learning a new language for your next vacation to Paris to finding help for that geometry homework that you just can't understand, the computer can do it all. Entertainment is everlasting on computers from the skateboarding dog on Youtube that you can't stop laughing at to the exciting new games on addictinggames.com. There will never be a dull moment. There are millions of videos and movies on youtube. There are thousands of games on the website alone from pacman to scrabble; there's no way we'll have nothing to do. I always go on Skype to talk to family living too far to visit. Computers are one of the best sources of entertainment; they definitely benefit society. Computers definitely do not change the way we exercise, enjoy nature or interact with family and friends. On the computer there are videos that show us new yoga moves and other ways to lose those extra pounds you gained over the holidays. There are sites to find where to go camping and have that family vacation you have always wanted. And we always make time to go see our family and friends. Computers don't keep us hypnotized. Without a doubt, computers benefit everyone's society. They are informational. They definitely entertain us all. And they don't turn us into mindless zombies so that we can't interact with other people. Computers are one of the most helpful things we have and no one should think they aren't after reading this essay.

If it can help a driver turn his wheel faster or hit his brake I think that hand eye coordination could help that driver stay out of an accident. Think of a climber trying to grab a hold on a mountain. He would be able to see it, grab it, and pull himself up quicker than before. You can google anything you want from when the American Civil War ended to when the Berlin Wall collapsed in 1989. You can also learn either interesting and useful things like food recipes or the contents in paints. Or you could just be keeping up with the news on yahoo.com. Computers are a lot of fun. There are hundreds of websites that will let you watch it for free. Did you want to hear your favorite bands new album? Between learning about other cultures and just having fun, the computer can be a great tool for interacting with friends and family, improving hand eye coordination, or learning something new.

Dear The Editor, I can see both sides of your argument, on whether computers are important. However, computers have revolutionized the way we live our lives. Just for a moment, think what would the world be like without computers. I feel the computers are an important aspect of our lives. Computers are especially important to students and teachers. For instance if a student needed to do a report on a foreign country, he could look up facts and other things on that country, then he could condense the facts into a paragraph on a word document, and if he had a question he could email his teachers. Finally he, could print out the finished report. All that, without having to get up and bother his parents to go to the bookstore and pay a high price on a book that he will probably read one time. Also if he had a question there would be no communication outside of school. Another example of students using computers is online textbooks, which spares them of lugging heavy textbooks home. Because I know computers have helped me in school and made more work much easier. Secondly, a large percentage of businesses say that they use computer daily, and some agree that without computer, their businesses would fail. Computer make business much easier, especially with the business managing and file keeping programs that are available. On a computer, businesses can store customer information, compare income, and keep stock of inventory without having a cluttered pile or file cabinet. Computers can also save businesses money because they can cut out jobs such as record keeper. Also businesses can save time by having meeting via web cams instead of having people drive from state to state for one meeting then do it next month and the month after; and they could email important things such as sales projections and other things as well. Computers are also important and helpful in the home. People can do grocery shopping from the home they can order pizza online and they can go shopping online. Also, people can pay their bills online which saves paper. Lets say this, a mother, has a child who is sick and she wants to know how to heal him, what to feed him, and what medicine to give him. She can look all this up on the computer and bookmark the websites for next time. Then her other child comes inside, and she wants to find a healthy snack. She can feed him which she can do online. Next she wants to make chicken fried rice, but she doesn't know how, she can look up the recipe online. Finally after dinner she need to clean a stain on the carpet but it wont come out so she buys a carpet cleaner from the web. Computers have just made a mother's day so much easier. Without computers our lives would be much harder. If we didn't have computers the person who did a report on that country would have failed, the sick child would have not been helped, the hungry child would have been fed unhealthy food, and many businesses would fail. Computers are an important facet of our lives and their benefits are undeniable.

Dear Editor, do you know someone who lives faraway from you? Or have you ever used an online service? These are only a few of the techniques a computer has. Computers benefitted society greatly. It helps people in many ways such as allow people to talk to each other, gain skills from playing games, and it has images and it is easier. As I mentioned, computers allow us to communicate with other people. This way, we don't have to talk to people in person all the time. it would get annoying if every time we wanted to talk to someone one of three things would happen without computers. those would be either getting in trouble at school, memorizing a phone number and then dialing it, or talking to them in person. Clearly, computers make it easier to talk to people. Next, computers allow us to talk to faraway friends or family. You could write an e-mail or talk to them in a chat. This helped me because I talk to one of my friends in another state and just recently sent an e-mail to my aunt. Without a doubt, computers make it easier for us to communicate with other people, no matter how far. Secondly, every computer that I have seen is able to play some sort of game, whether it be by a disk or on a website. These games can teach us many skills. The first skill we could learn is typing. just a few days ago, I was playing a game where you had sixty seconds to type as many words as you can, as fast as you can. If you make a mistake one second decreases off of your time. It also gets harder as you go, getting from just three letter words to five letter words to even seven letter words and so on. Also, a class that at my school, information processing, is about computer. Once we were finished with our assignments, we could play type to learn games. That is also a typing game. As you can see, some games can teach us how to type. Another type of games where you need quick-thinking to be able to win. This teaches us to be ready for almost anything. Also, it teaches us to process what is around you and decide in a decision. In real-life situations you sometimes only have a few seconds to react. Games such as these help in real-life situations. The last type of game is the tower defense. This shows us teenagers to think like our lives depended on it. If we were to ever join the army and become some sort of captain, we would be able to organize our troops in the best manner we could think of these tower defense games also teach us think and plan ahead. In these types of games, it costs money to buy upgrades and buy new towers. One decision is to either buy a weaker upgrade now or save for a stronger one in a little bit. Tower defense games make us make better decisions. Games can be fun, but they teach us skills too. Lastly, computer make things easier and have images on websites. One thing that a computer makes easier is finding information quickly, which is a great benefit for everyone.

Dear Newspaper, the @CAPS1 generation has grown up with the complex technology called computers. I have learned over the years of using them that they aren't as helpful as they seem. They can cause an addiction and create numerous distractions. First of all, many doctors say that computers cause "the new depression." The internet is where most of this takes place. For most teenagers, having a Facebook, Myspace, or Formspring is not unusual. I know from personal experiences that some people abuse these social networks and use them as another way to bully people. So therefore, not only do you get made fun of in school, but now people can make fun of you in cyberspace. This is the main reason that people become socially depressed. There is almost no way to escape it, and all of their anxiety really starts to get to them. Addiction to computers is also a very negative impact. Many people go on the internet and are so fascinated that this is how they spend their free time. About @PERCENT1 of people say that they are addicted. From my @CAPS1 experience with using the internet, I know that there is always something that pulls you back in. You know that you are an addict when you spend more than an hour a day on the computer. Parents always say that it is a self-control issue, but many adults have the same problem. They have just started to be able to use the computers, so many times they go through a phase of addiction. Furthermore, this addiction problem would be totally gotten rid of if we stopped using computers. Finally, computers also create many distractions for students. When students sit down to type their papers, they also, many times, have another window open at the same time. Therefore they are getting barely any work done. Social networks only just make this even worse. Constantly chatting with someone can cause you to lose track of time. Also, when you try to multitask with the internet, it becomes difficult to focus, therefore causing grades to go down or not complete homework on time. All in all, this is an issue that can be easily avoided by eliminating computers. In conclusion, computers do not help us. They cause social depression, which causes people to have anxiety problems. They cause addiction, which ends up taking over people's lives. They create diversions that make concentrating hard. I feel that computers have negative effects and they should be gotten rid of completely!
