Dear local newspaper, I believe that computers are affecting the lives of many people. More and more people keep getting sucked into the amazing things that computers can do and forget all about the other more important things in life. People should be exercising, and hanging out with friends and family; computers don't even teach you that much if you really think about it. People don't even realize that computers can take away very important things in life. For instance, people aren't getting nearly as much exercise as they need. In this generation, more kids are overweight and obese than any other generation. People get so caught up in what they are doing on the computer that they forget to exercise each day, or at least every other day. Computers just add to the list of excuses not to do anything. People already spend way too much time watching T.V. It rots your brain, and studies actually show that people are less aware and less connected to the world and the people around them. Computers are the same as T.V.'s; you say that you're just going to be on for a minute and then next thing you know @NUM1 hours have already gone by. Computers @MONTH1 be exercising your brain, but they're not exercising your body and that's what really counts. Even if you were on the computer doing research for a school project, the computer still wouldn't help you. Most people don't have the time to run out to the library to get the books that they need, so they just resort to the computer. That isn't the smartest idea because half of the websites that you click on or go to don't even have the correct information. You might look at it and read it, and even if it sounds good to you, that doesn't mean that it's right. Next thing you know, you have a @CAPS1 or @CAPS2 on an assignment that you thought you aced. On top of getting false information, most people don't even know where to look to get the information that they're looking for. People just type what they are looking for into the Google search box and press enter. Then they just click on the first link that they see and use the information that is right on the page. Then all of these different windows are popping up and you are far from where you were. People then just give up and start goofing off on the computer because they don't feel like trying to get back to that page. If people just went to the library and did research the old fashioned way, then they would stop to notice all the things in life that they are missing out on. People should be focusing on family and friends rather than playing games on the computer. Sure you can talk to people on the computer but you can't bond with them or really see what they are feeling. It's better to invite them over and have some fun playing board games or just talking in person for a change. Even if you're spending time with your family or friends you're probably thinking about the computer the whole time that they are there, so go out and do something for a change; a little fresh air wouldn't kill you. You should go to an amusement park, ride some rides with your cousins, do something that will keep your mind off the computer. People don't realize it, but after spending so much time with your family, rather than your computer, you will actually notice what you have been missing out on for so long. As you can see, computers aren't helping anyone. It's either not exercising, getting false information, or not spending time with your own family! Seems to me that having computers around isn't everything that it's cracked up to be.

To whom it may concern at the local community board, it is possible to imagine a world without computers, where drivers are bumping around and having difficulty watching the wheel and the road, phone bills are through the roof because the whole world has no other way of communicating, and students are home worried sick that they do not have a book to study with. Computers positively affect all of these areas of our lives. They teach hand-eye coordination, allow us to communicate with others in dozens of ways, and let students learn and stay updated from their very own home. Computers must stay a fundamental part of our every day. To begin, computers must remain in our community because they teach even young children hand-eye coordination. In a recent report, the National Drivers Association states that in the past five years, the number of driving students who pass on their first try has almost doubled. The video games, the computer mice, and even typing train the brain at a young age to work in sync with the body's arms, fingers, and other appendages. "It's not only on the road where hand-eye coordination counts," says Dr. Evans, head of surgery at City General Hospital. "We are finding that younger doctors, ones that grew up on video and computer games, can perform robotics surgery with much more precision than our older attendings." Without the coordination we acquire from the computer, many jobs would be out of reach, too. When asked, nine out of ten managers of local businesses said they would hire someone who could type over someone who could not. So, though you may think computers teach nothing, they can provide coordination skills for the rest of a person's life. Secondly, computers should be part of our homes because they allow people to communicate with others across the world. In a 2010 poll, only fifteen percent of teenagers had an e-pal, but a recent poll says that over sixty percent now have e-pals. Computers have opened new ways to communicate through e-mail, instant messaging, and social networking sites, just to name a few! Parenting Monthly says that parents prefer their teens to e-mail friends or message as opposed to talking on the phone because it quiets the house, frees the phone lines for others, and keeps the phone bill low. My friend once only talked online for a month and her parents encouraged her because the phone bill decreased by a third. It is clear that even though you may feel that computers take up time that could be spent with others, it is actually a way to communicate with people everywhere. Finally, computers can help students learn. In today's schools, students depend on homework being posted online and getting their books over the web. Once, my brother did not take home his book-bag for a week and got all his assignments online. We were grateful for the strain off his back. When asked, eighty-five percent of tenth graders say they use e-books at least twice a week. The internet is also a valuable research tool. Seven out of ten high schoolers say they use a book for research less than once a month. As you can see, the internet is a valuable learning tool. In conclusion, computers help us with coordination, communication, and education, providing nothing but positive effects on people and on society as a whole.

A lot of people use computers in the present day. This technology allows family and friends to interact with each other, research places and ideas, and lets you type a document to look neat. On the other hand, computer technology prevents people from being active, exploring nature, and talking to family and friends in person. I want to explain to you how I feel about computers personally. I can honestly tell you that I love computers. I spend a lot of time on social media, because it lets me talk to friends I sometimes do not get to see. I can even see how my cousin in another state is doing. Computers also help me out with homework. For projects on a subject that I do not totally understand, I can just hop on my laptop, search what I need, and bam!, I have my information. Then after that I can type up my report and even pick out a couple of pictures to print out, see? Computers are bangin! But I can understand the other side of the issue. Computers can be time consuming. I can admit that I have spent hours at a time on the computer. This has become a problem. Experts say that people are starting to spend too much time on the computer and less time in the real world. A perfect example is my brother. He loves online gaming. My mom will call him down for dinner and he will be too engrossed in what he is doing that he will skip the meal. His friends will call him and he will blow them off until he finishes his game. I agree that people should not spend so much time on the computer. You have probably read this and thought to yourself, well, how does she feel about it? I can honestly say, I was supposed to choose one side. But here is the thing. I like my laptop. I am addicted to social media, but I still play sports, I talk to my family, and I even like to take walks through the woods or on the beach. I am neutral, like Switzerland from Europe. Some scientists say computers have a positive effect on people. Some experts say they are concerned computers have a negative effect on people. Dr. James says they are both right. Computers are wonderful. They are one of the most growing technologies in our world. But we do not need to spend all of our time on them. I hope you understand my balanced point on this issue.

Plus, some people like teachers want to get staff off the internet for their students to learn about people and places. Others just want to talk to other family or friend members in other towns, states, countries, or continents. Once you read this letter, you will understand my reasoning. Click, click, click, "Oh no!" Your computer froze, what are you going to do now? Computers have a positive effect on people because it teaches you information, you can socialize, and you can improve your skills. Without a computer, you'd be hopeless in many modern tasks. Have you ever needed to do a research project, but don't have access to go to your local town library? No problem, because you have a computer at home. You could just sit down, type in a few things, and get all the information you need, and more! You can research just about anything on everything, because the computer will have it, from academic papers to how-to guides. Maybe you want to learn something new, but there aren't many books on it, well there you go, the computer is your friend. Many people assume that computers are just for entertainment, to play games and have fun on your free time. What they don't know is all the research engines like Google, Netrekker, and other online encyclopedias, all loaded with knowledgeable information. Some people sit at home and read to become smarter, right? You can do this with a computer, which would probably even be more entertaining than a boring old book from the library. Have you ever thought to yourself "the computer is just a way for people to get away from everyone else, and just have time to yourself?" If you thought that way, you thought wrong! There are many ways to socialize with others through the computer such as e-mail, instant messaging, video chatting, etc. There are various ways to communicate with people through the computer. It is amazing technology because even if someone is in a different country, you can communicate with them in the click of a button. Ever heard of social networking? The name is self-explanatory. You socialize with people all across the world through a network. For example, there is Myspace, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc. That is a fun way to connect with others like relatives you have never met or that live far away, friends, friends of friends, etc. You can even be really social and meet new people, as long as you're safe. You might be thinking at this point, that a computer is nothing more than research and socializing. Again, you thought wrong. Computers are a good way to help with your skills. For example, your hand-eye coordination improves. You look at the screen, type your words, look at the screen again, while clicking your mouse. That really improves your coordination. Also, your hand movement will get better. When you type, your fingers are moving all around the keyboard, creating hand muscles. Not just physical skills, but computers help with research skills. There are certain ways to research information effectively, learning to discern good sources from bad. This can help for future researching, and school purposes. Without all this, wouldn't a person be missing something? Computers play a big part in everyone's lives, no matter what age they are. Computers definitely have a positive effect on people.

Do you have a computer? I'll bet most of you do! You might spend several hours on the computer or even more hours! Computers in fact have many down-sides to them. You could be so involved that you never go outside or get exercise. Also, sitting a few inches from the computer screen does not help your eyes. Lastly, the internet has very inappropriate websites that kids should not be seeing. Are you a kid who spends two to several hours at a time on the computer? Well, if you are, it's time to get off the spinning computer chair and out for some fresh air. Most kids spend most of their time on the computer playing games or on social media or watching videos. It might be good for kids to interact with kids out of school but some kids take it way too far. They never go outside and get any exercise. This is not good for a growing teen. They need to be up and active, running and playing sports. So, limit the time you spend on the computer. Without a doubt, computers are very bad for your eyesight. Unlike a television or video games you could play a long distance away, a computer is played just a few inches from your face; over time, your eyes will be so used to sitting close to what you are looking at, that when you back up you can't see well at all. I knew a kid who played video games from about a foot away for long periods of time a day. Today, unfortunately, the kid has very poor eyesight; if that kid just knew the consequences of being that close to a screen, he would have thought twice about it. Think twice about how close you sit from the computer. If I were to ask anyone of you what you could find on the internet, many of you would say, "anything." Could there really be too much information? As a matter of fact, there is. You could be looking up a topic and something inappropriate, that has nothing to do with the topic comes up; kids don't need to, and shouldn't be watching or seeing these inappropriate sites. Its bad for kids, so stop it and be careful online! After reading this essay, I hope you realized that computers are bad for you in various ways. As a matter of fact it's physically, mentally and socially detrimental. So, next time you're on a computer, don't look at the little things, but the big picture of your health and well-being!

Dear Local Newspaper, Computers are a huge thing nowadays. Almost everyone has one that they use. But why do some people think that they are hurting our society? Let's go back around several decades ago. Those were days when it could take weeks to communicate with out-of-state family. Days when knowledge was only found in books, and often found slowly. Those were days where everything was done with a lack of speed and precision. Computers change all that. With nothing but the tap of a finger, we can communicate with people worldwide, or search the web for some new information. A large percentage of people's relatives live out of their state. I can relate, with many cousins in one state and others in another. Without these instant messages and emails, we would more than likely talk to them once, maybe twice a year! Some people say that computers make people spend less time interacting with family and friends. For me personally, and I know many others, that interaction would be impossible without these modern marvels. With all the modern technology out there, nothing has me as amazed as the webcam. You, with this tool, can talk face to face with someone on the other side of the world! The world is a better place when we can have a true connection to other cultures, and what better way than to talk to them directly. What people many years ago would never think possible, we can use at a moment's notice, and yet still, many people don't appreciate it. My relatives and my parents' friends have both used the internet to reunite with old college buddies or see how far away friends are doing. These are grown-ups, using the tools available to improve their lives. The internet goes beyond teenagers on social media platforms. What you can find online still amazes me. The information you could get out of many non-fiction books, you could find in just minutes on the internet. Any question, including personal ones, anything, can be answered. Years ago people would have killed for this power, for the common man to be able to access all he ever needed to know. I see the point people make about needing exercise, and they're right. But in five minutes on the web you could have an exercise routine planned out, with modern techniques and styles. The computer has anything for anyone. Looking for some place to enjoy nature? Search for it. In seconds there will be thousands of results. Missing a dictionary? There are literally hundreds of sites to find a definition online. People take these machines for granted and assume we could live without them, but I doubt they ever realize how much we really need them. The technology is there. Why not use it? I could never turn down an opportunity to talk to a distant cousin or another kid from a different country. I couldn't pass up a chance to check up on some old buddies that moved away. Thanks to computers, I have that opportunity. I have that chance. I've been shown an open door to find out everything I could want. Man can't know everything. But these days, he can find out anything. I'm not sure if the computer has changed the direction of advancing technology, but I can tell you, it has definitely charted the course for our modern world.

Dear Local Newspaper, Computers are harmfully effecting the children, and they are going to effect future generations even more. Computers are fine in moderation, as are most things. I have to disagree. They say they practice hand eye coordination, they can teach you about far away places and you can talk with people online. Sports are a great way to exercise and practice hand eye coordination. Tennis, baseball, basketball, hockey, etc are all great sports that practice hand eye coordination. They are much healthier that I.Ming your friends all day. You sit on your butt all day and scream to your mom to get you a drink of water, or some dinner. How are you suppose to be able to support a family when your older if you cant get up from the computer. "Raising a family is hard work," my mom tells me, "your family needs food which means someone needs a job, and someone also needs to get the food. That takes a lot of time and energy." I agree with my mom, and if simple things like going outside for an hour a day are practiced as a child, having a job and raising a family will be easier. Plus websites are filled with viruses, and what happens when your computer is dead due to viruses and you actually need your computer for a school project? The simple alternative would be going to the local library and checking out a variety of books. The books are trusted and filled with information. The internet is also not a very safe place. Facebook, aim, email, twitter, etc are all ways for people to comunicate through the computer. Facebook, aim and twitter are scary and not safe because you might not know who you are talking to. They do have a profile which you might be able to relate to, but they could be lying. "The internet is a broad place open to strangers," my dad says. I am not allowed to have these ways to comunicate because of the specific reasons that I stated earlier. My parents are doing this to protect me and I agree with their decision. Rather than talking to complete strangers go over to your friends house. Your friends are the people that you want to talk to and spend time with. Overall computers are bizarre pieces of technology that can be unsafe, not truthful, and are forcing children to become more dependent on adults. I have to disagree with the supporters of technology. There are many healthy alternatives to the computer. I believe that experts who are concerned that people are spending to much time on the computer and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. Not only do the alternatives that I stated before keep people safe, they also practice a healthier way of living. It is important to keep your bodies healthy because in the end thats what everyone's goal should be.

Dear Local Newspaper, My opinion on the effects computers have on people is that computers have a good effect. It's good for education, mind exercise, and communication all over the world. Being on the computer for too long can also cause eye problems where you will begin to lose your sight and will need glasses which will get thicker as you keep looking at the computer screen for hours and days. And computers can help you prevent those things that are bad for you by showing you ways to use the computer that won't harm you, making them a valuable tool when used wisely.

Dear newspaper, I heard you were discussing if more and more people using computers was a benefit to society. I believe that computer use has a negative affect on people. They get to interact with people who aren't safe, they spend less time exercising and they get into more trouble than before. Spending more time online in chat rooms causes people to meet predators. Take my friend Sarah; she was online one day when a man started to talk to her. She thought he seemed acceptable when he said he was nineteen and a model. She flirted with him on and on, day after day until one day her friend logged on and found out the man was really forty-two and a pervert. Sarah is not the only one that this has happened to; three out of five people in chat rooms say they have been lied to like this. Website designer John Smith says, "More and more people everyday are falling for lies over the internet and getting in sticky situations like getting asked to meet the person." Remember the saying "Don't talk to strangers?" Spending all your time sitting down on the computer means less time outside exercising. At tryouts, this girl Jessica wasn't in shape enough to stay up with the players. Instead of being out practicing like the rest of us, she was in her house talking on Facebook. She wasn't prepared when tryouts came, time to show what you had, so she didn't make the softball team. The next year she made captain because she was out training everyday before the big day. She's not the only one with a laziness problem. Four out of every ten Americans are couch potatoes and choose to go online than to stay in shape. Nutritionalist, Dr. Adams says, "This generation is worse than the last. They complain when they can't do something but that's because instead of going outside, they're on their butts watching television or online." Going outside is a breath of fresh air, what do you have to loose? Kids seem to get in a lot more trouble online then they ever have on the streets. They're out posting threats, dissing each other, sending personal messages or pictures and worst of all sometimes hurting someone so bad they commit suicide one year. The neighbor was more popular than this lady's daughter so she created this person online that the neighbor fell for. The online "guy" began trashing the teenage girl so bad she ended up hanging herself. People, including singer Chris Brown have been caught in sexting. It's embarrassing, inappropriate and against the law yet it still happens. These people are not alone. Three out of five people have gotten in big trouble through the internet. Governer, Mark Davis says, "The internet and phones are destroying this society. There's too much real life drama already." Can't you see something wrong with all of this? My opinion on computer use all is that we should use the computers less before we all start interacting with people that will scare us, become couch potatoes, and get into huge trouble. It's really not worth the damage of getting scared, hurt, lazy, or taking your own life over online interactions.

Dear newspaper, Computers are everywhere in our nation. We have them at home, at school or at our work. Many people believe that computers are bad for our health or we don’t spend enough time with our family. But I disagree. Computers teach hand-eye coordination, let us learn about faraway places, and also let us allow to chat online with other people. Have you ever had trouble with hand-eye coordination? Sometimes mine is ridiculous! But when I get on a computer it gets to be much better. Experts say that seventy percent more people with hand-eye coordination have improved by working with computers. A teacher at my school said, "My students have been working on the computers for about two months now and I have seen an incredible improvement in their hand-eye coordination already." I agree with these experts too. So many people nowadays that have a computer have passed their hand-eye coordination test! When I grow up and soon get out of high school I want to travel all over the world. But first I want to be educated on where I go. That is why computers are so helpful. I can just click on a button and the internet will bring me to hundreds of sites where I can learn all about the places I want to visit. One time my parents told me we were going to the city for the day. So the night before I did a bunch of research of different shops, museums, and places to eat. The computer helped me so much that if we didn't have it then I don't know where we would go. President Obama said, "One time when I had a big meeting in Japan, I had no knowledge about it. So I logged on to the computer and it brought me to a million pages on their culture, language, and much more. I don't know what I would do if I didn't have a computer." I love talking to my friends. But once I'm home none of my friends are around me, so I have nobody to talk to. If I also don't have the phone available then that makes it even worse.But, if I go on the computer then I can talk to bunch of my friends. I can go onto my webcam to see who I am talking to or I can go onto another website to get an instant message. I love talking online because one of my best friends in the whole word moved down to Florida so I don't get to talk to her too much. But if I go to the instant message website then I can talk to her as much as I want. Eight out of ten people sold in a survey that they have someone they talk to over the internet. So I say the computer is important in our society. It helps complete a number of tasks. They teach hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about faraway places, and it even allows people to talk to friends and family online. So I don't think computers are bad for us or our health. I think they are important and needed for modern life and connection.

Dear, editor of the local newspaper. I believe that computers are good for the future. The world has made many changes with its technology. I know not spending time exercising is bad but learning about new things can't be that bad. If humans didn't have technology some of us wouldn't have heat or fresh water. We use computers in life. Computers are good for people who use them to learn about the world. Some people who have friends far away can use a computer to talk to them. Or even people who can't talk use computers to talk for them. The hospital uses computers to save lives. Computers save lives in so many ways its scary to think if they were all gone we could all start dying. We use computers in hospitals; if there weren't any computers the chances of finding a cure for something would take too long and the person could die. Let's say someone has what looks like a normal fever and you just say that's what they have. Two days later they died because they had some disease and no one knew until it was too late. We use computers to purify water. We use computers to keep us warm during winter. We even use computers in libraries; why the library? Some people who have medical illnesses and can't talk have these little computers that can have something typed in them and it would say it. Most people use some kind of computer to talk, chat, and text. They might find it easier with a computer. The world's a big place and many people don't know much about it. But if you go online you could find out stuff that you may never knew existed or just plainly didn't know about it. Kids even use computers for school and school work. So many people rely on technology to get through their life. Computers even help people in school for people like me who broke their arm and have to take some test on the computer. Like me. Now so many things in the military, airforce, and navy are computerized. The military uses thermal sights on guns and tanks so they can identify people in even the most craziest weather. It could even locate a wounded soldier. They're even working with computers to make better bullet proof vests so they will be more lives saved in war. The airforce uses computers to talk to people on the ground so they could protect them. They now have planes that can be flown by a man far away and this would save their lives even if it gets shot down. This also allows them to see people hiding and they could tell the people on the ground to stay down or whatever. The navy uses radar to see if there is any boats or submarines coming near them and they have a heads up if there would be an attack. We use this to help with other advances in the future; we could soon have a computer that could help out people in far places like where there is a higher poverty rate. Computers save lives, allows communication, and is a good way for research. Computers is what we use to live; we need them to survive in our modern world.

Some "experts" are warned that people should not spend too much time on their computers. Yet, look at all of the advantages to a computer. You can develop better hand-eye coordination skills, interact with friends and family who could live hundreds of miles away, and you can learn about cultures all around the world, along with the people who live in those countries, without ever leaving home. In my opinion, computers overall benefit society, helping us learn more and more every day. First off, there are many skills you can develop on the computer. For example, when playing interactive high-paced games, kids get a sense of awareness, timing, and hand-eye coordination. Not to mention, with new advances in technology, people can now go to college without ever leaving home, and at a much lower price, while still getting a great education. Many people even work from home, thanks to their computers, which allows for a flexible schedule. These are still only a few of the many skills that can be learned on computers. Secondly, why buy a ticket to a far away country that's fairly expensive, trade in all your money for the money they have there, go through the hassles of baggage, etc., when you could simply go online and look it up on the computer? You can go online, look up some of that country's recipes, language, pictures, and people without the hassle of going there. Not to mention, for kids who aren't old enough to travel, or have to do a report on it, instead of making their way through countless textbooks, newspapers, and libraries in general, they go online, search their country, and they have most, if not all the info they need right there. So not only is getting the information faster, but you learn it in the first place, thereby, extending your knowledge. Finally, the internet helps people connect. Leading experts from the U.S.A., or Family security agency, says that since people have started using programs like Skype and Facebook, many more families, who live in different countries, have been able to re-connect and get to know one-another. For example, if you have an uncle who lives in another state, you could both buy cameras for your computer, install them, and within minutes, be seeing each other and talking face to face. I think this is better than simply writing letters to them, as it's quicker, and you get to connect more. Same goes if a friend or you move away, but want to stay in touch. A quick Facebook account or Skype, and you'll still be good friends. So all in all, yes, computers do benefit society, as they help teach people skills, learn about distant cultures and far away countries, and connect people, who might live in different countries. I don't see anything wrong with these beneficial factors to society. So yes, computers have a positive effect on people.

Dear Local Newspaper, Imagine a world filled with gargantuan people seated at a monitor, their eyes staring at it blankly. Outside the city streets are deserted, save for the squirrels running along fence posts. This is what will happen if people spend too much time on the computers. People will spend less time exercising, less time outdoors enjoying nature, and less time interacting with family and friends. This is why computers have a drastic negative effect on people. First of all, people spend huge amounts of time on their computers and small amounts of time exercising. In a recent poll done by a popular magazine, it stated that a large percentage of people between the ages of thirteen and eighteen prefer to be online rather than outside exercising. That article also states that since the early 2000s, child obesity has increased by a significant margin! A leading researcher at a prominent university states that the reason child obesity has increased so much is because children spend so much time in front of the computer and less time outdoors. Do you want this rate to increase in the next ten years? Secondly, spending so much time inside decreases the time you spend outside enjoying nature. Bird watchers monthly has had a decrease in subscriptions in recent years because people are not interested in nature anymore. In a study done by a noted scientist and his colleagues at a research institute, a majority of teenagers spend almost fifty percent more time indoors in front of electronic devices, most frequently computers, than they do outdoors. Another expert says, due to the new advancements in technology, people tend to spend more time indoors than outdoors and that percentage will most likely increase as the decade proceeds. Finally, spending so much time in front of the computer leaves you less time to interact with family and friends. In the past, more than eighty percent of families ate dinner together; now, only a small fraction eat together usually because they are in separate rooms in front of a monitor. This also leads to higher crime rate, believe it or not. Because young children and adolescents don't have the personal support and guidance from family because they don't spend time together due to the frequent use of computers, there is a higher chance that child will commit a crime compared to the lower chance a child would have decades ago. Do you want that for our youth? Now imagine a world where people jog together in the park, as they jog, they see a group of bird watchers huddled together under a tree. As the joggers proceed, they come to a pavilion and see a big family celebrating the birthday of a family member. This happy thought won't become a reality if people spend too much time on their computers and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and less time interacting with family and friends. So, local newspaper I encourage you, to encourage others, to get outside and spend less time in front of the computer. You have the power to make a difference in your real lives. But the question is, will you?

Dear Local Community Board, Did you know a large percentage of people today use the computer for necessary reasons? It's true! It's a fact the computer can help you with keeping in touch with friends, getting the latest news, and even gives you map access. Let me tell you some important facts about the computer. Of course, we all have friends in different cities and/or states! Instead of over charging a phone bill, many people keep in touch via email. Email is high tech, and super easy! All you need is your friends email address and you can send them anything from a friendly hello, to recent pictures of the family. Teens love to chat with friends and they're able to get to know each other better through the computer. Sites such as Facebook are certainly popular with this generation of teens. The fun messages are what makes everything so great. Keep in mind all the available ways to get in touch with friends and see why the computer is so great. Every time I log onto the computer I'm able to see the latest news updates! I remember going on and seeing something pop up about my favorite band breaking up. Thanks to the computer I got to read all about it and I was extremely glad I'd seen that because if I hadn't I wouldn't have got to see their last concert. While I do understand, the computer may not be the healthiest activity, it definitely is a great news source and everyone reads the news whether it be political, or about celebrities. Knowledge about what's currently happening in our country, and exercise is equally as important therefore, I'd be the first to support the computer as a positive effect on people today. Have you ever been lost? Maybe you didn't write down the correct directions, or couldn't remember. Next time look up directions on the computer! It's so helpful and could really save you a hassle. There are so many websites that have maps you can print out, such as MapQuest. It's a much easier, clearer way to understand where exactly you need to go. In my opinion it can help so much and it would be the right idea to go check it out today. Imagine all the places you could go just by getting a map online! Keep this in mind as one of the many great things about the computer. Now that you know some positives about the computer, remember how they could benefit you! Being able to chat with friends is one of the best! Don't forget about hearing the latest news, and finally, never get lost again, just print out a map. There's no doubt in my mind the computer has a very positive effect on every one! The time is now to get out there and utilize a computer for yourself and see the advantages.

Dear leader of the local newspaper, I have heard the strange misconception that computers are ruining our society. I for one, think that this is a terribly made thought. To begin, the internet (provided with most home desktop computers) can teach us a lot about the world around us. Additionally, the whole fact of contacting others around the globe, as well as having a whole fun world to explore, makes computers more enjoyable. Finally, thousands of jobs around the world are either based on or work with computers. Due to this, computers are , without a doubt, beneficial to society. The first reason I need to clearly point out is that the computer holds tons of information that can't be found anywhere else. While books have to be republished as updates occur in the world, anything on the internet can be updated almost instantly, beneficial to students with school projects for subjects like science and history, subsequently, people could actually go to school via online schools and colleges. Whilst regular colleges could cost around thousands of dollars in order to get in, online colleges are much rather cheap, affordable to anyone. Also, due to the high amounts of information online, schools seem to be growing obsolete as computers typically hold all information obtained in a regular school year, though they complement traditional learning. Because of this, computers are definitely beneficial to society. To build up, the internet provided with computers can bring loads of pleasure to those who use it wisely. Because of the growing population of those who use computers, companies tend to make computer shows, which usually attracts viewers by the thousands each day. This makes television seem obsolete as well for some. Another major thing is that software comes out for the computer almost everyday, allowing many things to be done by users. Software typically includes games, movies, and music for entertainment. Finally, since staying in touch with others is a good thing, chatting with others across the globe is very easy and durable, allowing distant relatives to come in contact with you via various chat programs. Due to this, computers can bring loads of fun to users, and are thus beneficial to society. Lastly, due to the rising demand of computers, companies typically rely on computers for jobs. Since the internet population is growing, companies allow people to fill out applications and send in resumes in order to apply for a job in said company. Also, some jobs can only be done while online or using a computer. Many jobs these days, typically banks, rely on using the internet most of the time, and some actually are based in the internet. Because of this, workers can finish the job easily in one place, instead of having to around and going to a boring looking building to do a boring job. With this reason, why doesn't anyone else see why computers are beneficial to society? With all of these reasons, I hope you see why computers are beneficial to society. Education just become a whole lot easier thanks to the internet. If education is not what you seek, you can then use the internet to have fun when you are bored. Finally, jobs can be completed even easier, and makes workers more responsible. So, leader of the paper, do you really, along with everyone else, think that computers are a waste of time in life? I believe the evidence shows they are a valuable tool.

If you are one of those people that love to be on the computer as much as you can, well, think of it this way. You spend so much time on the computer that you receive little or no exercise! Everyone needs to receive a little bit of exercise in order to stay fit and healthy. Our country's obesity level has gone up since our high-tech computers have come out. I believe that this is one of the main reasons for the rise in obesity. This is a major concern in our high-tech, computer society today. Besides you receiving less exercise, you will also receive less time with your family and friends. I understand you could talk to your family on Facebook, but you need interaction by talking face to face. This is one of our basic needs as an individual. Your family is going to be by your side no matter what, but you need to build a strong relationship with your family in order for them to be there for you. This is only going to happen if you interact face to face with them. The same thing goes for friends; this is another necessity for basic needs! Everyone should have some real-life relationship. Lastly, everyone needs to enjoy nature! It is a beautiful sight that everyone needs to experience. Being trapped inside the house to be on your computer is a terrible thing to do. The beauties of nature are amazing, but a large number of people don't take the opportunity to enjoy it. Being outside and enjoying yourself is a big thing for your body to survive. You need to soak up the powerful rays of the sun and have a life-changing look around nature. But little of this will happen if you stay on your computer for many hours a day. In conclusion, computers are not benefiting society because people receive little or no exercise, less interaction with friends and family, and a lost chance to enjoy nature. Everyone needs to have these needs met instead of focusing all their time on the computer.

With the click of a mouse, you can access the internet. Computers and the internet are a recent innovation. You could probably find one in a common household today. They've improved and gotten popular within the last twenty years, and I believe they greatly benefit society. Computers provide an easy way to learn and communicate. Think about how life would be in the past without computers; it would be very different, right? I don't think I could have written such a great research paper without the use of a computer. The internet has many helpful sources, such as databases, encyclopedias, and articles. You can find information on almost any topic, and the computer makes this easier for us to do. You can just search key words, and you have what you're looking for. Its faster than skimming through twenty books to find a single fact. Once you find what you're looking for, you can paste it into a standard document and print it; it's as easy as that. Another significant benefit of computers is communication. I have found this important over the last few years. A family that I have been close to my whole life had moved to a distant state due to jobs. Thanks to the internet, I have been able to keep in touch with them regularly. I'm sure thousands of other people have been in the same situation. Whether it's on email, an instant messenger service, or a social media site, people can communicate with others all around the world. It's more convenient than having to time your phone calls so it's a good time for both of you in different time zones. If we didn't have this connection with foreign countries, everyone’s lives would be much more isolated. Computers haven't just changed personal lives; they have also revolutionized the medical field. This has greatly benefitted our society. Scientists and doctors can quickly find out about new discoveries and what advances have been taking place globally. Doctors now use computers to plan and perform complex surgery procedures with greater precision. Computers have helped advance and improve medical research and diagnosis, which in turn saves the lives of many people. A high percentage of tests that have taken place to research a disease use a computer of some sort to break down the data. The technology of computers has benefitted today’s society and has helped people achieve great things in many fields. It keeps people all over the world connected and helps them learn in ways previously unimaginable. I hope that you see how computers have molded and helped the world today for the better.

Dear the newspaper, Computers are great resources and are helpful in many ways. Since we have the technology, why not use it? Computers give us simple yet very useful programs like Microsoft Word or Photoshop, outstanding abilities to look up any information you want, and keep in touch with far away relatives using Facebook or video chats like Skype. Wouldn't it be terrible if you were just about to finish an essay for school when you misspelled a word and had to start all over?! Well this is what happened frequently when computers weren't around and you had to use a typewriter. Unlike a typewriter, computers have programs such as Microsoft Word, where if you make a simple mistake, all you have to do is press backspace. With programs like this, essays and flyers are extremely easy to make. There are also a lot of other programs like PowerPoint, Photoshop, or video-editing software. These are real time-savers. You can just put your camera chip into your computer and "voilà," instant editing. Programs that you can download make life a whole lot simpler and save you a lot of time. Along with the programs to write a paper, you can use the internet and Google to get the information! All you have to do is type in a short phrase and instantly get thousands of sites, all packed with information. And instead of spending ten minutes in a dictionary, you can find a definition in a split second on dictionary.com. I took a tally and nine out of every ten kids use the internet at least once a day! Let's say you had a party coming up, but had nothing creative to cook for food. Just type in "creative foods for a party" and you will easily have hundreds of new recipes to choose from. The internet is an extraordinary invention that is very simple and helpful to use. Another fantastic thing to use on a computer is social connections such as MySpace, Facebook, or Skype. This is a great way to catch up with old friends from high school or college, or plan a big event while being relaxed at home. If you had soccer practice at night so you couldn't hang out with friends, but still had time to do a quick chat, this is perfect. Skype and other video chats are amazing. They are very convenient when you need to speak with someone all the way in Australia for business and don't want to travel. All you have to do is open a link and "bam," they're right there! These are great for businesses and long distance relationships. I have an uncle and aunt who live in England and we use Skype to keep in touch. It's a fantastic way to communicate across the globe. Computers sometimes make us "look" lazy, but they give us a lot. The time saved from their convenience can be used to run around and get exercise. Computers have amazing programs that help us in all ways, internet for quick information, and social connections to keep in touch with family, friends and businesses. Computers are one of the most convenient things we have and I strongly suggest you would agree with me.

Dear @CAPS1: People are spending far too much time on computers. This goes for children and adults alike. Just think about it; anything you can do on a computer you can do without one. That and people need to spend more time outside experiencing nature. Lastly, some bad things can be shown and can happen while online. I challenge you to name one thing you can do on the computer that you can't do without. You can't even name one. Think about it: you can research and find pictures from books and magazines. Instead of social networking sites, you can actually go and see the person, or if they are far away you can call them or write them a letter. To find out about current events you can read the newspaper or watch the news. If you like using computer design programs, try drawing a real picture instead. Lastly, if you download a lot of music you can just buy a cd or, better yet, go to see the band live. Face it, you can't do anything on a computer that actually requires the computer. Artificial simulations are no match for the real outdoors. On a computer all you can do is watch, and even that is nothing compared to the real thing; it's just a snapshot of it. Outside you can feel the gentle breezes, the warm sun, the cool grass; you can smell fresh pine and clean air. You can hear all the other creatures surrounding you. Going outside is better for you, too. Outside you get exercise and vitamin @CAPS2, while inside you get fat, lazy, and sick. Can't you see how great the outdoors are? Computers can do more harm than good. They can show children inappropriate pictures and talk about inappropriate topics. They are even now using computers to sell illegal drugs. Children also often use the internet irresponsibly and do things that can disrupt friendships and get them into trouble. The computer has also made it a lot easier for kidnappers to find children and kidnap them. They do this by pretending to be the child's peer, then using the information the child gives them, they will make an almost guaranteed kidnapping. This is happening more and more frequently. The computer isn't as helpful as you thought. Computers are not really beneficial to our society. They have no real use that isn't already taken care of. They cannot replace the real outdoors. Lastly, they can be easily used for bad, even illegal, purposes. As you can see, computers should not be used as much as they are being used by the general public.

The people who are concerned about the bad on computers are right about a couple things, but good does come out of it. For instance, what is the military needs recruits for the army? They can post up their ad on the computers that everyone will see. And what about the people who drop out of school and they want a second chance? They can apply for school online. First, as the army keeps losing more and more soldiers in combat and they try to recruit people, they can post their ad up over the internet. Sure they can mail it out but that would take forever for people to find out about it and learn about it. For example, they can post the ad up on Myspace and have thousands of people looking at it in minutes, which is a much faster and more efficient method of reaching a large audience. Finally, the internet is a great way for the military to recruit soldiers. Next, for those seeking education or employment, the internet provides vital opportunities. Online schools offer flexible schedules for those who need a second chance at education, allowing them to learn from home. Similarly, job seekers can use online portals to search for positions that match their skills and submit applications instantly, making the entire process more accessible and far-reaching than traditional methods. In conclusion, while there are valid concerns about computer use, the benefits in recruitment, education, and employment demonstrate its significant positive role in society.

There are many great things about computers. If we were to lose them then our lives would change dramatically. You can use computers for exercise, but then it is also up to the parents on limits. Last, without computers there would be more difficulty in large companies managing their operations and logistics. Computers can help exercise. One way is we can find closest gyms on the internet. We can find what is healthy to eat right away, accessing nutritional databases and fitness blogs. You can also get one of those Wii Fit games for a computer. Also you can find free work out videos on platforms like YouTube. Next, it should be up to the parents. It is their discretion if they see that the child is spending too much time on the computer and gaining weight; they can easily limit it. They can say for every hour you're on the computer you have to do an hour of exercise, ensuring a healthy balance. Lastly the computer can save lives. Before computers, medicine like Tylenol was used for everything: stuffy nose, headache, cold etc. Now we can go on the computer to find whether the medication is at all dangerous by checking official medical websites. You can also find the nearest hospital using online maps and services. Finally, computers can do a lot of good, even though it can make you less healthy if you spend too much time on it; it can save your life. It can also destroy companies and our lives if misused, but parents can give limits and computers can be used to exercise. So reading this essay please don't take away our computer.

Technology has been growing and changing rapidly. Just look at Apple's new iPhone, a decent sized touch screen computer. Computers have been rapidly changing too. Also the lighting from the computer is very hurtful to your eyes. The light coming on to your eyes is like staring at the sun but not quite as damaging. The sun will instantly damage your eyes while overtime a computer slowly damages your eyesight. If your eyesight is already damaged a computer will worsen it. The more time spent on a computer the more you damage your vision. Since your eyes are already bad you might think "well they can't get any worse." Typing too long or too much can cause your fingers to lock up and make it harder for your bones to move over your joints without pain. If this constantly happens to you, you could be a candidate for arthritis. Not letting your fingers take a break can also be one of the reasons your fingers hurt; if you never let them rest they can also lock up and it can be very painful. You should spend less time on the computer if you don't want arthritis. Because of all this new technology, less people go outside and play or hit the gym and exercise. Dear City Press, I believe that computers have a terrible impact on society. The reason I believe this is true is that kids can go "braindead" as some people call it. Also, kids can get obese, which is already a greatly growing problem. The last reason is that kids get bad eyesight from it. The first reason I believe that computers have a bad impact on our society is that all kids do is sit there and eat while they are on the computer, and they get an addiction to it so they just keep getting fatter because they aren't getting any exercise. This problem with children getting fat is already a very brought-up topic, and with something like this out, it's not going to get any better any time soon. Studies show that a significant percentage of kids who are on the computer more than an hour and a half a day are actually going braindead. This means that if this becomes the new trend for all kids, our next generation will not be smart and won't be able to keep up with other countries and fall behind, so we have to do something about this trend-setting issue if you want our country to stay in one piece. The last but not least reason is kids are forming bad eyesight. This can also be bad for future generations; if you let this catch on, the generation will all need glasses. It's almost like a domino effect. These are all the reasons that computers have a bad impact on society: kids get obese, they go braindead, and they develop bad eyesight from it, which is a serious concern for everyone.

Dear local newspaper, I think people are spending too much time on the computer and these are my reasons: less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with friends and family. My first reason is less time exercising; people are too busy on the computer playing games and talking to others. Don't you think you should be outside doing some exercise like running around or playing sports instead of being in your house on the computer doing nothing? People should at least get thirty minutes of exercising. You could be on the computer for a little while but not on it all day. Take a break from the computer and go outside for a little bit; enjoy the weather and being outside. People just can't take thirty minutes away from their computer time; I find that really hard to believe. It's like the computer took over their brains and all they want to do is be on it and never get off. My second reason is enjoying nature; go outside for a little bit and see what's going on out there. Go take a walk outside in the woods and look for the animals or look for animal tracks. There are a lot of fun things you can do outside like climb a tree or go fruit picking. You don't have to be inside all day and stare at the computer playing games and talking to friends. You could be outside enjoying the nice weather. People need to learn that there are better things to do with their time. My third reason is interacting with friends and family. It is important you spend time with them and see how they have been and what they have been up to. But instead, people are always too busy to talk to their family members because they are always on the computer doing stuff they don't need to be doing. There are a lot more important things in life and people need to understand that. Family is way more important than being on the computer, but people these days they put family second because they never want to talk to them or see them because they are always so busy wasting their time on the computer. Like checking your email is fine, but wasting your time on these chat things like Facebook or Twitter or Instagram is just a waste of your time; people can hang out and do things, they don't have to be on the computer asking their friends things that they should just call them and ask. Don't get me wrong, I have a Twitter account too and it takes away from your time hanging with family and other things, but I make time for it; I can hang out with friends and family and enjoy the nature and I do exercise. So I don't see why it's so hard for people to do that. So in conclusion, I think that people do waste their time on the computer too much; like I said, there are more important things in life and things you can be doing like exercising, enjoying nature, and hanging with friends and family. So I hope you take my ideas and consider them and thank you for listening to what I think. I hope people can get it through their head that they don't have to be on the computer all the time.

Could you live a day without a computer? I talk to my friends every day on the internet. I learn about current events that I wouldn't know without a computer. A computer also helps me through my daily life. I acknowledge that I should get outside and meet up with my friends, but sometimes when it's raining or snowing I just want to talk to them online. Another great thing about talking online is that I can talk to all my friends at once, not just the one I am playing with. I noticed that even when my friends go away on vacation, they can still stay in touch because of their computers. Not only can you stay in touch with your friends, but you can learn about current events. Whenever I go into my web browser, my homepage comes up and shows me the current events. Without a computer I wouldn't be able to see who won last night's ball game or what's happening with the health care bill. These are important things that help me keep up with things away from my town. A computer also lets me learn more about what the healthcare bill actually is and how it affects me personally. Not only does a computer teach me about current events, it also helps me in my daily life. When I'm eating breakfast, I check my email and look at the weather forecast. During school I type up my essay assignments. When I get home I check the homework website and talk to my friends online. All of that is done on a computer. That just goes to show how much I use computers each day. I rely on my computer so much that I would be lost without it and I would get half as much done. I strongly believe that computers are a necessity. They allow me to talk to my friends when we can't meet up in person. It keeps me up to date with current news and events. I think computers have become an integral part of our daily life.

Dear Councilman, why would you want people to be on a computer all day doing nothing? How would you feel if no one was out getting exercise, and no one was using the playgrounds, parks and beaches? Everyone will be sitting at home on their nice new fancy computers. When you really do think about how much time people spend doing nothing, just sitting around, why would a computer solve that problem? It really doesn't. This is what I would say to having computers: people spend too much time on computers, exercise is needed every day, and it makes your body wear down and your eyes strained. When it comes to computers everyone wants to get one, but when we say exercise it seems like people's minds click off. This happens because people are really starting to spend lots of time on computers. If they work on computers during a long period of the day, then head home to spend more time on the computer, what is that doing to your body? Not helping it. I like computers too and I like spending time on them, but when I need to get something done sometimes that doesn't happen because I get distracted and I forget what time it is and that's not fun. Sometimes this happens to people; they are engaged in their computer when someone is talking to them and you're telling them something you need them to do, and they're nodding their head like they know what you said, but the next time you ask if it got done and it didn't, you know they weren't listening. Exercise is really important for your body and doesn't even have to be hard to get anything from it, but don't spend your time wasted on computers. This happens to many individuals or families when they come home from work or school and jump right on the computers; families are not getting enough exercise or spending time with family because computers get in the way of that. Exercise would help to keep you healthy instead of electronics. Computers are like little robots that control your mind and body; it sucks the life out of you. It strains your eyes and it makes you weak and you really don't want to do a lot; maybe if people spent less time on computers and more time being more focused on families and nature, they wouldn't be weak and tired. I know a lot of people who don't want computers to be banned, but I think it would help for a lot of reasons and make families closer and bodies more focused; from my experience computers do help in some ways, but when it comes to real life it helps for really no one. I hope you understand why I say these sort of things, but if you do care about health and activities then you would say that computers are not a lot of help also.

Dear Editor, today I am going to inform you that more and more people are using computers than spending time with their family. I agree with the effects computers have on people because one, it allows us to access information; two, it allows us to interact with people; and three, because it helps us stay updated on what is happening in sports or everything else. My first reason why we should use computers is because it gives us information, like the weather reports, school openings, delays, and closings. It also tells us how Japan has been after the earthquake. It tells us a lot of stuff. It allows us to go to other websites to find information too. And it allows us to have fun and play games on the internet. It can help us on our homework. And it can help us find things like jobs and other stuff. My second reason why we should use computers is because we can interact with people. We can talk to people we've never ever met before. We can find information about them and they can tell us how their life is a little. It can help police find info about their criminals and track them down so they can catch them. It is better and faster than using the phone to talk to them. And it can make people have fun which will make them stay on the computer for a long period of time. My third reason why we should use computers is because it would keep us updated on sports and for those who love to watch it would tell us the most recent news on teams and players. And if you are a sports fanatic you can be able to watch live games on the computer. And we can be able to post about games and have a chance to see the players talk to their fans. In conclusion, this is why we should use computers: because it can give us information all over the world; two, it can allow us to interact with people we've never met before; and three, it will keep us updated on sports we like to catch, especially if you're a sports fanatic.

With more and more people using computers, I think that this does not benefit society. Now more than ever before people are bullying, but not just shoving kids around like they used to. Now the bullies found a new way, by starting web pages, emailing the person, or making threats online. With the internet people say things that they wouldn't be able to say in person because you don't have to see face to face all the time. Did you know that a significant percentage of all teenage suicides are from being bullied online? The bullies get into that person's head and cause them to hurt themselves because they let people get to them. If we didn't have as many people going online then the youth would be more protected from online predators. As you sit on the computer and play games or talk to friends, you are most likely sitting still. Well, when you eat and stay on the computer you aren't exercising. Well, more than half of obese people say they don't exercise because they are either too tired or don't have enough time. Of course you are going to be tired if you sit for a couple hours staring at a computer screen. When they say they don't have time but yet they spend an hour a day on the computer, that doesn't make much sense to me. Obesity has become a big concern; it is a main cause of health problems. People need to get active. The environment is a big concern these days, with toxic waste, the ozone layer, and skin cancer on the rise. But how does the computer affect this? Well, computers use energy and let out toxins for the environment, killing the ozone layer and the effects are much more powerful, hurting people. Yes, plants do help the ozone layer but when you print you use paper and it is very hard to keep up with the demand of paper and the demand of the animals who have to eat, but without trees and plants, what do they eat? By the time our children's children are here, there may be little to no wildlife left, barely any wilderness, and without the ozone layer many people will die of skin cancer, all because we are so addicted to using the computers. People's lives, health, and the environment are all big issues that computers help to destroy. How would you feel walking into your child's bedroom seeing them on the floor dead from being bullied on the computer? Or see a loved one suffer from heart problems due to obesity because they couldn't get off the computer? Or in about fifty years the ozone layer is completely destroyed due to the computers, with little to no wildlife left? Using computers does not benefit society. Sure, it's a quick look up, but so are books. The computer has everything a local library has. People need to stop being lazy and get out. Put a stop to suicides, obesity, and hurting the environment.

Do you ever have time to read a good book? Do you ever spend quality time with your family? Or do you ever have time to go outside and enjoy the fresh air? Well, if you don't, it's likely because you spend too much time on the computer. Computers are bad for society, and I will show you why. There are many great activities you can do such as reading a physical book. Instead of reading on the computer screen, read a novel; you can ask your parents to drive you to the local library. I understand that if you need to do research you can do it on the computer, but in the library there are all sorts of books such as fiction, nonfiction, science books and many more. Every intelligent citizen would acknowledge that computer websites often have wrong information. I remember when I was doing a school project on a famous singer, a legend of pop music. I used the computer to research who killed her and it said that a man killed her. I went to the library and checked out a biography on her and it said that a woman killed her actually. In addition, library books help you get more accurate and verified facts. Every caring, loving human cares about spending time with their family. How can you spend more time with your family? Well, you can visit some cousins on the weekends. Your family can make parties and gatherings. I recall having a big party for my baby brother's baptism, everyone came to our house. I got to see my aunts, and cousins that I didn't see in years. I understand that if you have a far away relative you would use the computer to chat with them or see them on webcam, but why not take a vacation where they live and go by car? That would bring the family even closer together. I know what that is like from personal experience. My family lives in another state and I visit them every summer. We have family reunions, maybe your family can do that too. As a result, family is important, so don't let the computer ruin yours. Do you ever go outside anymore? Is the computer getting in your way? You have to check your e-mail, reply to messages, go on your social media, its hungry for attention, you have to do your daily digital activities. What about your physical health? Getting fresh air can be good for you. These are many great things you can do outside. For example, you can jump rope, go to the park, go swimming, play in the snow and many more. I remember the time my cousin came over and we went to the park. We stayed there until the park closed for the evening. It was very entertaining and fun. Every citizen in our community wants to be healthy. Going outside can help you, run through the woods, or even jump roping is outside and excellent excersizing. In addition just going outside for a walk can do more for your mood. Now is the time to make a change. Why wait another minute? You can either be all alone on the computer or be outside, or be with your family, even the library isn't a lonely place. Computers are a bad habit, even though we might need them for some tasks, its better safe, then sorry to do it the old fashion way sometimes.

Dear Newspaper, It has come to my attention that there is an ongoing debate about the issue stating that not everyone agrees that computers benefit society. I can't understand why anyone would think that. Computers present many oppurtunities for people in their daily lives. They allow for people to communicate with each other easily, they allow people to research topics in a simpler and faster way, and they teach valuable hand-eye coordination skills. This is why I strongly agree that computers do benefit society greatly. In the modern world, nearly all businesses rely on fast and efficient communication. Many people in those businesses use not only phones to communicate, but computers as well for email and video calls. Online communication is a fast, simple, and effective way for people to communicate whether someone is at home or at work. This is one significant way computers benefit all of society today. Nobody knows everything, we are always trying to find out about new things that we never knew before. Sometimes we might use books for this, but the way most people use now is online researching. This is because not only is it quicker, but simpler as well to find what you need. When you research online, the information literally comes to you on the screen. All you do is type a subject into a search engine. This easy access to knowledge is another reason why computers do benefit society so much. The final reason is that computers teach and improve hand-eye coordination. This shows because as time progresses while you are on the computer you realize that typing becomes easier and more natural. It might take a while to learn, but over time people get the hang of using the mouse and keyboard efficiently. In a way, the computer is letting you teach yourself these useful motor skills. Some people would say that people spend too much time on computers. This isn't a real problem though because people often have to spend long periods of time on computers in order to do the beneficial things that computers have to offer, like work or learning. In conclusion, you can see that I have clearly stated the major benefits of computers. They allow us to communicate with anyone, research any topic, and improve our hand-eye coordination for other tasks. This is why computers do benefit society and are a positive force in our world.

In this modernized world computers are key to daily life. They offer many benefits that enclude global communication, digital enterntainment, and an accessible education. These benefits have positive effects on people throughout the world and are why I support the continued advances in technology. Communication is a large benifit with computers in the current era. Whether you are keeping in touch with friends or organizing important business meetings computer offer a large amount of aid and convenience. With the modern technology that is provided with the computer, people can instantly send messages to co-workers or friends in a matter of seconds from anywhere. In some cases businesses completly relie on the computer to function properly; for example, to have conversation with people accross the globe to discuss how they are going to expand internationaly into new markets. Computers are greatly necessary for people to communicate effectively and enable people to make plans with simply and efficiently. The computer also supplies an endless source of entertainment for all ages. With the internet the computer provides the users with websites that enable them to talk to friends, watch funny videos, play interactive games, and more activities. The computer provides a relaxing way to enjoy yourself when it is late at night or a rainy-day when you are stuck indoors. The computer enables people to stay entertained, and relaxed when needed after a long day. The most important function of the computer is perhaps in education for students. The computer supplies the user or student with a wide variety of information on any subject. The computer aids the user with vast information on every subject or topic that might be brought up in a class room discussion or assignment. It comes to be very useful for research projects or even learning another language through online programs. The computer is a very beneficail tool when it comes to education and expanding one's knowledge. The computer is a technology that has come to make daily life simple and more connected. It has come to be incorperated with almost any daily task that might occur during the day, from shopping to studying. It would be unjust to stop advancing in this technological wonder that helps so many. The computer is a technology that greatly benifits our communication with others, our entertainment options, and even our education for a brighter future.

Dear local newspaper, I would like to speak upon the topic of the effects that computers have on people today. My opion on this topic is that computers do have a significant effect on people, often a negative one. Most people while surfing the internet don't keep track of time properly. Computers are a good benefit to society because they allow you to talk to people and give different options for you to get the latest updates. For example, if your friend lives on the other side of the globe you and your computer can message so you can still talk to them all the time without long distance charges. Also when your bored it will give you something fun to do. You could see if anyone wants to make plans to hangout in person. And if you just want to stay home all day you can still interact with people through social media. Secondly it gives you new ideas on things you are interested in. It shares many different oppions from around the world. Maybe someone bought the same product and it did not work well; you could see the comments and review before purchasing. Would you want to spend you money on some thing that did not work properly? I certainly woudn't want to waste my money. You can also see if the majority of people like what they got from a store. Also they make you think of something you would not think about before; say you had a poor mark on a paper about how this was horrible, maybe if you read a similar page online it shows what you did wrong and what you did not do correctly. It gives you the chance to try something new that you might enjoy once you get the hang of it. Computers are helpful in a lot of ways; they let us chat with friends and family far away. It gives us thoughts we might have never thought about before and they tell us the newest updates as they happen.
