Dear @LOCATION1, I believe that computers benefit society very much. I believe so for various reasons that I will state throughout this passage. Although sometimes people spend too much time on a computer, it doesn't mean computers are bad for society; it just means people need to learn to spend their time wisely and maintain a healthy balance. Overall I think computers have a positive effect on society. One reason I am for computers is because they are a huge advancement in technology, representing a significant leap forward for humanity. They are able to make everyday life easier by automating tasks and providing quick access to information. They allow you to store vast amounts of information securely, learn about many places through virtual tours and databases, and communicate with friends and family across great distances. For one device to do all that is truly amazing! Also, if we can create something as complex as computers, it makes one imagine all the other possibilities of future technology advancements. Computers are only the start of it all, paving the way for further innovation. Another reason why I believe computers greatly benefit society is because they provide a wide range of entertainment options. You can watch movies on your computer, download fun games, and explore creative hobbies. There is hardly anything you can't do on a computer when it comes to leisure. If it is cold outside or raining, you can still entertain yourself with just a computer, making it a valuable resource for indoor activities. Computers are very great to have around for these purposes. Now, anyone who thinks people spend too much time on their computer and that computers are bad for society is just wrong in my view. I think those people are wrong because a computer can't force you to spend more time on it; it is an inanimate tool. It's your own fault if you choose to use your computer too much and neglect other aspects of life. You always have the choice to go outside and take a walk or engage in other activities. Computers are only wrong if you choose to use them wrong, much like the expression "guns don't kill people, people do," which highlights that responsibility lies with the user, not the tool. In conclusion I believe computers are a great thing to have especially in this modern society where digital literacy is important. So if you are ever wondering whether or not to buy a computer I suggest you get one to experience these benefits for yourself!

Dear Scientific Society: Computers are perhaps one of the greatest improvements to our society's advancement in knowledge in the past few decades. These gems of the future are like a human being; they have their own mind and can figure out answers to all problems. People all around the world use them, from Canada to Australia, to Japan to Germany, they are being used. People from ages of school kids to adults who have a job so highly appreciated as a chemist use computers! Do you wish to be that one standing on the side lines, stuck in the past, not advancing with technology? From the creations of rockets, engines, and planes; computers have never let us down. Still, the question is this: will computerized technology benefit our society or crash it down? Ever since the 1980s, computers have been used as an ad for new information. The speed that they are able to receive new information in is just astonishing! John Smith, a computer engineer, says "With the technology that we receive from computers, we are able to be in the game." This statement just comes to show one of the best benefits of computers: their ability to display the most current information. Now, I can see how books are an excellent resource in society, and how they provide for amazing information; however, it takes years to publish books! With the use of a computer, information that occurred sometimes as close to 24 hours ago can appear on the internet! Not only will this allow you to get information faster, but it will allow our society to "be in the game." You catch a football as it soars through the air, you track a baseball as it flies high in the sky, you grasp the face of a basketball all because you have "hand-eye" coordination. Hand-eye coordination is perhaps one of the most necessary aspects of life that a person can have. Face it, everybody needs it! So why not help your body to get that talent: buy a computer. Imagine, our society would advance in its sports and even just with life if they learn how to coordinate themselves. Did you know that 8 out of 10 people who owned a computer and typed daily were able to catch all three tennis-balls that were thrown at them! You could do that too! When typing on a computer, human development observers state, your eyes are freely tracked on the screen and you train your hands to maneuver about the keys all by themselves. Just as in basketball, when you train your hand to track the bounce of the ball without you needing to catch it. I can remember when I started typing, my hands began to naturally find the keys without me having to look at them. And the next day at basketball practice I felt like the amazing point-guard Steve Nash; the ball just came straight to my hand! Get this need of life, invest in a computer! Money may be the most vital thing in our society right now. With profits as low as medium wage, our local area is not that "rich." I can see how it could be hard, having to purchase these computers at prices as high as $1000 each. But then just think, each book that we won't have to purchase would save us $20 each. Not only do computers stand to last 10 years longer than any paperback, their information is always new, changing, and up-to-date. In order for us to be purchasing new books because of recent information would end up costing more in the long-run. Our neighboring society of Springfield just invested in over 200 computers for their society. They stated that it took only 18 months to get the money back that they had spent on the computers with the amount that they saved by not purchasing books! Now just imagine how much money our society would gain after 5 years! It is necessary for our society to have computers. With them we not only learn hand-eye coordination but we invest in more money for the future. And now with so many things happening in the world it is important to receive information instantly from these computers. I can't stress enough that without them we just might be less than the rest. Dreams of incredible rockets and medicines and cures for diseases just won't happen. Computers rise perhaps the only thing that actually benefits our society. You must understand how important this technology is to our society! But, in the long-run, the decision is yours to make. Choose quickly, the fate of our society is in your hands.

Whatever the user wants is a text and a click away! The last type of entertainment is social media and music, which allow the user to share daily life or talk to friends, family, or relatives. To sum this all up, I would like to tell you, Local Newspaper, that you should agree that computers are a good thing for society! Please reread and pick the right choice.

Dear Editor, I think this is a good idea because you can play games and talk to family or friends and listen to music. My first reason is playing games. When you are bored and there's nothing to do, all you can do is go on the computer and play all kinds of games like car games, shooting games, and arcade games too. You can do all this if you are bored or if you just want to go on the computer. My second reason is talking to friends or family. If your brother or sister or any of your family members live in a different state and you want to talk to them or see them, then all you have to do is ask them for their email address, and then if they have a Myspace or Facebook you could talk to them as long as you want. You can also talk to your friends on those websites too. My third reason is listening to music. You can also listen to music on your computer by going to a music website or by downloading a program like Frostwire or something similar. You can listen to all kinds of music like hip-hop, rap, rock, or heavy rock. If you want to listen to any song, you're going to need the song's name and sometimes the artist's name too. This is the idea I think they should consider and the option they should pick.

What is more fun, staring at a blank computer screen all day, or spending the day out in beautiful nature with your friends and family? Well, if you don't know, I do. I took a survey at my school with the same exact question and a large percentage of the kids said that hanging out with friends and family is much better than spending all of your time on the computer, and there are three reasons why they said that. First, instead of talking to people on the computer, you should talk to them in person. Next, it's unhealthy, and lastly, a lot of bad things can happen on the internet. So, if you are interested in this topic please keep on reading and I will prove that the computer is not a good way to spend your spare time. Do you know what computers were intended to do? Computers were made for people, but have you thought for one second that instead of interacting with people online you should interact with the people around you? Instead of going on Facebook or Myspace to talk to your friends, just invite them over. If you do that it's not only more fun, it's healthier for you. So next time, consider the other options. In my last paragraph, didn't I say that hanging out with friends is much healthier than being on the computer? Well, I was absolutely right! Did you know that when you waste your time you are only hurting yourself? Well, you are; when all you're doing is sitting down staring at a screen you are not doing anything to help yourself because you are getting absolutely no exercise. When you're not on the computer you are at least walking a little bit, but typing doesn't do anything for you. That's why people shouldn't spend all of their time on the computer. Have you ever heard of an internet predator? Well, let me just sum it up for you. An internet predator is someone that uses the computer to get people they don't know to do inappropriate things. And did I mention it was against the law, because it is. So if you ignore this advice, bad things could happen. And that's just one of the reasons why people shouldn't spend as much time on the computer. So, now you know why people shouldn't spend as much time on the computer as they usually do. First, instead of talking to people on the computer, go in person. Next, it's unhealthy, and lastly, there are internet predators. So the next time you open your laptop, just think: is it more fun staring at a blank computer screen or spending the day in beautiful nature with friends and family? And always remember what the better choice is.

Computers have a positive effect on people. Computers can help people learn about news in the world, places, and people. Computers can also help people communicate with each other. Computers can also teach hand-eye coordination. People who support advances in technology believe computers have a positive effect on people. Without computers people could not learn new things as easily. On a computer you can learn about new places. People could see where something is, locate it, or learn about the place. I remember when I was working on a project about a foreign country. I had no clue what to do on the topic, so I went on the computer and looked it up. It told me where the country was located. Then it showed me a picture of the country, and the history of the country. Without the computer I would not have been able to learn about this fascinating country. On a computer you can also learn about historic and famous people. On computers you can read biographies of them, or watch videos of what they did to become famous. People used to read news out of a newspaper; on computers you can too without paying the cost of buying a newspaper. Computers can also give you a live feed of what is happening in the world. Without computers people could not learn as efficiently. On computers you can also communicate with people that are very far away. Scientists did a study on how people communicate. A significant percentage of respondents said they used a computer to communicate with other people. People can use a webcam, instant messaging, or email to communicate with other people. To communicate with my family abroad I use a webcam. To communicate with my friends I use email or instant messaging. Writing letters is too slow; on a computer the other person you're talking to can reply immediately. On a computer communication is made easier. A computer can also teach you hand-eye coordination. On a computer you see something on the monitor and you can click it without looking down at the mouse to click. This can help you in sports and give you fast reflexes. In many sports you need hand-eye coordination. For example, in basketball you need to look up while you are dribbling or you will fall. Computers can give people fast reflexes and help people in sports. Computers should be part of society's everyday life. Computers have a positive effect on people and they can help people learn new things, like places, people, and news in the world. Computers are very beneficial to society.

Dear Local Newspaper, I'm writing to you because I believe that people in the community overuse computers these days. I think that instead of staying home on your lazy chair and playing Farmville and other games on Facebook you should get out more. I think that you should go to the gym and work out; you should go out to the park or have family fun night with your kids, if you have any. The last thing I think you should do is have a little "me" time; for example, take yourself somewhere nice. For a long time, all you've done is sit home playing Farmville and other games, and you probably get really sluggish, and are you eating right? Well, if you are not careful, you will have gained some pounds over time and you will look like you need to get yourself to a gym. From sitting on your chair while on the computer every day you aren't burning any calories or fat, and when you eat all you're doing is gaining weight, and you probably don't want to. Do you have a family? Well, if you do, I think that taking a family trip to the park would be fun or going to a community center would be a fun way to get your hands off those keys and your head back with your kids. Also, you should make another night a family fun night and play games and hang out with family; on family fun night you can play charades or a board game, as long as you don't have a computer in your house. The last one, my favorite, is "Me" Time. During "Me" Time you can take yourself shopping, go out to lunch or dinner, or even take a nap; the whole point of "Me" Time is that you do not go on the computer! You need to relax and just take a break. Well, those are my suggestions to you. It is now your turn to jump on out of the virtual world and put your head back in reality.

Dear editor, Have you ever stopped and asked yourself which was more important? Of course I can be talking about anything, but what about computers verses family, friends, nature, your own health etc. Well, I ask myself that quite often, and I feel that it's so much more worth it to be with family and friends than to be infront of a computer. For example, instead of sitting infront of the computer, kids, and even adults can enjoy going to the gym to lift weights or use the treadmill. Lastly, just by going for a short walk with your dog, your not only walking and getting well needed exercise, your bonding with your loyal friend and enjoying the outdoors. Well, if you have I guess you could never have too much, but if you haven't, its probably because your spending way too much time on the computer! There are so many different ways that people could learn to appreshiate nature more, such as sitting on a park bench in the @TIME1, while absorbing the fresh air and sunlight. Or you could go for a slow, realaxing bike ride through a trail with a constant cool breeze, brushing your face with every turn of your wheels. Finally, you could pick a warm day to sit out on the beach, and listen to some music, next to the salty ocean. How could you resist those temptations? Lastly, I believe that family is the most important thing to missing out on! Without family and friends you miss out on so many good ethics and experiences, like shared meals and heartfelt conversations. You lose out on having good lifetime realationships, and how could you turn dow the offer to be with the people you love? In conclusion, I feel that computer are taking away most of the things that no one deserves to live without. I mean, how could anyone live without family, friends, the beauty of nature, and your own health? That is why everyone should make the right desition to take reasponcible charge of their life, and choose real-world connections over a digital screen.

Dear local news time editor, using a computer daily has a positive effect on people, wouldn't you agree? People should use a computer more often. Maybe you do not understand an assignment from a certain class. You can add a friend online and they will tell you what has been assigned. Talking to family members can do good for you in many ways. You can be having some trouble in your social life, you can always talk to a family member or friend secretly through the computer. How much of your free time daily do you spend on the computer? It is proven that people ten to fifteen years old spend an average of two to three hours of their free time on a computer. People age sixteen to forty-eight spend two to four hours of free time daily on their computer. Too much time on the computer can interfere with physical activities, social time, and health issues. Computers have some good advantages here and there but mostly result in a negative effect. In this past decade, the percentage of exercise has gone down and computer bills have gone up. Americans have now spent most of their time web surfing, playing online games, and interacting with online chat rooms. After school, kids go home and turn their computer on instead of going outside running and playing. More people across the country have gained weight due to unhealthy food and no physical exercise. Many local sports teams have lost teammates due to lack of desire for physical activities because of computers. Many people have stopped going out with friends and family due to spending time on the computer. The thought that runs through many people's minds these days is 'why go out to talk to my friends, when I can talk to them online?' I think the opposite. Get out of the gloomy house and go out to see my friends. I don't even go online within every day. I check online for homework and for online shopping for about twenty minutes. Computers have a major effect on social lives like going out and being confident to meet new people. Lastly, health issues are raising rapidly! The reason we now have shows on television about people with weight and health problems can relate very much so back to the negative effect on people. Like various health shows and documentaries about the obese have shown how people gain weight. I think at least seventy percent of these people spend too much time on the computer and not exercising. Eating fast food then going home to play online games will definitely increase health issues like weight gain, organs being unhealthy, muscles not functioning properly, and eye and brain damage from staring at a monitor and screen nonstop. People should stop spending so much time on the computer and get outside or get active because computer use does have a negative effect. It interferes with social time, health, and physical activities. Get up and prevent the negative effects of computers now.

Dear Newspaper, The invention of the computer has made a great impact on society today. Another great application is note taking that can easily be typed. This application allows you to take notes by typing, which again eliminates the need to write with a pencil or paper. The most important and most commonly used application on a computer device is the internet. The internet has over millions of websites for many reasons. Dear local newspaper, I feel very strongly about my opinion of what effects computers have on people, as in they help others communicate with one another, give people information about different types of things, and make people smarter. To me that sounds like something with a positive effect, would you not agree? First of all, as some people say it doesn't let you interact with family members. Yes, it truly does; you can interact with both friends and family members by going to chat rooms such as AIM or Meebo, or through web cam meetings such as Skype.com. So that throws that concern right out the window; you wouldn't have to worry about that. Secondly, you get to learn information about different types of things, such as learning about wild animals—any animal like a giraffe, cat, or rat—or learn about different places like Paris, Tokyo, and New York etc... Also, you could find all of this information at home in one single day. Most importantly, I would argue it makes people smarter; the computer teaches you hand-eye coordination for free. The computer can teach you about any career or regular job that you would need to learn about in just minutes, if needed. To conclude, computers have a positive effect on people; they let people communicate with friends and family, you get to learn about different types of things, and they make people smarter. Even after I was done reading this, I thanked the lord for computers, as they help us so much in our daily lives.

Dear Editor, I'm writing to you today about computers; I believe that computers can teach you things such as hand-eye coordination and how that can open job doors for you. Also, you can socialize as well as study with this remarkable device. My first reason being socialization. I think that this is a good way to socialize due to the many options available. One prominent example would be Facebook. This is a social website that is used to connect or reconnect with friends. In a recent poll, eight out of ten people say that computers had made them more social. Lastly, computers are a good way to socialize because of the range they can travel. You can talk to people without the long distance fees of a phone call. This can range from the United States to Hungary in mere seconds. My second reason would be that computers are useful in studies. I would say this because even though books are good, they can be hard to find. With the computer you can access multiple educational sites. This means you can go from Wikipedia all the way to the infamous Google in just a click. Another reason I believe computers are good for studies is that you have endless resources at your fingertips; you will get the information you need without it being lost. My third and final reason is computers give you exceptional hand-eye coordination because I know an accountant. I asked him, "John, did you take that accounting job?", and he answered, "They only took me because I have good hand-eye coordination." And that's one job example; another would be real estate. Due to computers' multiple options you can look up properties for your client. With good hand-eye coordination, however, you can be more efficient with your work. This could help you lead the competition, thus making you more money. This then ends my essay, stating the benefits from socialization, moving down to studies, and ending right on jobs and career opportunities. These are only a few of the many bountiful things that a computer can do. Editor, I hope you read this with my warmest regards.

Dear School Board, I think that children are spending too much time on the computer for the wrong reasons. I say this because all young children and teenagers want to do is get on to social media and games all day instead of researching and educational things like that. I have three reasons why I think going on the computer for the wrong reasons instead of exercising, enjoying nature and interacting with family and friends is a problem. The first reason is because it is very dangerous and there are sometimes kidnappers on the chat rooms. The second reason is because they are taking time away from trying to learn useful stuff off the internet. The final reason is because the internet influences violence. There are my three reasons, now on to hear more. The reason number one why I say people are spending too much time on the internet is because it is dangerous. Young teenagers and children all enter a chat room online. Most of the time that is bad because kidnappers lie about their information so that you can meet up with them and then they take you away. So instead of being on the chat room you could be on the computer looking at the daily news or searching for educational content. This is why I say that the internet is not always good to be on all the time if you aren't learning about the nation. The second reason why I think spending too much time on the computer is a great concern is it's taking away from your schoolwork; children come in and go to the computer instead of doing their homework or reading. Kids like computers sometimes more than they like learning, and that's not good because not knowing the material could hurt them if they got up their determination, but they are on the computer for games but not for educational games. Another reason why I am concerned is that people are using the computer a lot for non-educational purposes. The final reason why I am concerned about people using the computer too much is because the internet on the computer can influence children to be violent in many ways; all the games and websites that show violence affect the world if they keep seeing such things frequently. I say this because in this generation when they see violence it gives them an image in their mind and then they think it's cool to do it because it seems exciting, like a game more than a book. When young teens see violence on the computer they think it's cool. This is the final reason why I was concerned that people are spending too much time on the computer. So these are some of the main reasons why I say that the computer is not always a good thing because people spend too much time on them for the wrong activities.

Dear Editor, Technology such as the computer is proven to have a positive effect on people. Computers teach you hand-eye coordination, they give you the ability to learn about far away places, and allow you to communicate with others online. Technology is continuing to grow, and it is becoming to impact our lives more and more each day. One way that computers benefit society is that they teach you hand-eye coordination. For example, as a person becomes familiar with their computer they are soon able to type on the keyboard without even looking down to see what letter or number they are touching with their fingers. Although the person isn't developing hand-eye coordination in the same way as playing a sport such as baseball, they have still developed this valuable coordination. Computers also benefit our society because they give others the ability to learn about far away places. Instead of walking or driving to the library to find a book about Egypt; they can simply go online and type in Egypt under a search engine. Within seconds, thousands of sources appear right before your eyes, and you didn't even have to leave your chair! That is another reason why computers benefit our society. Lastly, computers and technology benefit our society because they allow you to communicate with others, reconnect with old friends or family, or simply share the latest drama from your art class. I know whenever I'm at my computer my instant messenger is always open. It is something I utilize every day in order to communicate with my friends and distant relatives. In conclusion, computers do benefit society, and they are proven to have a positive effect on people. Technology is like a sponge; it absorbs information and then continues to expand every time you add more. By doing this I am able to maintain healthy, strong relationships with others far and wide.

Dear Editor, Computers are not bad for society. They actually can be quite good for people. Computers allow us to talk with people online. They can help us in school and give information we need to do things in life. People think they are bad, but all you have to do is look a little deeper and you will find the good in them. Many people use a computer, a significant amount of the time, to talk with people on the internet, whether it is using video chat or e-mail. People who don't like to use computers and e-mail might say, "Why not use a phone or even talk to them in person." With e-mail, you can send a message to someone miles away. If you are sending someone a list, a recipe for example, you don't want to read it to them over the phone. It would be easier to type it out and then send it to them over the e-mail. "When my son said he was going to teach me how to use e-mail, I thought it was going to be a waste of time," said Mrs. Johnson, a senior citizen. "It turns out, it wasn't. Now I use e-mail every day." Many people think email is a waste of time, but it can help you in your everyday life. The internet can helps in many ways also. It can help us get information about various topics. If you are trying to cook a stir fry but you don't know what to put in it, you try to call your mother but she isn't there. Your next choice is to look it up on the computer. It turns out there's a website that gives a recipe for a stir fry and you follow it and make the best one ever. I know from experience that you can find maps to places online, since I have to go somewhere new almost every week. Google Maps is one of the most used places on the internet, besides e-mail. Some newspapers have websites where you can read the paper without actually paying for it. This saves you money and it uses less paper so we can save trees. The huge world of the internet can change our lives. A large percentage of people that use the computer almost every day are students. Students use the computer for many reasons. The biggest one is typing. Students use typing to type reports and e-mail. "I have messy handwriting," said one student, Michael. "So if it weren't for the computer, no one would be able to read my homework and reports. Not even me." Michael is one of many people who are lucky that they have typing on the computer. Another reason students use computers is to look up information for reports. If a student puts a bibliography in his report, you will see that he/she used the internet a majority of the time. There may not be a book in a local library for a student to use, but the internet will have many websites and blogs for him/her to use. The third reason is for help. There are many websites that can help a student with any subject. The internet can help a student pass school. A computer can help anyone from talking to someone to helping a student with science. That is how computers are good for everyone in society.

To use computers, or not to. That is the question. Hundreds of millions of people use computers in their daily life today, but some believe that using computers does not benefit society. It is my firm belief that they do. Computers provide entertainment, a way to interact with people, and a nearly endless expanse of knowledge. Without them, we would quickly find life to be much harder and less fun to navigate. Have you ever been in your house on a rainy day just sitting around bored because there is nothing on television? Well I have on many occasions. When that happens, all you have to do is turn on the computer and you have endless choices at your fingertips. You can go on game sites and play thousands of different games, from simple puzzles to complex adventures. This can also help improve your hand-eye coordination. You can also watch movies or television shows that you missed or want to watch again. You can even go on sites such as fanfiction.net, and read or write your own stories, unleashing your creativity. Another reason why computers benefit society is that they help you interact with people. You can keep in touch with far away family members and friends using webcams, email, and chat sites without the bill that would come with talking on the phone. You can also meet new people from different countries and become their friend. That way you learn about different ways of life and cultures. You can also quickly contact people in an emergency, get updates on events, and communicate with your teacher if you have a question about your homework. Lastly, and maybe even most importantly, computers are an enormous source of knowledge. Say you wanted to learn how to start a campfire, you could just search, "how make fire" on google and thousands of matches would be found in seconds. Also, if you were assigned a project for school, you could do all of your research easily from your computer, then type the whole thing up on a word document. You can even get a college degree online if you wished. And if you want to find a restaurant that specializes in Italian cooking, you can find one close to you, get directions to it, look at the menu, see the prices, get the restaurant's history, and find reviews for it all on one magnificent little device: your computer. So you see, computers benefit society greatly. In fact I don't think we could live without them. They provide us with entertainment, an easy way to interact with people, and a huge source of information. Now, to all of you people who still think computers are bad; I'd like to see you last a week without using one.

Dear City Council, I strongly believe that using computers has a benefit to the community. I believe this because using computers helps with research, jobs, and staying in touch with people. First and foremost, the use of computers will contribute to better research. Most students don't have textbooks about astronomy or geology at home with them so they rely on the internet. When my teacher gave the class a packet, I didn't know what some of the words meant. So I logged into my laptop and went on Google, within seconds the definitions were popping onto my screen like pop rocks. After I found out what the words meant, I finished my homework in about five minutes. Without the internet I don't know how long it would have taken, probably requiring a trip to the library. Equally important, using computers will allow a wider selection of jobs. A high percentage of today's jobs in our city require some kind of computer work. Some jobs require quick typers, and some people type as fast as a cheetah runs. Some jobs require people using spreadsheets or design software. Computers are a necessity to get a well-paying job in today's market. Lastly, using computers will open a gateway to communication. Social media platforms, email, and messaging apps are a few of the many ways to communicate online. If one of my friends doesn't have a phone, they most likely have a social media account. This gives me a way to talk to, share photos with and leave videos for my friends. One afternoon, my friends and I were all going to work on our science project. One friend's phone was taken away so the only way I could talk to her was online. Did you know that a large majority of our city has a social media account, email, or a messaging app? To conclude, I hope you enjoyed reading about how using computers helps with research, applying for a job, and communicating with family and friends. Please, City Council, publish this in the Newspaper so all residents will agree with me and recognize the value of computers in our community.

Dear state newspaper editors I have recently read an article that was talking about how experts are concerned that people are spending way too much time on their computers. Well I agree with them. I strongly believe that computers are taking time away from you exercising, enjoying nature and even interacting with family and friends. If you look at teens these days, more and more are becoming over weight. Back in the days when there wasn't computer or internet, not as much people were over weight or even obese because they had time to go out and exercise or play sports with others. Exercising is important because especially when as a teen you are over weight or even obese, these problems just don't go away. This will cost you in the future because not only do you have a chance of getting diabetes but you also have to pay for all the medications and treatments that comes with it. Experts also believe that by spending time on the computer will take time away from enjoying the things that nature has to offer. While others might argue that it is a good thing for people to learn about the different types of places in the world online, I deliver this: why do you have to just read about the places online and look at the pictures? Why can't you be the one taking the pictures for others to see? And why can't you be the one experiencing it instead of just reading about it? Experts also believe that by spending time on the computer it is taking away time from you being able to interact with family members and friends. Well as a teen myself I have learned that interacting with family and friends is very important to our health. I am not the only person that agrees with that because study shows that kids that can talk to their parents and have good conversations with their parents have the ability to do well in school and have more respect toward others versus the kid or teen that can't really have conversation or talk to their parents. For example, if you are the type of person that talks to your family you will have good grades such as A's and B's and will learn to have respect for others, and the person that can't talk to their parents have trouble concentrating or even making trouble for themselves and getting D's and F's. Well I know that as a state newspaper editor you are a very busy person and have a lot of different things to do but I hope you take this in to consideration and remember the importance of exercising, enjoying nature and interacting with family and friends for a healthier and more fulfilling life.

Dear newspaper journalist, People shouldn't have computers. Computers have a negative effect on most people. Our country has the highest number of obese citizens in the world. A lot of people spend their day sitting in front of a computer at work. Then they go home and go on their own computers instead of going for a walk or a bike ride. Some people like to look at photos of nature or birds on the internet, even though there's a whole forest outside waiting to be explored. Another problem with computers is how safe they are. There are a lot of people on computers that don't belong there, and are trying to hack onto your computer. Viruses can sneak into your computer without you knowing it, and can look up everything on your computer, even personal information. They can even monitor what you're typing, which could be your passwords! A lot of people have been paying their taxes online and if there is a virus on their computer, they could get their personal information stolen! Plus, most people who pay their taxes online have to use their online bank accounts, so now the hackers have your bank account password too! Computers are bad for most people. They make people become unhealthy and can get their personal information hacked by a virus, leading to financial ruin and a loss of privacy.

Dear Local Newspaper, Have you ever forgot the book you needed for homework? Did you ever miss the newest episode of your favorite show? Well, all these things and more can be solved by using the computer. The computer gives us all the things we need. Whether that's information, games, or online friend chatting websites. The computer is necessary for our society today. Countless times I was in desperate need for information. If I'm doing a school report on animals, I can just go on the computer and search whatever I want. There's no more need for driving to the town library and then searching through countless books and encyclopedias. I just think that that is a waste of time, when you basically have everything you need twenty feet away. And it's in your house! There is no more need to search for hours through biographies. If you need to know state capitals, you can find it in no time. To me, that's a life saver. Not only can computers help you with information, it can make school projects so much easier. In my own experiences, I've needed pictures on school projects. Instead of drawing it, the internet can save time and effort. All you need to do is print out the pictures! However, if you have an essay that's, let's say, supposed to be ten pages, who wants to write all that? With a computer, you can type it out in half the time. Then, when done, you can print it, or even send it straight to your teacher. But, if it's not finished, you can save it on a thumb drive, and use it on any computer you want. All in all, that's a huge help. My final reason why computers are good, is that they serve instant pleasure. Computers have millions of games that a kid can play for free. Also, it has many websites, like @CAPS1, or @CAPS2, that let you interact with friends. If you need to tell them something, there is no need for a phone. Plus, if you miss certain shows, or want to watch music videos, there are websites for that. As a kid, I'm usually never home because of sports and school activities. If I miss something on @LOCATION1, it is almost definitely going to be on the computer. You don't have to wait a week or so before they replay that episode. Who wants to do that? In the end, I think computers benefit people around the world. No more driving to libraries, or going out and buying games. The computer has everything you want for free. Basically, I think the computer is a huge time and effort saver that every household needs. It definitely benefits society.

Yes, I agree with the concern that experts have. Dear local newspaper, I agree with the previous point that computers are not good because of different reasons such as putting a person's health in danger for not exercising much or making people spend more time on a computer than interacting with family & friends and sadly also it causes people to change their attitudes and ways of being. But if you want to hear more than you will just have to read on. There are plenty of consequences that people face for spending too much time on the computer, such as people getting addicted to watching certain things or simply getting addicted to the computer itself. Plenty of people nowadays have to wear glasses, and probably most of them have to wear them because of too much computer use, and it must be really bad having to wear glasses for the rest of your life. Also, too much computer is bad for a person's health because they're giving more time to a computer than spending that time exercising, which can lead to physical problems. Well, I've given you reasons why I think computers are not good, such as putting health in danger, changing a person's life, and causing them to lose family & friends; now the rest is up to you to consider and act upon for a healthier lifestyle.

You need to gather information for a project you're presenting in school, but how are you going to find out about your topic quickly and easily? Most people will turn to one of the most commonly used pieces of technology in the modern home, the computer. The computer is used for quick and easy research, interacting and communicating with friends, and for personal entertainment. Some people argue that the computer will take away from enjoying nature, spending time with family and friends, and exercising. But what if we didn't have the computer? The possibility of research and other tasks would be much more difficult. For example, computers help us learn about almost anything quickly and easily; this could help make work for school or jobs less stressful. Also, a computer can be accessed right in your home, so no travel is required, saving both time and effort. The computer has programs that are used to prepare articles, essays, slide shows, and brochures for presentation, as well, which are essential for school and professional work. If we didn't have a computer, research would be much more of a struggle and could require travel to libraries or other places. Computers are one of the most common ways to communicate with friends and family. Websites and e-mail help you keep in touch with anyone around the world. You can write e-mails, access live chat, or even use a webcam. E-mailing is just like mailing a letter except it is delivered instantly and doesn't cost anything, making it highly efficient. There is also no risk of anyone reading your mail if you use secure services. Live chat is when you chat over text on the computer, allowing for real-time conversation. Webcam is face-to-face interacting which gives off the effect of talking in person; a key benefit is that communication over the computer doesn't cost a thing, which is great for long-distance relationships. Lastly, computers provide games for your personal entertainment, which helps kill boredom and offers relaxation. The computer also helps improve hand-eye coordination through interactive activities, along with staying organized; documents, pictures, videos, and more can be placed in files and saved on the computer, making it easy for you to open them at any time. Computers may take away from some activities but think of how much harder and more stressful things would be without them. I think that the computer has a good effect on people as well as it being a helpful piece of technology that enhances our daily lives in numerous ways.

Dear local newspaper, I strongly believe that computers have a great and beneficial effect on society. They have numerous many features, options, and abilities to use! Would you really try to prevent your child, friends, and families from using such an amazing invention that helps us every day? The computer can help others communicate, help educate you, and even prepare you for the future. One great option that computers have is the option to communicate with others. You can set up an email or a chatting account to talk with friends and family. Now some people might think, why not use a phone to talk to others, but there are many reasons why talking online can be better than using a phone. I remember one time a few years ago, me and my cousin were alone at her house when the phone wasn't working. She went downstairs to get us some sodas when I heard a crashing sound; she had fallen down the stairs. Because the phones weren't operating, I hopped to the computers in her room to quickly "chat" with my dad and tell him what happened. From there on, my dad called an ambulance and she was all right. Clearly, not only are computers a great way to communicate, but they can also save someone's life in emergencies! Another feature computers have is that they can actually educate. For example, if a student has to write a paper for school about a specific topic, then they would need to do some research. The internet explorer on your computer can open your eyes to a world of knowledge. All you have to do is go to a search engine such as Google or Yahoo and type in the subject you wish to learn more about. Before you know it, there are millions upon millions of websites that can educate you on the subject you want to gain more knowledge on. A high school teacher states that a large percentage of students in the school use the computer to help them with homework and research. Indeed, there you have it, the computer's a great resource for information and learning. One last reason computers are highly beneficial for our society is because they can actually help you prepare for future jobs. Perhaps some day your child will get a job working in an office where they must use computers all day long. The head of the company is not going to hire you if you are not experienced with computers. However, if you know how to use a computer effectively, then you have a great chance of getting a job that can support you and your family. Studies say now that a significant portion of businesses involve using a computer. Computers are becoming a bigger part of society by the second; it's important to start learning more about them as soon as possible! I think now it's very clear how important computers are in our society. They help increase communication, are a great source for knowledge, and help prepare you for jobs. With each passing day, computers help advance the future and help make the world a better place for everyone.

Dear Editor, Health experts are concerned about today's population's computer usage. With this I agree, as many children and adults are counted and labeled as obese, or overweight. Technology has advanced enough to have machines do everyday tasks, proving how lazy some individuals are now-a-days. People sit at home staring at a computer screen, forgetting about spending time exercising, enjoying nature, or being out and having fun with friends and family. Having a computer clearly interferes with one's social life in real situations, not the "virtual life" of chatting with others over the internet. Having applications released that connect people over the computer devastates the reason to leave your house and engage in physical social activities. Now with video chat, you virtually meet the other person, showing how lonely and individually separate you can become from others. While your friends are having a party, you'll be absent, as I'm sure they won't have a webcam there for you to join remotely. Another reason why a computer is not needed is many people neglect pure nature. When surrounded by the new digital age, the beauty of the outdoors becomes forgotten. Sure you can watch videos and look at pictures of nature, but is that really anything compared to the crisp, clean air against your hair or the once in a lifetime animal actions you might see? Plus, nature and the fact of being outside might inspire you to continue a diet, or begin one, seeing how healthy and perfect the outdoors can be. It also serves as a great place to exercise and improve your physical well-being. As we all know, obesity is a factor in the country and around the world. But now, being overweight is at an all-time high, claiming lives and causing many into depression. In my opinion, I believe this is highly related to computer usage, especially with fast food playing a role. People have not realized the need to exercise more often and break sedentary habits. In conclusion, you can see how computer usage has affected us as a nation, and in a negative way. Computer using might be "ok" when used in moderation, like sweets or oily foods. It does serve as a way to pass time, for a while, but so does exercise, which is far healthier. Which one would you think would end as a better solution? Obviously, we must stop relying on technology to help, and begin activities ourselves again to foster a healthier and more connected life.

Computers. They are an amazing marvel of science that greatly benefits mankind today. But computers can be good or bad depending on how you use them. Homework can be made easier, connecting with others is easier, and entertainment like @CAPS1 and video games are a click away. On the other hand, computers can be distracting, addicting, and tiring. It is important to know the pros and cons of computers. For example, the search engine, @ORGANIZATION1, is an easy-to-use website that can be very helpful. If there is a concept or problem that you are having trouble with, just type it into @ORGANIZATION1 and links to websites pop up that will help answer anything that you would like to know. There is also a website called @LOCATION1. This website is an all-purpose dictionary, @CAPS2, encyclopedia, and translator. I even have an application for it on my cellphone for quick access. But technology can also be distracting. Social networking websites, like Facebook, games websites like @CAPS3, and also websites like @CAPS4 can be very tempting and distracting when you should be doing homework. Procrastination is very easy to give into. But self-control is the only way to avoid this problem. Budgeting your time so that you can do both your homework and go on the computer is also very important. One thing that I find very useful on computers is an online textbook. We are lucky enough today that most large books can be formatted onto a computer. Instead of carrying a @NUM1-pound textbook, you can just use a @NUM1 megabyte book on the internet. This makes travel to and from school much easier on your back. That, and textbooks often use up a lot of desk space, but all you need is the space that a computer will consume anyway. Studying is also made easier this way with searchable text. All of the things that a computer can do are great. But this can also keep us from going outside, exercising, and seeing real people in real life. This need for the computer can be bad. We are too connected as a society through screens. Our status, feelings, friends, and position in life are always needing to be updated online. Distractions are everywhere. Facebook, for instance, is very addicting. You are looking at a virtual landscape instead of the real world. Self-control really is the only way to get off the computer and step into the real world. Overall, computers are great, but you have to know when and how long to use them. They have several benefits such as entertainment, communication, and information access. But all of these things can be just as distracting as they can be helpful. Knowing this, I hope that society can think carefully about the pros and cons of the computer before spending endless hours in front of it.

Dear @ORGANIZATION1 newspaper, I firmly believe that computers do have positive benefits on society. These advancements in technology can only enrich people's lives. One way computers help is that students can do their school work online and see their teachers' pages for assignments and resources. Another great thing about computers is that whenever people need information or details on any place or thing they can count on the internet to help them out. Most importantly they are a vital source of communication. People depend on computers for their scheduling and keeping in touch with everyone that they know. Without computers students would have it a lot worse. When a student forgets the homework, they can just go on their teacher's online page and check what the assignment was for that night. Another thing that students benefit from are online textbooks. If a student can't manage to carry home @NUM1 pounds of books they can just use their textbook online. Nowadays, the internet is filled with lots of great information and educational sites. Teachers also can allow students to research for projects online and participate in online educational activities. Not only do computers help out educationally, they are probably the most well known information centers. If people want to see about a restaurant, store or product, they can do that online. Also, many people want to go to destinations but do not know how to get there. The internet provides them with directions for them on how to reach their destination in a quick and efficient manner. An extremely important and helpful aspect of the internet is the ability of purchasing and ordering items online. Before someone decides to buy something, they can find out all sorts of information about the product and shop around for the lowest price. People can even order groceries to their new house if they are busy! I strongly think that the internet is the number one way of communication between people. For example, the team manager of my soccer team always emails me times and locations of the next game or practice. I would be lost and confused without these emails that I depend on. Businesses also heavily rely on the internet to keep in touch with their clients that keep them in business. The use of web conferences saves a lot of travel and it allows the company to be in business with people all over the world. Above all, people depend heavily on social networking sites to keep in touch with friends, keep up to date on the news, and have fun talking to people. Without the internet, probably half of the world's communications would be down and that would not be good. Computers, without a doubt, have a positive effect on society. When it can be an educational resource it is very helpful. Also, it is the best information database known and is probably the most used. Most importantly, without computers the world would be a mess without their main source of communication. People know not to spend too much time inside and they always know when to go outside have some fun and get some fresh air. Therefore, computers have no negative effect on people and they remain an essential asset in everyday life.

Dear @CAPS1 @CAPS2, @CAPS3 computers hold exclusive information, I do not believe they have a good effect on people.
