The effects of computers on people are that adults and kids are getting way more attention than they need to. The first reason why is that most spend their time on social networking, constantly checking for updates and notifications. The others are either buying things online or playing immersive games for hours. Some of the people that are on the computers are wasting too much time being tech-savvy, focusing on digital skills that have little real-world application. It's other ways people can spend their time like biking in the park or taking a brisk walk around the neighborhood. Another solution is you can get up on your learning skills by reading books or find a job around your town that involves physical activity. Computers drain and waste people's minds everyday with endless streams of information. I think it is essential for the people that can't get off to seek fitness and mental health through outdoor pursuits. Then again it could be legitimate reasons to be on the computers spending as much time as you want, such as for work or important research. The people that abuse the access of their computer too much should think and find something else to do that is more productive. I think it'll be a good idea to have a time when the computers should be shut off one day or a week. By that I mean the cable/internet company should turn the internet and the cable off for a week of pure exercise and outdoor activity. That'll make people who are lazy to do something active like playing sports or gardening. It'll also be a good motivator for people who are on the computer or watching t.v. too much to rediscover other hobbies. Then it would make everybody fit and healthy if they try and participate fully. I understand the elderly or senior citizens who need their computers for health help and medical information. That's understandable but everyone else should not be exempt from this digital detox. Computers and laptops should be network disconnected periodically to make people get off their feet and do something helpful or brain building like learning a musical instrument. Everyday people are being digitally sucked into their screens. Some people in this world just can't get enough of it and it needs to dead soon before it causes more harm. The government should make a legal law that you must do something that will actively benefit you, like community service or physical labor. It should be a person of the state or local towns person that goes to every house to check compliance. Another way that could be done is by one person from every street in the state go home-to-home to make sure the procedure is being done correctly. A lot of people are not going to like it and they will not obey the new law, preferring their digital comforts. It should be a penalty towards anyone that fails to abide by it, such as a fine or community service. The second choice should be a loss of internet services for a set period. That'll make them really mad and in exchange they should still exercise as required. Sometimes it takes harsh laws to make somebody change their deeply ingrained habits for the better.

Did you know that computers are the number one selling electronic device in the world? I think that computers are only making our society a smarter and more intelligent place by providing instant access to vast amounts of information. Also computers help old time friends and family keep in touch across great distances through various communication platforms. Finally I think they are helping our society because computers teach great hand-eye coordination through interactive tasks and games. Studies have shown that a significant percentage of the people growing up with computers at home have a high paying job due to their advanced technical skills! Computers are very intelligent pieces of equipment and if you know how to use a computer you will most likely have a high paying career in many modern fields. Also mostly every job from doctor to police officer to cashier at a store all involve computers and to do those jobs you must know how to work a computer effectively. This is only one of the many reasons I think computers will benefit our society in the long term. Secondly, I think that this piece of technology benefits society because it keeps family, friends and workers in touch no matter where they are located. Have you ever had a time where you think back and wish you could see your old high school friends or even family living far away? Well, computers are one of the most popular ways to do so with all the new websites like Facebook, Twitter or even your old email website people are keeping in touch all over the world easily. Another way computers help old time friends keep touch is with the new video camera in the computer; family, friends and workers can actually see each other from different parts of the world in real time. A simple message though one of these websites will make someone's day and could even make yours when they reply. Finally I think that computers benefit our society because they teach hand eye coordination and other life skills through practical use. How do you think people can shoot a gun so accurately and so quickly or how do you think a baseball player can swing at such a perfect time? All these things revolve around hand-eye coordination which is best learned by using computers and similar devices. Also people can save lives by just a type about a hurricane, tornado or any natural disaster; but if they do not know how to work a computer many people can get injured or die from lack of warning. These are only three of the many reasons I think computers benefit our society greatly. So think twice about the negative comments people say about computers and consider their positive impacts.

Dear school board, teens that use computers is a good thing for their development and social life. I state this because the web has many things to do that are both entertaining and educational. For example, Facebook, Twitter, and Myspace are all social sites that allow for interaction. Also there are video sites such as YouTube that provide a wealth of content. Plus teens learn how to type fast, which is an essential skill in today's world. Social network sites are good for teens to express themselves and connect with peers. Teens get to talk to each other, make new friends, and post what they want on their profiles. For example, on Twitter you can post tweets, on Facebook you can join groups, and become a fan of something or someone, and on Myspace you can send messages to communicate. Teens relieve a lot of stress on the web by engaging in activities they enjoy. Videos are great when you're bored and need entertainment or information. Type in YouTube and get a good laugh or two from comedy clips. Teens that go on YouTube become more social by sharing videos and discussing them with friends. For example, teens can learn the new dance moves from tutorial videos. Plus on video sites there are comedy sketches that provide humor. Comedy helps daily life by reducing stress and improving mood. Typing helps life if you work in an office or a trade market where computer skills are required. Teens learn to type to make life easier and more efficient in their schoolwork and future jobs. For example typing fast is like texting on a phone but more professional. Typing is like writing a letter electronically, which is the modern standard. So get to typing and improve your skills. Ok so computers do help life in teen years by providing various tools and platforms. Basically it is essential somewhat for modern living and communication. All people should have a computer to access these benefits and opportunities. Just remember that social sites, video sites, and typing make life better and more connected for everyone.

Yes, I do think that we should continue using computers because it helps us stay in contact with other countries around the world, it forms a balance between digital and physical activities, and it also makes life simpler in many ways. First of all, computers help us stay in contact with the other countries around the world through instant communication. Without computers we would not be able to email or even video message other countries about important events and personal matters. Second, we have to balance computer use and exercising and interacting with others; but computers can help us interact with family and friends by emailing or video chatting can also help you stay in contact when face-to-face isn't possible. Last, using computers makes life simpler like how it's so much easier to write an email and not a letter by hand, and its easier to instant message someone then to call them when you need a quick response; also for school projects you can make your project look so much better by adding pictures and different fonts instead of just hand writing it plainly. That's why computers aren't a waste of time because they help us stay in contact with the other countries, they form a balance between our online and offline lives, and it also makes life simpler and more efficient for everyone.

Dear world, computers are a necessity to life in the modern age. They benefit not only the community but the whole world by connecting people and information! They provide education for anyone who has access to the internet, from children to adults. Secondly, it's a form of communication that spans the globe. Also, computers can be fun and entertaining, offering a break from daily routines. As you know, education is one of the most important things in anyone's life, and computers play a key role. Where would we be without a computer to help with research and learning? Think about how many times you've used Google or Wikipedia to search something you didn't know the answer to. It's a lot, right? I do research every time I get a random question jammed in my head, and the computer provides immediate answers. Imagine how tough it would be without a computer to rely on when you have no idea how to answer something or complete a task. Another thing is there are online courses now for students of all ages. Some college students have to look up their assignments and how to do them on their professors web page for guidance. Also, how would students know what their homework is if they can't check the school homepage regularly? I check it almost every day when I come home from school to stay organized. It's great that the teachers care enough to post the homework and announcements online. Without computers, we'd have a higher percentage of students not doing their homework due to lack of information. A significant number out of every group of people in America has some form of online communication program they use daily. Whether it's an instant messaging service or social media, maybe even YouTube, or just a simple e-mail, practically everyone has one account or more. How else are you supposed to talk to your friends after school or coordinate plans? What do you expect us to do, call them each individually? Then we would be on the phone for hours, which is inefficient! Anybody with a teen at home knows that they prefer digital communication. Also, computers help deaf people talk through specialized programs and devices. They just type in what they want to say and out it comes through text or speech synthesis. I remember when a lady came to our school who was blind and deaf and she demonstrated how to use that special program to communicate effectively. Another reason is teachers and parents use e-mail to talk about academics and their children's progress quickly. Clearly communication is a must have in our interconnected world. Therefore, computers are a benefit to society for keeping people connected. There is no way that anybody over the age of a certain number has never played a computer game sometime in their life, as they are a common pastime. Except, of course, if they don't have internet access or choose not to engage. I know I used to play computer games, but they started to slow down my computer so my dad told me I had to stop or I can't use the computer anymore for important tasks. Woops! Still, you can use the computer to look up cheats on video games when you get stuck. Oh come on like you haven't done that at least once! Or at least your children have done it for their games. Also, you can use specific programs like presentation software or design tools to create a cover page for a project or a presentation for your corporate business, making work more professional. In other words, computers are pleasurable and practical tools for various needs. As you can see, computers are extremely educational and informative. They provide search engines to figure out anything you've ever wanted to know about, from history to science. Like, foreign places or movies and their details. Anything you can imagine. Also, we wouldn't have as much communication with people across distances without them. How would we e-mail friends in other countries without computers to bridge the gap? Finally, you can find pleasure in computers through games, videos, and creative projects. They are beneficial for work, education, and leisure, making them indispensable in today's world.

Dear Local Newspaper, I don't know if I am understanding correctly but are you honestly thinking about not advancing technology? Quickly rethink that because that would just be the worst mistake you could ever make. Computers can teach hand-eye coordination, they can also give you very useful knowledge. Lastly, computers help us stay close to our family and friends. First off, about ninety percent of people say that they use the computer every day so that they can increase their knowledge. This could be as simple as going on Wikipedia and discovering the latest news. This is ten times easier than going on the television and waiting for the news story you want details on. I took a survey and thirty students say that they use their computer every night so that they can read more into their social studies or science unit. Taking computer advances away is like taking learning advances away, now is that what you want? Second, Dr. Evans, a children's doctor, states, "Computers give children that hand-eye coordination they need to enhance in sports" I agree! Sports such as baseball, soccer, and basketball all need a great deal of hand-eye coordination. Without the hand-eye coordination, students will not do well and end up quitting. I know that if I was having trouble with sports for a long time, I would give up! If the teens gave up sports then they wouldn't have anything to keep them fit and that would lead to hundreds of kids with an obesity problem. Lastly, taking away the advancing in computers means that you are taking away family and friends connections. Computers offer many sites such as Facebook or Myspace to connect with loved ones. You can also go on Skype to chat or video chat with them. Yes, maybe computers are taking away time with family but what about your aunt or uncle in Florida that you haven't seen in over a year? Don't you want some time with them too? You can make time limits for yourself so that you don't spend your whole time on the computer. This way you can talk to all of your loved ones. Would you want to be the one crushing the emotions of a child that wants to talk to or see his grandparents? In conclusion, I remember talking and laughing with my friends over the computer when I was sick so that they could cheer me up. Don't take that away from me! Keep enhancing computers so that I can advance my knowledge, increase my hand-eye coordination and get to see my far away friends and family.

Dear local newspaper, Too much technology! Computers have a negative effect on people. First, our country needs to exercise more, and not just sit around, second, we aren't spending enough time caring for our environment. And third, we are losing the ability to communicate with the people around us. Our country has problems with being overweight. Most people blame it on fast food, but it's also because people sit around using computers, and don't think about staying in proper shape. Before computers were made, people were much more fit, and healthy. We need to help our country get back in shape, and take our attention away from the computer, for even just a short while, and we need to exercise! The next reason is that computers don't just have a bad effect on people, but our environment too. We spend too much time indoors with technology, and we don't even care about the world around us. Before much technology, people used to plant gardens, and trees, but now that thought hardly crosses our minds. All the electronics these days are making people forget about nature, and that needs to change. The last reason computers have a negative effect is that people don't communicate as well anymore with the people around them. If we communicate so much with people through technology, we are losing the ability to speak and communicate in person, and it ruins relationships and connections between people, like family and friends. So we need to start caring about the people around us, and not always rely on technology. In conclusion, you can see the negative effect computers have on people. We need to exercise more to improve our health. Also, we need to help our environment by reconnecting with nature. And lastly, we need to communicate better with friends and family in person. We shouldn't get rid of computers, but just step away and care about the world around you.

More and more people are using computers on a daily basis, but I do not agree that this benefits our society. People are spending too much time on computers and less time exercising and staying healthy. Also people using computers are spending less time with family and friends. As people use computers more they are spending less time exercising and staying healthy. Professor Smith has done a study showing that people who are on the computer for more than five hrs a day are overweight and do not exercise regularly. He goes on to state that if these habits continue throughout their lives they will become obese and are more likely to die from a heart attack before age fifty. I have experienced changes in my community's health due to computers as well. Last year I had a friend who weighed one hundred fifty lbs and exercised regularly but when he got a computer that following year he stopped exercising and gained over twenty lbs. He now is much slower and can not do more than five push ups. I do not agree that computers are benefiting our society because as people use computers more they exercise less causing them to be unhealthy. Not only do computers lead to an unhealthy life style, they also cause people to spend less time with family and friends. Studies show that seventy percent of children that own a computer spend less time with their family and more time on the computer. This may not seem like a big thing at first but this study also shows that many children who spend less time with their families grow up to become lonely. I remember when a new student came to our school. He wasn't that social of a kid and didn't have many friends but he was still doing just fine. When he came back the next year, I found out he had a computer and would keep in touch with none of his friends and barely spoke to his parents. He stayed apart from the rest of the students and didn't talk much. Then one week he wasn't at school and for the rest of the week he didn't show up either. Finally, the teachers told us he ran away from home and has still not been found. So people that use computers are spending less time with their family and friends which can cause them to become depressed and lonely. More and more people are using computers on a daily basis, but I do not agree that this is benefiting our society. People are spending too much time on their computers and are spending less time exercising and staying healthy. Also people using computers are spending less time with their family and friends. I know that the more people using computers is not better for our society it is worse.

Dear Mr. Jones the editor of the Springfield citizen, It has been brought to my attention from some people around Springfield that computers and technology are bad for us. I have also heard that people believe in the technology. So, the reason why I'm writing today about this issue is to put my beliefs out there. I believe that this new technology is effecting our daily exercising, playing outside to enjoy nature and interacting with friends and family. Now that we have new technology with computers and such, people are distracted and do not want to exercise. This will effect our youth because we will be fat, unhealthy and sluggish all the time. Mr. Jones we don't want this to happen to our youth because we are the future and if this keeps up the state and country will suffer. Another reason is that its good to exercise and not be on the computer or watching television all the time is because exercise has been proven to make you have more energy and will feel happier most of the time. Computers do not do that for us at all. A poll even says that sixty percent of people get headaches and feel tired after being on the computer. Exercise won't do that at all. Since all of our new technology with televisions and other gadgets, people really don't go outside play around and enjoy nature anymore. I was asking my mother about this topic and she said, "Kids these days just don't go outside anymore. I remember when I was your age and my mother would kick me outside at nine am and I wouldn't be back home until around five pm." I believe that this should still happen. Maybe parents should still do this with their kids and have them run around the neighborhood with other kids. If we did this more often maybe kids and adults too will just do this naturally and will not have to rely on computers or phones for entertainment. Don't you think this is a good idea Mr. Jones? My last topic is with computers and cellphones and how we really don't interact with friends and family anymore. Now a days friends email, video chat or text each other instead of going and doing something with them. This isn't really healthy for us because we might not know how to talk to people in real life. Also if someone emails or texts you, you really don't know how their tone is because you are not talking to them face to face. Lastly I know families that get hurt by technology because that is all they do. They don't put down their phones or get off their emails and they feel like they don't see each other. This is also not a healthy relationship with family members. Mr. Jones I really hope I have persuaded you that technology is only ok to use sometimes and not every day. Remember technology is bad because we don't exercise, play outside and enjoy nature and really don't interact with friends and family members. Thank you for your time.

Dear Editor, I think computers greatly benefit society, and advance technology. They provide knowledge in a click, and entertainment after a long day of work or school. Not only that, but people have found long-lasting careers because of the invention of the computer. So obviously, computers are a great influence on society. Do you want to find out when major league baseball first came to be? Or maybe you have a history report due the next day, and your parents can't drive you to the library? This isn't a problem anymore. Computers have evolved a long way since they were invented. You can check up on your local news, by having dozens of electronic newspapers right at your fingertips. Or maybe you want to venture outside your neighborhood, and check out what's happening in London or Tokyo. News isn't the only thing the internet is useful for though. You can also go onto one of the hundreds of websites for school help, or check how the stock market is doing. Or, you can just use the handy calculator found right on your desktop. What could be better? Of course not all users have a computer for information. Many have it for entertainment purposes. In fact eighty percent of people use the computer for entertainment everyday. What, with all the fun stuff you can do, who can blame them? Social networking is placed at the top of the list. A whopping seventy-five percent of internet users use sites like Facebook or Twitter. These sites are useful for catching up with friends you might not have seen in years or continue a conversation from thirty minutes ago. You can also use computers to watch live-streaming T.V., or that new movie you got yesterday. That's right, televisions might not be needed soon! And what would a computer be without games? There are dozens of hundreds of them scattered all across the web. How great is that? And finally, many people have found their careers through the internet. Did you know that a famous singer, Justin Bieber, was found through YouTube when his mom posted videos for the family to see when they couldn't attend performances? Of course, YouTube isn't the only way to make money. Tons of jobs are listed by employers only for the curious person to find. No more wondering city streets, now you can just submit an application or have an interview without ever leaving your home. Artists have also discovered talents, by playing around with Photoshop or Illustrator. Not to mention the career paths involving computers directly, such as repairing or movie special effects. So no matter what you use a computer for, be it job hunting, entertainment, or information, they are a good idea to have in your home. There's a reason that ninety percent of households use them, and it's not just an excuse to sit around all day.

Dear Local Newspaper, First of all I would like to say that I love your story and puzzles in your paper and I think I have a story you guys can use. It's about people that is addicted to computers. I guess you guys are wondering about what I mean about addiction to computers. Well I'm going to give you three reasons about this. My first reason is people aren't spending a lot of time with their family. I say this because most of the time couples get into arguments because the person that's addicted to the internet isn't doing what he or she is supposed to do. For example, say you have a turkey in the oven and you're so into the computer you forget all about it until the fire alarm goes off. Another reason why people can be addicted to the computer is because of all the online chat rooms they have. I know people that's addicted to online chat rooms and I sometimes get worried about them because half of the time they don't know who they're talking to! It could be anybody, even a pedophile. My final reason is because some people just don't care. Some people can be on the computer all day and night doing nothing besides online chatting when they could be doing an essay or something helpful or caring. You know I used to be addicted to the computer myself and because of that I almost failed all my classes; because of that I don't use the computer to talk or anything such as that but now I just read my email or write my essay. And that concludes my, or should I say your next top story.

Lies! The computers we use in society do not harm us in any way! They are a huge step forward for mankind and only benefit our lives. They benefit us greatly for the following reasons: computers are a source of knowledge, computers can aid the advertisement and business of many workplaces, and they are a very helpful and easy way to communicate with someone across the street or across the ocean. Without a doubt computers do nothing but benefit the people of our society. First of all, computers are a big source of knowledge. Many people want answers to a question they have encountered recently but cannot find the answers in a book or newspaper so they turn to a computer and immediately their problem is solved. Computers today hold every bit of information on every topic imaginable from history to politics. All one has to do is find a site such as an online encyclopedia, type their question, and millions of answers pop up assuring a solution to the problem. Computers can also provide a place to research for a project or statistics of the economy if needed by school, business, or just for recreation. Times are changing fast and the sources of the world's history and school subjects can easily be found in the corner of the internet. What you have looked for in books and papers can be easily found on the internet at the click of a button. Clearly, computers are a huge source of knowledge for our society. Second of all, computers and the internet support many businesses in advertising and making profit. Every single time a visit to the internet occurs many different businesses are able to advertise their products and overall businesses with pop-ups, side bars and websites. It clearly helps the workplace get attention. Along with advertising products, businesses can even sell their products online without doing a thing. This can also aid the consumer because they would not have to drive all the way down to the store and pick up what they need. All they need to do is select the items they wish to purchase and await its arrival a few days later. Clearly, the computer and internet can help support the welfare of businesses. Finally, the computers we use today are a huge and easy way of communication. Contact with people from another street, town, state, or country can be established by the use of social networking sites. You could send a letter with the touch of a button without having to make a trip down to the post office and await a reply. An instant message, which can be used on any of the sites mentioned, can also be achieved. This is where you could write something down in the computer, send it to anyone and receive a reply within seconds. Obviously, computers play a big role in the communication of one to another without a problem. In conclusion, it is clear computers benefit the society greatly without a side effect at all. Computers are a good source of knowledge, an aid to business, and a great way of communication. Everyone has agreed to this without hesitation so you should too. Computers are the best things that have ever happened to our society today.

Dear local newspaper, A large percentage of households own a computer. This illustrates that computers must have a positive effect on people if most people own them. I believe computers do have a positive effect on people because it gives you the ability to talk to other people online, learn about new things, and gives you hand eye coordination. My first reason why I believe computers have a positive effect on people is because it gives you the ability to talk to other people online. Some people don't have phones but do have computers. If you needed to contact somebody you could do it using a computer. Also some people have family and friends who live across the world. Computers are great for keeping in touch; it also won't cost you a lot for long distance, like phones would. Because computers give you the ability to talk to friends, family, and other people it is a positive thing because it is important to do so. My second reason why I believe computers have a positive effect on people is because it gives you the ability to learn about new things. Learning about new things using a computer gives a positive effect on people because you don't have to travel and go places to get information to learn about things. Dear Editor, In my opinion, spending too much time online has a negative effect on society. People aren't getting a full social experience when they talk on email, Facebook and Twitter. In person interaction is better than online, because you see how the person you're talking to is reacting to everything you say. Having a good, positive social environment is beneficial to you and your friend. Spending too much time on the computer can also damage your social relationship with your family. For family who live far away, and online is the only way to socialize, online interaction is a great thing to have. But for your close family, you could be missing out on their lives and how they are doing. Your relationship with your family could be in jeopardy because you insist on using your computer. When you use the computer, you're probably eating some food too. And spending time online is taking away your time from exercising those calories off. The obesity level in our country is increasing, probable cause being over-usage of computers. Online activity is hurting our health, and making us not enjoy our outdoor life. In conclusion, being online too often is abusing our social life, our health, and taking up too much of our time. Using the internet is good for adults so they can pay taxes, work at home, and do many other beneficial things for them and their families. But for other, less useful sites are being used to interact. Why not just call or meet up with a person, instead of using the computers?

Dear Editor of the local paper, I'm writing a letter to tell you about the effect of computers on people in society. I think that computers help society learn and helps people to talk to others around the world. Computers help society learn about faraway areas of the world, to learn about the history of an area, and to study animals and habitats unable to reach without travel. Computers make it easier to learn about areas that are hard to research like deep sea trenches and the cliffs of the Andes in South America, allowing us to learn about the history of an area or cities of ancient civilizations like the Roman Empire in Italy. They help us study animal species and the habitats they call home like the Bengal Tiger in India or the species called the Mountain Gorilla. Computers help society learn about all this. Computers also help people talk to others around the world; like you can hold a conference on your computer when you are home. It is easier to talk and ask questions with others while you are on vacation, and you don't have to pay to travel to a place to have a conference with others. You can hold a conference on your computer from home when you can't make a trip. It's easier to talk and ask questions about something important to your business. You can go on your computer and talk with other people without spending money to travel there. This is how computers help people talk with others around the world. This is how computers help society learn and talk to others around the world.

Dear Newspaper, People use computers in their everyday lives, and having computers has become customary to many people throughout the world. We go on computers for research, writing papers, or just for pure entertainment; in all these ways computers are very helpful. But, like all good things, too much computer time can be harmful. Sure they provide our lives with knowledge, info on the outside world, and connections with people from just about anywhere, but some of us become too attached to this virtual life instead of living our own real lives. This happens to many people; some don't even notice what computers are doing to them. For most people, life can be challenging and the real world too stressing, so they retire to the computer for awhile, and to me this is fine, but when someone were to keep doing this it would become an addiction. Instead of relaxing by taking a walk or reading a book, they go to the computer; this would not be good for their social life or their minds. In my opinion, minds need to think; they need exercise by puzzling over something or figuring out a problem. Sure you think your brain is thinking by playing a challenging computer game, and sure, in some ways, it is. But it could reach its full potential by doing something else that's not straining your eyes so much. Computers can be good, but not for everything in your life. Now what about your social life? Computers can be a helpful resource in many ways, but not if you let them become a destruction. This can happen by letting the computer be your constant companion. Nowadays people have come up with online games where you can interact with other people. This isn't necessarily bad unless your whole social life is only with these online people that you really don't know, instead of with real people that you see at school or meet on the everyday streets. So what I'm saying is that talking with people online isn't bad as long as you put them as secondary friends and have real people come first. Like I said in the beginning, computers are part of our everyday life, and it's not a bad thing; they can be very helpful. But you must control what you do on them and how much you use them. If you do that you will most likely have a much more balanced lifestyle, making you, your friends, and family a whole lot happier.

Dear Newspaper people, as you might have heard on the news, more and more people think computers are the benefits of society. I personally disagree with them. There are also new things to try like jumping out of a plane or bungy jumping. You could be going to new places around the world. Traveling to Paris, Rome or even under water. Even going to Italy and having a melting, warm, right out of the oven tasty cheese pizza. My mouth is grumbling for just thinking about it. How many people do you know? What about on facebook or myspace? That is not enough; you should go to the park. Meet some people. Just going to a family house, you can be interacting. Everyone should be interacting with someone. Even two year olds need to interact with other two year olds. That is how they learn how to share toys; you're not two anymore but it's good to know someone. Learning how others think too. You might think your way is good and the other person's way is not. That is called interacting and talking about it. You might see on the news how many families have someone in the family having weight problems. Many shows like the biggest loser on television are trying to help these people lose weight. But what causes this? It could be not eating right, or not exercising right. But the problem could do with computers. Many people are spending sixty minutes on the computer, than only ten minutes exercising. Just a quick walk around the block can make you lose at least one hundred calories. Dear Newspaper, Computers today have a negative effect on people. The valuable time of getting daily exercise is reduced, you will not see your family enough, and some of the costs are outrageous! Owning a computer is surely not a good idea. Is sitting around all day your idea of a workout? Having a computer would be very bad for your physical lifestyle. Clicking a mouse and typing away are only moving your hands, not your whole body. An individual who doesn't use the computer daily, or for large amounts of time, would be healthier than someone who always uses the computer. I remember seeing a commercial about two children and how their lives ended up later on in life just by their computer usage as a "tween." Not only will you be unhealthy, but anti-social behavior is probable too. Many kids, or even adults, spend precious family time playing The Sims or creating their own ideal family. This, however, is not acceptable. Spending time with your family is something precious. When asked about computer usage, a friend said, "you could easily become addicted with just a few turns!" If you are addicted, both your family and you suffer. They will stop inviting you places. You wouldn't want to lose the people who are going to be there for you, on another note. "Warning!" shouts your computer. You have another virus. Uh oh, it's deleting your hardware: all your scholastic essays, important book-marked websites, and sentimental photographs. Do you have any idea how much it would cost to even try to retrieve this data? Well, it'd be a lot. I know you're probably thinking, "This couldn't happen to me," but in reality, yes it can. Storing things on a computer is much riskier than having a hard copy. It will also save you more money. Furthermore, appliances use electricity when they're even plugged into an outlet! So when you get your electric bill, don't be surprised; computers can be very costly, which is why it's not worth it to have one. Computers are just another unnecessary thing in life. They will take away from your over-all health, reduce family time, and cost you some big bucks. It is a fact that you can survive without a computer. But without health? Well, you'd be dead. I ask you to consider my ideas.

Dear Editor, I am a student at a middle school in the United States. You recently produced an article about whether computers were good or bad for people; I write today to say that computers are beneficial to people everywhere. This is true because computers help people with things like hand-eye coordination, to learning advances in our schools, and finally, it helps people communicate with ease. Please consider the following. First of all, computers help hand-eye coordination greatly in the long run. This is true because people playing games on the computers got more skillful with using their hands and eyes together. A study from a university stated, "Computers help hand-eye coordination twenty percent more than putting your son or daughter on the football team." Computer games could help kids get more accurate with their skills or that of any sport. So now you know why computers help people develop better hand-eye coordination. Secondly, computers help people learn new things. Although people might think this to be false, it is indeed true. A recent study at an institute shows that ninety percent of schools in the country use computers for research. Finally, I recently had a paper about a historical figure and the only source I thought of was Wikipedia on the internet because it is faster than searching for a book about him. So now you understand the computer is a helpful learning tool. Finally, the computer is a great way to communicate online. It is better than a telephone because it is faster and more efficient than calling someone up and talking for a long time. It is a lot cheaper than a phone because you just have one payment a month, unlike a phone bill where it starts to add up. In fact, a professor in a recent study said that "telephones are obsolete now; with the internet, people can chat at lightning speed." Finally, using e-mail or Facebook is so much better than phone tag; on Facebook you know where you can chat with friends. So that's my reasons that the computer is good for communicating. So now you see that computers are necessary because they develop hand-eye coordination, they help people learn, and finally, they are a great way to communicate.

Dear Editor, A recent concern has built up among experts that computers today have negative effects on society. I do not agree with this. Computers ease life, teach you about faraway places and people, and finally, you can chat with others. I believe computers can only benefit a society. As previously mentioned, computers ease the hassles of life. With computers, you are able to plan your life with calendar output. This program enables you to enter data on places you have to go and reminds you when it is time for that event. With this program, you will never forget where you have to go. Also, with the computer, you are able to gather information at extremely high speeds. Suppose you are doing a research project in school on types of cars; you just enter cars on a search engine and get millions of results. This saves much more time than going to the library and finding a book, which can take up to an hour. Finally, with a computer handy, there are programs for special needs people to write. New programs such as word processors have a special function called voice commands. This lets a person who cannot write because of blindness or a disability speak to the computer what he or she wants to write. In an instant, it will pop up on the screen. Computers ease people's lives drastically. Besides easing lives, computers teach you about faraway places and people. Pictures on a computer give one a firsthand account of what a faraway place is like. Instead of just reading about it, you can see it. According to Time Magazine, if a person sees a place, they will learn more by thirty percent than reading an encyclopedia. As well as pictures, blogs give people an idea of how a person lives in a regular day in that place and how they feel about it. This is another firsthand account of the place. Finally, ebooks on the internet give you a large amount of information. Ebooks are books but in an internet format. These books include encyclopedias that give statistics, poems, and events that are in the far-off place. For example, if you are planning a trip, you can learn where to eat and where to get entertained. You can learn about far-off places and the people in them with computers. Lastly, with computers, you can talk to people around the world. You can talk to friends. Have you ever moved and wanted to talk to a friend from where you previously lived? Now you can easily do so with video chat. Not only can you talk to someone, you can see them. I remember two years ago when I moved to a new town, I missed my friends in my old town so I video chatted with them. As well as talking to friends, one can have a business meeting around the world without having to travel out of your town. For example, if a company wanted to make a trading agreement with another company in another country, they could do so with a click of a mouse. This will save the time and money of traveling. Also, you can talk to others online to get a feel of what happened. For example, a reporter a few weeks ago video chatted many people in a disaster area to understand how bad conditions were after the earthquake. You can talk to people with ease with a computer available. In conclusion, I believe computers are beneficial to a society. They ease life, teach people about faraway places and the people who live there, and allow people to talk to others. Computers open doors in the world. Computers help society a great deal.

Dear Principal, as a student of the local middle school technology is utilized to the fullest. Computers have helped us write essays more efficiently & complete research assignments. However, personally I feel that this constant usage of computers has a negative impact on people. Firstly, computers hinder interpersonal connections. Sites like Facebook help keep in touch with old college buddies', but no computer can replace face-to-face communication. From hard, cold text, one cannot decipher subtle connotations or wit. But, people are beginning to replace seeing one another with social networking. With the technological revolution came games like World of Warcraft. These games are addicting, and our society mocks "nerds" for spending too much time playing these trivial games, but it really is a serious issue. For example, in a recent study done by university students, "three out of five teenagers who play computer games do not get the recommended amount of daily exercise." This is because these games are so absorbing. The amount of time put into gaming ultimately consumes all free time. This is dangerous, because a gaming addiction can lead to delusion, social inadequacy, and obesity. As a people, we are quickly learning that what was once so genius, is actually dangerous. If one was to stare at a backlit screen for hours on end, their eyesight would definitely start to deteriorate. Loss of eyesight is just one of the negative impacts computers have in our health. As aforementioned, obesity is another issue. Now, couple this with bad eyesight, vitamin D deficiency & a negative outlook & you've got yourself a issue. All of the diseases brought on by computers can be helped by less time on the computer, & exercises. Naturally, as a species we were not meant to spend so much time in a fixed position. This static state is a new phenomena that is acquiring major health problems. The over usage of computers practically robs us of our time, destroys our health, & hinders our social interactions. This makes computers a negative influence on people & their overall well-being.

Dear @CAPS1, Computers have been an incredible help to many people as they advance in knowledge. But, many people do not think about the negative effects of computers. Computers make research easier to find, and they organize data well and quickly. Computers make communication easy, but there are many negative effects as well as positive. Chat rooms on computers are a great way to communicate quickly, but they can also be dangerous. More and more kids are spending time on computers, rather than outside exercising and communicating with friends and family. Chat rooms are commonly used by kids as well as adults. Kids use them to talk with friends, make plans, and catch up with relatives. But kids aren't the only people that use chat rooms. Adults use them too. Some for good, others for bad. Adults sometimes have chats for their work to talk with their fellow workers. They can communicate easily what has been done and what needs to be done at the office such as what bills have been paid. This is a good way for workers to know what's going on outside of the office. There are many other useful advantages of computers. Some other advantages of computers are the computers' functions. Computers are good for finding information quickly. Computers are useful to find information for school projects. Computers can also take that information, and organize it on graphs, and computer programs such as Microsoft PowerPoint. Other pluses about computers, are that they can teach hand-eye coordination. Typing can help the majority with this. Typing is also another advantage. If people don't have great penmanship, they can use a computer to type essays, homework, and school projects. This makes reading the assignment easier for the student as well as the teacher. There are many advantages to computers, but there are also disadvantages. More and more kids are spending their free time on the computer, instead of outside exercising. This is causing kids to become less active. Being in a chat room all day is also a disadvantage. Kids today are using a new language in chat rooms as well as texting. They are using abbreviations for words and phrases, such as "idk" for "I don't know". This language is damaging how kids read and write. Although chat rooms on computers can be useful, they can also be dangerous. Kids as well as adults go into chatrooms and talk to other people, saying invalid information about themselves, such as their age. Some adults go into chat rooms and pretend to be a teenager. They talk to kids until they find out something like an address, phone number, school, and district. Once they get information like that, they can find out many other things about kids. This is extremely dangerous and unfortunately, it does, and has happened. As you can see there are many advantages as well as disadvantages. I believe, if people can find a balance between them, people will agree more about computers. In my opinion computers are handy, but dangerous. If kids are more careful online, and spend more time outside than on the computer, there would be less controversy. Parents would be less concerned about their child's safety and health if kids only used computers for homework, and were safe about who they talk to online, and also what kids say in their profiles. If all of this happened, there would be a balance, and I think people would be less drastic over a period of time, and people would be more comfortable with the role of computers in our lives.

Dear @ORGANIZATION1, Computers have a positive impact on people. Although people aren't outside being active, computers still benefit in a good way. Dear editor, computers are good for people because they really help with their work and homework and other stuff. For instance, at work, computers allow employees to create documents, manage complex data, and communicate with colleagues across the globe efficiently, boosting productivity. For students, computers provide access to a vast amount of information for research and offer tools like word processors to complete homework assignments that are neat and professional. Beyond these primary functions, computers assist with other daily tasks such as managing finances through spreadsheets, staying connected with family through video calls, and even pursuing hobbies like digital art or music production. The convenience and power they bring to organizing our tasks and accessing information make them an indispensable tool in modern life, ultimately saving time and enhancing our capabilities in nearly everything we do.

Dear Local Newspaper, Are you spending all your precious time on a computer? On the computer you are probably wasting every second searching the web or playing games. You shouldn't spend a lot of time on the computer as it will just wash away your brain. You shouldn't go on computers for a long time because instead you should be exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with people. By jogging instead of going on the computer you can lose weight and see the real world rather than the world behind the computer screen. Nevertheless, computers are fun to go on, like playing addicting games, but isn't it better to play a real sport like soccer? In soccer you have to use your mind and a lot of your body, so it is much better than sitting or laying around dazed at a computer screen for a long period of time. Don't you love playing outdoor games! Like playing tag or hide and go seek, isn't that more fun than playing an addicting game on the computer screen? For me, I think it is. That is my reason why I think you should exercise then stare at the computer screen. Secondly, you shouldn't be on the computer for a long amount of time because you should instead be enjoying nature. Nature is beautiful and refreshing, unlike a computer. Yeah, I know computers offer a lot, but do they offer the fresh air outside, the warm breeze, the land, and the living animals on the earth? I don't think so and neither should you. Instead of going on your computer when it is raining, you should play with your pets, and if you don't have any, put on a raincoat or grab an umbrella and go outside. Especially in the summer you should be outside enjoying nature; go for a swim or bring your annoying little siblings to the park. There is more to offer outside than going on the computer. More importantly, you shouldn't go on the computer because you are better off interacting with living people in person. On the computer talking to people you are going nowhere; chatting with people on the computer makes it impossible to read someone's expression. So get off the computer and hang with your family and friends. Get into a fun conversation or debate. Make new friends when you're at the mall or discovering a new trail in a park. Do anything but interact on the computer when all you see is typed words writing back to you. Get yourself out in the world; don't just interact with people but with the world, not the computer screen. In conclusion, you shouldn't spend most of your precious time on the computer. It isn't necessary for you to spend all your time on the computer when you could be exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with people. I strongly believe people should be outside rather than on a computer. So what are you waiting for? Get off that computer and take a hike!

Dear Editor of the Local Newspaper, The average teenager spends nine hours on a computer daily! People spend too much time on their computers. They don't exercise as much nowadays. Also, they don't enjoy all the wonderful nature the world has to offer. Most importantly, people who spend too much time on the computer don't see their family and friends. These are the reasons why people shouldn't spend so much of their time on a computer. Since people spend too much time on the computer, they exercise less and less. A recent poll shows that one in every three children is overweight. If our modern society didn't have so many distractions like computers, then maybe people would be bored and maybe go outside. Back in the 1970s only fifteen percent of the adult population was obese. So, why in recent years has this number skyrocketed to thirty-five percent? Back then electronics weren't popular, so for fun, kids played games with each other outside on a regular basis. Now it's rare for a kid to be motivated to put down the mouse and go play kickball with neighborhood friends. The kids would rather sit inside an air-conditioned house than go outside and have some good healthy fun and work up a sweat. Computers keep people from exercising, so their effect on people is negative. With computers being so popular, people are less involved with nature. Our society doesn't take the time to notice the cool breeze on an autumn morning, or the waves crashing on a hot summer afternoon. They don't take time to appreciate how beautiful the foliage is in the fall, or how it feels to be showered with snow on a chilly winter morning. People would rather sit at a computer for several hours doing virtual wonders of our world. People don't respect the natural beauties that nature has to offer. Computers take away from people enjoying nature's joy. Computers ruin people's relationships with family and friends. A sixteen-year-old boy would rather talk to his girlfriend on the computer than spend time with his family. Kids don't organize their priorities well enough as it is; adding a computer into the mix just makes it worse. People have accounts on social networking sites like Facebook, and sometimes they are very drama-filled and cause problems. Friendships are easily ruined, and usually the cause of this is some kind of misunderstanding. It is very sad but true that kids would rather watch goofy videos than visit a grandparent. Computers are negative to people since they ruin their relationships with friends and family. People should spend less time on the computer. Computers are a main factor in the vast increase in obesity rates. Kids need to regain healthiness before it's too late! Also, people of all ages should realize the natural beauty of nature, but computers get in the way of that. Most importantly, computers ruin many relationships with friends and family. They cause stress and unnecessary drama. As you can see, computers have a negative effect on people.

When you were a kid, did your parents let you play all day on the computer? Well, my parents don't let me, and I think that's not fair. I think it's not fair because being on the computer has a lot of benefits, like teaching you hand-eye coordination. Another advantage is that when you're on the computer you can chat with people through webcams. Also, with a computer you can do homework assignments for something that requires you to do research. And of course when you're on a computer, you can watch your favorite movie or TV show, like popular sitcoms or exciting dramas. Now aren't these some great advantages? As an adult, I'm pretty sure that you like to do a lot of things from the comfort of your own home; well, when you have a computer you can. One way you can keep in touch is by online chatting, like through a webcam or my favorite, instant messaging. Surprisingly, another thing you can do is work online by setting it up at work or telling your boss how to do it. By the way, if you're an adult who didn't go to college when you were younger because you had to work, well, if you have a computer or laptop you can go to school online, and the best thing is that you'll be in your bed nice and warm without any worries. Now don't you think that is a nice way to spend your free time? When you're a kid my age and you have a computer, all you want to do is play games online with friends. Well, that is what most of us kids do nowadays, but our parents don't let us play too much. The only time they let us stay on long is when we are maybe doing a project for school. But when you're a kid, besides playing games all day, we also want to learn about things like historical places or famous landmarks; that's what you can do. Most people would agree that when you have a computer you can just book a hotel online instead of going all the way to the hotel. Of course, that's what my parents do; every time for a vacation they look everything up online, like the hotel and the flights. Yes, having a computer is helpful. Another thing you can do is watch movies online when you are on a plane going to the vacation, because that's what I do with my laptop. But the thing I like the most is watching shows because every time I watch different episodes of my favorite series the time goes by so quick that a three-hour flight only seems like one hour. Finally, I have explained to you why having a computer is a good thing. One reason is because you can do a lot of things on the computer itself. A second reason is that you can do a lot of school work with it, like doing a research paper or going to school online. And my final reason was that you can book things online without going anywhere, wasting gas. So now it's your turn to decide whether having a computer is a good thing or a bad thing.

Dear local newspaper editor, I think that kids should be allowed to go on their computers so they can talk to their relatives across the country whenever they want to. I have family members in another state. I talk to them every day because I have a laptop, and they say that I have relatives in a different city. I believe them because I have their email. They told me about my mother living in a nearby town. So I asked her, she said yes that is true, and I looked up where my mom lived. Thanks to the computer, I also learned that this city has one of the tallest mountains in the country. So I asked my mom if I can go to this city, and she said yes. So I went with my sister, and we even visited our family members and the mountain point; I can tell you it looked exactly how I pictured: very tall, covered with trees. Birds chirping, squirrels climbing trees; the thing that surprised me the most was there was a house on top of the mountain for sale. I wished that my mom was there because she will love it. So every time we go down there we rent that house, thanks to the computers. Lastly, you can even look up people on the internet. I heard that a famous comedian almost died. So when I got home I went on my laptop and looked it up, and it said nothing about that, but it did say one thing that surprised me the most: it said that he was getting a divorce from his wife. I think the person who said that he almost died must have misread it. So now I look up all my favorite people. Thanks to computers, the time is now to accept that people should have computers to use to learn about the world or just to see what everyone says. So I hope you make a good choice. But before you choose, think about it.

Dear readers of the local newspaper, the big rectangular shaped black or white box with lights and beeps, the computer was a smart idea! But why do you ask? I'll show you. This device can teach you a new language; Skype can let you talk to friends on the web or on the phone (but you still have to pay a small fee). You can surf the web or have a laugh on YouTube. Who needs to go out and buy stuff when on eBay or Amazon you can just order and you're done (but you still have to wait for delivery). Why go to a video store to rent movies when you can go on Netflix and order a movie and keep it for as long as you like? No late fees, no driving all the way to the movie store, no more of that please! Next, let's go back to the web. If you own a webcam or a built-in camera on your laptop or netbook, you can video chat with friends and family across the globe! If you're the kind of person that likes video games, then boy, you will love this! Personal computers can download games such as The Sims, Spore, etc., so then you will love the PC. MACs also share good stuff such as the Finder, Safari, Dashboard, etc., so that's all I have to say about Macintosh. And now you are probably asking which computer should I get? My dear friends at the newspaper, you have the ability to choose either a Mac or a PC, but it's not my decision to pick out your computer; it's yours, so go out and create an investment for a computer today! But I'm not finished yet; you can also pick a laptop, a desktop, or a netbook. I can tell you about all of them, and I will. A laptop is good if you're on the go a lot and if you're in the office or you have a lot of business trips; it's a good idea to have a laptop at hand. A desktop is good if you're home a lot and work is online on the web or you just like the comfort of home; then a desktop is right for you! And last but not least, the netbook; it's good if you're on the go a lot, especially when you're on vacation, and it fits nicely on your lap or on a table, or if you don't want to get up to use the computer just grab your netbook and you're ready to go. I almost forgot; all netbooks come with a built-in webcam, so if you're on vacation and you don't have a phone or computer, just go on your netbook and there you go. Well, that's all I have to say; thanks for reading.

Dear Local Newspaper, Have you ever thought about how computers effect human beings? The impacts? The results? The education? I believe that computers have a positive effect on people. Computers allow people to talk with others online, have the ability to educate in certain areas, and teach hand-eye coordination. Who says the only way to contact or communicate with someone is through letters or the phone? The technology brought upon using computers allows people to talk online with others in a fast, easy, enjoyable way. Have a question that you have to ask a friend, but someone else is using the phone? Write a letter! Oh wait, letters can take up days and your question is urgent! The computer is an easy alternative for communication. Say you're an amazing singer with a beautiful voice and you want to find an agent more than anything. Computers are so advanced in technology that they can find you an agent in no time. E-mail, websites, social media, and more, are all ways you can contact that agent. Computers are a great way to communicate. The mind is an extraordinary thing. It can be filled with knowledge, and still have the ability to learn and understand more. Reading books is a fantastic way to learn, but the internet has so much more to offer and you are not only reading from one great author, but tons of great authors. The computer allows you to learn about far away places and important people without making that trip to the library. Have you ever heard of online colleges? They are advertised on television all the time. Some people sometimes think that learning from home, laying in bed with a laptop placed in front of them is a distractive way to learn. But what about being comfortable and not intimidated by anyone else around you? Computers can help you get your college degree in a comfortable environment. Hand-eye coordination is an excellent and wonderful thing to have. Along with videogames, computer games teach you exactly that. Parents sometimes think we kids are wasting our time playing games on the computer, but we are actually challenging our minds and our hand-eye coordination ability. Computers are key when it comes to psychological learning. Hand-eye coordination is taught to us through games and such that we play without us even knowing it. Hand-eye coordination allows us to catch a ball or play sports, and computers help us achieve that skill.

Recent studies have been conducted over the past few years, and they show that people of all ages spend a large percentage of their free time on the computers. This is becoming a problem all over our state and country. Computers are consuming the lives of everyone. An anonymous source claims that they use their computer to contact old friends. A study shows that phone usage has gone down because adults and teens would prefer to email or instant message a friend. This results in sitting in front of a computer screen waiting for a response. A student at the local school says, "I go on the computer once or twice a week. I don't use it all that much because I'd rather be out having fun with all my friends rather than be holed up in a room by myself." Some people believe it is a way to be more social, but it really isn't. It's just sitting in front of a screen talking to people you may not even know too well. When you sit down in your computer chair and start e-mailing away, you aren't doing any physical exercise. The only movement people will normally do is get up and go to the bathroom. Then they are right back in a chair, making minimal movements. A significant percentage of people who sit in front of a computer end up obese because they don't burn any calories. Since they don't release many endorphins, they aren't very happy. If they got up and went outdoors to do physical exercise, they would be fit and happy. Often, teenagers feel more powerful when they are using a computer. They find it easier to disobey rules their parents set for them. Teens also find it easier to bully other children via the internet or social networks. A number of students at the local middle school confess to being the target of malicious bullying online. Others confess to be bullied, and they definitely don't want to be bullied on facebook or myspace where everything is out on your profile for your peers to see. Teens should have limited time on the computer, so they don't do anything they will regret in their future. Therefore, adults and teens should be aware that using a computer is fine, but they shouldn't over use the luxury of a way to find information quickly or contact a friend in a foreign country. This generation needs to be reminded that their whole life shouldn't be spent on the computer. Probably less than a certain number of minutes a day should be spent checking your e-mail or instant messaging a friend. Then you should go outdoors and spend time with your friends and family for a healthier lifestyle.

With the recent development of technology in todays society I know that there is a lot of controversy with computers. Many people believe that computers are positive towards our society. But with all of this technology we still need to find a balance. It is like todays kids spend many hours per week on computers. People are not experiencing the world outside of their computers. You may even notice that if you use the computer too much you will miss more interactions with your family. So although computers can be very useful you need to be able to turn off the computer and realize the true important things in your life, besides the computers. computers can be both good and bad. But I think that we need to find a balance between the two. So, to the newspaper, computers help our society thrive. But at the same time we need to learn when we have had enough time on the computer. So I believe that we can all find a healthy balance of computer use in our lives.

Dear School Newspaper, Computers have both negative and positive effects on people. Many people before us went through everyday life without them. The innovation of computers was a great leap into discovery. Unfortunately, the negative aspects of this magnificent invention detract from the novelty. With the computer came a plague of not exercising and a disinterest in, perhaps even an inability to enjoy nature. On top of this destruction of the mind, this monster is the cruel cause of many declining relationships, for who has time for friends and family while in the middle of an intense internet game? As unique and intriguing as the computer might be, it is slowly destroying the mind and body. Increasing interest in a monitor tends to result in decreasing care for exercise as well as a decline in the amount of exercise gotten each day. While playing on the computer, the mind @MONTH1 be racing but the body sits unmoving, @CAPS1 physical activity is being done. Indeed, for some the addiction is awful enough that the person only moves to get food, use a restroom, go to bed, or when a parent demands it. All of the day's food settles into the stomach and little to none of it is burned off. Meanwhile, in some of the more severe cases the person is so entranced that bedtimes are pushed later and later. Sleep is essential to the body and mind and going without can be damaging. Nowadays the computer detracts from the sleep and exercise that the body requires. Even nature suffered from the advent of computers. Fewer people went out to admire its beauty. Nature is a wonderful teacher about the circle of life and the natural way of the world. Oftentimes parallels can be drawn between the wild and the tamed. Attached as people are to computers, they cannot experience the world to the fullest. Some argue that flora and fauna can be found online, but seeing a picture is different, almost cheating, compared to being beside the plant, able to study it from all angles rather than in an unmoving form. The experience is not the same; you cannot feel the breeze or smell the fresh air. Also, computers are indoors, so the true world is shielded from view. Even nowadays with laptops, if one was to be brought outside, the user would be focusing on the screen, not what is around them. Computers have severely cut down on the admiration of nature. Even family and friends suffer when computers are around. Many people barely pay attention to conversation while focusing on the screen. They tend to only pretend to listen half the time. Even when chatting with friends online, the conversation is disjointed because attention is probably focused on another part of the internet. Frequently, during conversations without a computer nearby, the mind is focused on something from earlier that day. Relationships are suffering, and computers are at fault. Computers are sucking in society, more of it each day. Much of what is done on computers, like the study of faraway places, can easily be found in books. Computers have resulted in a lack of exercise, less time with nature, strained relationships, and a generally unhealthy lifestyle. Through all of this, they have returned little to society. Why does the world continue to put up with computers and their negative effect on humanity?

Dear editor, I believe that computers are an important part of modern life and prove themselves to be invaluable because we use them everyday. Many times we don't even think about using computers, it just becomes a part of our daily routine. We use computers everyday in many ways, sometimes to stay in touch with a far away friend, learn about and experience faraway places, or to practice hand eye coordination. Computers are so beneficial to our life we might not be able to live without them. Most people have experienced a friend or relative move; when this happens not all hope is lost because with the use of a computer you can stay in touch. Many computers nowadays have built in webcams which allows you to get more than just an email. With these systems you can actually get an image of your friend or relative. Even Oprah Winfrey uses the webcam feature on computers to have people "skype" on to her show. In addition to this there are many other ways to stay in touch even if your computer is older. These relatively new "social networking sites" include facebook, twitter, and many more. Every morning when I wake up and watch sportscenter I always hear about what famous athletes are posting on their twitter pages. This is just another great use of computers. In this economy not many people are spending thousands of dollars to go to a beach paradise in the tropics, but with the use of computers, you can go there virtually. Computers are great in this aspect because they allow you to learn and experience many expensive things for free. For example if you wanted to learn something about India, you wouldn't have to go to the local library and check out a book, you could just type it in. There are many websites such as this that give you access to information that you could ever need. This proves also to be valuable if you are studying for a paper. The computer is just a great way to get information without ever having to leave your home. Hand-eye coordination is an important skill that many people lack. It allows you to throw a baseball, play videogames, or even drive a car. Many computer skeptics believe that you don't benefit from using computers but a recent study done by @LOCATION1 news and report reveals that people who use computers had @PERCENT1 better hand-eye-coordination than non-computer users. When driving you often need to operate the car, turn up the radio volume, and pass out goldfish to your kids at the same time, so this could be a scenario where improved hand-eye coordination would be handy. Hand eye coordination is an important skill and this skill is further developed by the use of computers. In conclusion, computers are beneficial both in hand-eye coordination and in communication, as well as in getting information on a topic. Computers are one the most significant inventions ever and are valuable in many many ways.

Dear Editor, should people use computers more? No, they should not use computers more. Computers have many benefits to society but they also have many negative effects on people who use them. People are spending more time on computers and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. First, people spend less time exercising. Most athletes have to stay fit and healthy to play in their sport. I am a wrestler and a baseball player but if I don't spend some time a day working out or staying active, I will be out of shape and weaker once my match or next game comes along. I'm sure Olympic athletes work out and stay active daily so they can be stronger and faster than anybody else out there, so I don't know why people sit at home on the computer all day. Second, people don't take the time to enjoy nature. Nature is one of the most beautiful things on this planet. Whether you are hiking a mountain or a lake, nature is all around you. I personally love to hunt and fish. I take the time every summer, especially in July, fall, and sometimes winter to go out, enjoy nature, and have fun, and so do many other people in the world. Everyone who sits at home on the computer can't enjoy this gift that we have been given. Third, people won't take the time to interact with family or friends. If you are on the computer all day then you can't go out and be active with your friends, or go for a bike ride with your brother. If you are on the computer you are on personal time that could be being used as a fishing trip or a walk in the woods. If you don't spend time with your family because of something you're doing on the computer, then you are missing out. You won't value the most valuable things that you have in life; your family is important and you should always be able to make time for them. Finally, should people use computers more? No, they should not use computers more. Computers take time away from exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. There are good things about computers, but the less time you spend on them, the better it is for everyone.
