Dear Editor, The age of the computer is upon us. Everywhere you go, you will see people with laptops or other portable computer devices. While some people dislike the world's large usage of the computer, I happen to disagree; I feel that the computer is a great way to put out and find information. I also feel that it is good for people to communicate with their family and friends who live far away. Lastly, I think that computers provide us with fun activities, entertainment, and a way to relax. What do you do when you want to know what the capital of Canada is? You either go break out the old atlas, or, with a simple click of a button on the computer, discover that the capital is Ottawa. My point is that with computers, finding information is fast and easy. Also, with computers you can share information as well as receive it. Lets say that you are not a doctor but have discovered a cure for the common cold by using items found in everyone's households. What do you do? Well, you could go to the media and do interview after conference after interview, or, you could simply post it on the internet. It is plain to see that the computer is an important tool in the process of exchanging information. "I'm sorry son, but we can't fly out to California to see your grandmother. We don't have enough money." I think that everyone has heard a variation of that line at least once. But here comes the computer to the rescue! With computers, your grandmother over in another state is just a click (and a screen) away. By using webcams, you can speak with someone across the world without having to worry about the expensive costs of flights! No webcam? No problem! You can send someone very far away a message through e-mail or instant messaging. Say "bye" to expensive plane rides, long phone bills, or years going by without seeing a loved one. Computers are not just tools that are used strictly for work; computers can be used for fun purposes as well. In other words, computers can be used for fun! How exactly does this make computers have a positive effect on society? I'll tell you how. Many professionals are workaholics, also known as people who work too much. After a long day of signing papers and fiddling with a budget, wouldn't it be nice to just sit down and play some solitaire? That's possible with a computer, and you don't even need a deck of cards! Computers are full of fun games, like solitaire and chess. These games are a great way to help people relax, and trust me, everyone needs relaxation. Having some downtime can really help someone to be a healthier and happier person! Aren't computers great? They can let us exchange information, talk to family and friends across the globe without a big price tag, and they provide us with entertainment. So everyone out there who does not like the effect computers have on the public, please reconsider. Computers really are a helpful, fun, and useful tool to society, enhancing our lives in countless ways.

Dear town of Southington, Computers in our town are very important, for instance, for all of the banks we have computers and for almost every job. As for teens, I think you parents out there need to set some rules like two hours of play a day, three hours on a weekend, and if they don't listen, take the game away for a day or two, but that might not get them to spend time with you because they might be mad, but it will get them outside or at least doing something more active and not watching T.V. or playing video games all day. Dear Newspaper Editor, I, a member of the public, am writing a letter to you to inform you what I think about the subject of if people spend too much time on the computer. My first idea is that sometimes people do spend too much time on the computer than usual. It's a problem because some people begin to become overweight and start to lose control over their eating habits. My second idea is that computers do a lot of things for us, but there are still a lot of things a computer can't teach us how to do. So computers are helpful but they're not always a substitute for finding something to do outside, which is sometimes different from using a computer. My last and final idea is that people become too attached to their computers and lose sight of what really matters, such as exercising and fitness. Then people are angry when their computer crashes and forget how to do things because they're always on the computer. And those are my ideas on the subject about if people spend too much time on the computer but not as much time with friends and family.

Dear Community, I want you to imagine it's a beautiful summer day. The birds are chirping, the smell of beautiful flowers are filling the air, but instead of playing outside with your neighbors, you are inside trying to master the unbeatable game Cubefield on the computer. Computers have had a negative impact on today's society. When people are engrossed with whatever they might be doing on the computer they become very lazy; they lose the motivation to go out and exercise; people also lose interest in helping around the community. This is why computers have a negative impact on today's society. Statistics show that a majority of people would rather stay inside on the computer than out and about helping and working around their neighborhood. Computers have had such a negative impact it makes people want to stay glued to their chairs with their eyes glued to their monitors. Yes, computers have had a lot to do with a lot of technical advances, but at what cost do these technological advances come? Many kids are becoming obese and lack the motivation to come out of their room off of the computer. Computers are making society very lazy; this is why they have a negative impact on us. Computers have also made society lack motivation to go and exercise. A very close family friend was very obese. She was lazy and never wanted to exercise. Instead of going out and doing something about it, she stayed in her room on Facebook for weeks at a time. Though the computer wasn't the one who made her obese, it was used as a tool to hide behind the real problems. It is sad when many teenagers say they would rather stay inside on Myspace than going outside for a jog. Yes, it's true computers help you learn things you might not have known before, but so do books, newspapers and magazines. Computers have had a negative impact on society. Helping out in your community provides many opportunities to meet new people, and it feels like a sense of accomplishment. But the urge to stay in on the computer clouds your better judgement. I know that I would rather help the elementary school across the street build a new garden rather than stay inside on Twitter. If you are inside searching the web, how will you know if the old lady across the street needs help with her groceries? Helping around your community lets people know you care about what's going on. So don't let the computer have another second of your time. Computers have had a negative impact on society. Teenagers as well as adults have become very lazy. They lack motivation to exercise as well as help around the community. Now it's your turn; don't just stare at your computer screen absent mindedly. Go out and toss the ball along with the neighbor's dog. You've heard the facts; now make the right decision.

Dear newspaper and readers of our community, I am a student from the local school; I have recently been informed about the argument over computer use and I feel it is silly. We need computers in life to help us do jobs, communicate with family or friends traveling the world, and for research on homework. First of all, without computers many people would struggle. My father uses a computer for his job and he couldn't do his job without one. Sure, many people spend way too much time on their computer, but other people use it to save information or find research. I know people argue that computers should be used less, but could you get through a week without using one computer? Most people couldn't, especially if you own a business. In addition to using computers for jobs, some people like to chat online with a friend that moved away. Imagine if your family member or friend traveled constantly and they went to places where they couldn't get connection on their cell phone; the only way to talk to them is chatting through the web. I'm sure everyone has used a computer once to talk to a friend or for something related to business, so they are more useful than people realize. Lastly, as a kid we need to be able to use a computer, not just to talk to friends but for homework. Some homework requires us to make powerpoints, write a paper on historical facts, and we need computers to do so. Without computers, kids wouldn't be able to gather facts or information to write a paper. Decreasing computer use for kids can potentially bring down their grades. My teacher always says, "grades are the most important thing." I'm sure all parents would agree with that. All in all, we can't decrease the use of computers because it can do damage to people's lives. Think about people who travel a lot, kids with work that needs to be done, and parents with jobs that they need computers for; don't upset all of these people by decreasing computer time. Thank you for your time.

Knowledge is one of the greatest quests for mankind, always trying to figure out how and why things happen. Thanks to this natural curiosity we have made amazing leaps in technology. A few decades ago what seemed to be impossible is now possible. And one of those many thought to be impossible was to find anything you want in only a matter of seconds. I think computers are a great benefit to society because you can learn things around the world in the blink of an eye, they allow you to talk to people around the world and they give you better hand eye coordination. The first reason I think that computers are great for modern society is that we can learn instantly about foreign countries. Years ago the only way you could learn about places far away was if you read it in a newspaper, many of which didn't tell you about faraway lands. Now with the internet we can learn what is happening anywhere we want to know. "Thanks to our modern technology people are now more informed about the rest of the world than ever before," stated Dr. Evans, a communications expert from the University of Michigan. "Modern computers and the ability to collect information quickly compared to years ago." Without computers we wouldn't have known anything about the recent earthquake in Japan. Furthermore, with computers we can now talk instantly with people over the internet. A century ago talking to people instantly seemed just about impossible. But thanks to technology that kind of thing is an average part of our lives. "Many of our advancements and decisions are made while we talk online, even some of the world's greatest leaders make the hard decisions because of this advancement," stated a reporter for the New York Times. "Without this technology many of the decisions made in Washington and Brussels wouldn't be made and many soldiers would have died as a result." The final reason that I support computers is that they help teach you hand eye coordination. One of the ways that computers teach hand eye coordination is through video games and simulations. In video games people make it so you have to react to movements and notes in order to complete your objective. In the military, computer simulations teach the soldiers how to react to many different situations. Through these situations, many soldiers have learned how to survive in combat and save many of their fellow comrades. "The simulations we have invested in have improved combat effectiveness by over twenty percent," stated General Miller of the US Army. "Without these simulations many more American lives would have been lost in recent wars." So now that you have heard all of the reasons of why I support computers, I hope you are much more informed about this topic. Without computers we wouldn't be able to learn about foreign lands, talk to people instantly, or have as good hand eye coordination. I hope everyone else will see these reasons for supporting computers.

Dear Editor, as you all know many people in our town have been quarreling about computers. Some people are pro computer usage and others not so much. In my opinion computers are a great modern technology. One way computers benefit our society is the ability to access ample information, pictures, and news. Also you can chat with new or old friends. Another good thing about computers is you can also have fun on the web, watch movies, even go shopping. Have you ever done a report on a far away country? Maybe you've never heard of a small nation or a remote city. So what do you do? Search the web! Instead of taking a walk to the library just search one of the many search engines such as Google, Yahoo, Bing or Ask! A large percentage of people nowadays have at least one maybe two computers in their household. A significant number of people can access the web on their cell phone! Can you believe this? Pictures are also accessible on the web. You could find just about anything in the picture search engine. Have you ever wondered about current events in our country or others? On certain sites you can find live newsfeeds or an article about something important such as the earthquake in Japan that recently happened. The internet is benefiting our society today. AIM is just one of many private chat rooms that is available to people. On these open chat rooms you can talk to people that are thousands of miles away. "I was on Facebook looking for my friend from school and I found her page; before this year we didn't talk very much but now we can talk through Facebook we hangout and talk all the time!" comments an avid Facebook user. Dating sites are now available, too. There you can meet new people and develop a relationship with them. Entertainment is everywhere on the internet. You can play a variety of games, watch missed episodes of your favorite TV show, stream live movies, watch videos on YouTube, and much more! Many people think there are only pointless games on the computer but there are educational fun games as well such as math puzzles, language tutors, and history quizzes to learn from. Did you know that more than half of shopping for clothes, car parts and other things are bought on auctions such as eBay and Amazon? I recall a time when my dad and I was going to see a movie but we weren't sure what was playing or what times they started at. So we simply looked on the cinema's website. So now you know where I stand on the issue of computers. Computers are a great reference point, can allow you to chat with friends, and provide endless entertainment, making them a valuable part of modern life.

One of my friends said this about the computers we use in the library: "Whenever you don't get something about what we learned in history class that day, you can use the computers to better understand it." Computers are a great way to research a topic, and that's why they should not be gotten rid of. I use computers every day for school, researching or writing a project for any of my classes. Everyday I spend at least an hour writing something up for school. Computers help lessen the time spent writing because it is fast and easy; it is easy to type something, like an essay paper on ways to persuade the reader. In my opinion I think that computers have a good effect on people. I think this because millions of people use computers every day! The effects on them are that people learn things easier. There are millions of job sites that would have to do with something about learning. About half of college students go online and do challenges for their courses. If you were a college student and did college online you would: see your family more, it wouldn't be a hassle to get to college, and it would be easier to concentrate being by yourself and learning. Also they even make software which is very popular for learning a different language and where you learn this from is on a computer. My second reason is the ability to talk to people online. About a third of our daily communication happens through online platforms. You can use online phone services and you can also use applications that have you talk to people for free. I know I have a Facebook account and I think it is a good way to keep in touch with people. So in conclusion I think that there are good effects on people that use computers. Also when everyone that uses their computer they can still enjoy nature and talk to their family in person. So if you don't have a computer you should get one and you will be able to do other fun stuff you like while also enhancing your learning and communication.

School Board, since computers were invented they have grown so much, which makes a lot of people use them more. More and more people use computers, but not everyone agrees that this benefits society. Those who support advances in technology believe that computers have a positive effect on people, but there are negative effects too. I believe that computers are a negative effect on people because people spend too much time on the computer; they are not exercising, there are many dangers, and there is less interaction with family and friends. First of all, a negative effect computers have on people is that they spend too much time on the computer and that leads to less exercise. Recently, I spoke to a local parent about this issue and she spoke out, "We have one family computer and my son is the one who is always on it right after school to late at night." This shows that many children are on a computer too much. I have to admit that I personally sit on my computer at times and not even realize two hours have passed. I try to cut back on my computer time, but it doesn't really work out. Sitting on the computer for hours every day also means a lack of exercise. The hours used up on the computer could be the time in which you are exercising. Someone's health is very important. Spending too much time on the computer and not getting exercise is a major negative effect computers have on people. Secondly, the most concerning issue parents have with computers are the many dangers, which is another negative effect it has on people. Recently the biggest site is Facebook. So many people are addicted to it. Though, it isn't that safe all the time. Another new thing is ooVoo or Skype, which allows you to talk to someone with a webcam. There could be a time when a teen "meets" someone on-line and agrees to do things on the webcam for someone they don't really know. These sites aren't safe, and knowing young people they can be in danger. I spoke to some researchers about this and they would agree that these sites are potentially dangerous to young teens. All these dangerous risks are another negative effect computers have on people. Lastly, another negative effect computers have on people is there is less interaction with family and friends. Instead of getting together with a friend people just go on the computer to talk. That isn't the same as an actual get together. I actually enjoy family parties. Seeing all my aunts, uncles, and cousins is so much better and fun. I do e-mail my family and friends when I don't see them, but I get excited when we have get togethers. Nowadays it's not like that for a lot of people. Many people work long hours and spend too much time on the computer, which takes time away from interacting with others, and that should be more important. The computer also negatively affects people by reducing interaction with family and friends. In conclusion, I see computers as a negative effect on people. Computers make people spend a lot of time on them, have dangerous risks, and take away valuable interaction time. I strongly suggest you look over my points and consider the negative impacts they bring to our community.

Dear Local Newspaper Editor, Are computers really as great as they seem? It seems to me that they are used way too much in people's lives, and that computers are distractions that don't allow people to di ceratin things in their life that they would if they weren't always on the computer. People's lives are starting to revolve around going on the computer, checking your facebook, and looking at new videos on YouTube.com. I know from experience facebook or myspace can be very addicting. I'll spend hours commenting on pictures or new wall posts, and then at ten pm I've realized I haven't begun any of my loads of homework. This happens quite often, and I end up staying awake until around two. The following moring I wake up at six am, exhausted. I am not exaggerating either, this happens to many of my friends, and if you have kids, ask them because I am ninety percent sure they are on facebook or MySpace all night. This doesn't just happen with kids either, my mom just got a facebook and she is hooked to it, even more than I am. Sometimes it can be come a competition to see who has the most pictures, or the most friends. Kids start adding people as friends that they don't even know computers aren't just distractions, they are also very dangerous. At my school we had assembly where they showed us how easy it was to find out someone's personal information, Even if you don't have your address or your phone number listed, there are many other ways to track you down. If you take a picture right after you won the championship soccer game, in your jersey. Just that one picture shows your team name, your last name, and your number. Anyone could easily search all that stuff on the internet and know exactly where your next game be. As the local newspaper Editor, I am sure you must be concerned about the safety of the town, or even your own kids. Some people often say "that would never happen to me" but it easily could, especially if you're constantly on your computer. I have noticed that a lot of teens around my age are starting to become obsessed with being on the computer. A lot of times in families, instead of spending time together. syblings are fighting over who gets to go on the computer. One sybling might need it for homework, while the other just wants to talk to her friends on MySpace and each believes they deserves the computer. Computers are starting to interest a lot with people's lives, in a negative way. Once again they are distracting, dangerous and hurt families. Computers hurt society more than it helps. And maybe you should look into how much time your kids are spending on the computer.

What computers stop you from doing is your homework in school, as they can be a major distraction from your studies. But when you do something on the computer you're not supposed to do, like visiting non-educational sites, you get stuck on a website you can't get off your screen, falling into a trap of endless clicking. So what I'm trying to say is to don't stay on the computer for longer than just thirty minutes for leisure, as it can quickly consume your valuable time. By limiting your computer use, you can maintain a healthier balance between your digital and real-world activities, which is crucial for your overall well-being and academic success.

Computers are a common household item these days, found in nearly every home. Due to how much computers are able to do, from communication to information retrieval, most people spend a lot more time on the computer than they should, and it is affecting our society by reducing face-to-face interactions. Computers can be very helpful, when trying to find information on a topic quickly and efficiently, but some people take it too far and rely on them for everything. Some people, their jobs are on computers, requiring them to be seated at a desk for the entire workday. Others like teenagers will do gaming or have instant messengers, which sometimes takes away from outside activities and physical exercise. Another situation with computers is that adults can get really into online gambling which is terrible for a person to do even at a casino, but now they can do it from their living room couch, making it more accessible and dangerous. Computers can also keep you in from outside, preventing you from getting fresh air and sunlight which are vital for health. Computers are bad in some ways but good in others, depending entirely on how they are used. Sometimes computers are a perfect resource for students and professionals alike. When your history teacher assigns you a five page essay on the civil war and you have no idea what happened in the civil war, a computer can provide the necessary research. In this case computers are good, as they offer a vast library of information. Or your boss could tell you to find the amount of teen deaths in car accidents due to cellphones, a task perfectly suited for online databases. Computers seem like a perfect resource for such specific queries. So far you've learned computers have their highs and lows but if computer time was limited then people would be able to do more stuff outside, or read a book, fostering a more active and well-rounded lifestyle. Some people might abuse computers others might not but if computer time was just limited I believe, that a lot of things would be different in our society today, with people being more present and engaged with the world around them.

Dear editor, I see that there is an argument between computers being good or bad. I think that my opinion can help your decision. I think that computers are good for a number of important reasons. I think they are good because they help kids with social skills, they help people with bad handwriting and they help people learn about things around the world, connecting them to global events. First of all computers help kids all around the world with social skills, especially those who are shy or have difficulty communicating in person. They help them because there is so many ways to communicate with people through the computer, such as email and social media platforms. There is instant messaging and webcaming websites which allow for real-time conversation. Also a survey said that seventy percent of parents say that the computer raised their kids social skills a lot, giving them more confidence. Another thing the computer helps with is people with bad handwriting, which can be a significant barrier. It helps because you can go on Microsoft Word and instead of writing a great report that no one can read you can type it out clearly. I know that when I have a paper for school that neatness counts on I always type up my report to ensure a good grade. This can help a lot of people who can't write as well as others because on the computer you can change the font and everything to make it look as nice as you want, creating a professional appearance. The last reason I think the computer is a good idea is because a lot of people don't like to read newspapers and watch the news so they like to research certain subjects they like, to know what's going on around the world from sources they trust. I know my mom doesn't have time to watch the news or the newspaper but when she checks her email the first thing that pops up is the biggest news of the day, keeping her informed efficiently. People all around the world go to the computer to find out the latest news, from political events to weather updates. I hope you consider my opinion when you make your decision, where you will think of all the kinds of people it helps, from children to professionals. People with social problems, people with bad handwriting, and just busy people who can't sit down and watch the hour news benefit greatly from computer technology. Thank you for your time and for reading my letter.

Dear Local newspaper, my opinion is yes people are on the computer too much. I have three good reasons why I think people are on the computer a lot and why it is a problem. Fresh air will help that, maybe by going to the gym or going for a jog outside for a while to get the blood flowing. Being inside isn't really good for you, as it can lead to a sedentary lifestyle. Just being inside just makes you kinda gain weight from lack of exercise. And then you wouldn't have any time with your friends, and more only if you're inside like always, missing out on social connections. Finally, you spend all your time at home being on the computer, which is a waste of your one precious life. And you don't have any time, energy and such more for other pursuits. You just need to make time for friends and family, who provide genuine support and happiness. Now you know my opinion why computers are not a benefit to society when overused. Dear Readers, Can you imagine not talking to distant friends, only knowing about your town, or even failing tests because you didn’t have a computer? I know I couldn’t. Some of the great benefits of having a computer are talking online with friends, learning about new places and things everywhere, and being able to study for school and tests from the internet. First, being able to talk to distant friends and relatives is now possible with the computer. Facts show that a large percentage of families in the country have distant friends with internet access, now all of these people can talk to each other! I'll never forget the time that my close friends moved, but I was still able to talk to him because of the computer. Second, the computer allows you to learn about new places and things all around the world. I never would have known about some of the places I've been to if it wasn't for the computer. A leading organization stated that the computer expert Dr. Smith says "Computers are the reason we have so much information; without computers we wouldn't know about these places." Furthermore, it is now possible to study without leaving home because of the computer. Homework can be done on the internet online. I'll never forget the time that I forgot my book, but I could still study because of the online book. In conclusion the computer has many benefits to you, like interacting with friends online, learning about new places, and being able to study. Computers are just full of all-around benefits.

To whom it may concern, Computers can be a great asset to our society, but they are an even bigger hindrance. People are wasting their days away on the computer. Hardly anyone goes out to exercise, or to enjoy nature. Perhaps the worst effect is that hardly anyone interacts with their friends and family anymore. Surely you don't want to succumb to the computers. Put down the mouse and go outside! Obesity in our nation is at an all time high. Experts agree that computers and other types of technology are to blame. People who spend a lot of time on the computer hardly ever exercise and that affects them negatively. These people have a shorter lifespan! They might not be around in twenty years to see their grandchildren grown up. Also, they have many medical problems. Dr. Evans, an obesity expert, says, "I have seen a positive correlation with the obesity rate and that of computer usage." Computer addiction can kill you! Obesity can also cause heart attacks and infertility! Since you can avoid these diseases and health risks by getting off the computer, why wouldn't you? Using the computer is not a good price to pay for your health! Do you have fond childhood memories that involve nature? I know I do. Most people who spend too much time on the computer don't get the chance to make memories like that. They're too preoccupied with the computer to care. Many people won't ever see any of our national parks! Drew Johnson, a park ranger, says, "In the past few years, we have had less visitors than ever before." If people can't tear themselves away from the computer for even a minute to see the splendor of our national parks, there is obviously something wrong. Get off your computers and go outside! I share everything with my friends and family and try to spend as much time with them as possible. Almost all people who use the computer often say a significant percentage of the time, they use it as an excuse not to see friends and family. In reality, they don't want to leave it. As a society, we are becoming too dependent on technology. A community supervisor says, "I have seen a definite decline in family enrollment. We hardly ever see kids with friends and family hanging around". She is right. Now is the time to stop using computers! Computers may not be totally to blame for the problems stated above. Maybe it's the people, though computers do contribute to the problem. If we didn't have computers, there would be more people out exercising, and enjoying nature. Memories would be made when we hung around with friends and family. Now is the time to turn off the computer, and go outside. Call up a friend and take a stroll, and you will know you can have fun without computers.

Dear local newspaper, People spend too much time on the computer. People sit in front of their computers all day when they could spend that time exercising. My dad got extremely overweight when we got a new computer. All he did was sit and play games like Space Wars or Dragon Quest. I couldn't believe how fat he got so my mom told him and now instead of playing on the computer he goes to the gym. You wouldn't believe how much weight he lost. Also did you know that America is one of the fattest countries because people don't exercise and just play on their laptops and computers. So it would help America a lot to stop playing software and start exercising. So many people miss out on the beautiful works of nature. The cool relaxing air at the beach is much nicer than a dark stuffy room with just the glow of a computer. There's so much to discover, so much to be explored. So yes you could find the geysers in Yellowstone online but it's nothing like seeing it in real life. If there were computers back in the early 1800s people would never had the urge to find new land; you don't hear of many great explorers now do you? I bet if everyone took a break from computers new species would be found or maybe even a cure for cancer. Who knows what you can do if you step out of the box and into the beautiful part of nature. "Please come down and talk to your grandparents." "Not now mom I'm playing on the computer!" How many times has this happened to you? Has your son or daughter been on the computer when great Aunt Marie has been over? They might have wanted to play on the computer then but they don't know if that could have been their last day with him or her. Computers will be here forever or almost forever, people's time is limited. Therefore hanging out with a relative is much more important than playing on the computer. I know a kid named Billy who was playing on the computer when his friend called and invited him over. Billy said no. His friend was so disappointed and angry. I would be too. Would you like to have a friend pick a computer over you? I'd hope not. Therefore computers hurt and are not as good as real people. In conclusion quality time with people, nature, and exercise is more important than a glowing box. I hope you agree that computers do not always help society.

Dear local newspaper, a survey shows that a majority of students at the local high school say that they spend most of their free time on the computer. I think computers have a bad effect on people because they can cause safety issues, health issues, and of course education issues. With all this new technology, teenagers aren't aware of their surroundings at all when they are focused on the screen. On top of that, they're not aware of what's happening to them in the real world. Adults also use the computer, but not as frequently as us teenagers. It's time now to realize what computers are doing to us and the world today. Computers can cause serious safety issues. Now more than ever people use social media where they talk to friends. But, what they don't know is that the person on the other side might not be who they think it is. Lately, on the news we hear of teenagers getting raped or kidnapped because the people they were talking to on the internet were not who they said they were. Bad people are always lurking on the internet, and we need to prevent them from getting in contact with kids. But, even besides having bad people online, computers can interfere with your privacy. It's possible for computers to give out your personal information to other people, so we really need to watch out what we share. Computers though not only cause safety issues, but health issues also. Computers play a major part in destroying our health. About a large percentage of children are now overweight or obese. TVs used to be the issue for people not exercising, but now computers are doing just the same. There are so many things to do on the computer that just don't make you bored, so there is no reason to get away from it. But, you need to get up and exercise, and computers are preventing people from doing so. It's like they are hypnotizing us because we simply don't want to get up from the chair. Computers can also have an impact on your vision. I know that after a long time on the computer I have a massive headache because my eyes just hurt so bad. Also, computers can make people stop talking to each other verbally. Talking and interacting in person makes us have safe relationships with one another, but computers again are preventing this. Besides interfering with our health, computers do the same with education. Computers can really be bad for our education. Students now easily forget to do homework. There are so many distractions today that when people spend a long time on it, we forget to do other things that we're supposed to do simply because we're distracted. But, even though we forget our homework, we also sometimes forget to study before a test. This would result in a drop in high grades. Computers shouldn't be distracting people, but instead helping them with schoolwork. I think it's not entirely the people's fault for getting distracted on the computer because it just has so many interesting features. For example, the internet, and websites like social networks, video sites, and games, etc. We have so many distractions in our lives that we don't need more from technology! Computers really don't have a good effect on people overall. More and more people get computers everyday. They should know what it's doing to them, and what's happening to the world around them. Why not go outside and enjoy nature? Maybe, go to the mall with friends and socialize. There are a variety of things to do rather than staying glued to the computer the whole day. People need to stop being so dependent on technology and open their eyes to see the negative effect computers have on people's lives.

Dear Editor, I am writing you this letter to give you my opinion on computer use. In my opinion, I think that some people use and rely on computers too much. Whether it be for a research project, talking to friends, and even finding answers for homework, the dependence is clear. Everyday millions of people are on the computer for hours straight without a break. Moving your fingers doesn't count as exercise, and it wastes electricity and time. Many people I know would be lost if they didn't have a computer because their friends are online or they need it for homework assistance. These type of people need to be taught how to get things done without technology because one day it might fail them. Some students rely on their technology to work or they will fail their assignments. These children need to be taught that there are other ways to do things, like hanging out with friends in person, reading a book from the library, and even doing their homework with pen and paper. Since students rely on their computers so much, they are always on them. Every day people I know go home from school and jump on a popular online platform for the rest of the day. They never seem to do anything else, like going outside and doing sports. Many kids do not do any type of athletic sport anymore. Obesity is a huge problem in our area, and the numbers keep increasing drastically. Everyone thinks that it is being caused by bad eating habits, but that's only half of it. People overusing their computer is also a big part of the problem. Children around the neighborhood are stuck on their computers all day checking messages and setting up profile pictures. While these children are on the computer, they don't even think; they just chow down on unhealthy snacks. This computer usage problem is beginning to become a big deal with the obesity rates and how much people rely on it for basically everything in their lives. So we need to be the first people to stop this before it forms a bad habit that is hard to break. This could be a huge problem in the future if not addressed. So let's start to cut our usage time down now for a healthier lifestyle.

Imagine your life without the benefits of the computer. Do you think it would make life a little harder? Computers have positive effects on people for educational reasons and for a new way to develop communication skills. Technology is very important to our society. The computer is a great way to socialize with friends. It is a new and inventive way to communicate. I know that some critics say that there is less time spent humanly interacting, but on the computer it is still interacting. With a phone you can only chat with each other, but a computer has a webcam. This device allows you to talk to people with some human interaction. Around fifty to sixty million users have this device to use. It often is preinstalled into many Dell and Apple laptops, giving us portable access to talk. CEO at Dell said that "since the laptops have come with a built in web cam, one out of every two that have it installed use it to chat socially and for business." The computer can help with our communications for personal or business needs. The computer is a good way to start and develop with communication skills. More than half of children use a computer to start with the beginnings of their communication skills. Computer allow many people to become connected with each other in new and effective ways. In conclusion, the average computer can benefit our lives in positive ways. From our educational needs and to our communication needs, the computer positively affects us in these two very important ways.

Dear Newspaper, Imagine your life without computers. Writing articles on a typewriter or by hand would surely be a hassle. The question of whether or not computers are beneficial to society has risen in the media, where they argue that people spend less time exercising, interacting with nature, and less time with their family. However, computers are a great step forward in modern science and are beneficial to communities. Computers have drastically helped out educationally at school, not to mention the easier way of connecting with friends and family. Also computers have so many different forms of entertainment. Computers are great step forward and are completely beneficial to our society. Firstly, computers have helped academically in our schools and at home. I can't even imagine the hassle of coming home with the assignment or writing two essays, only to have to write it by hand! Wanting to get it over with would only cause me to rush, resulting in a bad grade. Also, think of the handwriting factor. Most kids in my school don't have good handwriting, and I am assuming that teachers have a hard time grading something they can't read. With programs such as Microsoft Word, you are given the option of different fonts, colors, bolding, pictures, symbols, and so on. Another way computers have helped academically is in schools. More and more teachers are using computers to help us learn. Tests are taken on computers, websites to help us research are visited, and other Microsoft program such as PowerPoint can be used for a project. Computers help a lot in school, while helping us learn so much more. Computers also help with keeping in touch with friends and family. The days of short letters are replaced with long emails with pictures attached, sent in a matter of seconds whizzing through the internet only to arrive on your friend's screen. People can save money by not having pictures developed but instead having them stored on their computer, ready to print onto bond paper. There are advances in communication through computers that have been made. Things such as video chat where you can literally see and talk to the other person, or just audio chat where you can talk to the person, have been made. Such easy ways of communication motivate people to speak to family and friends and stay in touch. Computers have made a positive impact on community by having simple ways to talk to your loved ones. Computers can also provide a fun source of entertainment on the web. Websites have been created where you can play games, find people from your past, or maybe just look out funny videos. Anything you type into your toolbar instantly transforms into a page of links websites where you can find details on your topic, or relative things. One fun website is that of 'YouTube'. This website lets people upload videos. The possibilities are endless on the web. Another fun website is 'Facebook'. This website is where you can 'friend' people you know from the past and interact with them. You can post videos, write messages and such. As you can see, entertainment is everywhere on the web. The time is now to understand the full benefits of computers. Computers are a benefit to modern day society because they help academically, encourage you to stay in touch with family and friend, and provide entertainment. We should all understand that computers are a huge advance in science, and they are a great help, and also fun!

The effect computers have on humans is by far a positive one, and the outstanding intelligence computers provide must be embraced, not feared and avoided. Whether we like it or not, computers will be necessary to solve issues of the future. Besides, for personal usage, computers are highly beneficial. The main reason people fear computers is because of the dangers it radiates, which really isn't reasonable, when analyzed closely. To not use such a complex and developed system such as the computer is completely irrational, the computer is the future plain and simple. It is inevitable that the computer and technology related to that, paint the picture of the future of our world. Whether people like the concept or not, computers will be necessity to solve the problems and calamities that will wreak havoc on the world in time. Computers can predict natural disasters, and with that, people in the area of the catastrophe's destination can be evacuated. Lives can be saved. Computers can calculate pollution margins, and provide solutions to the large amount of pollution humans release in the air and water. Our nature can be spared. So much more can be attained by putting the computer to full use. People must adapt to modern technology, or we will fall behind and watch our environment slip away. This proves the effect computers have on people is not only positive, but necessary to advance in an ever-growing world. Stepping down to a less global level of effects and to a more personal level proves to also be beneficial to humans. Computers in most cases, do better work and create less error than humans themselves. Instead of requiring humans to work in dangerous locations such as deep water, computers can be sent down to visualize the before unattainable areas. Also, faster communication is extremely helpful in certain circumstances, such as an occurrence in a workplace causing the area to be off-limits. A member of the workplace can simply e-mail his employer, informing them of the accident and preventing them from putting themselves in danger, or simply preventing them the trouble of a commute to work. Even from home to office, with simply the press of "send", people across the world can be informed of the accident. Foreign communication, specifically by means of instant messaging can strengthen our tie with other nations, in the fields of both business and government. Lastly, finding information, is so easy with a search engine. Where would we be without computers to find information rapidly? We would be still going to the library and checking out books, reading through page after page to find the information that would have taken less even a minute on a computer. Even a person opposed to computers would have to admit that to be highly beneficial. As you can see, on even a less global level of use, the computer still proves to have a positive effect on its users. The one thing, parents especially, that fuels the negative opinion on computers is safety and reliability. When these two topics are analyzed, it is so simple to eliminate unreliability and danger of the computer. Installing a program of which there are infinite to choose from, that allows "good" websites to be viewed, and "bad" or potentially dangerous sites to be blocked. This eliminates all that is heard about on-line interactions and activity gone bad. Even without software to block dangerous websites, computers are generally safe. Only one out of a hundred websites, includes content considered "detrimental" to humans. Also, of those hundred, ninety-five provide reliable, correct information. Those two statistics annihilate the question of safety and reliability that some users come to ponder. That goes to show that the computer's negative aspects can be eliminated, leaving only the positives to remain. In conclusion, computers have a far more positive influence on users than negatives. Computers are the future, and have even proven to save lives. Why wouldn't somebody want to save the life of another? Also, the benefits of personal computers are too large and helpful to pass up. Lastly, when viewed carefully, computers are very reliable, and can be made extremely safe, which eliminates the main fear of computers. We have come so far to create such a safe, beneficial, and necessary device, we must put it to use, and by doing so, better our own lives, and the life of our planet.

Dear Newspaper, People should play with their family and friends instead of staying on the computer all the time. People would be more fit, have closer bonds with their family, and get better grades in school. When the computer is unplugged, anyone has a chance to go outside and play. When people go outside to play with their friends, they exercise which causes you to lose weight and build stronger muscles. Many scientists believe that it is better to go outside and socialize than to sit on a computer and watch monotonous videos. People would be more active if they stayed off the computer and went outside because it will keep you happy with your body, and healthy so you don't die of a terrible diseases. There would be closer bonds with families if people stayed off the computer. Family would be closer together instead of spreading apart by computers, sharing conversations and experiences. Your family is always there to comfort you whenever you have a terrible day. Your family will help you get over any problem so that you can keep moving forward. If you did this by computer, all you see is a persons face who can't comfort you with a hug or a reassuring touch. Without computers, you get a closer family that loves and supports each other, but with computers, people just drive their families away. Closer families also help children in school get better grades. Families who stay off the computer and have dinner with their families typically have children that get better grades, as they can discuss their school day. Many scientists agree that kids who have dinner and play with their families get better grades in school. If kids get better grades in school from staying off the computer and spending quality time with their family, we could get great inventions that can help mankind in every single way. All of this can happen from staying off of computers. Staying off computer is a great way to help yourself and other people to. It would get people fit, create closer bonds, and create more graduates who go on and achieve the greatest of all inventions. Imagine what else could happen by staying off computers, a healthier and more connected society for everyone.

I strolled into my bedroom, I noticed the computer sitting on a wonder desk. I thought that computers are very helpful. There are many controversies on whether computers benefit or do not benefit society. My opinion on this topic is that computers are useful and I support this technology. Computers are excellent tools that could help students with work in school. For instance, this year I had a science project about how my hobbies and interests are related to science. One of my interests is reading, so I had to research about how reading a simple book can be related to science. I went on the internet, typed in my question about reading, and two seconds later thousands of results came up. I had even gotten some pictures too to use in my presentation. A couple of days later after I had handed in my project, I received it back. I had gotten a high grade on this project! Clearly, being able to use a computer really boosted my grade in science. Without the internet, I probably wouldn't have been able to get an A on this. As you can see, computers can help students with projects, etc. in school. Using this technology can help you reconnect with friends and family members. In elementary school, my friend Sarah had moved away to another state. I had no way of communicating with her until I found a program on the internet that lets you chat with people. Both of us had been using this and we've been able to talk for hours on end. I don't see Sarah as often as I had used to, but with my computer wide open in my bedroom I can chat online with her almost everyday. Computers can help re-establish old relationships with friends and family, keeping those connections alive. Furthermore, communicating on these platforms are also another benefit. Using computers can help enrich peoples minds. For example, in school we use a program called, "Study Island." Study Island involves you playing games that help you learn, and tests when you are ready to take them. Study Island has been helping us practice for the state exams. After taking multiple tests in subjects such as science, math, and language arts, I now feel confident about taking the state exams and I believe I am going to do well on these tests. As you can tell, the tool of Study Island on the computer can benefit your school grades and test preparation. The effect computers have on people are that they help and benefit the society. I think that more citizens should own computers because they can expand your knowledge and connect you to the world. I am clearly in favor of owning and using computers for their numerous advantages in education and communication.

Dear School Board, Computers these days have made positive changes to all of our every day lives. People have made better connections with family and friends, and even have the ability to make new ones through online platforms. While social networks are great and all, computers can also make work extremely easy and professional-looking, allowing for polished documents and presentations. They can also perfect the skill of hand-eye coordination through interactive games and applications. But with that in mind, is the computer truly a harmful or helpful device? Sometimes we wonder where our long lost friends and relatives have gone and how they are. Well, with the computer and internet access, you can easily contact them through great social networks such as Facebook. I hear it all the time from everyone that reunions have been made, and friends have been reunited after years apart. And besides reuniting friends, you can also make new ones with a simple click of a button, joining groups with shared interests. Isn't making more friends and reconnecting so easy now? Computers nowadays offer wonderful software from Microsoft that can make making slideshows, projects, and reports far easier and more visually appealing. I remember making a slideshow with my best friend back when we were in fifth grade. All we did was take the pictures, upload them to his laptop, and then we added captions and transitions to all of the pictures. We did an amazing, professional job on the project and received an A- for our efforts. Though I understand that in the process of computer-usage, people hardly find time outdoors, the technological advance will enhance hand-eye coordination, a skill useful in many areas. Imagine this: You're up at bat in a baseball game. Two strikes and three balls is your count. Everyone is cheering you on. The pitcher pitches the ball and wham! You swing that bat and hit yourself a homerun! Do you know what skill was used to hit that ball? That's right - hand-eye coordination, which can be improved by using the computer. So now while everyone is wondering what sort of effect the computer has, remember how easy that work was for me and the high grade we achieved. Also think back to that baseball player. You know, the one that hit the homerun using hand-eye coordination that might have been sharpened by computer games. But most importantly remember how easy it would be to contact the ones you love most and keep closest to you, no matter the distance. The computer is a positive advance in society, and everyone should be assured so, embracing its benefits for communication, work, and skill development.

Dear @CAPS1 @CAPS2, More and more people use computers, but not everyone agrees that this benefits society and I am one of those people that does not agree. I disagree, because if you're on the computer all day you'll forget about important things in life. For example, you will forget to exercise, you will forget nature, you will also forget to interact with your friends and family. I promise you if you keep on reading you will understand and realize my point of view on this issue. People spend too much time on the computer, and they don't exercise like they should to stay healthy. Exercising is very important, that helps you with your growth and strength. Exercising helps you grow stronger and it makes you feel better. If you're on the computer all day then, you won't exercise and develop right, which can lead to health problems. Another reason, I think its such a bad idea is you do not get to enjoy nature and the outdoors. When you're on your computer you can not go on a hike in the woods to see the trees. You can not go on a camping trip under the stars. You can not do those things, in the pleasant air of nature that feels so refreshing. The last reason but definitely not the least is you will forget to interact with your friends and family in a meaningful way. That is so important because a computer could do a lot of tasks for you. It could teach you a lot of facts but it cannot say I love you and mean it. Only your family and friends could do that for you and make you feel cared for. Hopefully you understand and realize my point of view after reading this. People should stop doing this; you forget to exercise, enjoy nature, and to spend time with your friends and family who matter. All I got to say now is thank you for the opportunity to listen to my idea about limiting computer use.

Dear, @CAPS1 I believe that people shouldn't spend so much time on the computer because they do less exercising, they don't interact with friends and family, and its bad for their health. People shouldn't spend so much time indoors on screens. They won't enjoy their life outside of their houses and miss out on real experiences. My first reason why people shouldn't spend so much time on the computer is that its bad for their health and well-being. Spending too much time on their computers can strain your eyes from the bright light. Some people with seizures including myself would trigger an attack and cause us to space out, which is dangerous. Spending too much time on the computer can mess up your vision or damage your body from poor posture. To me that's very unhealthy and should be avoided. Another reason why spending so much time on the computer is bad is that you don't interact with your family and friends in person. On the computer all the time can make you forget to spend time with your friends and family who care about you. You would get addicted to being on the computer all the time for games or social media. You would forget to say hi and how are you to your family over dinner. You won't spend time with your friends and they will start to ignore you and think that you don't care about them anymore, which hurts relationships. Being on the computer all the time will mess up your social activities with other people and your ability to talk face-to-face. My final reason why spending too much time on the computer is bad is that you're not enjoying nature and the world outside. You don't realize how much you are missing because you are on the computer all day long. Yes you can learn things by the computer but you can also learn by doing it yourself outside. Being on the computer too much will make you not want to exercise and that won't be good for your body in the long run. You would forget to at least go for a jog in the park, discover new things in your neighborhood. You realize that exploring nature is better than just watching it on a screen; the air feels fresher. Those are my reasons why spending too much time on the computer is bad for you. Its not healthy for your body or your eyes. You don't interact well with your friends or family and become distant. Also you won't enjoy nature for yourself and the peace it brings. So just get off the computer and enjoy what life gave you outside, where real memories are made.

Dear Local Newspaper, Think back a couple decades ago, before computers existed. What do you see? There were children outside exercising, playing with friends, and living somewhat danger-free lives; then came the computer. Computers are driving the next generation to a dangerous life of staring at an assortment of pixels all day long, as well as ruining any civilized relationships you had. I strongly believe that computers have a negative affect on society. Did you know that as the number of computers sold increases the obesity rate has gone up significantly since computers came into our lives? Why? Because people spend way too much time on them and not enough time exercising! Another affect of the long hours spent in front of the screen is a decrease in eyesight ability. My family friend, for instance, had to get glasses because his eyes were damaged by the computer. "I'm worried about my daughter's eyes...she stares at that screen for hours on end!" said one concerned parent at the local school. How could something so harmful possibly be good for our society? Speaking of hurtful, the internet is very unsafe. Predators surf the web, looking for young, innocent people to meet and most likely abuse. A large percentage of parents have not been monitoring their children's computer usage; parents are unaware that the internet makes it easy to talk to anybody in the world, from one country to another! Monitoring would also come in handy when it comes to inappropriate videos, pictures, and discussions on the internet. It is so easy to be surfing the web and fall upon things you should not be seeing! Lastly, people easily get caught up in being hidden behind a computer, and say mean, hurtful things that would never be said to one's face! These unfortunate factors cause many of the issues between people today. Speaking of which, computers have a very negative affect on relationships nowadays. As I mentioned earlier, so many fights happen through computer communications. Even if online conversations are friendly, they get people accustomed to making people "friends" through a computer, not face to face. After being in a computer-oriented friendship, people tend to forget how to act face to face and find personal meetings awkward. One eighth grader at the school commented, "I can't imagine only talking through computers, never being civilized with other human beings! Unfortunately, that is where computers are leading us to..." Imagine never seeing your best friend in person, only through technology! It might not even be your friend. It could be a dangerous poser! This is yet another problem...through the internet, you might not even know who such relationships are with! It could be fake, and you'd have no idea. Spending all day rolling away in front of a computer, putting yourself and relationships in danger is, unfortunately, the effect of computers. Computers are not worth the terrible consequences civilization must face. I strongly urge you to stop the advances in technology now, before it is too late! Make the change today.

Dear Editor, I would like to thank you in advance for taking the time to read this letter, it means a lot to me. I am writing today because it has come to my attention that some people are saying that computers do not benefit society. Those people are very wrong! Computers are amazing! They allow easier research; I can learn about other countries, and can talk to people online. I do all of this stuff almost every day! We're just finishing up a pretty big research assignment for English and social studies. It involved taking notes from different sources. Luckily, I was able to go on the card catalog on the computer and find many books on my topic, just by typing the keyword! We can narrow down our options so easily because you can search for something so specific. After you find your topic, you can check and see if there's reliable information by reading a summary. All of this can be done in about fifteen minutes or less. This would be nearly impossible without a computer. I have a few relatives in different countries. A while back my family and I were trying to plan a trip to visit them. We were able to go on a search engine and find directions to their house from the airport. It gave us the directions and the estimated amount of time it would take to get there. I've also been able to do plenty of research on other foreign countries at the push of a button. It's so simple and convenient, too! My two uncles live far away. On Thanksgiving my mother was upset because she missed them. I was then able to set them up in a video chatroom so my mom could talk to them. This is great; it's so convenient to be able to send an instant message. I can talk to people all over the world and it doesn't even cost any money! In conclusion, computers are very helpful because you can learn about foreign countries, have easy access to research, and can talk online. There's a long list of other things that make computers great, but it would take too long to write. Thank you again for listening.

Dear local Newspaper, I think that computers have a good effect on people. Also you're not just sitting there; you're moving your fingers and you're using your brain. Scholastic kids states that kids who use the computer and use the keyboard bring their test scores up several points. In conclusion, I don't think that the computer has a bad effect, and after you're done reading this I hope you agree with me.

I think that it is fine that people spend a lot of time on the computer instead of having time to exercise, enjoy nature and interact with family and friends because it is the person's choice to either stay on the computer all day or go outside. Computers affect people's lives in good ways and bad ways. People stay inside all day and do nothing besides sit there and just click buttons. It's good to go on the computer for a little a bit but when you're on it all day then you could have no exercise and become lazy and fat. But when you go outside sometimes you won't have to worry because you are getting exercise that helps out your body. I think computers are a great way to have fun. Without computers life would be ten times harder for people in this world. People like accountants use computers for their job.
