I think that computers are fine and it doesn't matter how long you're on it; it just depends if you're learning and not playing games all day and being lazy and getting fat.

Dear Local Newspaper: Are computers positively affecting society? As technology advances, humans are relying on them more and more; most people use them daily. I believe computers affect people positively because they help write papers, are a social tool, and are a big help with research. After reading this letter there will be no doubt that computers have a positive effect on people in society. My first reason why computers have a positive effect on people is they help with writing papers. Whether it is writing a resume, a science report, or a spreadsheet, none of these are ever seen nowadays done by hand. Everyone expects to see the flawlessly inked letters on the printer paper in whatever piece of writing it is. This helps the people writing the paper because writing takes many drafts to get the piece perfect; it is a pain to write each draft by hand. In addition, it is easier to read someone's writing when it's typed, especially if the writer has bad handwriting. However, computers help in more than just writing papers. My second reason why computers positively affect people is by being a social tool. Many websites online these days have social networks such as YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, and Myspace. In the listed websites above and many others as well, people can meet other people through other friends and games. The nice thing about meeting them online is that you don't have to plan a time to meet the person; if you are both online you guys can begin chatting. The chatting also helps when people have long-distance relationships, whether friends, mates, or family. Online chatting helps people stay in-touch with someone they might not see everyday. That is a big help with everyone's social life, keeping them connected. Furthermore, online sites like eHarmony or Match.com take people with little time to worry about love and match them with their perfect mate. This also helps people who are shy get married and start a family. This helps people live happier lives, another positive effect. Finally, computers positively affect people by making research much easier. My dad always says "You kids got it easy. When I was growing up, we'd to go to the library and spend hours researching before we could write our papers." Now, it's simple. Using the internet and a search engine, all you have to do is type a topic and you can get all the latest articles in just seconds. Libraries might not have the most recent books, or someone might've checked out your topic's book. Then what can you do? The internet is also an extremely useful help when the research topic is very specific, if it's a certain bacteria or species that a book might only briefly mention. The internet has a much broader range of articles, so it is much easier to find information for any topic. With research taking less time, people can spend more time enjoying the day, like playing outside, than in the library stressing because they cannot find a book on their topic. This is a strong reason why computers should not be seen as a negative effect on society. To conclude, computers have a positive effect on society, because they help write papers, they are a social tool, and are a big help with research. Where would we be if we had to handwrite everything? Think about how many fewer friends or maybe even relationships we would have without social websites. What about how hours of research are now two clicks away? Computers have changed our lives for the better, and we should appreciate all they do for us.

Dear Local Newspaper, I'm writing to you today to show how I feel on how computers have an effect on people. Computers have a very strong negative effect on people. Computers can cause people to gain weight, cause problems for their eyes, and lead to financial issues like not being able to pay bills. We all know that we all gain weight at some point in our life, and we can lose that weight. But if you are on a computer for six hours a day you don't have time to cook a real meal. So what do you do, you eat a lot of junk food and unhealthy snacks, which contributes to weight gain. Do you really want to be the reason why someone is over weight? Picture yourself looking at a bright computer screen for six hours non-stop. Do you think that your eyes are going to be fine? I disagree. When I really tried I can't even keep my eyes open and I'm pretty sure you can't say that your eyes are going to be fine when you just got done looking at a bright screen in the dark. This prolonged strain can lead to serious eye problems. Can you see yourself quitting your job just because you say you're going to work at home? But you don't do your work, and get fired, now how are you going to pay your bills with no money? Once your power goes out you have nothing to do because you got fired all because of your computer. Now what are you going to do with your life? Well that is all. I would like to thank you for your time. And I hope you agree with me for my three reasons: you can gain weight, have eye problems, and struggle to pay your bills. These are significant downsides to excessive computer use that we should all consider.

You are the visitor, click here to get your prize! That is a normal thing that will pop up on computers, they can give you viruses, and people can get your personal information. That is one reason computers are bad. On top of that, "Kids on computers more than ever are abducted each day!" says an official from the missing child agency. They get abducted because kids go on chat rooms and get themselves into trouble by talking to strangers. On another note we rely on computers too much, it is not healthy for us. "Pop up ads cause many problems," says a leading security expert. More than half of the people in the world have computers. This was from a world wide poll. More than a quarter of that is kids. When kids are on computers they always click on the pop up ads. These ads cause catastrophic problems! Peoples computers get viruses, identities get stolen, and credit card information gets found out. Therefore with those things happening you are going to yell at your kids, but you can't blame them they just thought they were going to get a free prize. Now that I have told you about pop ups let me tell you about chatting. Chatting on a computer is just a bomb waiting to be set off. "Chat rooms are the main reason. Now that I have told you about chatting let me tell you about how people rely on them too much. Instead of looking up what a book was about, just read it! Everyone thinks a computer is the answer to every problem when in reality a significant portion of the things on the internet are false, says a technology magazine that deals with the disadvantages of technology. I remember when I needed to know if my flight was canceled, so I went online and looked it up. The website I went on said it was canceled but later when I called the airport just to make sure, they said it took off when it was scheduled to! And instead of an e-mail just send a letter! Do you want your kids abducted from chat rooms? Of course not, and do you want to miss your flight for vacation? No I don't think so, computers are very bad and are used too often. No one wants their identity stolen from some pop up ad. We need to do things on our own more often and stop relying on computers to do everything for us, as this dependence creates significant risks and problems in our daily lives.

Dear local newspaper, I believe that computers have a positive effect on people. It teaches hand-eye coordination, gives people the ability to learn about faraway places and people, and even allows people to talk online with other people. Computers are one of the best technology inventions yet to come that benefits society. First off, computers teach hand-eye coordination. For instance if you're in a rush to type an amazing long essay you won't have the time to keep looking back at your paper, the keyboard and the screen. So you would need to know where these handy-dandy keys are, which improves your motor skills and coordination. However, it would be a lot more trouble if you didn't have any knowledge about computers or where the helpful keys are. Secondly, people would be able to learn about faraway places. If somebody wanted to take a nice, relaxing vacation or honeymoon with their beautiful wife they would need to know the weather forecast so they would know what clothes to bring, and how much money they need to bring to visit all the luscious, freshest restaurants, and hottest stores in this enormous populated city. Without a doubt, I would love to take a vacation, but if it's going to cost a fortune I might have to re-consider this amazing trip, and a computer helps with that planning. Lastly, you can talk online with other people. On blistering cold days when you can't go outside, or call them because you don't have a phone, you can message them on social media as long as you want as long as you have a connection and an email address that nobody else has. Now it's time to decide! Do computers have a positive or negative effect on people. In my opinion computers are great for society and we should keep having them around because they teach hand-eye coordination, and give people the ability to learn about faraway places and people. Best of all, you will be able to talk to your friends and family online. This is certainly a great form of technology people should have and embrace for its many benefits.

Dear trained reader, Hello! Ah, I love hearing my computer thunk on when I wake up. Such a lovely sound. Some people feel the need to disagree and say computers are bad for people. But, I feel the computer is a magnificent invention. All that typing will help improve hand-eye coordination, you can look up anything in the world, and you can even meet new people and keep in touch with faraway friends. The world is just a click away! What's this? You need to write a paper on how to play baseball and improve your pitching skills at the same time? No need to worry, you can just type that paper up on the computer! This is one of the many perks of owning a computer. Typing a paper is so much faster than writing it out by hand. Studies show that typing a paper is significantly faster than writing everything out. Even a noted handwriting enthusiast says "Typing is so much easier than having to write! I type all my books now instead of proper handwriting." It's been said by officials that most hand-written lovers are converting to typing for better hand-eye coordination. If it's used by the people that oppose it, it's gotta be great! Let's say you're doing a project on panda bears, but you don't know anything about them. What do you do? Search it up on a search engine of course! A search engine is a bounty of information, serving up morsels of links for any-and every-topic. I remember this one time I had a big report to write but I didn't know anything about the subject. So what solved my problem? The search engine! It's been proven that a vast majority of information found online is true. You know what else on the computer can help you with information? Just about any domain name on the web. Just type what you're looking for, add .com at the end and voila! all the information you could need. Hm, what else can the computer help with? I know. Your friend that moved away, you can send her a message and get back in touch. Or, if you don't like your friend that moved away, you can meet new people. For example, there are sites designed to match people up for romantic relations. So maybe you don't like computers. Oh well, all I can tell you is that you're missing a lot: great hand-eye coordination, magnificent information, and colorful people. Like I said, the world is just a click away, offering endless opportunities for connection and learning.

Dear readers many people use computers but, not so many people think the internet benefits society. Well, I disagree! I think this because the internet helps you connect with people you're looking for. The internet also gives you the advantage to shop online. If you don't have a navigation system, you can get directions online. If you read more you will see why I support these details. Have you ever heard of popular social media sites? Well in case you haven't, they are social networking sites that help you connect, chat and find people you are looking for. I have an account and they're not that bad. They're actually fun. There are games you can play, quizzes you can take and you can chat with your friends. It's a great way to find someone you know in another town or even another country. This is one reason the computer is a good source. If there is ever a reason you can't drive to the store or wherever you need to go to buy something, you can shop online and buy it! You can just type in the address of the website and look at all the stuff they have and click what you want and buy it! They even have grocery shopping online. So next time you're really upset that you can't go shopping, just shop online. "It might take a while to get your purchase items, but it's worth the wait." What if you don't have a navigation system? well if you don't, don't worry! you can go online to a website such as a map site. All you have to do is type in the address where you're starting from and then the address where you're going to. Then you can print out the directions so you won't be lost! That's definitely an advantage! So, don't you think that the computer is a definite advantage to almost everyone? Well I do! you can use it to find people you need to find, you can shop online and you can easily in less than five minutes get directions! That's why almost everyone should use a computer for these wonderful conveniences.

Dear Newspaper, @CAPS1 you know that two out of three @CAPS2 own a computer? Computers are a very helpful tool that benefit everyone in society. They allow people to communicate with each other, learn, and teach hand-eye coordination and other good things for school. Computers are a very useful and beneficial part of society. The advance in technology has upgraded computers, and now allows people to communicate through them. For example, new webcams allow people to actually see and talk to each other from your computer screen. This allows people no matter how far to talk to each other and stay in touch. With my webcam I am able to keep in touch with my cousins in @LOCATION1. Another way of communication is through email. Through the internet, people can type messages back and forth. It is very fast and easy allowing people to talk to each other more and communicate. As well as webcams and email computers grants people access to communication websites such as @CAPS3 for instant messaging or @CAPS4. On these websites people message each other back and forth very quickly and easily. It is not difficult to do, like writing a letter would be, so people can communicate more efficiently and easily. Computers are very helpful for communication along with learning. Computers are an advancement that could help people learn more about anything. For instance, they could learn about foreign plants. All they would have to do is go to the internet, type what they were looking for, and it would come up on the screen. It would allow people to learn about places all over the world. Also, people can see pictures on the computer. For example, if someone wanted to go on vacation faraway, they could type in the place and see what it looks like. However, the computer does not just show places. People could also see animals, other people, the environments, and anything else they want to learn about. Plus, with new websites being created, people could actually see what the earth looks like from space. They can look at houses, the wonders of the world, and much more; computers give people the opportunity to learn about so much more. Learning more would help people, especially students to have a better education. If you ask anyone in school, they will tell you that computers are a very useful tool. Firstly it allows them to type. Students can type a project or paper on the computer faster and easier. It will also look neater and more organized. Plus, computers teach students hand-eye coordination. By typing or even just clicking the mouse, students are bettering their coordination. This is due to the fact that while they are looking at the screen and typing or clicking, they have a sense of direction and know what to hit or where to put their hands without even looking. Lastly, computers help students because if they need help, they can just ask one of their friends through the computer. Students would better understand the content they are learning and when they go to school, they would already know it. Therefore, computers would lead to students getting better grades. Computers play a big role in society today. They are a way of communication, learning, and allows students to do better in school. Overall, computers are a very beneficial tool in our society.

Dear Newspaper editor, @CAPS1 you have a computer at home? @CAPS1 you use facebook, @CAPS2, or any other type of social networking site? Well if you are like the majority of the respectable, caring @CAPS3 in this country you probably answered yes to both of these questions; and you most likely also believe that the computer is a great tool to teach hand-eye coordination, as well as an awesome way to talk with other people online. Not only that but you should notice the great potential the computer has for showing us distant, faraway lands and cultures. What would we be able to do without hand eye cooridination? Dear Newspaper, @CAPS1 technology has grown exponentially during the last few years. The use of computers especially has sky-rocketed. However, I believe this is not something to be excited about. The constant use of computers can negatively affect people's health, family and friends, and their appreciation of Nature. The over usage of computers is a huge problem. Have you ever sat in front of a computer screen for hours on end? If so, you know the feeling of sleepiness and irritability. The lack of exercise while using a computer impacts people more than they realize. Excessive use of computers has been linked to obesity and high blood pressure; the more people use the computer, the higher their blood pressure tends to be. Just sitting in front of a screen is terrible for people's bodies. To stay healthy, one should only use the computer when it's absolutely necessary. Constant computer use can also separate you from others. This generation, adolescents especially, use the computer to communicate with others more than actually talking to them. Communicating only over the computer can draw them away from people socially. Not to mention how fast rumors and secrets spread over the internet, which can damage trust. Using the computer can ruin relationships, even those with family. Being negligent of family by always being on the computer can draw people apart. Families can become a non-important thing. People can't pay attention to their families while sucked into a computer screen. Furthermore, computers are creating false substitutes for almost everything, even nature. Humans started out living in the wild, gathering food from the land and giving back by replanting. Our connection with nature was strong; we needed it to thrive. Nowadays, however, instead of listening to the sound of rain and the crinkling of dry leaves, people prefer high pitched artificial beeping and the classic "You've got mail." People do not appreciate nature as they used to, as they should. The beauty of nature is simply overlooked as if it's nothing special. Well, without it we wouldn't be alive. Life cannot exist with nothing to thrive off of. We can hop on our computers and look at pictures of nature on @ORGANIZATION1.com, or we can grab our shoes and see it for ourselves. No one can experience the greatness of nature while on the computer. No one can experience the feel of cool lake water sliding over their skin or a hot @DATE1 day while emailing a friend. It can't be done. Computers have robbed us of our ability to experience the natural world. In conclusion, computers are horrid for people. They can affect health, friends and family, and appreciation of nature. We must use computers only when necessary in order to stay healthy. Instead of going online, get going outside.

Dear School Board, Computers are destroying modern youth. The rapid advancement in technology is not a positive thing. The popular social networks such as facebook and twitter are putting youth at danger of cyber-bullying and child predators. Children are also becoming addicted to computers and are paying the price physically. Although we are becoming a smarter species, we are destroying the ones who will soon lead the world. This crazy computing must end! Although children are able to socialize using the computer, they are at danger of being hurt physically and emotionally. "I really tried to ignore all of the cruel comments people were posting about me. I tried as hard as I could, but everytime I logged unto facebook and looked at what people said about me, I died inside. I almost had no desire to live." That quote was said by Michael, a former student of Riverdale High. He is as victim of cyber-bullying. Thousands of students just like Michael are being pestered just as bad, and if not worse. The social networks that modern technology promotes harvest cases like Michael's. If this rapid increase in technology continues then we will see many more cases such as that one. In the past year, five cyber-bully victim have committed suicide. Those are five lives that could have been saved; five families that could still be together. This computer madness is losing lives, we cannot allow this to continue. Not only are computers causing emotional danger, but also physical. The average teenager spends between one to four hours on the computer - making the one hour of exercise seem miniscule. The large number of obese children is in large part caused by computers. The many features of computers, such as instant messaging, music playing, and games, draw kids in - making them spen time they could use exercising, in front of a computer. Statistics show that the average obese child spends forty percent of their free time on a computer. The time they spend exercising and playing makes up only five percent of their day. In 1995, children spent ten percent of their day in front of a computer and thirty percent outside. Over the past fifteen years these numbers have headed south due to tha advance in technology. These numbers prove that computers have dictated obese children's day, making their physical condition even worse. Computers are to blame for our worlds weight issues. As I conclude this letter, I can only hope that I persuated you to make a stand and hault this technological advancement. In conclusion, computers are harvesting cyber-bullying which leads to emotional discomfort. They also dictate time, and as a result, children become obese. We must take a stand and alter statistics for the better, for computers are truly ruining young lives.

Computers are a huge impact on society, but do they make everything better? People spend way too much time on the computer. Computers do not help your brain; they can make you fat, and for a lot of people, they cause drama. People should stop spending so much time on computers. Computers do not help your brain in any means possible. Think about it; sure, you do a lot of your work on computers, but what about your kids? They spend most of their time online and doing pointless stuff. Instead, they could be going outside or even studying. The internet is open to the world, so anyone goes on it, and if your child is on the computer, they are exposed to many vile things that will not help them in the future. It is a proven fact that the less time you spend watching TV or on the computer, the better grades you get. I remember my mom always yelled at me for being on the computer and getting bad grades, so she took the computer away for a while, and now I have much better grades. So being on the computer does not make you smarter. The computer can make you gain quite a bit of weight. If you are on the computer a lot, you are sitting around, and a lot of people eat while they are on the computer. So now you are sitting around the computer eating. That can make you gain weight. I know from experience that being active and going outside or exercising really makes you feel good. Once you gain all that weight, it is very hard to get rid of it. Sitting around like a couch potato is not healthy. You can become obese. So you could say you are happy with your weight, but no one ever said it was healthy. A lot of people have died from being that heavy. It puts a huge toll on your life. If you do not want to die from being too heavy, then I advise you to get off the computer and go outside and live your life. The last thing that makes computers so bad is the drama they cause. Most people have Facebook, AIM, or other platforms, but if you ask anyone with one of those, they will most likely say they have gotten in a fight through one of those. Also, now they have something new called Formspring, which can let you be anonymous, and people go on yours and just say horrible things. One of my friends was a victim of that, and it ruins you. Also, there are so many people on Facebook that lie about who they are, and anyone can easily find out who you are. Nowadays, people know how to hack into people's computers and get info. So computers can not only be unhealthy, but they can be deadly. Why would you want any of those things to happen when it is so easy to just cut back on your computer time? Remember, computers do not help your brain, they can make you fat, and they cause a lot of drama. So please do not use the computer so much.

A majority of people use computers daily for many different types of things. Computers are very beneficial to society. Even though people often use their computers too much, the tasks they complete help our world run smoothly. Also, computers allow us to keep in touch with friends and family that we do not see anymore, and they teach us valuable information very quickly. Without computers, society would not run as smoothly as it does now. One way that computers benefit our society is that they complete tasks such as writing a paper, researching information, and more, much quicker. For example, if you, the journalist, needed to quickly print an article in the paper on the devastating earthquake in Haiti, computers would greatly benefit you because they would allow you to type the article much quicker than having to handwrite it. Computers are very beneficial to society because they allow us to complete things very quickly and efficiently. Another reason why computers are very beneficial to society is because they allow us to maintain relationships with people from long distances and allow us to always keep in touch with old friends and family. Moving to a new city from about a year ago, computers have greatly helped me stay connected with friends halfway across the country. In a recent survey, a significant percentage of college graduates stated that a computer helps them stay in touch with friends from their hometown, but it also allows you to actually see them through video calls. Our society is beneficial because they connect the world. Another reason society benefits is because they allow people to learn very quickly. Search engines such as Google, Yahoo, Bing, and more allow us to research anything we want to know at just the click of a button. This ability to know anything very quickly has a great effect on people; with this knowledge, people become more intellectual and intelligent, and with that intelligence, they make great things happen. According to a leading computer scientist at a major university, the knowledge people get from computer search engines allows them to better do important things and achieve more in their lives. Computers benefit society and have a great effect on people when they are balanced out with other important things such as exercise and socializing. They teach us new information quickly, perform tasks quickly and efficiently, and allow us to keep in touch with people across the world. If it were not for computers, things would take longer to get done and society would become worse. We need computers to do important things and complete tasks needed to live life effectively.

I think spending a lot of time on the computer is not a good idea because the internet has bad things online. The internet makes people stupid, and the internet makes you lazy. Those are the three reasons why you should not stay on the computer all day. One of the reasons is that the computer has bad things online like kidnappings. I have seen a lot of videos and movies about kidnappings where an older man or woman starts talking to some young kids, and they go meet someplace, and the young teen or kid never comes back. Another reason is that the computer makes you stupid; for example, when I used to be on the computer all day, I would get out to get something to eat, and sometimes I would go into the bathroom to get food and then notice that that is not the kitchen. It feels like I just woke up when I got off. My last reason is that the computer makes you lazy. The computer makes you lazy because you just stay on the computer all the time, sitting on the chair without sunlight or exercise. The internet will make you want to stay there more, and it is not good for your mind and body. These are my three reasons why you should not stay on the computer; the more you use it, the more you will want to stay. So do not stay on the computer because there are bad things on there, and it will make you lazy. Please do not stay on the computer for a long time if you want to stay healthy and safe.

Dear local newspaper, I think that using a computer can benefit people and have a negative effect on people. Benefits could be gaining knowledge and meeting new people; bad effects could be weight gain and having a lack of social skills to talk with friends over the phone, etc. First, gaining knowledge is really essential. I think that is because when your computer crashes or breaks, you would most likely know what to do to fix it. I do not think you would want to have to pay money to get anti-virus software that probably does not work. Another reason why I think that gaining experience using a computer is good is that if you want to become a computer engineer, all that time you have spent on the computer could really benefit you later on in life. Secondly, I think that computers could help you meet new people from foreign countries and other states. Not that you have to meet them in person; you could just have a friendly conversation online. The third and last reason why sometimes computers can be bad for you is weight gain. Most people are probably spending so much time on the computer that they are not getting enough physical activities. All they do is sit down, eat unhealthy snacks, and play games and watch videos. That is really bad for your health. In conclusion, using a computer moderately is a lot better than using it a lot. It could help you gain knowledge and meet new people, or it could make you gain weight and have a lack of social skills, so balance is key.

Dear editor, if you think that people spending a lot of time on the computer is good, I do not. People should get more exercise. Also, they do not get enough fresh air. Finally, they do not spend enough time with family and friends. Now we have to determine whether people should spend a lot of time on the computers. Those people who spend a lot of time on the computer could be going outside every day to get exercise. Some parents have their kids hooked on playing on the computer all day instead of going outside to get exercise. They could ride bikes, scooters, play basketball, or wiffle ball. They can also go swimming, play sports, and go to a playground. Finally, they could go for a long walk on the beach. People need to get fresh air instead of being on the computer all day. They can go sit on the beach for a while, go outside to watch their kids play or watch their games like baseball or basketball, or they can go outside just to be outside. They can go sit on their porch to wait for their kids to get off the bus from school. Those people who love to play on the computer do not spend enough time with their family or friends. They could go visit their family more often or go out for lunch with their friends. Also, they can spend more time doing things with their kids. Even though there is a chat on the computer, it is nice to talk to your friends in person. The time has come to decide whether people spending a lot of time on the computer is a bad thing or not. They do not get enough exercise every day. They also do not get enough fresh air. Finally, they do not spend enough time with their friends and family. So now you need to write a letter to your local newspaper telling them which side you are choosing, but I believe the evidence against excessive computer use is clear.

To my opinion computers have a negative effect on people I think it has a negative because it causes people to get less exercise, you spend less time with your family and friends, and it distracts you from things you need to get done. First of all, computers have a negative effect on people because it causes them to get less exercise. For example, there are many football, soccer and baseball games, but instead of practicing these sports, people will just sit on the computer on the webcam all night. Another way is that you can get work done without even leaving your house. You can shop online, stay home and work online, and even go to college; those things used to include getting out and moving around, but now you can just stay inside all day and do those things and be lazy. Second, the computer causes you to interact with people less. For instance, when I went over my friend's house, I sat right next to her and she didn't even look at me because she was playing computer games. I know that a lot more kids have this problem too because I was reading in a magazine that a certain percentage of parents are not interacting with their kids as much as they did before they got a computer. Lastly, I think the computer has a negative effect because it distracts them. It distracts kids from conversations; first of all, when people try to talk with someone who is on the computer it is very hard because they are absorbed in what they're doing. Secondly, the computer distracts kids from homework. I know this first hand, because whenever I have to type up assignments I get distracted and end up going on different websites, and not getting my work done. Lastly, it distracts kids from household chores. Some kids just put them to the side and forget to do them because they're busy playing a game or surfing the web. I know that if I did that, I'd get in big trouble. Those are the reasons why I think the computer has a negative effect on people because it causes them to get less exercise, they don't interact with people as much, and it distracts them. So unless you want all those things happening to you, I suggest you spend less time on the computer!

Dear Editor, Many people have been complaining about computers in our society. They say they are keeping children inside doing nothing, but really they are helping us so much! The internet is where you can research anything and tons of helpful ideas come up. Playing certain games helps us with hand-eye coordination. Lastly, computers allow us to stay in touch with people who are far away. Like last year my friend went to Poland and we were able to talk through our computers! So please join me and help the world know that computers are good! First off, I would like to say the computer is a good source of information. How would you like it if you still had to read scrolls from Greece when you could look at information online? Not to mention, if you need to know something really fast, like right before a big meeting, then all you have to do is simply type in what you want to know and bam! Just like that you know, and off to your meeting you go. Secondly, using the mouse and keys on a computer can increase your hand-eye coordination. Like my parents always say when I'm typing an essay, a high number of words per minute is a good rate. A study showed that a majority of kids get better hand-eye coordination after getting good on the computer. A lot of times kids have poor coordination, but I have a feeling that if kids work on the computer, things will change. Most importantly, the computer helps us connect with people far away. Like I mentioned before, I stayed in touch with my Polish buddy. A lot of people don't have cell phones so they have an email account, Gmail, Facebook, MySpace, or a Twitter. All of this allows us to stay in touch and keep up with our friends' lives. This is very important because if we are social then we will get out with our friends and do stuff, which is very important for our well-being. In conclusion, it is good for our society to have computers in our lives. They will help us in the future; we will get good grades on projects because of our sources. We will be healthy with good hand-eye coordination from using the mouse and keyboard. Lastly, we will have many friends. These are all very important things in life. So let's keep our computers!

Dear readers, I write to you today about the effects of computer usage. I feel that there are some positive and some negative effects from using the computer. You can talk to people, and you can get work done, but if you are at this too much you'll be starting to gain bad health and miss other things in life. Throughout the computer, there are many ways to communicate with others, which is an amazing thing. Whether it be through a game, typing, or video chatting, it's very important to talk to people and this makes things much easier than going out and talking to people face to face. For example, pen pals: over the years people have written letters to their pen pals, but now you can send it over email and email doesn't cost any money, just type up your letter, click a button and it's done. Another positive point about computers is that you're able to get work done on it. From work for a business to school work, it doesn't matter. You hear of people using computers to do work all of the time. Why do you think there are computer labs at school or desks with computers in offices? Computers have become advanced and the easiest thing to get things done with for presentations, essays, graphs, anything. A concern I have of the computer is that people are becoming too addicted to computers. Many younger people are overusing computers which leads to bad health. When people sit in front of a computer screen all day only getting up to grab something to eat, people will become obese. To stay healthy people need to be outside and exercise. We need to make rules to keep people out in the open air to give the generation a healthy life. So, I have mixed feelings about computers. They can be amazing for a while but only for a while, and we must be careful not to overuse them. And if you can't see this, you should open your eyes to the potential downsides.

To the editor of the newspaper, I am writing to state my opinion as to whether computers benefit or harm society. I believe that computers are a great tool for several reasons. First, computers are a learning resource, and a way people stay updated with the world around them. Also, computers keep us connected with friends and family more easily. Clearly, computers are more helpful to people than they are harmful. Life as we know it today would be greatly altered without the advances in computer technology that have been made over the past few decades. Today if I need to know something, whether it be for school or my own reasons, I can almost instantly look it up and get answers from many different sources. This helps people to be more educated and updated with the world around them. A doctor from a university recently performed a study on high school teenagers and concluded that students with access to computers scored significantly better on standard testing due to background information they have acquired while online. Along with the internet, there are programs which help people to learn a new language, or write on the computer. Also, computers keep us updated with events that are happening in the world. For example, when the earthquake devastated a region, I first saw it on the news, but got very few details. I then looked it up online and immediately got the death toll, the aid that was being given, and ways I could help donate. Without computers, I would have known none of this. Another reason as to why computers are so helpful to society is that they are tools that help us to keep in touch with others. With things like Facebook and instant messaging, I can chat with people, invite friends over, and even plan parties. Without computers, I would need to call each person individually, but with computers I can write one message and send it to everyone all at once. This gives me more time to do things like play outside and exercise. Also, things like email and Facebook help people to stay in touch with old and distant friends. Studies show that a large percentage of people with some type of social networking account have a more active social life than those who do not; according to a doctor this means that these people will have an easier time adapting to different social situations than those who do not. Clearly, this is a great benefit. In conclusion, the computer helps society a great deal more than it hinders it. It easily allows people to stay educated, updated, and connected. It helps people stay aware of the world around them and educated about everything. It makes things that would otherwise take lots of time very quick, giving people the chance to do other things such as playing outside. It keeps people socially capable and active, and allows people to connect with others. Without a doubt, computers are a very good thing for our society.

Dear Parents, Computers have effects on people and their lives. They cause a lot of people, especially children, to spend their time after school playing games, on MySpace, Facebook, and checking their email address instead of going outside. I think that children and adults should go out and have a good time; there is not a problem with going on the computer once in awhile, but if you spend all day on a computer then that's pretty bad. Adults shouldn't let their children spend all day on a computer and adults shouldn't either because it won't help your life. Computers could mess your life up by the choices you make and pictures you put up and things you write on there. For instance, if you have a MySpace or Facebook and you put bad pictures up, in your future when you want a good job they could just look back at that and say look at this, I don't want this person working for me, and there you go messing up your future. Instead of going on the computer all the time you could go outside, do sports to keep your body healthy, and go out in the world and learn new things or even plan trips to go on with your family, walk around and stuff like that instead of going on the computers and putting yourself at risk of losing a job or messing up your future. You shouldn't let computers mess your life up because if you do then your life won't be the same. Children could mess their life up because of things they wrote or pictures they put up which other kids could see and be mean to them and talk about them for the rest of their school year, or things could lead to a fight over one little word you said or picture you put up because you thought it was cute. Sex offenders are on computers and some people don't even know it until they get taken away or killed. Dear newspaper post, I have been thinking about the way computers affect our lives. Lastly, I believe that the less time we spend would help us and be so much better. I know, after an hour or more online, I feel lazy and I don't want to do anything. In addition, computers also let people learn about faraway places, about different cultures and different people, fostering global understanding. With one of the largest number of members, Facebook is a website that people use to communicate regularly. More than @PERCENT1 of most students in an average school have one. They communicate there more than they could without computers, sharing updates and photos. Computers aren't making people "anti social" or making them interact with friends less, they're actually talking more and maintaining stronger connections. Computers are letting people communicate daily with people from all around the globe, without having to worry about running out of cellphone minutes, making it cost-effective. Overall, computers are letting people broaden their horizons and learn about a lot of new things. They are more of a benefit than a burden, providing countless advantages. Computers are the next best thing since sliced bread, a truly revolutionary invention.

Dear local newspaper, There are several reasons how computers have an effect on people. My position is to convince the local newspaper why certain people shouldn't and should use computers. People are getting caught up on the internet, or people not having enough money to explore the world, so they just be on the computer. In effect, people shouldn't waste their time on the internet because you will get caught up. For example, my friend stays on the computer more than eight hours. He tells me that he's on a chat line, hooking up with other people. He forgets about everybody. He's so on the computer. He stopped going to school, he is gaining weight. Now he is just a nobody. He just sits in front of his computer and does nothing. I feel like he just threw his life away just for some stupid chat line. It's not hard to find another person in our city. There are a lot of beautiful young ladies out here to explore. Similarly, people shouldn't waste their time on the internet because you start losing time. For instance, you spend less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with family and friends. People stop losing their focus on important things, and start paying attention on other things. There was a great person I knew. She was so successful. She made tons of money. Until she started losing her job. She was fired because she was so stuck on Facebook. Facebook is like a place for a friend search; you could meet other people from different cities; you could just find people to date on that website. Facebook turned her life around. I remember her telling my mom how her life is so messed up now, how she got fired, how she doesn't pay her bills, and how she is moving into a smaller place. Sometimes websites make you lose focus on important things in life. Consequently, certain people should use computers because the internet can help you with certain things. In summation, it can help you find a hotel or a trip to go on with your friends or families. I love being on the internet. One time I signed up for this website that was called Myspace. For a moment I did get caught up on it. But I learned to use it wisely, for connecting with old friends and planning events. So, while computers can be a trap, they can also be a useful tool when used with care and moderation, which is the point I wanted to make.

Dear local Newspaper, My opinion on the effects that computers have on people is that they are creating more and more obese people. People tend to get moody, and it seems that computers are addictive. I think computers have a huge effect on people. The number one thing is that more people every year are becoming obese because they do not leave the chair they sit in for most of the day. Also they get so lazy they don't want to get up so they will just order food and have it delivered right to their house. The next idea is that they do not get enough exercise, because they just sit there all day and don't move. But when they do move it is to get something to eat or go get their phone. This is why they should limit kids and adults to only two hours or less of computer time each day. My next reason is because people that are on computers tend to get moody. Like one second they are happy and once they get off the computer they are sad. They get all cooped up inside for the whole day. They don't see enough sunlight because people don't see they are indoors too much. If they exercised for one hour each day the moodiness would change. People need a lot of exercise to maintain weight and muscle. My last reason that computers have effects on people is that people will tend to act addicted to the computer. Like if they are playing a game all day and don't realize it, they will get addicted and not stop playing all day. People need to leave the computer and do something else like ride a bike or play a sport. In conclusion, what I am trying to tell you is that it is not good that people stay inside all day and play on the computer, because it is hazardous to your health and it is putting you at a high risk of obesity. So can you please listen to my ideas and consider promoting healthier habits for everyone in our community.

Dear Newspaper, I have been reading about the debate about computers. People say that computers are teaching important skills. Others are saying that, "People are spending too much time on their computers and less time exercising." Personally, I think that people should be able to use computers; I mean they were meant to help us anyway. Just think how much computers have helped the human race, from talking to friends and family in other countries to looking at what time the plane leaves to another city. It is said that more than one million people and up use their computer more than once a day. Without the computer there is no worldwide web which is connected to everything in this world. Without computers you wouldn't be able to control any robotic equipment which will give more jobs, but the cost of food would go up tremendously; without computers the equipment wouldn't work in hospitals; computers can save lives as they store important information. We would have to go back into the dark ages with typewriters again. Another big issue is that people are overusing the computer. Once you learn to moderate the usage of your computer that won't be a problem. Some people say computers cost too much. There are ways to put so called "down payments" on computers, something like a plan where you pay each month, and setting up internet is easy as one-two-three. So, yes there are good and bad things talked about computers but without them we wouldn't have a modern era. They control the robots that make your car, the medical equipment that saves lives, so with all this said I would like to say thanks for listening and go computers for all the progress they bring!

Dear Editor, I am writing this article on computers to inform you of my opinion on computers' positive and negative effects. The reason why computers are so successful is because of some of the great information they provide. Such as directions to a place you are going to or home information on a subject or a person. Although these all sound good, anyone can post information on the internet so some information might not all be accurate. Some reasons why the computer is bad is because of sites which are not safe and can give your personal information to a stranger, coming back to bother you in the future. Also, some websites or pop-up icons are not suitable for younger kids, exposing them to content that is too mature for them. Lastly, talking on the computer is a part of our everyday lives, such as emails; almost every American with a computer has one. An email is a great way to relay information quickly. Also, the new source of web cameras is giving you the ability to see people and talk into the computer, which is rapidly growing in the United States and beyond. That is all in this article; this tells you my point of view on computers and their dual nature in our modern world.

Dear local newspaper, I think that the computer is not a bad thing because of three reasons. One reason is that we can learn about a faraway place. Another reason is they teach hand-eye coordination. The last reason is we can talk to friends and meet new people. From the computer we can learn about a faraway place if we were doing a report on it or just out of curiosity. We can learn what kind of plants grow there for food; for example, tropical places grow bananas and coconuts. We can learn what they eat; like in Mexico they eat many beans; a lot of their food has beans, even their salads. We can find out their language as well; maybe they talk Spanish like in Spain. You can also teach hand-eye coordination because it involves using your fingers and eyes to see what you are typing. You use your hands on everything while typing, whether you are typing or you are using the mouse. But it is not just for learning things; it is also for friends because of all these sites like Myspace, Facebook, AIM, and webchat. The possibilities are endless; you can even play games. If you don't know someone on Facebook or Myspace that's okay; it is a great way to meet new people and new friends. And another thing, if you are having trouble finding a friend you can just see if they are online. It is good for getting together somewhere or for planning something. And for those people who think it is taking away family time, you can always just say okay that's enough and talk to them. So that is it; computers are good because you can learn about places, develop hand-eye coordination, and talk to new and old friends, making them a valuable part of modern life.

I believe that the household computer can help with everyday things like research and development, homework, artwork, an always renewing travel dictionary, a twenty-four hour super store filled with never ending items, video games, and a very sophisticated calculator. New programs are coming out all the time, but addiction is always seen as a very bad thing to have. If you become addicted to any part of it, you will start to have no friends or girlfriends and you'll probably start to ignore your family. Furthermore, you'll get carpal tunnel syndrome from typing and eye strain from staring at a bright screen all day and looking at it closely. You will probably get a bad back from sitting all day in a chair or kneeling or leaning back in a chaise lounge; it may be comfy but it's bad for you. In conclusion, computers help a lot and they are fun, but they are addicting too, so have fun. But don't get addicted because computers may be fun, but portions are healthy and that's what should be done.

Dear Readers, one of the most important inventions of the past decades is the computer, and it has its pros and cons. I think people spend too much time on computers, especially teenagers. They spend too much time on social media and video games, and not enough time outside enjoying nature and playing sports or exercising. While they may talk with friends with messaging apps, it is not the same as going to the park with friends and playing a game of baseball. Families also are distant from each other when they sit around on their devices. Teenagers spend too much time on the internet going where they should not instead of doing more beneficial activities like reading. I am sure we all know at least one obese person or teenager. My neighbor is the size of a killer whale and eats just about as much as one. He will sit on the computer chair and stare with his eyes glazed at the computer screen for hours on end. Sometimes I wonder how many brain cells he wastes per second. I will bet that everyone who reads this knows someone like my neighbor. The statistic that thirty percent of America is obese is not exaggerated at all. In my opinion, it is the fault of the internet and computers. Instead of going to the gym or the soccer field with friends, they go to the computer and talk and eat junk food. They spend their time watching pointless online videos, while they should be playing baseball or football. Doubters say you learn hand-eye coordination with computers, but you can learn better with sports. Computers are a large factor in obesity because they encourage people to sit around instead of doing standard sixty minutes a day of exercise. The next pressing issue is the amount of reading the average teenager and adult does. I would say that the average gets about ten minutes of reading a day because they are too busy chatting with friends on the internet. I have a cousin who reads about a book every two years and fails every test he gets and has stayed back three times, but instead of reading and learning, he is chatting and texting. He wastes these excellent educational opportunities while there are people in underdeveloped countries like Africa who are lucky to own a book. I know more than fifty percent of the kids in my class do not read anything except the required reading and that is because they sit around on the computers wasting time. The average reading score is about two hundred and that number is decreasing because of the lack of reading done and the time on computers spent. I have seen surveys that say three out of four kids spend more than six hours a day on computers. These statistics and quotes have left me thinking, how much time do we really need to spend on computers instead of reading or else we will turn into oversized monkeys who can't even read. The computers and internet are doing more than just erasing brain cells and our health, they are taking away the experiences that we could have outside in nature. Nature holds natural wonders like the Grand Canyon, the Rocky Mountains and the Great Barrier Reef. What beats skiing down a large slope, or climbing Mount Everest, certainly not computers. Unfortunately, that is what most people choose to do. They sit and tap on the keyboard instead of walking nature trails and walking on the beaches. They sit on old moldy chairs and stare at computer screens, unlike the people enjoying the butterfly gardens and wildlife preserves. Instead of taking steps to help the environment we are sitting on the computers sleeping and being mesmerized by the light of the screen. We should be preserving and learning about what is left on the planet, but we are not because of these computers and the internet. I have presented a strong argument against computers that you may listen to or not. I strongly urge you to take action to start reducing time spent on computers. Set up programs at your house or town for turning off the computers. We need to do something now!

Dear editor, last week, I noticed an article in the paper headlined "Get off the computer and go exercise." This caught me off guard because there are many benefits to computers, such as it enhances education, you can learn about foreign countries, and you can talk to other people. Every school has a computer. They have easy access and are very helpful. I know that last year, if someone asked a question and the teacher wasn't sure of it, we would go straight to the computer. It also helps us do better on projects. I know I had to do a project last month, and without the computer I wouldn't have it today. We also use the computers for the programs they have. In art, we made a cartoon, and made it look real with Photoshop. It's also easy and fast to use a computer for research. You can also learn about far away places with a computer. For example, you can find out about other countries in the world. You could find out if it were landlocked, not landlocked, how many people live there, and facts similar to those. You can also learn the history about the country such as their leaders and government. Finally, you can also learn up-to-the-minute facts with websites like Wikipedia.com. Lastly, you can talk with other people using email, instant messaging, and websites like Facebook, which allows you to connect with friends. With email, you talk with someone for business, to receive links to important websites, and to share information. Instant messaging is just like texting on your phone, except much faster. You can instantly talk to people and catch up with them. Thousands of people are on Facebook. You can connect with old friends, and talk to current ones. I know my mom uses Facebook and talks to old friends since she moved. So, in my opinion, I think computers are a good thing to have. Not only do they enhance your education, but they also teach us foreign countries' history and let us connect to old friends. When you were in school, do you remember your "best-friend-for-life?" Well, with Facebook you can catch up with them, instead of them being just a memory.

Dear Editor of the Gazette, did you know that eight out of ten homes in our town have at least one computer if not more? Computers help us with daily things and make many tasks, like writing an essay, much easier. They benefit our society in many ways. Without computers some families would lose contact with loved ones who are far away, not to mention it can keep many things very organized and neat easily. Maybe the best benefit is how you can learn about far away countries and cultures with the click of a button. Computers have endless possibilities for how they can benefit our society. Many people don't realize that some families cannot be with each other so easily as others. If a family member is in the service sometimes talking on the computer is the only chance they get to communicate with their loved ones back home. Saying that this is not a benefit is a lie. For others who don't have such a severe need of communicating it is still a convenient way to have a conversation with someone far away without racking up the phone bill for a long distance call. Also many times this can be an alternative to parents buying their children expensive cell phones. So having a computer is definitely a benefit to communication. The computer can also make many tasks much easier; for example, if you were assigned a five-page essay in school, typing it on the computer would be much neater and quicker than writing it all out. Also many businesses rely on computers to keep data organized and all in place. Like the program Excel, Microsoft created this to make a simple way to organize data. It is much more efficient than having everything in different sites with millions of papers in every drawer. So another benefit of the computer is that it can keep things organized and provide easy ways to complete everyday tasks. Maybe the greatest benefit of the computer is how much you can learn so easily. Say I was curious about the recent earthquake in Japan, if I wanted more information I would head straight to the computer. You simply go to Google or another search engine of your choice, type in the subject, one click, and bam you could read for hours all of the websites and articles that would come up. The computer is full of information, and is right at our finger tips; this is definitely a huge benefit to our society. The computer is a wonderful tool that can assist in so many ways, whether it is communication, organization, or just curiosity. This advance in technology is just another way to improve everyday life. Computers don't just benefit our little town of Springfield, they benefit our whole society in all of the amazing things they do.

Computers are good and bad. They are good because that is a way we can communicate with other people in different states, keeping in touch with family and friends across long distances. Another reason computers are good is because they can keep you out of trouble by providing constructive activities and can keep you entertained with various games and media. However, computers are bad because they can lead to addiction; you can become a computer freak and become hyper-focused when it comes to computers, neglecting other responsibilities. Still, computers are good because they can do a lot of things that other objects cannot do, offering unique tools and resources. In the end, it is all about finding a healthy balance in their use.

Dear local newspaper, As you can see, about seventy percent of our population overuse the computer. They should be out getting fresh air and spending time with their family and friends. On the other hand, the computer can come with much use for many people. Family lives quite a distance away, and as well, some friends are getting out of touch is a possibility. You can also learn about far away places, like Paris. The computer is often used for projects and essays which is important. You can learn quite a bit with a computer. The computer can be used in many ways. One way is to keep in contact. Sure you can just go to the park and spend time there but not everybody lives that close. For people who have relatives or even good friends who live quite a distance, a computer is what you need. It is a great way to keep in contact. You can keep everyone updated at all times. For example, my cousin recently went out of the country for college; she will be there for a few months so she has her own blog on the computer to keep everybody updated and stay in contact. The phone is not always an option. To learn about far away places is great. Online you can learn about the history of specific places. You can see the towns and so much more. You can even see pictures. Maybe one day you will even get to see those specific places in person. How cool would that be? School is a big thing now-a-days. Students have project after project, essay after essay and its a lot of work. As you grow older it becomes more work and with a computer, you will have less weight on your shoulders. With essays you can type them, and fix your mistakes without it looking sloppy. Projects are easy to fix too, so messing up isn't a big deal. On the other hand, more Americans now than ever before are overweight. The computer has a lot to do with that. Most people will come home and sit on the computer for the rest of the evening. They don't realize what a big effect a computer can make on a person. More people should be out exercising and spending time with family. Computers can be a negative thing or a positive. It can be more helpful than you could imagine. But, yet it can make a huge negative effect on people. It can help keep contact with people, to learn about far away places, or even with school work. Let it be beneficial; use it when you need it, but remember to step away and enjoy the world outside your screen.

Dear Newspaper, Computers benefit society because they teach people. They are also helpful because they solve problems that humans might have trouble with. They can also entertain us when we have nothing to do. They can teach people many things. They can help tourists learn about a location they wish to travel to. Actually, eight out of every ten tourists research the area they're going to on a computer. They help students catch up or fully understand something. One time I was having trouble with fractions in math. So I decided to look up the way to find the answer and it caught me up with the class again. The computer can explain cultures from anywhere in the world. According to culturedigest.com, ninety percent of people visiting a new country find out about the culture first. Computers solve problems that some people might not know about. It can solve a math problem easily with a built-in calculator. Seven out of ten computer users have used a calculator to help them solve a problem. They also solve geographic problems. There may be an abundance of dated maps but this is easily solved with live satellite maps. Map Tools says there has never been a flaw in their system. Computers have a wide variety of entertainment. They can play music. Eighty-five percent of teens get their music from the computer over a CD. Computers can entertain you with games. One day it was raining hard and I had nothing to do so I went on my computer and played Minesweeper. This kept me very entertained. Please take this letter into consideration. Thank you for your time and for considering the many ways computers positively impact our daily lives and learning.

More and more people use computers but not everyone agrees that this benefits society. Well, to me it does benefit society in many ways like learning online. You can learn many things online; you can practice math, reading, and even writing. You can also have fun online if you're bored at home and have nothing to do. Also, you can interact with friends and family members, by email etc. When you're online you can learn a lot of things. If you're at home, and you need to study for a test, you can go online and study. You can also learn more, because you can learn how to do a math problem if you don't know it, or just catch up on reading. People sometimes need a computer because they might be bored, so they can go online and play games and have fun. People, especially kids, get bored at times, so they can just go on the computer and play games and trivia so they can still learn. Computers can let you interact with your family and friends. You can e-mail or use a webcam. If you haven't talked to someone a long period of time you can just go to the computer and talk to them. If you want to find a former school classmate that you haven't talked to in years, you can now. Computers do benefit the society. In my own opinion we do need computers. If parents do not want their child on websites they don't approve of, the parents can always block those websites. Computers are really necessary; they can help in a huge way with education, communication, and entertainment, making them a valuable tool for modern life.

Being a teen myself, my computer is something I don't think I would be able to live without. But is it holding me back from more important things? I think so. I feel that not having computers will in a way educate people more so than now. For example with school research papers we immediately go to the computers in order to find information when we could be using books and magazines. With having the use of computers many people don't properly know how to use and find information in books. Also being around computers and using them so much is pulling families further apart and stopping humans from being more interactive with nature and the environment. For many people using a computer is a life style, it's something we tend to use more than religiously and that may not be the best thing. Children, teens and even adults get extremely addicted to computers. Teens and children use laptops and iPads everyday in order to do their school work, and to talk with friends. As well as parents/adults, they use it to get their work done and use it as an easy communication with co-workers. To this very day people have become very addicted to computers. I know for certain that in my family, my mother, nor my father, nor my brother, nor I could go through a day without using a computer. As I mentioned before computers are also pulling families further apart. There is less family time and communication between family members these days, due to computers. Instead of spending time with the family, teens prefer spending time on the computer chatting with their friends. I bet if a poll was taken on how much family time has been taken away in households because of computers I almost guarantee it would be quite a large amount. I know the only true family time some families have without computers is dinner and that isn't much. Lastly many humans are not as connected to nature and as involved as they used to be. Using computer keeps people inside and not exposed to nature. Though there are many advertisements and pop ups on the computer that inform us about how to take care of the earth properly, we so easily ignore them and remain playing on the computer than going outside and doing something to help make the world a better, clearer place. Not only is it just taking care of our earth, but it is also the fact that not many people these days go out and get the fresh air they need as much as they really should. Most likely not all of that is due to the use of computers, but I bet a great deal of it is. Like I said before it is super hard to imagine a day without a computer, I mean how would we communicate or do our work? But there are truthfully other ways to do them that we just aren't very used to because of the fact that we are so attached to them. I never really noticed till now that it is possible to live without a computer, and that so many people are missing incredible things such as family and nature because we are so addicted to the computers, and it is a realization worth considering for a more balanced life.

Dear local Newspaper, In my opinion I believe that computers have helped our society a lot over the past decade or so. This is because when you are on the computer you get better hand-eye coordination. Also you learn how to type and do other things with a computer that you will need to know how to do if you want to get a decent job that pays well. Also now on the computer you can go on Facebook and other websites where you can make friends and chat with other people. So its not only helping your social skills and hand-eye coordination but also you are most likely to get a good job if you know how to type and use a computer. First off, having a computer teaches you to have better hand-eye coordination. This is because when you get a computer having better hand-eye coordination will teach you how to type better and more quickly. Secondly, having a computer will teach you better social skills. This is because now a lot of people go on Facebook and you can make friends and chat with your new ones. Also when its a cold and rainy day you can occupy yourself by playing different games and also you can check the news and forecast for tomorrow's weather. Lastly, when you learn how to type you have a good shot at getting a good job because you know how to type and work a computer. This is because when you are looking for a job that pays good you will most likely have to know how to type and operate a computer. Indeed, in conclusion, in my opinion I think computers have helped our society over the years, but other people may think differently. So now lets see what you think about the role of computers in our modern world.

Click, click, click the mouse of a computer goes as you are searching throughout the internet. Computers are a great way to teach kids how to be social, make people more intelligent, and help you with your homework, I believe that computers have a very positive effect on people. Computers can teach kids to be social because first off computers are like an online phone, you can talk to people in so many ways, facebook chat, aim(chat), myspace, twitter, skype, and a lot of other ways that I haven't mentioned. Dear Newspaper, Meet a family. Just a normal family whose lives have been changed due to computers. They are overweight, constantly suffering from fatigue, lonely, nature deprived and lazy. They isolate you from friends and family, they deprive you of the nature around you, and most of all, they can cause you to become overweight or even obese. Friends and family are two very important things in everybody's life, even if you dont realize it. By using computers rather than interacting with them, you are weakening the connections you have. Computers can cause you to isolate yourself. They might cause you to talk to your family less. Unfortunatley, friendships can be lost this way. "Spending long hours on my computer had caused me to become isolated and made me fell lonely," says a teenager, by reducing the use of computers you are doing yourself a favor. Computer can deprive you of the nature that surrounds you. You most likely would be on your computer rather than going outside. Instead of spending countless hours on the computer, you could be playing a sport or activity. By playing sports you are increasing your hand eye coordination, far more then if you were to be on a computer. Wouldnt you like to be having fun with your friends playing volleyball, basketball, swimming or even going for a walk rather then sitting in front of your computer? I know I would! The obesity rates of this country will increase if people continue to use computers. You will risk a significant rise from lack of exercise. Computers can ruin lives by increasing your chance of becoming unhealthy and overweight. So now think, would you want to be lonely, overweight, and deprived of nature? I know i definitely wouldn't. That is why computers should be used less frequently! So now is the time; lets join together and raise awareness of the negative effects of computer!
