Therefore I state that computers should not be used for more than a couple of hours a day to protect our health and our lives.

Dear Newspaper, I disagree that computers are unimportant to people because they have research, online colleges, and online stores. Those are my top three reasons and I'm going to give more details. My first main idea is that computers help students find important information on a project. You can go on Wikipedia to help find information about the Battle of Gettysburg and other important history. One example is I went to American history.com to find good information about Printer's Alley and what happened there. People also look up a lot of stuff that involves school. You can get research about the earth and what happens to it. My second main idea is that computers are good for people is when you finish high school, you can go to college. Some colleges can be found on the internet and you can go to college at home on your computer. One example is my cousin. She goes to college on the internet because she has to take care of her two children. Whenever you watch television you see a commercial about online colleges because they are trying to tell you to go to school online. My third and final reason why computers are good for you people is that some stores have an online store where you can look at what they have in the store. Children like to go shopping a lot but they can't go to the mall or the stores because you don't want to go. You can let them see what they want and buy it online rather than going to the stores. It can be shipped to your door without going anywhere. My mom sometimes orders from Amazon.com so she doesn't have to go there. It gets shipped to our house in less than a week. There were my three main reasons why people should have a computer. They can find research, attend online schools, and use online shopping stores. This can help people understand and appreciate the value of computers in our modern world.

Dear Daily News editors, hello, my name is John, and I would like you to write an article on the effects computers have on people. Computers have been the technological item to have over the past decade or so years. They allow people to learn many new skills, get important work done, and even socialize! However some experts believe that people spend too much time on computers, and that people are not as active or healthy because of it. Everyone wants to be healthy. While computers are fun and useful, could they have a negative effect on society? A large percentage of adults are employed, and with that number dropping people need to get more work done to keep their jobs, or even keep their businesses open. With computers available at work much more work can be done, with programs like Microsoft Word people can type reports, and with programs like Excel, people can calculate taxes faster, so they have more time to work. Some people are working with stocks, and these days, the stocks could be good or bad, so you need to keep up! You can go to the stock websites and control what you buy and sell, without raising your phone bill from calling the brokers. Laptops make work possible on the go too! Computers teach many skills you need to know for jobs, and other skills you might need at times in life. You can learn typing, work programs, and programming which are all needed in some lines of work. Computers increase math skills and hand-eye coordination too! And you can read your favorite books via online scans! Now you might be wondering why not pick up a real book? Well, you can find online scans, and some are free! Not only do computers teach skills and work, they are very fun too! Between Facebook, Twitter, email, and Skype, there are lots of ways to talk to friends and meet new people. On Facebook I can have up to many people talk to whenever I want! Why not talk to real people? you ask, well the answer is simple, maybe it is a lazy Sunday and nobody wants to go out anywhere, or maybe your friends want to talk right before bed time. Talking to real people is important, but can’t be done all the time! Online gaming has become a sensation! So many people are gaming now, that if you're not, you are missing out on an amazing experience. Some people think gaming is a waste of time, but the same can be said for any indoor leisure activity, everybody needs a fun activity they can do anytime! Besides everybody likes having fun! Some people believe the ludicrous notion that technology is making people into fat, lifeless losers, but, it is the opposite, you can socialize online and meet new people. People can balance computers and games, with exercise and sports. With computers you can efficiently complete work and learn new skills! Computers are positive if used correctly. I hope you like this article, thanks for reading and considering my point of view.

Dear sir, I believe that computers are great for society. There are lots of benefits to having a computer to use. You can talk to people online with instant messaging, which is a lot more dependable than a telephone or cell phone. Lots of times people don't answer the phone when you need them, but with a computer you can send a message from the computer directly to the person's cellular device. You can learn a lot from a computer, such as things about the world and people around the world; you can learn things from the internet your teacher can't even teach you. Then you can study and expand your knowledge independently. It is a problem if you're on the computer more than you exercise, but with technology today you can get exercise while using a computer. You can play music from it while you workout, or watch a movie while running on a treadmill. Even though people go on the computer too much, there are ways to exercise and use the computer at the same time. So there are ups and downs, but in the end, it doesn't matter how much you use the computer because you can get exercise simultaneously, which is why I think it is a benefit to have computers today.

Recently, there has been debate about whether or not computers benefit society. Although each side has its own reasons, computers do have a positive effect on people and on society. Computers are beneficial in several ways. With the use of computers, you have the ability to research and learn about foreign and local places, you are able to communicate with others, and they help people complete everyday tasks. At one point in everyone's lives, you need to know about local or even foreign places. It is completely unrealistic for someone to travel to every place they need to know about. This is where computers come in. Over the internet, you can research everything from the main staple of the diet in a distant country all the way to the day of the new year in another nation. You learn about things in the comfort of your home, or of your home town. I remember once in fifth grade I had to do a research project on ancient Egypt. By going on the computer, I learned all I needed to know and then some. The project was a breeze, and I got a perfect score. Also, you can learn about local upcoming events, and about the world around you. During childhood, every kid has many questions, some their parents might not be able to answer. Using the computer is a quick and easy way to get these answers. Computers help educate the minds of people and without them, we might not know anything. Communicating with people on the other side of the world is difficult. Mailing a letter could take weeks to reach the recipient. Computers provide us with an immediate method of communicating with others whether they are local or far away. Last year, my uncle moved to another state for work. I never got to see him. We communicated with each other over computers, and when he came home for Christmas, we were as close to each other as we were before he left. Computers kept our relationship healthy and I do not think it would have been that way without them. Scientists say that about eighty percent of all adults have communicated with someone at least once through computers. They also say that half of these people regularly use this method of communicating. Although we still use phones and "snail mail", I do not believe that our society would be able to function socially without the available use of computers. Everyday, computers are helping people get through their days with minimal problems. People get things done quicker, giving people more time to do what matters most, interacting with their families. Without computers, everyday business would take about twice as long leaving less time for the fun things in life. My neighbor, said "taxes and banking are so time consuming. I do not know that I would be able to handle it without the ability to do my banking online." In addition to taxes and banking, computers help with everything from shopping to working for the perfect phone company to use for your new business. Having the ability to shop and browse online takes away driving, walking and checkout line time letting you relax and take your time throughout the rest of your day. Typing also gives you hand-eye coordination; without it, you wouldn't be able to do everyday things such as opening the door to playing sports outside with your children. Using computers helps people get through their lives easier and more efficiently, and I could not even imagine life without them. Computers benefit the people of society in every possible way. By helping them obtain knowledge, purifying and strengthening relationships through constant communication ability, and helping make their everyday lives easier, they have a purely positive effect on people everywhere. Computers have a great effect on people and should continue to be used in everyday society.

Dear Local Newspaper, did you know that more than half the students in the world use the computer to study? I think that people don't spend a lot of time on the computer. And even if they are, it's for studying, learning, or catching up with old friends. Here are some reasons why I think that computers have good effects on people. Most kids use computers to learn about things they are doing in class. And they also use the computer to study about a country or a person they are doing a report on. Also there are games on the computer that can help you with math and other subjects. Now onto my second reason. You can also use the computer to send emails to friends that live far away, and also you could use things like Facebook to find friends that had moved away. And you could also use a video camera to video chat with a friend or if you are a business man or woman you could video chat with clients all across the country. Now onto my third and final reason. Computers also have applications like Microsoft Word which lets you type things such as essays or term papers instead of having to write them out by hand. Also there is an application that lets you make a PowerPoint if you need to make one for a project. And there is an application that lets you paint pictures or draw pictures, which is great for art projects. Those are some reasons why I think that computers have good effects on people. If we didn't have computers the world would be very different; kids wouldn't be able to search things for projects or type essays. And you wouldn't be able to keep contact with someone who moved away. Also you wouldn't be able to make PowerPoints for projects or create digital art. And that is why I think computers have a good effect on people.

Dear Editor, I think computers are one of the most important inventions ever. They help education, make everything easier, and traveling is simpler. It helps education because teachers always use computers to help kids learn important information. For example if we have to study for something there are websites specially made for studying. Also there are sites to teach little kids how to read or write. Almost all schools have computers these days. Some schools even give computers to kids so they can use them to study. A large percentage of teachers in the U.S. use computers more than textbooks and get high test scores. That's why computers help education. A second reason is it generally makes everything easier. For example instead of writing an essay for school and having it take hours until your hand is sore only to find out it's filled with misspelled words, you can type it quickly and use spell check. I have never heard one person say that the computer hasn't made life easier. Another example is if you had to find some information on your new dog. Instead of going to your library spending minutes, you can simply open up your internet and then search it and find the info you need in seconds. That's why the computer makes everything easier. The last reason is that traveling is so much simpler with a computer. Without it you have to go to an airport to buy tickets. In fact I don't even remember what it was like to not book travel online with a computer; all you have to do is go to the airline's website and then buy it from there. It's so easy to arrange travel to places, but sending mail is also simpler. I haven't sent a postcard in years. Instead I send email. It is quicker, easier and more reliable. That is why traveling and mail is easier. Overall the computer is one of the most helpful things ever and with technology upgrading daily soon it will be even easier to do things. While too much computer is bad and people shouldn't only interact with the internet, the computer comes in handy almost all the time. That is why I think the computer is important.

Dear Editor, There has been lots of talk and arguments about computers and whether they benefit society. I believe it does benefit society. One reason is because you can communicate with others. Another reason is there are many things to do on these computers or even the world wide web. Having computers is always handy. You can talk or web chat with friends. This one time online I found my old friend from elementary school, that I hadn't seen in five years. Whenever I come home from school I'll go on the computer and talk to all my friends. The computer is a great place to make plans or to catch up with some buddies. My next reason for why they benefit society is there is so much to do. It's like an at-home amusement park. The internet is a wonderful thing, whether to do homework or play games. Even some evenings I'll just sit down for two or three hours and just play a game. But, I still exercise daily. Yes, computers can get addicting but, it's always good to go outside and exercise. Many people say over half of the country's population has a computer, and a significant portion check email or go on the computer every ten minutes. Yes it's not healthy but it's their decision. In conclusion I believe computers are indeed beneficial. I have stated many reasons why, such as they are great for communication or catching up with some friends; also there is an infinite amount of things to do. So if you don't have a computer go out and get one. They will be worth your while.

Dear Newspaper Editor, The average American uses the computer at least once every day. These machines definitely benefit society, with them people can easily learn about faraway places, learn without having to carry heavy books and papers, and chat with people all over the country and sometimes even the world. First of all, computers can teach you all about the world without you having to go to a library apart for a book. Free sites like Wikipedia provide fast knowledge on most anything; you can use these sites for essays, trip planning, and just to satisfy your curiosity. Some people believe that computers prevent people from exercising and enjoying nature; however, computers actually promote exercise and going out to look at nature. Computers provide quick and easy access to travel agencies, as well as information on popular tourist areas in any region. They also bring advertising for gyms and ideas on exercising at home. Computers don't hinder workouts and nature walks; they make it easier to do them. But computers make other things easier as well. Schoolwork can be much easier with the use of computers. Instead of dragging around heavy books, students can carry a small laptop; students also can stop worrying about keeping track of papers because everything can be saved to a laptop. Computers organize files so even a messy student can keep organized. Another advantage is that anything typed on a computer is neat and easy to understand, unlike some handwriting. The laptop program in our school district is an example of how schools can be simplified with laptops. Each student is given one to use instead of books. "It is so much easier," said one student. Schoolwork is very difficult for some kids, and computers can make it simpler. My last argument is that people can talk to anyone using chat sites. If someone has a cousin in a distant country, they can still keep in touch. It's the same for friends who moved. E-mail is a lot faster than traditional postal mail. The process of mail carriers taking a letter from one person to another is slow, whereas an e-mail is almost instantaneous. It is also more private; unlike mail that is just sealed with glue, e-mails are password protected. There are also other sites that are for socializing. Instant messages also allow people to talk with one another. This can help people learn about culture in other cities, states, and sometimes even different countries. These sites can help close the gap between cultures; they can help get rid of racism and can help make the world more ideal. Computers make our community better. They let us learn about faraway places, make it easier to enjoy schoolwork, and enable us to talk to other people from almost anywhere. So, don't worry about anything, you'll realize computers truly are beneficial to our society.

Computers are the future. Computers are the best technology we've created. They allow us to improve our hand-eye coordination, learn about faraway people and places, and connect with our friends. Computers improve our hand-eye coordination; typing is a good way to improve this vital skill by not looking and knowing which buttons are where. Using a mouse is also a good way to improve coordination by moving the digital mouse with the one in your hand. This can improve writing, because you are moving the pen in your hand the same way you would move a mouse or type. This can also help with driving, because you can't look at the wheel, you have to keep your eyes on the road, and in order to do that you must know how you're moving the wheel. Computers can help hand-eye coordination which can help with writing and driving, with typing and moving a mouse. Computers can increase our knowledge about faraway places and people. Cultures come in a variety, and we can learn about all of them from the comfort of our own home. We can also learn about nature from our home. Learning about different cultures can teach us many things, like what kind of clothes they wore, food they ate, and places they lived in. This allows us to change our own culture by getting inspired from others. Learning about new places can help broaden the mind about other spots in the world that can lead to a vacation. Lastly, computers allow us to interact with friends from our chairs. Chatting, e-mailing, and video chatting are all great ways to interact. With a webcam you can even see the other person as if you were face-to-face with them. You can also e-mail important files, such as pictures, documents, and even videos. This can help with someone's job by sharing work quickly. In conclusion, computers can teach us hand-eye coordination, can teach us about faraway places and people, and lets us interact and share with friends. Computers are a very important part of my life and our modern world.

Dear Editor, More and more people use computers, but not everyone agrees that this benefits society. Those who support advances in technology believe that computers have a positive effect on people like me. They teach hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to learn about faraway places and people, and they even allow people to talk online with other people. I will tell you why we should benefit from these computers. The first reason is computers teach hand-eye coordination. You can learn how to type really fast, which requires your eyes and hands to work together. Without hand-eye coordination, how are you supposed to hit a ball coming at you with a bat, or how are you supposed to catch a ball with your hands? These are skills used in sports that computers can help develop. The second reason is you can learn about far away places and people. Like how we are in the United States and we want to learn about Japan. Or say that we are in France and we want to know about the German people; we can look it up. We don't go all the way down there just to see the German people; we look it up online. Now think about it, you aren't just going to fly there and come back the same day. The last thing is you can talk online to anybody you want from Africa to the US all the way to Australia. You can have conversations and share ideas instantly. So you see computers are really special because you see, you don't want to write someone a million things by hand; it is not right, so we need computers to communicate efficiently in our modern world.

Dear Reader, did you know that a large percentage of Americans spend too much time on their computers? I believe people should spend more time outside with their family. This overuse can certainly lead to brain problems, a hard time seeing, and the biggest thing is death. First of all, there are people with brain problems because they are on the computer too much. When they are out with their family, they think of their computer. People stay on their computer for a non-stop amount of time, which can affect their mental focus. In a recent survey, it showed that teenagers stay on the computers the most. Most people don't have a life outside their computer room, missing out on real social interaction. Most of all, eye doctors have been getting calls from parents. They are worried that their child or children have a hard time seeing. I interviewed an eye doctor and this is what he had to say: "I had one child come into my office and he had the hardest time seeing." He asked the kid's mother why is he having a hard time seeing and she said, "My son spends on average three and a half hours on the computer." The child had to get a pair of special glasses so that he could see better. These glasses are really expensive, adding a financial burden. I have read about children and adults dying from using the computer too much. They have fried their brain from using the computer too much, leading to dangerous behavior. Their brain tells them to do things that are illegal. For example: breaking into homes, killing people, and hijacking cars. I heard one kid used the computer so much that he started to kill people and got shot by a cop. The more people die from using the computer too much, the higher the death toll will be. It is now or never for my friends out there to work together on cutting down on how much we use the computer. I'm sure that no one wants to be part of the death toll until we really have to. It is time to go outside and have fun with your family. They miss spending time with you, so get off your butt and go outside. But wait, make sure you turn your computer off so that you are not tempted to go back on it and can fully enjoy the outdoors.

To the Editor, I have recently heard that some people think that computers don't benefit society. However, I disagree with that. First, it allows children and adults to learn about distant places and other things. Also, it allows family and friends to connect with other family and friends. And lastly, it is a form of entertainment on a day that you can't go outside. Some people might not agree with me; however, I believe the computer wasn't a waste of thought. I think the computer is a benefit to society and the whole world. First, the computer allows children and adults to learn about distant places and other things. People, professors, historians, and other highly educated people post discoveries and information about things every day. That means every day someone can learn something new every day of their life. When I do research on an important person in history, I learn things I never learned in school. The computer is the best way to allow people to put info they've learned for other people to see and gain knowledge from each other; these are endless possibilities for everyone who owns a computer to learn. You wouldn't believe the things you can learn on a computer, from science to art. Also, the computer allows family and friends to stay in touch with other family and friends in far away places. If there were no computers and some of your family moved to a different country, there wouldn't be an efficient way to stay in touch with them. The computer allows you to send e-mail to a family's computer or cellular phones. The computer is the best way to stay close to your family even though they are far away. My brother is in college and every day I get on the computer when I get home and video chat with him. If there was no computer, I wouldn't be able to chat with my brother and see his face. Lastly, the computer allows a form of entertainment on a rainy day. Certain software gives people the chance to create games and post them online to the public. When I can't go outside because of the weather, I get on my computer and play video games. The games keep me company and engaged. I can even play with other people with online multiplayer, making it a social activity. Some of the games are educational also, teaching you different things about history and problem-solving, which adds to their value.

Dear Newspaper, Advances in technology, while amazing, don't always have a positive effect on society. That is why, I honestly believe computers do not benefit my community. For instance, computers can be very dangerous and people these days just seem to spend too much time using them! Not to mention, computers cost way too much money. To begin, my mom and dad always say, "don't talk to strangers," when I go out. I think they should say the same when I go to use my computer. Computers can truly be dangerous for someone who isn't careful. For example, online predators often depict themselves as someone they aren't, like a friendly peer. Therefore, you can't ever really trust someone you simply met in a chat room. Also, cyber bullying is another problem computers put people at risk for, where hurtful messages can be sent anonymously. Another danger computers have, is anything posted on the internet can be accessed by almost anyone. This includes pictures, blogs, comments and other personal information, which can be hard to remove completely. I believe society would be better off without the constant worry of a computer! Secondly, people, especially the younger generation, spend excessive amounts of time on computers. Some people spend hours each day using a computer when they could be doing an activity that actually benefited them, like playing sports or reading a book. If people spent just as much time helping their community as they did on the computer, the world would be a much better place to live. Not to mention, it would bring people closer to one another through real interaction. Computers seem to control peoples' lives and that just isn't healthy. I think people should spend more time living and less time with their faces glued to a computer screen! Lastly, computers are like vampires, sucking away your money. In today's economy people need to be saving their money for college or even simpler things like a new pair of shoes! Additionaly, at the rate that technology advances, even the most high-tech computers are out of date in a year or two and a new one is needed to keep up. Also, computers' prices are constantly rising, along with the cost of software and repairs. It is very hard to keep up! I strongly believe computers are a waste of money and bring society down. All in all, computers just are a negative attribute in communities across the nation. First off they can be dangerous. Secondly, they are too time consuming and, thirdly, computers are too expensive. Computers just simply are a hassle in today's world.

Imagine this: You entered a raffle at your child's school for an all-expense paid trip to Hawaii, and you won! You are so excited until you realize you know nothing about Hawaii. You don't know what the weather is like, you don't know what kinds of food they eat. You're not quite sure how to prepare for the trip. So you go online and learn everything and anything about Hawaii. You pack appropriatly, and you have a great time. All because you had a computor. Computers can help you get a better education, no matter what your age. It also gives you the ability to keep in touch with friends and family, and are necessary for many jobs. Computers help many people learn about different countries and cultures. We know so much more about other places now than we did before computers. But computers can teach you so much more than just different countries. They can teach a whole new language, or help you understand the science lesson better. There are many online colleges where you can learn the lessons online and on your own time which is good if your really busy with work or family. The internet is a great way to keep in touch with your friends and family. You can use email, instant messaging, video chatting, or you can make an account on websites like facebook or myspace. For example, my cousin is in the navy, he has been for three years, and before I got a facebook, I had lost touch. Now I talk to him all the time and see his photos. When most people hear computers, the first thing that pops into their head is "internet". But that's not all a computer is good for. Nowadays, many jobs use computers. Banks, offices, teachers, engineers, even cashiers. Computers are no longer a luxury; they have become a necesity. In fact, eight out of ten jobs require a computer. Computers allow you to type up that book report, or make a very important letter look professional with different fonts. Computers have changed the world; and once it's changed there's no going back. So, it looks like access to a computer made that trip to Hawaii easier and more enjoyable. Clearly, computers have become a part of every day life. You can keep in touch with your friends and use it for your job. But most importantly, you can learn so much from the comfort of your own home.

To the Middlebury paper, regarding the article on whether or not computers benefit society, my opinion is that they have lots of significant pros to make them a worthwhile thing to have in our towns, schools, homes, and businesses. They can help more than they hurt, and can you honestly see your life without checking e-mails and keeping up to date with our society? For example, a student can study their math facts online for math class or learn about the skeletal system for health classes. It also is an advantage in conserving money because instead of having to pay for your son or daughter to fly to Rome to learn about the Colosseum, you can let them learn about it on the internet first, to see if the trip is actually worthwhile. Also an essential thing needed for life is hand-eye coordination, and a way to practice that is by playing exercise practice games on a computer. That helps instill the coordination your towns children will use for the rest of their lives! Educational benefits will only increase as technology improves, so cutting children from it now is a big mistake! With computers, communication is a breeze. Students can get homework assignments through their e-mail, saving time so they have more time for studying coming up. Keeping in touch with families is simplified also because in just one e-mail you can catch up with all your family members! In addressing concerns, you can't place the blame on computers for why people don't exercise as much. People choose how much they exercise, not the computers. Computers don't control whether you see family or not. If anything they help bring people together! Spending time in nature is that particular person's choice, no one else's. All these cons can't be blamed on computers, because its the people that decide how much they're used, not the computer. All in all, I think keeping our use of computers where it is now is the best idea, because without it communication and education will decrease and with that, who says exercising will increase?! Overall the choice is the computer's user, not the computer, so when used in discretion, computers contribute greatly to society.

Dear Editor, it has come to my attention that certain members of our society believe that computers are not beneficial. This position comes from a lack of judgement and a closed mind. Computers are lifelines to business workers who use them to complete all of their work; these tools also enable news of disaster or weather to spread efficiently and effectively. These technological devices also create and sustain communication between family members and friends. In today's society computers are vital and getting rid of them would be like stopping oxygen from making its way to the body, being accompanied by multiple severe consequences. First and foremost, a large percentage of all modern companies require their employees to work on computers. These works of art aren't just handy-dandy toys, rather they are essential to the working class like a pencil is to a student taking a test. John, an owner of a small business, agrees. "My company designs software and uses computers daily. Many of my employees work from home and have to own computers." The growth of computers is not something to be frowned upon, rather an achievement in technology enhancing the lives of others. By ripping our computers from the lives of workers chaos would be created with many unappealing consequences. Adults aren't the only ones whose jobs consist of computers. Nowadays students' homework is mostly online; computers decrease the amount of time needed to write an essay and are a boon to students of all ages. Sarah, an eighth grader at the local middle school, is an example of this. Every night she has at least three hours of homework and usually one hour of it requires a computer; however, this isn't a problem because it cuts back the time it takes for Sarah to do her homework. She can quickly type up an English essay or research a science topic instead of doing it painstakingly slow using an old fashioned method. Moreover, computers are doors into the real world, especially for residents of our town. Whether some people like to believe it or not, our town is a bit of a secluded area where people aren't always aware of what is going on outside of their closed off town. Computers cause news to spread like electricity and open our residents' eyes to national and global problems. Tom, another student at the high school, states, "When the earthquake took place in Japan my friends and I were all at lunch, and when we came back to class our teacher was projecting the news via her computer onto the white board." If computers were taken away a stream of knowledge would be cut off from adults and children. Most importantly, computers create communication between friends and family; calling up to talk to someone isn't always an option, so computers are the better choice. Families can connect with each other no matter if they have cell phone reception or what area of the world they are in. Emily is a senior at our local high school who agrees. "When I go to college next year I am going all the way to California and want to be able to talk to my family; via email and instant message I can contact them even when its inconvenient because they don't have to respond right away." Emily brings up a good point; computers serve the luxury of communication, which is vital to keep a majority of healthy relationships, as shows a study at the university. In conclusion, computers are an incredible piece of equipment that should be valued and not taken away. They are vital to workers and students and bring news to residents of any corner of the world. Computers also are how friends and family are able to stay connected and communicate. Therefore, I urge you, readers of the newspaper, to raise your voice about the benefits of computers, so they aren't taken away from our society.

"Hello? Are you there?" "Can you hear me?" You never have that issue with computers. It has come to my understanding that there is a dispute about the benefits of computers - should we have them and advance them, or not? Well, I believe that computers are a necessity to an average person. Computers help everyone, and make life easier! Sure, there are cellphones and other helpful electronics, but do they always prove trustworthy? Computers are always reliable - whether it's for homework or another reason! Computers provide easy interaction without breakups, they make it easier to learn, and if you are smart then they are safe. Without computers, who knows where our society would be? To begin, computers allow people to have conversations with others that are halfway across the world! There are a variety of applications that you can choose from, and they are all easy to use. My personally preferred option is email. I myself have family in Europe, which is a whole continent away! Sure, I could call them, but my phone bill would be through the roof! How else am I supposed to keep in touch with my loved ones? Do you know how many others face the same problem? Through a recent study, three out of four families in our state say they have relatives that are far away. That is a large percentage of the population! Imagine there was no computer for them to use. Phone companies would be rolling in money and regular families would be living on the streets. Or worse - they would lose any relationship with their family. Do you want that? Computers are easy to access, and you can interact with loved ones, friends, or new people. It doesn't get any better than that! So, which would you choose - losing your family relations or keeping in touch via email and computer applications? If that isn't enough, computers make it easy to learn new things and accomplish tasks. I know that as a student, other students and I need to type our homework at least three times a week! Just yesterday I had to type up a response, a free writing choice, and an entry for a history project. Imagine if we had to go back to using typewriters. Either homework wouldn't be done or everyone would have a major lack of sleep. Both options are unacceptable. Plus, computers are great for research. If you have to look up a new country, look at far away colleges or find out about the world, why not visit your handy computer? You could learn which college is right for you without leaving your house. You could visit a new country without leaving town! Sure, you could read a newspaper, but answer me this: where does the paper come from? Yup, trees are killed for them. Computers are the easy, environment friendly alternative for you. If those two reasons didn't convince you, maybe this one will. Most people think computers are unsafe, and that may be partly true. But if you are smart or listen in school like me, you will know that isn't always the case. In our school, we are taught about the risks of computers, and how to prevent any possible dangers. I'm sure most schools do. In fact, nine out of ten students say that when it comes to safety, computers are rated an A+. Everyone knows about hackers, and so we avoid them. My parents even say that for over thirty years they have never had a single issue or risk of safety when using a computer, and neither have I. "Dangers are only powerful if you let them be, and let them take control," says Dr. Evans, an expert on the subject. So, if it's safety you are worried about, then don't. The kids of today, and tomorrow, know what is out there, and how to stop the minor risks. So, why don't we recap what we learned today. Are computers helpful and the best way to go for communication? Yes, they are. What is the best way to learn new things easily? I believe the correct answer is computers. What are safe even if some don't agree? It wasn't phones... no, not television... oh yes, computers! I see why you might think no, they should be outside, well let me tell you, cellphones and t.v. will keep them from that anyway. At least computers don't rot your brain. Well, I have done my part. I support computers, and their advancement. But it isn't up to me, is it? No, it's not. So please do your part by spreading the word. It's the right thing to do. You know that you want to!

More and more people use computers, but not everyone agrees that this benefits society. I feel that those people that think computers do not benefit society, are right. I feel this way because people need to start exercising more, and interact with family and friends in person. Also, they should get out and enjoy life. If they don't, they will most likely eat more and gain a lot of unwanted fat. Also, some of them don't even exercise at all, choosing to remain sedentary for hours. Secondly, they don't interact with their family and friends as much in a meaningful way. Those people tend to probably argue with their family because they had to get off of the computer. When you fight with people you want to get away from it so you go back to the computer. It's not healthy to be on the computer for long periods at a time, as it can strain relationships. Lastly, they should enjoy life. See the world through their own eyes, not through a screen. Party with friends and family in person. Go to college and do something with their lives that is active and engaging. They need to enjoy things how they originally were without any computers, iPods, or even cellphones, experiencing the world directly. In conclusion, the reasons I feel this way are because people need to exercise more, and interact with family and friends directly. Also, they need to enjoy life beyond the digital realm. I hope you understand as to why I feel this way and consider the importance of a balanced life.

I believe that people spending too much time on computers can negatively affect their health and the relationships they have with friends and family. If you are immersed in the computer and one of your friends asks you to go outside, you are most likely to say no because the computer is grabbing your attention more than the prospect of going outside. That refusal hurts your health by keeping you sedentary and damages your relationship with your friend. Similarly, if your family is going to a movie to have family time, you might choose to stay home on the computer instead. That decision directly affects the bond you share with your family. Most people would rather stay on the computer than spend time working out. This pattern effects your health because often when you are on the computer for a long time you end up feeling hungry and keep eating and eating; since you are not working out, you can easily gain weight. You are not exercising and you just keep consuming snacks. Since you are not being physically active and your mind is always focused on the computer, your body can become weak and you can get sick. That is a primary reason why many people are not healthy today. Computers can mess up your relationships with family and friends. Sometimes your friend can ask you to go outside or to work out and you say no because you are preoccupied with the computer, which strains your friendship. Or your family could be having a movie night and you remain on the computer while they leave without you. That is actively messing up the relationship with your family. Furthermore, being on the computer can lead you to go nights without sleeping. If you are playing a really engaging game and it comes time for you to take a rest, the game's fun can compel you to forgo sleep. After a while, this can become an addiction and you won't stop playing. Consequently, you won't get adequate sleep and if you have school the next day, you won't be able to concentrate, being too busy worrying about the game. So that is why computers aren't so good for us. They can mess up your physical health, they can damage your social life with family and friends, and they can cause sleep deprivation that hinders your ability to focus.

Dear local newspaper, "Get off that computer, it is time for dinner!" But mom, I don't want to, I'm in the middle of a game. Does that conversation sound familiar? Of course it does, as every kid likes to play on the computer. However, noticing your kid being on the computer for excessive hours is not a good thing. In this matter, experts are definitely right because kids and adults are spending too much time on the computer. These people could be doing other beneficial things like exercising more, enjoying nature, and interacting with friends and family. Spending too much time on the computer is simply not healthy. On the other hand, if someone kicks you off the computer, you can always use that time to get that six-pack you wanted. There are three main things that can get you in shape. First, taking a light run every night on your community track can transform your legs from being fatigued every time you walk up the stairs to being firm and able to run lap after lap just for a warm-up. Every year my dad takes me to the track in the summer and times me for the forty and one-hundred yard dash, the four-hundred meter, and the mile run. Between the months I train all the way up to the final assessment, then my dad does another evaluation. I do this training because I play baseball. Weight lifting is another excellent way to get in shape. Some basic exercises are bench pressing, squatting, and dumbbell curls. There are more challenging exercises, but I won't go into that here. Once you feel like you are in shape, take all of that training and put it into playing a sport. Exercising is not the only thing you can do; enjoying nature is another wonderful option. Just go outside if someone kicks you off your computer. Absorb everything about the nature around you, from the squirrels to the trees. If you are in the winter, enjoy the snow instead of being inside all day playing computer games. But, if that doesn't work out for you, then hang out with your family. Hanging out with your family can be a rewarding thing to do. Gather your family and plan a trip together. You can go to a baseball game, a park, or the movies—anything that will get you away from that computer screen. That is my opinion on why I think people should get exercise, enjoy nature, and spend quality time with their families instead of being on the computer constantly.

One girl sits by her computer doing homework. Another girl with her computer talks to her friends. Those girls are doing activities that make our world more productive. I think that computers have a positive effect on people. Computers help people with hand-eye coordination, learn about faraway places, and talk with others online. This is what computers can do to help our society become better. Firstly, the computer can teach us valuable hand-eye coordination. By playing various games, we can use the skills we learn in real life. A boy can play football online, then take what he learned about timing and reflexes and use that in a real football game. Hand-eye coordination developed on the computer can help us to learn new things about our society and our own capabilities. We could use what we learned to discover new things and help us to improve the community as a whole. These skills can also help us do more things at once. Multitasking is a difficult task to master, and with good hand-eye coordination and computer practice, it becomes easier. A second productive task computers can help us with is learning about the world. Some people don't know what is going on in other countries; the computer can direct us to news and information instantly. The computer is literally like one huge library for us to use. Another positive effect that computers have on people is communication. Many people have a Twitter, Facebook, Myspace, etc., and all those websites can help them stay connected. Products like Skype, video chat, AIM, and email allow people to have conversations online. Email is something that facilitates so many new ideas. You cannot only talk, you can do business, send pictures, invitations, and announcements. Schools, offices, and companies all over the world use these products and it doesn't only make society better, it makes the entire world better. In conclusion, computers do have a positive effect on people around the world. They can help with hand-eye coordination, help you learn about far away places, and they help people communicate effectively. That one girl doing her homework gets an A and the girl talking on her computer signs off to be with her family.

Dear Newspaper Editor, I believe computers and excelling technology benefit society because they can help with hand-eye coordination, they provide an easy way to learn about faraway places and cultures, and they allow you to save and use your time more wisely. First of all, every person needs hand-eye coordination; if you didn't have it, you would either throw a ball in the complete other direction or you would get hit in the face with it. Computers benefit children's education too, as they can help you discover and learn about far away places from the comfort of your home. For example, if a student is studying a famous explorer in their history class, a renowned author in English class, or maybe a composer in music class, instead of pulling out the old, dusty biography book, it would be easier and faster to look them up on a search engine. Lastly, the computer benefits everyday working people or stay-at-home parents because if you have to get in contact with a certain person or business quickly, you don't have to take the chance of looking in a phone book and finding the listing is not there. You can just go to a search website, type in a last name or business name, and you are all set. Also, if your child is being a nuisance screaming and running around the house, you can just set them up with an educational game so you can get your household chores finished without interruption. Those are three of the most important reasons why I think computers benefit society. They are hand-eye coordination, innovative learning techniques, and saving everyday people valuable time.

Dear Newspaper Editor, I think computers have a bad effect on people for three main reasons. One, they can really hurt your eyes. Two, they can pose safety risks if you have little kids in your house. Finally, three, you will never see your family or friends if you are always on the computer. The first reason computers have a bad effect on people is that they can really hurt your eyes. If you are always staring at a computer screen all the time, you can strain your vision and potentially cause long-term damage. With you having bad eyesight, you can even be more prone to accidents and serious head injuries just from the disorientation caused by hurting your eyes. The second reason why computers have a bad effect on people is that they are not safe if you have little kids in your home. For instance, you could be watching an adult movie that little kids are not old enough to see, and this exposure can have a bad effect on them. It has a bad effect on people because you will have no control over what they see, and if you have a little kid in your house he will always be curious and he will probably hear something really, really inappropriate, like adult music or language, if you are not careful about what you access with a kid in the house. The third reason was that computers have bad effects on people is that if you are always on a computer, you will never see your family and friends. If you are always on the computers you will miss out on the important moments and shared experiences. You will never engage with your loved ones and don't pay the rent of attention they deserve because you are focused on the computers. You forget what your family looks like and you fail to keep the little kid with you engaged in the house. And last, the solution is simple: get off the computer and go see your family and friends in person.

In today's day and age, computers are a key part of business, education, and recreation and they benefit our society. First of all, you can get a better education learning from them, also, it is a great way to communicate with people. Finally, it even teaches hand-eye coordination that you could use in your everyday life. My first point is that you can get a better education using them. For example, the textbooks that we use in social studies at our school still refers to the Soviet Union as the USSR. Computers are a great way to get up-to-date information about the world. "With our outdated textbooks in school, the Internet is our number one recourse to get information," said Mr. Jones, an eighth grade teacher. With computers, you can learn about far away places without leaving the comfort of your own home. In addition to getting a great education from them, computers are an excellent form of communication. I remember when I was in fifth grade and my father was across the world on a business trip. Our phones couldn't call long distance so we relied on computers to communicate with each other. This helped me get over my father's absence. When you use a computer to communicate you are also saving money. "You can save over five hundred dollars a year when you use the Internet to communicate over a cell phone," stated Jane Smith, an electronics expert. Finally, the use of a computer increases hand-eye coordination. With all the typing you do on a keyboard, your hand dexterity increases by the second. In fact, "seventy-five percent of computer users are more coordinated throughout their day, opposed to people who don't own a computer," according to a recent poll in the New York Times. And in this day and age hand-eye coordination is a necessity. Besides, wouldn't you like to have the ability to have your hands work without having to look at them? So as you can see, computers would benefit society and everyone who uses them. They are a great benefit that students need for their education and business. Thank you for listening.

Dear Editor, People like computers, it is a known fact. They are very much like a drug, addicting and irresistible. Despite what people believe though computers are very good for our daily lives. You can communicate, play games, listen to music, watch movies, even learn a language on the computers. So in all ways, the computer is anything but bad. Video games are fun. They help us relax. In today's age, traditional games just don't give people the joy they experienced when younger. Computer games, they are the replacement. Imagine playing baseball with a friend who lives miles away from you, while still being a kid in your own living room, or set in your exercise adventure. Computer games broke the border giving you a higher level of interaction. "You got mail." Many people hear that sentence more than once everyday. By many, I mean millions. It is an alert saying that someone sent you an email. Emails are messages sent over the Internet, faster than any postal service. Instead of waiting three days for a letter, in a matter of minutes you can have a message sent to your friends. Microsoft Outlook, Gmail, and other electronic messaging systems are a superior form of communication; these let us speak to the world! Although it sounds silly, if you wanted to, you could send a message to anyone with a message box. Let's say you went to watch a certain movie, but you don't own it. With a computer with a DVD drive, you can watch any film. Better yet, you can download the movies; media are available online, with you able to watch them with the click of the mouse. Computers are filled to the top with gadgets and accessories that make our life easier. Games, movies, emails—anything you need is likely on a computer. They are the perfect tools in modern society.

Dear Editor: Some people believe computers benefit society. However, others feel they are too consuming. I, for one, believe computers help society. Computers teach hand-eye coordination, give people information, and even allow people to chat online with others. I'd bet your job requires you to use a computer; you probably even have a personal computer which you like to use to chat with friends. I do that all the time and I like it. Another thing I like are sports. One of my favorite sports is softball. In softball you need to have hand-eye coordination; this will help you swing at the ball more accurately. When a pitcher throws the ball you have to hold the bat at the right angle and watch the ball to know when to swing. If kids used computers and became good at hand-eye coordination, then possibly more kids would join a local sports team, and possibly even join a travel team. Do you like to travel? I do, and the way I learn about places before I go is by looking that particular place up on the internet. About three years ago I went on vacation to Florida. I wanted to know what it was like there because I had never gone before, so when I looked it up I found out that they had many tourist attractions and "packages" that let you swim with dolphins. I was very excited to go and when I did, I had a blast, and to think if I didn't look it up I would not have known what kinds of fun things they had! No wonder so many people like computers! One of the biggest reasons why I like computers is because I can chat with my friends online; one main attraction online is Facebook. Everybody, primarily, has one. Some people have one because they like to look at pictures. I have one because I like to chat with my friends. One night I was chatting with a friend; we were laughing having a great time, and then she reminded me that we had science homework due the very next day! I thanked her and then completed my work. You see if kids chat online their friends can remind them of important necessities such as homework. This could improve grades by fifteen percent! So you now see why society needs computers and if you have forgotten let me remind you: computers teach you hand-eye coordination, let you learn about faraway places and people, and now allow you to chat online. Just think what would society be like with no computers.

Computers are helpful in everyone's life. New things can be learned from them, such as historical facts or scientific concepts. They can provide a way to contact others through various platforms. And they make writing a lot easier by offering digital tools. Overall, they have a good effect on the world. Technology lets everyone explore new topics with ease. If something is typed into a search engine, results will pop up within seconds. Click on these, and information that is needed is displayed, from articles to videos. The computer is also helpful for research papers, allowing for efficient source gathering. The internet allows a more elaborate final draft through editing software. Learning benefits a grade in school or in work by improving outcomes. It is always good to be able to contact anyone who is wanted. With the computer, people are able to send emails, talk on social media, or even talk to a loved one on a webcam. On these platforms, pictures can be added so anyone who wasn't able to be at an event can now see what it was like. Webcams hooked up to the computer let people talk face to face with someone else they might not have seen in months. These are all good examples of why computers have a positive impact on the human race. Writing out papers can be a hard, tedious task. On the computer, it is possible to type out words and not have to get out an eraser for any spelling mistakes. These are picked up by spell check, which underlines errors. This way, no points are deducted for wrong spellings, improving the final score. Sometimes people have sloppy handwriting that is difficult to read. These difficulties can all be solved by a typing program on the computer, producing a clean document. Therefore computers must have a positive effect on people. They teach new things through online courses and tutorials. They allow people to contact others who are far away, bridging distances. They can also make grading a paper easy for teachers with clear text. This concludes that computers benefit the society we live in today.

Dear editor, Computers are becoming more and more prevalent in the community. People are spending too much time on computers instead of on other activities, an effect not beneficial to society. Because of computers, people have lacked exercise, missed enjoying nature and other parts of the world and forgotten about interacting with family and friends. Computers should be used in moderation and not in place of other important events in our lives. First of all, computer users receive significantly less exercise than those who do not use computers. According to a survey done by a health organization only a small percentage of computer users reported that they exercised at least once every week. In contrast, a much larger percentage of non-computer users (non-frequent computer users) reported that they exercised at least once every week. Can one imagine what it would be like if everyone was a loyal computer user? Nearly everybody would be overweight, lethargic from lack of sleep due to hours on the computer, and unworldly. Getting exercise is an essential part of everyone's life, and lacking it could be deleterious to one's health. Hopping off the computer and instead getting exercise, would make for a healthier and more fit country. Not only do computers deprive people of getting exercise, but they also prevent people from enjoying nature and other parts of the world. By traveling to new and unfamiliar places in the world, one is able to experience and learn about other cultures. Going on the internet may be a decent way to learn about other places, but actually feeling the ambiance and environment of a foreign place allows for a much more profound understanding of another place. For example, when I went to a foreign country for a vacation, I learned about the differences in traditions and culture. I saw the separation between the poor and the rich when I looked from humble shacks along the river to the portentous, elegant edifices scraping the sky. It was an experience I could not encounter on a computer. People should be able to enjoy the wonders and differences of the world not on a small screen of a computer, but through the screen of one's eyes. Lastly, computers inhibit people from interacting with family and friends. From my personal experiences, I tend to ignore friends and family when I am focused on the screen. Speaking, playing, and generally socializing with others is a critical part of everyone's life. Without this basic necessity people cannot be happy. In summary, computers should not be used in excess. This sort of use could lead to people getting less exercise, not fully experiencing the world, and loss of interaction with friends and family. To make a better country and nation, the people of the community should make an effort to reduce computer use.

Dear Editor, many people at my school sit on their computers after school. They don't go outside and enjoy nature. They don't visit with family and friends or even exercise. Many people are affected by this. Going outside can enhance your knowledge, you can go on a walk in the woods. When you are on your walk you might find interesting new species of insects or plants. Also when you are outside you can play with your friends or siblings. Often times in neighborhoods there are a lot of kids, you can start a pick up game of baseball. You can also build new things outdoors. You could find a big tree and build a treehouse or tire swing with your family. Going outside leaves you with a lot of fun activities to enjoy. When kids sit on the computer they don't interact with their family or friends. During the summer you can go to the beach with your friends. It will cool you down without having to pay money for an air conditioner. You might also find the opportunity to go to a different state for the day. Or you could go across the country to see your sick grandma or your newly named cousin. Going on a picnic will give you time to get to know new people. You could invite friends and have them bring a new friend for the whole group to meet. You will also have a lot of tasty food and who wouldn't want that? Going places with your family and friends can lead to a worth wild experience. A large percentage of kids chose to go on the computer than to exercise. Kids will become overweight from this lack of activity. When on the computer many kids will eat snacks constantly. Eating for hours each day is not a good idea for your health. You can go out for your schools basketball team or run distances in cross country. Once you are on the team you will make new friends, and get your exercise for the day. When you are on a team and exercising you will learn valuable life skills. You will learn the benefits of working as a team and by yourself. So getting your exercise is a very important role in your life. Why would you choose the computer? You wouldn't be able to enjoy the outdoors. Or spend time with family and friends. You would become over weight and unhappy. So, don't choose the computer, choose another activity that promotes health and happiness!

Computers have many positive effects on people these days, most of which are very good and can lead to you becoming more self-confident. Computers can educate people, from learning about some ancient historical figure to completing complex school projects. Also, computers entertain people too, offering a wide array of activities. Lastly, they can even increase your chances of finding a job or helping out with your current work. For most people, education is very important, but since kids don't stay in school all day, they often use the computer to learn; kids can learn about other places and cultures through interactive programs and websites. This benefits us because we're learning something new and growing our knowledge base. Also, kids can efficiently do their projects, for example, writing an essay, researching their science fair project, and so on. Lastly, kids can learn about people from other times, such as famous musicians from long ago, historical celebrities, legends, and hall of famers. People always look for some kind of entertainment, and the first place they often go is the computer. Everyone likes entertainment, and the computer is often the best plan. They could play a variety of games, from games based on the past or games set in the future. There is also a whole bunch of genres: multiplayer, puzzle, castle defense, sports, racing, arcade, and so on. Another fun thing to do is interact with friends online or even talk to family members who don't live near you. Lastly, you could watch funny videos, sad videos, and music videos. Another way that computers affect people is in their prospects of finding a job or getting help with their career. The computer can teach people what they will do on their job and what to expect from their role. Also, it can let you search for available jobs in your local area or beyond. Finally, it can help them by allowing them to create a professional web page or portfolio. In conclusion, computers have profoundly helped people. They can increase their education, give them entertainment, and even help out with their job or help them find a new one.

There have been many advancements in computer technology, and there are people who are for it and there are people who are against it. I am against it and I will tell you why. You spend less time exercising, which means you'll gain weight. You spend less time enjoying nature, which means you're lost with anything natural, and you spend less time with friends and family which probably proves you are disconnected. I am not saying the computer is a bad thing, but too much of it certainly is. First, you spend less time exercising. If you don't exercise you gain weight, you miss out on most of the physical activities you could have done, and you risk your health. This is a bad thing because you are not yourself anymore and if it goes too far you can't even move around easily. So if this sounds scary, you should plan your time on the computer so it doesn't happen to you; time is so limited that we waste it on stuff on computers, so think before you go on the computer—maybe you can go for a jog outside instead. Next, you spend less time enjoying nature. Nature is so beautiful but it is being destroyed and we do nothing. There are only a few hundred, maybe a few thousand, people who truly help the environment, and if you think about it, that is not a lot compared to the billions of people on earth. It is a crying shame to see something so beautiful die while most of us do nothing to help. Finally, you spend less time with friends and family. This is the most important reason of all, the main course if you will. Your family is so important because they are your best friends in the whole wide world. Your friends are important to them. Your family might leave you if you dedicate your life to the computer; if you ignore them they might feel neglected, so be careful. Your friends are just as important as your family; they both make you laugh, have good times with you, and cheer you up when you are upset. Just don't forget that as time goes by. Well, there you have it, my three reasons for being against working on the computer too much, and they all sound like good reasons, so let's recap it all, shall we? First, you spend less time exercising, which is very important. Next, you spend less time enjoying nature, which is also very important. Finally, you spend less time with friends or family, the most important of all. So I hope you enjoyed my essay and you've learned something from it. So remember, too much of a good thing is bad, and I'll just leave you with that thought.

Dear editor: Did you know that a significant percentage of people in the world have computers? These computers are definitely benefitting society. People need computers to get updated on important issues, contact others, and learn new information. Computers are necessary for everyday life. It's very important that news gets around, and one way for it to do that is by computers. Average people like me and you need to know the weather, global issues, and many other important topics. If you use the computer to get updated on important issues you will be able to access the information right away. For example, there is no need to wait for the weather to come on the television when you can find out the weather for your local area within seconds. Just recently there was an earthquake in a remote region and millions of civilians were affected. If a natural disaster was to happen somewhere nearby, people would need to know and computers are a great way to make sure everyone is updated. Not only does the computer help us get important updates on global issues, but it is also a great way to contact people. My relatives live very far away and we can't afford the long distance phone call charge, and so we e-mail them. A vast number of people contact far away friends and family by e-mail! The computer is also a great place for friends to contact each other through social networking sites, such as popular platforms. People need to interact with other people and the internet is a fantastic place to do that. Finally, computers can also be used to learn new information. If children need to find information for a project or essay they can easily search the internet and find an answer. Kids need to access the information that is necessary for school on the internet. Computers are useful for adults as well. If adults want to learn something new, all they have to do is search it on the computer. It's so much easier than going out to the library and finding that information in a book. Did you know that most adults use an online dictionary to find the definition of a word? Computers can find every answer to your questions. In conclusion, computers are really benefitting society. Computers can update you on important issues, help you contact people, and find out new information. These advances in technology are good for human society.

Dear Local Newspaper, Having home computers is a good thing for many reasons. One reason is because people can use computers to learn about other countries and people. People can also use computers to type and save paper. Also, people can use computers to talk to people living close or far away from you. Finally, computers can save paper by replacing books. One of the most important reasons why people need computers is because computers can help you learn about and research other things going on in the world. If a student needs to research a country and write a paper about it for school, it is much easier and faster to use a computer than to look through a textbook. Computers are also better and faster than a textbook if you want to know more about a person or a culture. Using computers to type is also faster than writing a paper by hand. Using a computer can save time and money when it comes to typing a paper. When you are typing a paper, you don't have to worry about your handwriting or breaking your pencil. You also don't have to worry about spelling something wrong because computers can check your spelling and grammar. When you are writing a paper by hand you have to think about all these problems and more. You also have to spend money on pencils and other writing supplies. Computers also saved people money because they didn't need to buy as much paper to make textbooks. Computers also evolved how people can communicate with each other. Before computers were invented, you couldn't easily talk to people in other countries unless you paid to use a phone or sent them mail. Now, you can send instant mail which saves days of time and paper. You can also use webcams to talk to family members and people you don't know. That can save you a lot of money because you don't have to pay money for postage stamps, phone calls, or plane rides to visit them. Those are some of the best reasons why having a home computer is better than not having one. A home computer can save you time when you want to research a country, person, or culture. They can save you money because you don't have to buy postage stamps, pay for phone calls, or pay for plane rides to visit someone from a different state or country. Computers also help save paper because you no longer need to make large textbooks or use a different piece of paper when you make a writing mistake.

In my opinion, I agree that it benefits society. The reasons that support my decision are that lots of businesses use computers to work, fast food restaurants use computers, and schools use computers. Computers are all needed just for those reasons. My first reason is businesses use computers to work. Workers use computers for designing, filing people's names, and to type papers and essays. People in the designing industry don't use paper and pencil anymore, because they use designing software to work. Instead of filing in a cabinet, people and workers use computers to store information about their patients, clients, and workers. Computers can hold more information and files than cabinets can. People also type papers and essays for work. For example, news reporters have to write a report and type it for their company in order to get it published. Workers in business need to use computers to file documents, type reports, and design items like clothes and games. My second reason is that fast food restaurants or even sit-down restaurants use computers, instead of using old cash registers. For example, major chains use technology to type in people's orders and the amount they pay. Back then they used to use cash registers, and to get money out they needed to click a button, but now they have everything secured and managed using computers. Every restaurant has at least a touch screen computer in it to use. So restaurants need computers to survive in the modern world. My third reason is schools need computers for students and teachers to write reports, and to file the students' names and grades into a system. Students in classes write reports for projects or even for class work. Teachers need computers to file the students' names, grades, and information, instead of using a physical filing cabinet. Teachers also use computers to make homework pages and they need to print stuff off from word processors. So schools use and need computers for both students and teachers. In conclusion, I agree that computers benefit society, because businesses need them to work, design, and file, and fast food restaurants need them so they can take people's orders, and they are used in schools for students and teachers. So that's why it benefits society.

Dear @CAPS1 @ORGANIZATION1, Computers are an extremely useful tool in this modern age. They teach hand-eye coordination, give people the ability to easily learn about faraway places and people, and allow people to talk online with other people. Therefore, I believe that computers have a positive effect on people. Hand-eye coordination is a very important skill for young children to master. Without it they will have sloppy handwriting, absolutely no chance at sports, and much more. Computers help teach them because they need their finger to hit the same key that their eye sees. And because they tend to want to type faster, it will help even more because the finger and eye will have to work in unison to type faster. Computers also give people the ability to easily learn about far away places, people, etc. People used to have to spend hours searching for a half decent book on a topic, and then find the specific information they need in the hundreds of pages. Now that information is only a few clicks away. Say you have had problems with your faucet, it keeps dripping but you don't want to pay for a plumber. You could easily find step by step instructions on what to do using the computer, the possibilities are endless. Finally, Computers can allow people to stay in contact with friends who @MONTH1 live far away. It is more convenient than using a plane because you don't have to have something in your hands the whole time. You can walk away and then come back when you hear that you got a message. It is also very useful for people such as businessmen because they can talk to multiple people at once while still being able to get other work done, @PERSON1, author of business magazine tells us in an interview that it is nearly impossible to run a successful business without a computer. How people could possibly say that computers have a negative influence on society, I don't know. But I hope that you will publish this in the paper and show them that computers are necessary for our modern way of life.
