Dear editor, I have read your past article about how computers can take too much time out of some ones life, time they could be using to exercise or on other activities. This is completely untrue and in many ways actually benefits society. The internet is a fast and simple way to shorten the time spent doing activities we would already do. Instead of sending a letter to someone to invite them to the movies you could just email them. Letters can take weeks and can even get lost while email sends it to them instantly. Also what if the movie sells out or is canceled, don't worry with the internet you can reschedule and buy tickets online so that doesn't happen again. Suddenly your phone rings, its a call from your best friend saying to turn on the news, but you have to leave to pick up your kids in three minutes. Instead of waiting for the reports to stop talking and repeat, you can check instantly on one of the many news websites and still be early. Have you been dying to talk to someone you haven't seen in a long time? Well with one of the many free websites like Skype and Facebook you can do that in a heart beat. You can talk to that person and find many others. Also if you've been feeling lonely, like you can't find the right person, with dating sites you can find the perfect person and maybe go to the movies with them. Not only does it save time and connect you to other people but it can help you physically. According to research at the National Institute of Health, people who use computers for at least thirty minutes a day have a fifteen percent increase in hand-eye coordination, reaction time, and accuracy. Although some say it's bad for your eyes that is a lie, it was proven by Dr. Evans, a respected expert, instead of being harmful to health who has multiple degrees in science and health. Therefore, the evidence clearly shows that computers are a beneficial tool for modern life.

To whom it may concern: I will agree that computers have caused many people to spend less time outside. However, it has kept kids inside instead of being on the streets causing trouble. Computers have become a part of our everyday life. Some use it to stay connected with family or to reconnect with old friends. Experts say it's bad but the school gives us a computer class in education? We learn keyboarding skills, presentation techniques and how to research any topic. School itself has influenced computer use. If we could travel back in time, we would most likely see kids hanging around the streets. Now-a-days, kids spend a lot of time inside, on the computers. This isn't necessarily a bad thing. I bet you, or your parents, or maybe even your grandparents used to hear about gangs or fights going on in the streets. Now that computers have become an important item in many people's lives you don't hear those types of things as much. I'm not saying they don't happen but you don't hear your child come home and talk about gangs and fights. Therefore, being on the computer isn't that bad. In history you probably learned about immigrants coming over to America to get away from their ruler. Well, not everyone was able to come. Some people have family in another country. Due to time difference, it is hard to stay in touch. My mother came over here when she was young. The rest of her family still lives in the home country. To stay in touch they email or video chat. The five hour time difference makes it difficult to know when to call. The invention of computers has made it easier to catch up with family! Most importantly, the use of computers is influenced in schools. My school has a computer class, where we learn how to skillfully type. We are also taught how to correctly cite and research work. This is helpful because if we don't know this information we could plagiarize and plagiarism is illegal. Frequently, teachers give us projects that ask for computer use, either we have to look something up for specific, accurate information or we have to type a formal document, as well as using the online textbook instead of taking it home. After reading all the facts, I'm sure you will agree that computers can benefit society. Students stay off the streets and only cause trouble with siblings at home. People won't feel like they've left or lost their family. Schools influence computer use to help us learn. Certainly you cannot disagree with me on these points.

Imagine a world without computers. Where would we get all of our information from? Would we have to rely on television or magazines, where information can be changed or is not always up-to-date? Or how would we ever get any reports done for work or homework? I know many people who don't write neatly, so how would anyone read their handwriting? Basically, computers affect our lives so much in a good way that it would be chaos without them. Computers allow people to learn how to type, which can improve all-around skills such as hand-eye coordination. They let us connect with places we are not familiar with and see family members through video calls. Furthermore, they allow people to have an online education, which can help with the economy by providing flexible learning opportunities. Computers affect us in a very good way and they change our everyday lives. Some say children these days cannot type, but a recent study done at a major university showed that a significant percentage of kids older than eight already know how to type on a keyboard. Computers have such a big effect on us with so many skills that people don't acknowledge enough. Because all of those kids know how to type, they can often spell better too. I remember one time when I was in the middle of writing a report online. I got to a word I didn't know and had always had trouble spelling it. So I took my time and typed it out one letter at a time, and it was correct! This example shows that computers can affect everyone's lives, even younger kids, by providing helpful tools. The way that we get information from computers is just like the way our hands get information from our brain to move. For example, when babies learn how to walk they rely on their brains to show them how it's done. This is just like how when there is a natural disaster, such as the earthquake in a remote region, we rely on our computers to show us and tell us what is going on and how something like this could happen. Computers can affect us this way because there are many things we might never know about our world without them. Computers affect families' everyday lives by giving them access to online educations. My ten-year-old cousin told me that she was happy her mom could go back to college from home because then they could spend more time together. I know you might think that computers can make families get further apart, but they actually can bring them closer together by enabling shared activities and communication. There is only one choice and that is that computers affect all of us in a good way. They can help us learn how to type, connect us with our world, and bring families closer together. Without computers we wouldn't be the same as we are today, and our modern society would function far less efficiently.

Dear local Newspaper, I think we should keep improving technology on computers. Some people think that people spend too much time on the computer and not enough time outside. I personally think that the computer is important, as long as people don't use it non-stop. There are many reasons why the computer is important. First of all, there are many places in the world that not everyone can go to. The internet is a good way to find out about a place, its culture, and its history from the comfort of your home. Also, if you are going on vacation and you would like to know a little about the vacation spot, you can just look it up on the computer to find attractions and hotels. Another reason is the computer can help you study a place too for a school project. Also, if you are writing a research paper for school then you would probably want to find your information on the computer for accuracy and depth. If you are disagreeing with someone then you can find quick and easy information to support your view. All you do is look up something and you can find it in seconds. And you can learn new things that you have no clue about, expanding your knowledge. Most of the time the internet is very helpful for these tasks. One more reason is communication. On the computer there are many ways you can communicate with other people, such as through email and instant messaging. If you have friends or family far away then you can keep in touch with them without leaving your house. Also, if you are not sure about homework or something like that you can just ask a friend to find out quickly. And you can send pictures or videos to people in order to keep in touch and share experiences. Sometimes people use that feature for bad or inappropriate things, which is a concern. But you can do something about it, like using privacy settings, so you don't get those bad things. The internet can help you a lot in your everyday life. You can learn about new places, you can do research, and you can communicate with friends or family. If we keep improving technology you will be able to do a lot more than you can do now, like experiencing virtual tours of distant locations. The internet will be able to help you a lot more in your everyday life with these advancements. Now you can see that the internet can help people and it's not just keeping people inside; that is why I think we should keep improving technology for everyone's benefit.

Dear Newspaper, I personally believe that new technology is a great thing. That’s why I think that computers have positive effects on our society. Some of these effects include developing skills to help people for the present or future, getting a better education, and helping people to become more social. Computers can help people in so many ways; you just have to realize it. So come and see why computers are a good choice to have and use. My first reason for why I feel computers have positive effects on people is because they can help develop skills that one has and may not realize. For example, a teenager might say while typing a paper that she really likes to write. So, she might go on the internet and start looking at different writing styles, and maybe she could become a famous journalist one day. It's all from the skills she got going online and searching for what she enjoys. Another situation could be that a man applies for a job and then the employer says he has to know how to use different software, so he could go on the computer and look for a tutorial on that specific software to learn it. A computer may help people build skills now and for their own future in this manner. My second reason for why computers can have positive effects on people is that they can help them get a better education. Any adult who hasn't gone to college and wants to can take classes online and earn their degree that way. The education is not just for adults; kids can go online and research the history of different places they live in or want to visit. The great thing about it is you can find the information fast and easy, which aids learning. Computers help people learn more and get a better education for themselves through these resources. My final reason for why computers have positive effects is that they help people to be more social. There are so many ways to connect with family and friends from your own home. You can send an email to someone and wait for a reply. Or now, you can even instant message somebody and talk to them like they're in the same room. There are also websites, such as Facebook, where you can get together and talk with old friends you haven't seen in years. Computers can help everyone connect with anyone from anywhere. As you can see, computers have so many positive effects on people. They can help you build social skills for now and for our future. They can also help people get a better education through online resources. Plus, it is a great way to connect with past and present friends easily. Hopefully you can see how a computer can have positive effects on so many people in our community and beyond.

In today's society many new technologies have been released. Such as the music player, cell phones, and video game consoles such as Xbox, but probably the most popular and most used is the computer. The ability to access and search for information in just a couple of clicks is remarkable. Some people are so engrossed with technology that they almost get addicted to it and use it every chance they get. Is this good for people? Is what they're doing affecting their health and physical activity? Yes, people these days are affected by the internet greatly. Certain websites can once lead to a high addiction, such as Facebook, Myspace, and YouTube. These are probably the main platforms used, even for schoolwork. In the years since Facebook launched, the addiction level has increased dramatically and so have the high-pressure levels associated with constant use! Dr. Smith, a noted expert, says this online behavior must stop; people are getting addicted and gaining weight from the lack of physical activity. As you can see, the online internet can be very useful for information and connection, but it is not something that should be used non-stop as it can affect your health and bring other dangers like eye strain and social isolation.

More and more people use computers every day. Computers are a great help for projects, email, vacation spots, and so on. However, some scientists think people are spending too much time on the computer instead of exercising, or taking a walk. I think that computers are an important part of a person's life because the information found on a computer is very useful. It can be useful to you when you have a report coming up. What if your teacher tells you that a report is due tomorrow? What are you going to do, you don't have time to go to the library. I would go on the computer and get all the information I need from the internet. I would also use a computer to learn about far away places, or even famous people in history. I also could look up where I'm going on vacation and then I could learn more information about it. Like, you could find where the best restaurant locations are, the best hotels, and even the best tourist spots. Computers are also helpful for chatting. My grandparents moved so I don't talk to them that much anymore, but since I have a computer I can send a quick e-mail saying hi, or asking how they're doing. Also imagine going to work and not having a computer! That's a lot of work to write down by hand! At some works, the work consists of emailing other work members about the problems they are having, and about meetings. By using a computer you can keep up to date on everything that's going on. Also computers are helpful because if you had a test to study for, and you forgot your notes at school, you can look up online what you are studying. Then you can study from the computer screen. So then the next day you won't fail the science test. Computers can be a nice little break after all your homework is done. If you want to go on the computer to talk to your friends, it should be an incentive to get all your homework done first. Sometimes people need some down time after all their homework is over with. Playing games on the computer can be a nice way to relax and unwind. Computers are a great help for reports, vacations, chatting, and information to help you study for a test. Also to play games on. A lot of people use computers to do work on for their jobs. I think computers are an important part of a person's daily life and provide many essential services.

In my own opinion, computers are a great addition to our world. Computers can help people with schoolwork, communication and entertain you in a safe way. Those are the reasons why computers have positive effects on people around the world. First of all, computers help with a child's schoolwork. For instance, if a student is doing a research paper, the world-wide-web is a helpful place to easily get information from that you can't find in books. In addition if a student forgets, loses, or is missing homework, they can log on the school website and print the paper out. Also, most teachers expect an essay to be as neat as possible. That is hard for some students, but typing it is neat, and everyone can do it. As you can see, computers are very much needed when it comes to school work. Second, computers are a great way to communicate and keep-in-touch with other people. For example, if an employee wanted to speak with a boss, or send something to him, he could easily e-mail it to him. Also, if friends wanted to talk with one another, they could instant message each other. If a teacher and a parent of a student had to set up a conference, the teacher could e-mail the parent a time and date. That is why computers are great for easy communication. Lastly, computers provide a safe, fun way of entertainment. Many companies make kid-friendly websites that children can go on. For instance, my six year old sister goes on a website that teaches you things in a fun way. Studies show that a high percentage of kindergartners who go on these websites, do better in first grade compared to those who don't; computers are a great way to spend your time. In conclusion, I believe that computers have a great effect on people around the planet. They help with school work, provide easy communication, and provide safe educational activities, as you can see, computers are a great addition to our world and its development.

Dear Editor, Some people think that computers are used too much, and are helping people become over weight, and even obese. This is maybe true, but computers also teach hand eye coordination, give people the opportunity to learn about far away places, and people can even communicate on them! Over all I think computers effect people in a positive way, and these are some reasons why. Computers help teach hand eye coordination. I know your probably thinking “huh? How do computers do that? All your doing is staring at a screen.” But to your dismay computers do teach hand eye coordination. It does this because while playing games, people watch the screen, and click with their hands. They don’t just stare at the mouse while they play these games. By doing so, it teaches hand eye coordination. Scientist have proven that people who own a computer and use it at least a few hours a week, have better coordination that people who don’t own a computer by a significant percentage! Just that statistic alone speaks a thousand words. Hand-eye coordination is a real thing. It helps you play better in sports like baseball, and not only that but it helps future jobs. As you can tell, without computers our hand eye coordination would suffer. People think that computers are only used for games, but in reality, they teach us many things about the world. Without computers people would know about nearly anything that’s going in other countries. For example, the other day, my mom was checking her email and came across the story of a young, starving child. That story changed her everyday life because she takes food for granted. Without a computer my mom would have known less about life in other countries. Because we live in a fortunate nation, we need to know what’s going on in other countries. Others are less fortunate, but computers help remind and teach us what’s going in the world everyday. One of the main advantages about computers is they allow people to communicate through them. Even my grandmother said that, without computers, I wouldn’t be as close to you as I am today. My grandmother and I use the website skype.com. This website allows you to not only talk to the other person, but to see them too! Because of sites like these, I’m allowed to stay in contact, and be able to see my grandmother who lives far away. Without computers this wouldn’t be possible. Not only do computers let you talk to people far away, but people close too. I often find myself asking friends over the computer, what the homework is, or when the next test is, etc. Computers make it easier to connect to people near and far. In conclusion, computers help in all different ways. The world would be upside down without them. They give people the ability to learn about far away places and people, teach hand eye coordination, and allow people to communicate with each other. Computers have some flaws, but they also have so many positive effects too that I think they shine over all the tiny flaws. Thank you for considering my viewpoint.

Dear our local newspaper, Computers have a huge effect on people in a negative way. It could change our lifestyle dramatically. For example, people who sit there all day on the computers spend less of their time exercising, enjoying nature and socializing with friends and families. Therefore, computers affect us greatly. One of the reasons why computers are horrible, is because people spend too much time on their computer and don't exercise. It's always important to stay fit and healthy. This could be why a large percentage of people who live in the country is obese. This could be a leading cause of obesity. I can connect to this because I had a relative, who admitted that he gained at least five pounds for being on the computer constantly; not exercising could lead to this. Is it really worth sitting in front of the computer all day eating? There are better entertainment activities that are active and will keep us healthy and exercising. Another reason, is that it seems people are far more involved in technology, which affects you greatly. This will not improve your social abilities. You could lose self confidence in yourself and not be as open or outgoing. No one likes to be a loner. The feeling could be devastating. This would make it very difficult to interact and make new friends. It's always a pleasure to know that you have so many loving people around you. You could lose them with a snap of your fingers by spending more time focused on the computer, rather than your friends and family. Lastly, it could be bad to get through life without your friends and family. In conclusion, people who spend too much time on their computer spend less of their time exercising, enjoying nature and interacting with friends and families. The computers are liked so much that they matter the most in life, leading to being more focused on them. Computer affect us in a negative way that can change the course of our life for the worse.

Dear editor of the Local Gazette, Our society is being ruined, ruined by computers of course. They are so time consuming that I am afraid they are causing more people to be obese in our community. People are afraid that they are limiting themselves from interacting face to face, and spending time enjoying nature. I feel the exact same way and someone should put a stop to this! An average american goes on a computer for about several hours a day. With going to work or school, and sleeping, that way leaves a little time to go out and explore nature. Our national parks have been decreasing in their numbers of customers at a fast rate. I visited Yellowstone last week to find out if as many people have been going. The man who works at the entrance was saying that "since the start of last year alone about twenty percent less people have been to the park," I believe that the reason for that is because of computers. They limit people from going to parks or to zoos, by consuming the public time with all of the "new fashion" or the newest game on miniclip.com. Also, I believe that the public is spending so much time on computers that they are not able to go out and exercise. With the newest "sims game," how are kids supposed to stay fit and healthy? I did a study on how many hours kids spend on their computer and out of the people who said more than sixty minutes, a majority of them could legally considered obese. Is that how we want our next generation to be our next president and lawyers, and doctors? No, we want them to live life to the fullest by taking care of themselves by exercising. Computers are getting kids so consumed that is not ok. Lastly, with computers, families and friends don't really talk to each another face to face, or interact with each other at all. I mean sure, parents come home to their child on the computer and give them a kiss on the head. But is that enough? I do not believe it is. I asked a friend of mine's child about how much he interacts with his family and friends face to face. He said that well since he got his new "gaming computer with a large gig hard drive", he hadn't been talking to them a whole lot. However, everyday he went on "chat for a good two hours", to talk to his friends. And only occasionally would he get an e-mail or two from his family asking how his day was. I do not believe that that is good in order to have good friends and a strong family life. That is what our town has come down to because of computers. They limit you from interacting with friends and family, give you less time to exercise and limit you from going out and exploring nature. Who knows, maybe at this time in a few years, our community will be run by computer. Do we want that? No, so lets put a stop to it now. Thank you very much for your time.

Dear editor, I believe that computers are a great and fun tool. But I also believe people can spend too much time on them. The computer is excellent for productivity. People can use them to type papers or reports, create detailed graphs, and accomplish other important tasks for us. Schools are integrating computers more and more now. Schools have websites for students to visit to find out their homework assignments, classwork, projects, reports, and extra credit opportunities. The school has even started doing something very new, allowing parents and kids to check the student's grades online. Not only do the schools help students, but everyday people benefit as well. If a student has a project but doesn't know how to start it, then he or she can google their project topic and find ways to begin. Computers can be really great and easy to use as you can see, especially for schoolwork. Computers are not only great for academic purposes, but also for leisure purposes. Before computers and the internet, there were only a few ways to have fun during boring times in the day. One was watching TV, reading a book, or going outside, if you could. What do I mean by that last sentence? If you lived in a city, then it would be harder to go outside because maybe you lived in an apartment or somewhere not in a community with a yard. Then you couldn't go out easily; and reading books can become boring after a while, and maybe there was nothing on TV for you to watch. But when computers and the internet came out, people could play games, watch videos, and talk to cousins or family who live far away. Computers are also good for social networks. Not all families live close, but they can still be a close family. But in this economy we can't always afford to visit them whenever we want. So by using computers we can contact them, facebook them, myspace them, and even video chat with them, which as I said is great for far away family. But at times people can become too obsessed with them. Some people spend all day on one website, particularly Facebook or YouTube. Do not get me wrong, these websites are fun and cool. But not cool enough to never go outside and have free, natural fun. I remember I logged into Facebook and saw a girl on, I logged off around an hour later and she was still on, then I logged in again around midnight and the same girl was on! That is just too long to be on one website. Computers are a great tool for humans to use for business, education, and leisure. But too much of anything is not good, and moderation is key to a healthy life.

Do you like computers? Do you use the internet to help you? Do you use it every day? Well, this article gives you information about all of this. First, a lot of people don't like computers because they say they're too confusing. Actually, computers aren't that hard to work with; you just have to be patient and take some time to get used to them. Also, computers can make things easier like typing. Why should you write by hand when you have the option to use a computer which lets you write faster and more neatly than you could on normal paper? Secondly, the internet is very easy to use and often more convenient than books. All you have to do is go to Google or any other search engine, type what you're looking for in, and in a split second you have all the information in the world on that topic. Also, if you're planning a vacation the internet can help immensely. You can purchase plane tickets online and sometimes there are special discounts available on the web. Also, you can book hotels and look at live pictures with more detail than a simple brochure. So when you book a vacation on the internet you know it will be a good one. Finally, you can purchase almost anything with a click of a button. Almost every website has discounts and sales. I remember the time when I bought a pair of shoes online and saved a lot of money. Also, it usually ships to your house in a couple of days, which is very convenient. Lastly, going on it a lot isn't necessarily bad. I go on the computer almost every day but I also go outside too. I can do this because at night when no one can go outside I go on the computer for school or for fun. Also, you can talk to your friends or family over the internet. What if your mom or dad went on a business trip for a few weeks? You could use your webcam and talk to them and see them as if you were in the same room. So is going on the computer really so bad? I don't think so, especially when it is that helpful and easy to work with.

Dear newspaper, Have you ever grabbed a nice cold drink and sat at your computer desk? I know I have. Computers do benefit society. One way computers benefit society is they don't make people stand around a bookstore or library for hours at a time. Another way computers benefit society is by letting people chat with people all over the world. The last way that computers benefit society is they teach people hand-eye coordination. If you have ever been to a bookstore or library you know how hard it is to find the book you're looking for. Instead of spending hours on your feet, you can go sit on your computer for ten minutes or less. On the computer you can get any information about anywhere or anything, not just one book about France! Going to the library can be tiring. Health experts say they have done many tests and the people that use computers have better hand-eye coordination than people that don't use computers. A doctor in a health magazine said that the people that don't use computers aren't very coordinated. Being able to develop a skill helps your mind, too. As you can see, computers benefit society and help people's hand-eye coordination, making daily tasks easier and more efficient.

To begin with, the learning ability people get from it has improved. The internet source is very helpful to many people. The communication is much easier than talking on the phone. I believe that computers benefit society in many different ways. First of all, children and people at home and at school use computers for learning purposes. In some grades at school there is a special typing program that helps improve typing skills. There are also hard drive discs that you can play with to help you enhance your reading skills. It is just a way to make learning fun for young kids. Another great way to learn online is going to websites that have sample math problems and printing the sheet out to practice. They are great ways to help learning. Secondly, the computer has many more ways to benefit someone. They are helpful for getting your local weather forecast. In the winter you can see if your school has been cancelled in seconds. Often I get projects where it calls for me to do research on a specific topic and it is very easy to look up simple information. The computer also has different links that are helpful for writing a paper, making a power point presentation, and creating an excel spreadsheet. All of those resources can either help graphing results for science class or even typing up a paper for English class. They are useful ways to make life easier. Lastly, computers tend to make communication a little easier. For me, when I'm out sick from school I like to tell my teachers by emailing them and even asking if I can make up any work. Using Facebook, AIM, MySpace, and Skype are all fun and fast ways to communicate with friends. All of the websites pretty much do the same thing but different people like different sites that their friends are on; you can email friends and family who live far away and even close. It's a way to get back and forth to each other. In conclusion, you have heard the different ideas and I consider computers as a benefit. It helps us learn, communicate, and most of all do the important things that we need to succeed in our daily lives.

I believe that computers have a positive effect on people. The three reasons I think this are because computers enhance our hand-eye coordination, they give us the ability to research and find out information about a certain topic, and they allow us to communicate with people who we are not able to see very often. Computers, in fact, increase our hand-eye coordination. The usage of both the screen and the keyboard allows us to look only at the screen while typing on the keyboard. Hand-eye coordination is an important skill to have when exercising by playing sports or working out, which is also important and very good for our bodies. If you want to apply for a job in, for example, an office, and you started stumbling and acting clumsy, then you might be looked at differently than if you were organized and knew what you were doing. This is why hand-eye coordination is important to people. Computers also have the amazing ability to search the world wide web. This gives us the ability to make millions of searches for any given topic. For example, in fifth grade I did a research project on ancient Egypt. Without all the useful information I found on the computer, I would have never been able to learn everything I did. As most of the world already knows, there was a devastating earthquake in the small country of Haiti. Computers were one of the ways that helped spread the word and get everyone to start helping and sending supplies and food to the victims. Also, if a family is thinking about going somewhere for a vacation, they can take care of most of the planning on the computer. They could buy flight tickets, book a room at the hotel, and even get a rental car for when they land. This is what my family did on our vacation to Florida and everything turned out perfectly all thanks to the computer and being able to do everything online. This is how the computer can help you research any topic. Lastly, you can use the computer to communicate with people that live far away and you rarely ever see. For example, my grandparents live in California, so I use video chat to talk to them since I only get the chance to see them once every two or three years. Also when my dad goes on business trips to other states or even somewhere out of the country, we use instant messaging or video chat to keep in touch. Lastly, if you have friends or family who are fighting for America in Afghanistan right now, you can also use a video chat to communicate with them. So these are all my reasons why I believe computers have a positive effect on people. They help with hand-eye coordination, they give us the ability to research and find information on any topic through the internet, and lastly, they allow us to communicate with people who we are not able to see very often. These are my reasons and I hope you agree with me that computers have a positive effect on people today and will continue to do so in the future.

That is very unhealthy and can higher your chances of getting different cancers. Just ask Doctor Jones from the hospital," Last week one guy was rushed to the hospital because of a very common cancer that you get from unhealthy living, he passed away ten days later. It was very sad." I strongly believe that being on the computer to long is a very bad idea. It can ruin you eye-sight, you never get to see nature and interact. But most importantly, it is very unhealthy. It is now or never, You would never know if you can be that man in the hospital with that cancer. Dear Newspaper, I believe that computers have both positive and negative effects on people. However, I believe that there are more positive effects than negative. Some of these positive effects would be that they are essential for education, a very useful place to communicate, and they can be fun. My first reason for supporting computers would be that they are very educational. For example, you can research almost anything if you are doing your homework and you forgot an answer. On the subject, you can work from home if you are sick or on vacation. But how do you get your work to your boss? Email of course! which brings me to my next subject; communication. Another resourceful thing about computers is communication. There are so many different ways to communicate; it's unbelievable. Take instant messaging for an example. You can send messages to peoples cellphones. You can send messages to other people that are online or you can just chat on some websites such as various social networks, and tons more. You can also video chat with people on things like video calling services. Those are just a few ways of communicating on the computer. Finally, I would like to tell you about the fun things you can do on computers. First, you can buy games from a store and download them onto your computer. Personally, The Sims are my favorite. Also, they have educational games so learning can be both fun and educational. Another thing you could do is play free games or download the game from the internet to your computer so they are both fast and easy. To conclude, computers can be both negative and positive but I chose to look at things through a positive eye and I think you should too. After all, computers can be educational, a social network, and fun. So open your positive eye and you won't be sorry.

Dear Local Newspaper On the subject of computers; their pros and cons, I would have to say that both sides provide very important reasons why you should and shouldn't use computers, I think that computers are very important to many students just like me. First of all computers help me and my fellow classmates with many assignments. Some of us simply don't have the time to go to a library and look for a book that might not even possess the information needed. On the internet you can find the same amount of valuable information or more! It also helps to develop your hand-eye coordination. Some people say "you can learn hand-eye coordination outside too?" Although that is true, typing is very fast and neat. As you can see my handwriting is not the best but I type very fast and make little mistakes so I do not need the neatest handwriting ever. The way I see it computers are the fastest way of doing a lot of things. So if you spend time writing neatly you might not even be able to go outside and see nature. My dad is an environmentalist and he uses computers. Sometimes the easy way isn't always the best way, that's why we must have balance. Do not inform people to stop using computers but to balance their time with them. Everything is good if it's balanced. For example, caffeine, in large amounts it is rather unhealthy but when you need a small boost you turn to caffeine and it helps, same with computers. Besides, computers are now made everywhere, trying to get rid of them is simply unreasonable. We are already in a recession we don't need more trouble. I prefer to talk with my friends eye to eye however if you cannot do that a computer is a perfect alternative. So you see computers are very helpful to some and balance is the answer for a healthy lifestyle.

Would you like to discover new things and explore amazing mysteries around the world? Do you love to have friends overseas? Do you want to relax and do something fun after school? Advanced technology today allows you to do almost everything that would have been considered impossible just a few decades ago. We need to decide whether computers have positive or negative effect on people. I firmly believe computers gives society many benefits and opportunities. Who would disagree that computers are devoted to educational purposes? Computer experts have invented countless programs that make schoolwork easier for kids. For example, word processing software helps you with essays and reports. With this program teachers wouldn't hurt their eyes trying to read sloppy hand written compositions from students. Spreadsheet programs help you organize and calculate, and presentation software gives you the tools to create dynamic presentations. Many schools have a computer lab for students to complete their school tasks. Schools have also acquired convenient-sized laptops to help students do their projects and take tests. That saves a lot of paper and a lot of trees! Furthermore, many colleges offer their courses online. You can obtain a college degree right at your house without going anywhere. Education has never been so easy, thanks to our advanced network and computers. It is very important to mention the entertainment benefits of computers. I have noticed many teens play cool games on the net. They seem to greatly enjoy this opportunity. It is an ideal way to relax after a stressful day, getting on the computer and listening to the newest songs. Some websites offer downloadable songs for free so you don't need to worry about the financial part. Moreover you can watch movies online anytime, from a wide section such as horror, romance, comedy, fantasy or even children films. No more movie tickets, no more driving to the theater. Without a doubt computers can put a smile on everyone's face with its entertainment benefits. Many people feel that computers pull both kids and adults away from their social life, but actually, computers give them a chance to communicate with other people around the world. Ten years ago, who would have thought that they could chat and talk directly with someone a thousand miles away, with no mail or telephone or whatsover? I came to this country a while ago. I am extremely grateful to computers because I can keep in touch with my friends and relatives. I can just send them pictures of the snowy winter sceneries here through email in just a minute. How much easier could it get? Computers definitely improve communication and bring people closer. Let's not wait any longer. Computers have endless positive effects and should be popularized. They help you learn, have fun and communicate with people faraway. Above and beyond all that new technology makes the earth a greener place by saving paper and trees. Don't sit here and wait, educate people about the benefits of computers today.

So all I'm trying to prove is that computers are an amazing invention but we should just use them a little less and get out and exercise, and have fun with our family and friends and do good in school and at home so we can get to spend some time on the computer. I hope you see it my way now.

Dear @CAPS1, I am writing to express my opinion on computers' benefit to society. I believe that computers are very useful tools for learning and communication, but people today overuse that power. Some people are working all day, leaving early in the morning and getting back late, so that they rarely spend time with those they love. But if you are hooked on the computer, as so many of us are, you @MONTH1 just not spend enough time with family and friends. Using a computer isn't exactly a social thing; it's one person with a mouse, a keyboard, and a monitor. You @MONTH1 say "@CAPS5, but there are also online social networks." @CAPS5, but how often do you even see those people in real life? Computers can take precious time away from you that you could be sharing with your family and friends. That certainly does not benefit society. A major fault in computers is that you have to be indoors. So you cannot be online chatting, or playing a game, or checking your email, outside while enjoying the beauty of the outdoors. Sure you could use a laptop outside but are you really enjoying the outdoors? Computers and outdoors go together like chocolate milk and fillet mignon - not well. That is the reason why pine trees don't have outlets, although now you never know what they'll do next. Another side effect - that goes along with the aforementioned statement about computers and outdoors - of computers is the lack of exercise. The idea of this article is not to prevent you from using computers, but to make sure you use them like you eat double fudge brownies with walnuts and cream cheese frosting - sparingly. As long as you use them correctly, they are a very, very valuable tool to be used, but overused, can be problem causing, and even prevent you from spending time with family and friends, getting exercise and even spending time outdoors. For instance, I could do a search engine on recent disaters and find hundreds of articles on recent global events and other recent news. However you could also find out interesting facts like how many have chosen to sail around the world in the past ten years, uncovering niche information. But this is just one of the many uses a computer has. Critics sometimes think that the use of computers interferes with spending time with your friends and family. But computers can actually do the opposite by facilitating connection. There are many websites that allow you to talk safely to people. Some of those websites are facebook and chatme.com. Did you know that you can even video chat with people, making conversations more personal. It's just like youre right there with them. Incredibly, unlike calling people and using a phone using these websites is free and open to anyone, removing financial barriers. This brings me to the last point. Computers are great writing tools. They allow you to write efficiently and neatly, producing clean documents. Also, programs liek microsoft word allow you to spell check your work, catching common errors. However one of the most usefull qualitus of a program like word is that it allows you to change your work and add sentences or words wherever you want, offering great flexibility. Its you can see computers are a usefull and beneficial part of society. They allow people to easily stay informed on world news, keeping them connected. Secondly computers allow easy and safe communication between people and lastly they are usefull for writing papers such as writing prompts, aiding in education and work. I hope that by reading this, you can now see some of the many uses of computers and appreciate their role in modern life.

Today, wherever you go, there is technology being used, integrated into various aspects of life. The most common, computers are widely used by a majority of people, but are computers really beneficial to society? Computers are beneficial to society because it is a way to connect with the world, a way to increase responsibility, and helpful for education. Computers are beneficial because they help people connect with the world in profound ways. You can use a computer to find anything that is on the web, so you can find information about places that interest you or places that you would like to visit, planning trips with ease. According to recent studies, a significant number of people check the internet for places to visit before they actually go. Furthermore, it is a way to connect with faraway friends, maintaining relationships across distances. One of my friends moved to another state when we were in fifth grade, but we still e-mail each other, and are still friends thanks to this technology. The computer is also one of the fastest ways you can learn about current events as they unfold. All you have to do is go to a news website for instant updates. All of these connections will widen people's views of the world, fostering a global perspective. Computers are a way to increase responsibility, too, by presenting users with choices. When the people use the computer, there are many choices that they have to make, like what websites to go to and what to download or watch, requiring discernment. Having these individual chances will help people think of what the right choice is, promoting critical thinking. Even if you choose the wrong choice, you will learn from your mistake, which is a valuable lesson. Second, the computer is a very fragile machine and it takes a lot of care to handle properly. For example, you can't have any liquid nearby and must not throw objects near or on the computer, teaching users to be mindful. Thinking of this and making sure not to damage the computer are ways to increase responsibility and respect for property. Lastly, computers are beneficial because they help education in numerous ways. Teachers can use the computer to make lessons more interesting and engaging for students. For example, they can create interactive points and presentation to provide a visual aid, reinforcing what they learned at school. Additionally, you can make online portals for the students, which provide them with their homework and information about the classes conveniently. One of my friends once said that without the computer for research, he would definitely be failing his classes. Nobody wants to struggle, and a computer is a great way to present information clearly. Lastly, if you want information on a particular school, you can just search it online and find its website quickly. School websites have information about classes, events, and clubs, offering a comprehensive view. They provide the information that you need to think about going to that school in an easy, convenient way, while finding the website for the school take no more than a few minutes, actually going to that school for information can take more than just a few minutes, and even hours, saving valuable time. According to educational surveys, many students choose what college to go to first by checking its website online. The computer is an easy, convenient way to get information, democratizing access. Now, no one should be doubting the benefits of a computer. They are a connection to the world, like places, and people, enriching our understanding. They increase responsibility by giving you many choices to navigate. They help education by providing information about and for schools, enhancing learning. This is why computers are beneficial to the society we live in today.

Do you think people spend to much time on the computer? Another example is my neghbor who spent all day in his basement playing on his computer and haven went outside and since he hevet went outside he is terreibely afraid of the sun and he is now ten years old an dhe still dont go outside it was because he spent to much time on the computer, showing the long-term effects. Many people use computers in their daily lives, making them a common fixture. Some people agrees that it benefit the society and others disagree, leading to ongoing debate. Some experts think people are spending too much time on the computers, and less time exercising, playing outside, and having family time, expressing valid concerns. I think differently, computers help us with hand-eye coordination for jobs, stay in touch with family members and friends, and computers also help us learn about different things, offering significant advantages. Computers help us with many things but the most important is jobs and career preparation. Many jobs use computers for various tasks and communication. In order to get a job using computers you need hand-eye coordination which computers teach us through regular use. Computers prepare us with skills we are going to need when we get jobs, making us more employable. Computers are very helpful in this regard. Computers also help us stay in touch with our family members and friends, no matter the distance. A resident of a small town says that if we didn't have computers she wouldn't have been able to see her neice and nephew open their christmas presents she got them, sharing a special moment. She also wouldn't have seen her nephew take his first steps, a milestone event. "Technology is wonderful" she explained to me, expressing her gratitude. She loves staying in touch with her families through computers, which strengthens their bonds. Computers are also help young children to old adults learn new things, acting as a vast educational resource. Computers hold a lot of information, many people learn things they have never heard of on the internet, expanding their knowledge. My younger sister learned how to read on the computer using educational programs. She is now in the highest reading level you can be in, in first grade, showing clear progress. Computers are very helpful at learning new things and acquiring skills. Computers can do many things, they help us with getting jobs by teaching us hand-eye coordination and other necessary skills. They can also help us keep in touch with our loved ones, maintaining important relationships. Computers teach us about interesting things like faraway places and people, broadening our horizons. Computers are a wonderful thing to have in our society, providing numerous benefits. Experts, their is no reason whats so ever you should be concerned with more and more people using computers, it's a good thing that enhances our lives in many ways.

In the world we live in now, everything is getting technilogical, transforming how we operate. In my own opinion, its a good thing that brings numerous advantages. Using computers has been very helpful to our society, impacting various sectors. They give people the opportunity to research things fast and easily, they save trees, and they're a wonderful way to communicate with people, covering key areas of benefit. First, computers are great to use for research instead of books that waste tree and other resources. A few years ago, kids would get a school project on a certain country and the thing that would came to mind is the library, requiring physical effort. But, nowadays it's computers that are the first stop. Sure, of course books are very helpful, but so is the internet, plus its much faster and easier to find to find the information you're looking for, saving time. You can learn about a place before visiting it with a click of a button and learn about places far away that you may never see. It really is magical how much knowledge is available. Next, using computers saves trees and helps the environment significantly. With a computer we don't have to keep cutting down so many trees for books and paper, reducing our ecological footprint. Another author can now sell their books online and people are able to read them right on their devices, increasing accessibility. Honestly, there really is no reason to keep making physical books for every purpose. Even students can do their home work, test and quizzes online, embracing digital education! I think it's a mirical and it's so amazing to see how much our world has changed in only about twenty years, showing rapid progress. Finally, computers are great to communicate with people far away, closing the distance. Some people have family in the war who they don't see for months or maybe years, making communication vital. With a computer you can get emails that get deliveres to the person right after being sent, providing instant updates. Or you can even webcam and actually see the person face to face, making interactions more personal! It must be hard not being able to see your loved ones everyday, which is why a computer is very helpful for maintaining connections. Even to those who have a family member away on a business trip or that live in another state/country, computers offer a lifeline. Computers are very helpful, especially today with everything going on in our world, proving their value. With computers we can do online research efficiently, save trees by reducing paper use, and communicate with people far away effortlessly. So, in my opinion computers do benefit society and are a positive force for the future.

Dear School District editor, I have recently seen on the channel five news that you want to know about the effects computers have on people. In the past, not everyone had computers and got knowledge from them. Ninety percent of the students surveyed at the student council agree computers are helpful to us. In my opinion, computers have a positive effect on people. The first reason is computers teach hand eye coordination. Without this coordination, people would not survive. The users would be over very quickly. The computer makes us use these muscles so we can live happily. Ninety percent of the students recently took a survey at the student council, agree computers are the main source of hand eye coordination. Dr. Smith, an expert in relationship to humans said, "People without computers can't do what others can. They are unable to have fast reaction time." To sum it up computers help with hand eye coordination. The second reason is computers allow us to learn about far away places. When you can't look up and learn about places, you are not knowledgeable about them. You're lucky if you know where in the world they are. Computers allow you to look up those places on a map. You can look into going there for vacation or doing a report. Eighty-five percent of the adults who surveyed at the public library said the computers help. They are full of so much more information than books alone. To sum it up, computers allow you to learn about far away places. The third reason is computers allow you to talk online to people. This extends your friendships with people. You can talk on the computer, not just at school. It also allows you meet new and different people from various backgrounds. You can talk to people in Japan that you couldn't talk to without computers. Computers allow you to open up the world to all people. Ninety percent of parents who took a poll in our community say they want their children to learn about different cultures. They need the computer for that task. To sum it up, computers allow you to talk online to people. In conclusion, computers have a positive effect on people. The reasons are to teach hand eye coordination, learn about faraway places, and talk to people online. I strongly urge you to look at any point of view closely. This decision is now up to you to see the clear benefits.

City Times, Computers are very helpful devices. Life would be very hard without them. Not only are they helpful, but they are fun and easy to use! I believe that computers have a great effect on people because you can keep in touch with family and friends, go on school websites and use search engines. Friends and family are extremely important in peoples lives. Computers can help you keep in touch with them! The three applications that I mostly use are Skype, AIM, and Facebook. Skype is a free online application that you can download to your computer, add your friends, and video chat! Using this, I keep in touch with my grandmother, my friend who moved, and even a friend from England! AIM (AOL instant messenger) is where you can send messages to friends and get instant replies! It is just like text messaging, only through computers. Lastly, Facebook is a website where you can add friends from all around the world! I am friends with tons of family that I don't get to see very often, a friend who moved to California, and many other people that have moved! Facebook, AIM, and Skype are great ways to keep in touch with other people! When you are home sick from school and need to make up school work, instead of calling a friend from each of your classes, go to the school's webpage! All teachers should have their own website that you can get from there. On their pages, they should have posted homework, quizzes/tests schedule, favorite links, projects, and their e-mail address. I find this very helpful because even if you don't understand your homework, you can e-mail your teacher! Not only do school websites have teachers pages, but they also have lunch menus, events coming up, the school address and phone number, and many more! School could be a lot more difficult without a website. Do you ever have a question but nobody has the answer to it? www.Google.com has the answer to everything! You can find webpages, videos, pictures, translators, etc. Google is not the only search engine on the internet, there is also Yahoo, Bing, Ask, Dogpile, and many others! These can all help you find answers, pictures, videos and many more! I often use these to find pictures for a school project, webpages for research, translators to check my spanish homework and videos to show my friends! If we did not have search engines, life would be a lot harder. Computers, as you can tell, are extremely helpful, easy, and fun to use. People love them and use them all the time. I hope that you agree with computers having a great effect on people! Staying in touch with family and friends, having a good education, and finding answers within a click is the easiest way to go through life successfully.

Dear Newspaper, Computers have a huge effect on society, can you even imagine where we would be without them? They are great for communication, learning, and shopping. Computers have a large effect on people. Without computers, communication with co-workers, family, and friends would be nearly impossible. Social networking sites, such as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn play a huge role in everyday life. These are the sites you use to access information from others to making plans for the weekend. Do you think that your children use the internet too much? Nowadays, that is their way to communicate with their peers. It makes them more social, which is a great quality to have in life. Also, I don't know about you, but I have talked to many people around the world using the internet. It gives you the chance to experience other cultures firsthand. Communication was absolutely not as easy before having computers. It may seem hard to believe, but you can learn tremendous amounts of things from the internet. This may include learning about people. How would you video chat with someone without Skype or FaceTime? You can learn a lot about a person from talking to them face to face, a thing that can't be done on a phone call. Also, research for school could not be done without the internet. In a recent survey, eight out of ten teenagers said that they use a search engine site, such as Google, Yahoo, or Bing at least once a day, seven out of ten of those eight said that it is for school. If it weren't for these search engines, children wouldn't be doing too great in school. Clearly, the computer provides ample ways to research and learn on a daily basis. It may sound ridiculous, but in 2023, forty percent of shopping was done on the internet. If someone wants to start a business, their first stop is usually the internet. People are making money every year with the help of computers. People find it easiest to buy something with the click of a mouse. It is easier than the hassle of crowded malls and long lines. Also, do you remember when Black Friday was the time to put the alarm clock on for four AM? Well, now people do holiday shopping online, there are hundreds, even thousands of sites that offer great sales. Now think about how purchasing items would be if it weren't for the internet. It's not a great image, is it? As you can tell, computers have affected our lives in a great way. Communication, learning, and even shopping have become much simpler. Many may think that computers are not bad to have, but the good overshadows those negative aspects completely.

In modern society, it is rare that you come across someone who doesn't know how to basicly operate a computer. At my schoo, there are three computer labs, each with about twenty five computers, a library with twenty computers, and each teacher has two computers in their classroom. Today's society is helping mother nature not only in our actions, but in computers too. In my opinion, computers are helping the United States, not hurting the United States. They have assisted education, social reconnecting and the environment. We must look kindly upon the advancement and miracle invention known as the computer.

Dear Local Newspaper, Don't you agree that computers should be limited or often not used? Recently, it has been brought to my attention that computers have a negative effect on society. I can remember when my step mom Sarah was a size six in the waist. Sarah would exercise everyday after work for two hours. This all changed when my dad bought her a lime green, Dell Inspiron laptop for her birthday. Sarah quickly became addicted to Solitaire and began to cut down on her exercising routines. Six months later, when she went to a doctor's appointment she found out that she gained more than ten pounds. Sarah is now a size fourteen in waist. Studies show that seventy percent of people gain weight because they cut down on exercising so they can have more computer time. Most people spend to much time on their computers and less time interacting with family and friends. This reminds me of my step dad John. When John gets home from work he usually goes straight to the computer instead of having a conversation with the rest of the family. He gets angry when Billy (five years old) bothers him because he wants to play. John is usually online. From three o'clock till ten o'clock playing chess with strangers from all over. What he doesn't know is that while he is building relationships with strangers he is breaking the bond between him and his loved ones. Thirty-two percent of teenagers are involved with cyber bullying. This reminds me of my cousin Emily. Last summer, Emily became a member of Facebook Myspace, iTrouble quickly began to find her. In other words, girls from ages thirteen to twenty began to send her threatening messangers. No later than a day when Emily was walking down the street a gang of girls jumped her. However, she survived the brutal attack and deleted her Facebook account. In conclusion, without a doubt, I firmly believe that people shouldn't spend to much time on computers. My three arguments are cyber-bullying, less exercise and less interaction with family and friends, I hope you take my suggestion seriously and bann computers.

Dear Editor of the newspaper, I understand you think computers don’t have an effect on people. Computers do have an effect on people. To go along with that, adults and children use the computer to type something on Word if it's for a report for work or an essay in school. Maybe you have used the computer to type information for your newspaper. Yet, one thing kids love to do on the computer is communicate with their friends. Most kids either use Facebook, instant messaging, or Oovoo to communicate. Having these programs helps kids stay in touch with friends that moved away. Plus, one thing good about these programs are if you have family that live very far away from you, you can always talk to them at any time. I understand why you think computers don't have an effect on people. Computers do have many effects on people. That's not all, computers help people find what they're looking for. It also helps you with your work. Nevertheless computers are a great way to communicate with friends or family. Think long and hard about what decision that you want to make, as the benefits are clear and significant.

Dear Local Newspaper, Do you remember when you were a kid? There weren't any computers or other electronics except the telephone. The computer is very advanced and helps people in many different ways, such as: hand-eye coordination, learning and being able to talk online. These things benefit society and prove the advancement in technology. The computer teaches hand-eye coordination when people don't even realize it, through typing whether typing an email or an essay your hands are working and helping you. The hand-eye coordination that people learn on a computer can be used for sports. A professional tennis player said, "I used to go on the computer everyday and play tennis later, and eventually the computer helped me with my favorite sport." Hand-eye coordination is very useful, for many things; our survey of many people found that most of these people say that hand-eye coordination is a very important skill and that everyday activities, such as computers, help them improve. Typing is very commonly used while sending emails because they are fast, fun, and let you communicate. When talking on a computer there are many new ways that are popular and fast, such as email, Facebook and many more. It is nice to be able to talk to friends and family online because other options are more expensive. For example, many live in one state and her sister, who she is very close to, lives in another state. They can't talk to each other a lot because neither of their calling plans allow them to call without charging hundreds of more money. They also can't fly to see each other because plane tickets are expensive these days. Also, the economy isn't doing that great, so they couldn't stay in-touch until webcams came out. Now, they see each other almost every week. Many said, "I was considering flying, but now the webcams and email are useful and save us both a lot of money." People might argue that you can just send letters to each other, but, you can't send your baby boy's first steps that you just video taped, or a YouTube video that is really cute. Also, you can meet new people online that you might not have seen normally and when you can stay in touch, you can stay much closer to each other. Even though computers are great for fun, working and learning are much easier online. When online, everything that can be learned is amazing whether it's a word's meaning or the earthquake in another country. Being able to keep track of everything in one computer is amazing. A teacher at a local school says, "We are trying to make more things electronic to protect the planet, so we don't waste paper and will save trees." This is true, about half of the homework of fifth graders is online, whether it is to look up the equation for photosynthesis or to find out what year a historical figure died in; being online does help the environment. It is important to be able to have computers in schools because it gives more chances for kids to learn more things faster, like sixth graders having a math class online. It gives people more information coming from more people. Online, you can read a scientist's experiment or a paparazzi's take on a celebrity's new boyfriend. The computer has changed society a lot, for the better. Now, in the modern era, computers are part of the everyday lives of people in which they benefit. With better hand-eye coordination, being able to talk to your friends, and being able to learn, the computer benefits society in numerous ways.

Dear @CAPS1, Some people say that computers are fun, smart, and do no harm. Is that true though? Do computers cause harm? Well, for one thing, I know that computers can take up a lot of people's time. For example, many people don't go outside as much. This is because most people are usually on their computers. What are they doing on the computer, you ask; well, let's find out. There are many things a person can do on a computer. It can be for fun, chatting, educational purposes, or hard work. This is because if they spend all their time on the computer, they can get sick. Going outside, exercising, and getting fresh air is very important. So people out there, get off your computer.
