Dear local newspaper, I'm sure you love kicking back and surfing the web. After all, the internet is an amazing invention. However, the truth of the matter is that some people spend way too much time on the computer. We miss out on all the other important things in life, just because of too much time on our laptops. Excessive use of the internet can lead to not enough exercise. It can cause us to be anti-social, and lastly, not allow us to enjoy the beautiful nature that surrounds us. Do you know what a very high cause of obesity is? Electronics; kids sit on the computer all day long, while they should be out exercising and keeping fit. Sure, it is still okay to surf the web. You just have to keep the time minimum; we could ensure this rule by having a time limit set at home. I myself love to use the computer, but I make sure to get off after about an hour. The whole idea of the "internet" is such a broad topic that leaves us with so much to explore, we just have to keep an eye on the clock. There are so many forms of chat on the internet; Facebook, Twitter, etc. Many people are always on one of those, instead of talking in person. We can eventually become anti-social due to so much time spent on the computer. Although yes, you can be talking over the internet, it is necessary to be talking to people face to face, it is as if we become glued to the computer. Websites such as Instagram and TikTok are also causes of this. People get addicted and are on them constantly; social media websites actually take away time that could be spent with friends. So instead of having a chat over the computer screen, plan a meeting in person. Don't allow the computer to let you lose the social skills that you have built up. I love going outside each season to see the beautiful nature that surrounds us; if you spend too much time on the computer, you won't have time to enjoy it. There are so many things that you would be missing out on. Take time out of your day that you would normally spend on the computer to take a walk outside. Things outside are so much prettier than your computer screen, trust me. Once you cut down your computer time little-by-little, you will realize all the other things that are more worth your time. So the next time you think about going to surf the web or play that new computer game, I hope you think about my opinions I presented to you. Too much time on the computer causes us to not get enough exercise, and we can become anti-social. We won't be able to enjoy the nature around us. Computer time is fine in moderation, you just have to be aware of how much time you spend on it. Hopefully, my supported reasons have given you another view on surfing the web.

Dear Local Newspaper, I think that computers are both a good and a bad thing. Computers allow us to play games, and learn about almost anything. But computers cannot simulate fresh air and exercise. Computers allow people to play a wide variety of games. People can play chess, solitaire, and a great deal of other games like that. Computers also allow us to play a very wide variety of online games. I can think of at least three different sites that have online games, each site having at least fifty different games! Hundreds of thousands of people play online games everyday! What would they do if we didn't have the computer to play those games? We can also search any topic from a computer anywhere. This is an amazing thing to be able to do. Imagine if nobody had a computer; how would we research so much of our knowledge? Yes there are libraries, but using a computer is so much faster. Plus you can print things out on a computer; with a book you have to copy important information down, though you can highlight the important parts. No matter how much computers do, they may be the reason kids are getting bigger and bigger all because they sit for so long. Computers are amazing and society benefits from them by a lot. But just like everything, computers have their downside. So please inform adults and kids about the goodness of computers, but also warn them about the bad things that could happen if you spend too much time on the computer and not enough outside.

Have you ever gone on the computer? Have you ever sat there on the computer for a long time? I am writing you because I am concerned with the health of the town. Many people have computers and go on them daily. It may be fun, but it could also hurt your health. Computers can be addicting and cause us to play for hours. Many people do not exercise at all anymore. Most are too busy on their computer. You should have at least sixty minutes of exercise each day. "Active kids should have anywhere from sixty minutes of exercise on average per day. A lot of kids are now playing video games on the computers for that time instead of exercising," says Dr. Sereno. Many kids don't go outside enough either. Did you know you should have a minimum of thirty minutes in sunlight each day? You get most of your vitamins from the sun. When was the last time you took a bike ride, went camping, or went to the beach? All are very fun things to do that you could be missing out on because of the computer. I know I absolutely love going to the beach. Hearing the waves, laughing by the ocean waters, and feeling its cool spray is just heaven. If I was on the computer all the time I would not be able to enjoy that. My most important question is, do you like having fun or going out with your family? I believe computer conversations don't feel the same as being with the person. Can you imagine never actually seeing or hearing the person you're talking to? That's how it is with texting. A large percentage of communication is now done online, but wouldn't you rather talk to the person on the phone or talk face to face? I feel people should spend time exercising, going outdoors, and spending time with friends and family. Remember sixty minutes of exercise, thirty minutes in the sun each day to stay really healthy. Please consider this and write an article to improve the town's social and overall health. Its up to you!

Readers, imagine a world without computers. Communication would be slower, schoolwork would be far more difficult and we'd lose a source that generates tons of fun. Do you really want a world like that? The pros of computers definitely outweigh the cons. For example, computers make world communication way better thanks to tools like email, instant messaging, and video conferencing. Computers also make learning for school easier and allow you to work more efficiently. Lastly, computers make the world a much more entertaining and fun place thanks to YouTube, news and online movies/tv shows. The effect of computers is definitely positive on society. With one click a message can be sent to anywhere in the world. How great is that? Because of computers people not only email each other but we can even have live chats through text or videos; online communication is a great help in my life, and the lives of my peers. For example, whenever I forget homework or have questions about schoolwork I can reach my peers and get help in a matter of minutes. Not only can I seek help from others on my computer but I can stay in touch with my friends and family. So those who think computers cause us to spend less time with family and friends are mistaken. Computers link the world together and greatly advance communication positively. Aside from communication, computers also greatly improve education and learning in many ways. For example, they make it so that projects and assignments can be done faster and easier thanks to programs like Microsoft Word. It's proven that students who use computers for schoolwork find that they make learning easier as well. Online encyclopedias help students all over the world with schoolwork or just learning for fun at home. Another way that computers improve education is through online tutors and help sites. Computers have made it so you're basically always within minutes of a teacher. I can't imagine completing any assignment without a computer on my desk. Computers are not only practical for school and communication but they're also a great way to spend time having fun. One source of fun on the computer is online movies and tv shows. Thanks to them you can always stay caught up with the latest episodes of your favorite show. Online gaming also brings joy to people all over the world; you can spend hours playing live with others in detailed three-dimensional worlds! Computers also enable you to kick back and laugh at historical videos on YouTube. Lastly computers make browsing all the latest news a breeze. You will always know what's going on in the world, thanks to your computers. So whether you enjoy chilling and watching videos, playing games or reading up on the news you will always find a way to have fun online! What's not to like? With such a positive effect on the world, computers are definitely amazing technology; you can communicate with friends or family online in an instant, work on your school assignments, learn something new or simply have a great time! We hope you see how computers make life better and much easier.

Dear Local Newspaper, I have heard that some people do not agree that computers benefit our society. Well, in this letter I am going to give you three reasons how computers do benefit our society. Those reasons are that people have friends and family in other states, some people use them to stay organized, and computers help you learn more. I hope that by the end of this letter you will see that computers do benefit our society. First of all, I think that computers benefit our society because email lets people stay in contact with family and friends in other states. This is true that you could use the phone and call them out, but you have to pay for long distance. You don't have to pay anything to email somebody. I know from experience because I have friends and family in a lot of states in the country. "Computers help me stay in contact with my family all over," said a user from a major tech company. Indeed, many people use the computer to contact loved ones every day. Some people even use them to stay in touch with family who are at war. Next, I believe that computers benefit society because software keeps people organized. I know this may not seem like a big deal, but a lot of people use computers to keep things organized so they know how everything is. What would happen if we didn't have computers to track all of the appointments? Well, I will tell you what would happen: appointments would be missed, and you might end up getting things you already have. "I keep my schedule on my computer," said one professional. And finally, I strongly believe that computers benefit our society because they help people learn more. Yes, it is right that not everybody goes on the computers to learn, but that doesn't mean they don't learn. Here's a couple of examples: one is a music site that lets you learn song lyrics, dance moves, and more. Another is a social site that lets you learn what other people like, don't like, and so on. Then there is Facebook, which lets you see what people are doing that day. "People learn everything on the computer," stated a noted educator. Now I hope you see that computers do benefit our society, and if you think they don't, that is your opinion. I hope you see what I see now.

Dear local Newspaper, In my opinion computers have a good effect on people because people can communicate with each other, learn on the computer, and mostly people can shop online. Dear Editor, Computers are a great invention! They allow you to do so many different things. They have a lot of positive effects on people. Computers deal with all sorts of things, from hand-eye coordination, learning about faraway places and people, to talking online with anyone. Come on in to the wonderful world of computers. Computers have a super positive effect on people. They help teach hand-eye coordination. You can look at the screen without having to look down at your hand to move the mouse. You can see where it's going just by looking at the screen. Doing this helps everyday skills like playing sports. If you can use your eyes and your hands at once, you can hit a baseball or even catch a ball. Computers teach hand-eye coordination by being able to do two things at the same time. Wouldn't it be amazing if you could just find a recipe to go to? Well, you could simply use a computer. A computer helps people learn different things. It's also easy to learn about different cultures, people, and places. Let's say you want to learn about another country; a computer gives you the ability to learn something new. People use computers almost every day. They give you access to communication tools. For instance, instant messaging is a great way to talk to people. You can chat with people by typing. Furthermore, sites like social networks, blogs, or forums are places where you have your own page to post your own opinions. You also have a friends page to see how you are doing. These sites give people a chance to reconnect with old friends. Webcam is becoming a huge sensation! Sites like Skype let you see and talk to the other person. They allow you to talk to people that you miss and feel that they are there with you. Computers benefit people all over the world, but that doesn't mean they are taking over; they are only helping them improve their lives.

Computers have been one of technology's greatest advances, and yet one of society's downfalls. Originally thought to spread ideas and knowledge of faraway places, computers have been proven to do quite the contrary. Computers are dangerous devices, and are targeting young, wholesome kids. It is the main reason why society is as it is today, predicting that this future generation is wobbling on an unsteady and weak foundation. These devices, the source of this mayhem, must immediately be removed from society because they take away the true benefits of life, have harmful effects on our health, and support some of the country's deadliest predators. Firstly, computers are linked with the crime of stealing the pleasures of childhood. Since @DATE1, the amount of adolescent users has shot up by @PERCENT1. Amazingly enough, @PERCENT2 of parents polled admitted that their children spend at least @NUM1 hours on the computer everyday. This takes away the pleasures of reading, exercising, spending time outside and hanging with friends and family. These negative effects have an unhealthy toll on society, especially teenagers, the most frequent users. As a result, diet and exercise are curtailed, raising the obesity number by @PERCENT3, and lack of outdoor or family activities have promoted anti-social behavior. At this alarming rate, our future generation may indeed be balancing on a cracked foundation. In addition to limiting diet and exercise, computers are also the source of yet another health risk. As long as the computers are plugged in, they emit invisible waves of electromagnetic radiation. These waves are linked to diseases and cancers. Use of computers has been thought to cause brain tumors and leukemia, as well as other brain disorders and cancers. Leukemia, when caused at a young age, is difficult to cure and stunts the child's development. Children exposed to at least @NUM2 hours a day to a computer screen, compared to the few who spend their time outdoors, are @NUM3 times as likely to develop such possibilities. The ultimate prevention to such risks is to reduce exposure to such causes, limiting computer use completely. Lastly, computers are harmful because they are also a deadly weapon. As an adolescent unthinkingly surfs the web and chatrooms, they are at risk of attack by thousands of child predators prowling the web. Computers contain extremely valuable and secret information, such as names, birthdates, genders and even social security numbers. With one click, accepting a stranger's invite, the online predators hack into the child's computer and obtain such valuable information. Or the predators may be less passive and attack directly—asking personal questions to the child themselves. In fact, a familiar story tells the unfortunate fate of one local teenage girl, who unknowingly chatted with an online stranger. This online predator smoothly invited her to the mall, where they met. A couple of devastating weeks later, the girl's remains were found, burned, as the last deadly act the predator performed on the teen. Therefore, computers are simply too dangerous, a predator's handbook as they search for their next victim. By removing the computer, you eliminate the threats online predators pose for your child and you as well. It is amazing to learn that technology's greatest advancement, the computer, can unleash such harmful effects. Lack of engaging activities such as exercising and reading are stunted by the ever distracting computer; its electromagnetic radiation attacks our health; and lastly, it supports the acts of the thousands of cruel, sneaky online predators awaiting your child on the web. By removing the source of all these troubles, those acts can be prevented and society may begin the path to reform and recovery.

Dear Editor of the Daily City News, computers are a wonderful tool and they bear many positive impacts on society. First, computers have created numerous new forms of communication. Also, they have enabled us to create a new age in research. In addition, computers have given us amazing modern ways to entertain ourselves. Computers have an incredibly positive effect on people. One reason why computers have such a positive effect on humans is that we have developed many new ways to communicate with people all over the world. First, one fantastic program such as instant messaging has given us the amazing ability to hold a conversation with one or more people anywhere in the world, and be able to respond within an instant. In a recent survey, a large percentage of people said that they prefer instant messaging over any other type of communication besides face-to-face talking. Second, most computers come with webcams built in now, so you can actually see the person you are communicating with. I had a friend move recently, and we are able to see what each other are doing and remain friends even though we do not live in the same town, and I am sure a similar experience has occurred to you or someone you know. Finally, the popular program of Facebook has changed communication forever. People can now see things going on in your life wherever they want. Although some may criticize it, it has been a wonderful tool. Computers have established incredible ways of communication. A second reason computers positively impact people is that they have created a new era for research. One example would be our phenomenal search engine, Google. Google can find almost everything, helping people in finding information. Schools now use computer resources such as online libraries which allow for deeper research due to the fact that there is so much information available on the internet. In addition, computers have created many opportunities for people to learn more because of the billions of web pages in existence. Studies have shown that a significant percentage of people have found a website containing information relevant to their research that was more current than a book. Computers are the reason that research has continued to thrive and new discoveries continue to be made. Finally, computers have established amazing new entertainment for people of all ages. First, video websites such as YouTube have created a place for people to watch music videos and creative films just to enjoy themselves. If you cannot get tickets to a concert you want, going online to watch music videos by that person is a much cheaper alternative. Second, gaming websites are a less expensive option; if you go online you can play similar games at no charge. Finally, websites with appropriate funny stories posted on them are a fantastic way to get the laughter of a comic without leaving your couch. Wouldn't you prefer to stay home, rather than going out when it is not necessary? Computers are an incredible way to achieve quick, inexpensive entertainment in today's economy. In conclusion, computers impact people in many positive ways. They have established new forms of communication, research, and entertainment that will forever change society. Therefore, I invite you to join me to demonstrate the incredible strength of computers.

Dear local newspaper, I think that computers have a positive effect on people because it helps them learn about foreign places, it allows them to connect with family and friends that live far away, and it helps them with their jobs. Computers help people learn about foreign places. Before my uncle went to Japan, he wanted to learn about their culture. He went on the computer and researched Japanese culture, so that he can be prepared. How would you feel if you went to another country and knew nothing about it? What if you were to go to that country and do something that was disrespectful to their culture, but you didn't know because you didn't do research on it? I know I would feel bad. Now some people might say that you can read a book on that country, but not everyone has time to sit and read a book. Computers make the world a little smaller and helps us learn about each other quickly and efficiently. I think that's pretty positive. Don't you? People connect with each other through the computer. More than eighty percent of people who move away from their family and friends reconnect with them through computers. Nowadays there are social networking sites, like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, that gives people the chance to contact a family or friend that lives far away. When I moved to California from Texas, I thought that I was never going to see my best friend again. But then, I got a Facebook account and found her on there. I was very estatic. We swapped numbers and addresses. Now everyday I talk to her on the computer. Also, the only way I talk to my aunty, who lives in Florida, is by the computer. I can't talk to her on the phone because that would run my phone bill up. Another reason that computers are positive is that is helps people find their biological parents or siblings. It brings them together and helps them reconnect with each other. Computers help people with their job. Anybody who is a manager of a company has a laptop. It helps them store data, files, and important information securely. Computers are essential to these people. Also, it helps them keep track of their company if they go on a vacation. How would you feel if you owned a company and went on a vacation, but you couldn't keep track of it because you didn't have a computer? It provides essential peace of mind. Computers have a positive effect on people because it helps learn about places, talk to their family, and keep track of their job, making daily life much more manageable.

Dear Editor, I strongly believe that use of computer is beneficial to the community. One reason I feel this way is that computers can improve hand-eye coordination and other skills. These computers provide access to games helpful in pilot training. In fact, a flight school, in Florida, USA, just began using these games as part of their training this past year. Instructors report that piloting skills in trainees and students are far better than in years past. Additionally, computer games can improve reflexes. Two years ago, a man named John Doe, thirty-five years old, fell onto the train tracks just as a train was coming by. Through extra-ordinary reflexes he managed to leap out of the way, saving his life. When asked how he did it, he said he had been playing computer games since he was ten years old. These games also make you more intelligent. The National Institute of Health's recent study reports that brains were twenty percent more active after use of computers. The researchers achieved this data by attaching electrolytes to the patient's brain both before and after using the computer. It is for these reasons that computers improve hand-eye coordination and other skills. Another reason for why computers are beneficial is that they allow you to talk online. They even allow you to communicate with your family who live far away, strengthening your relationships. I recently got back in touch with my cousin who moved to Canada. Letters were too expensive and took too long, but email and Skype provide us with a great alternative. These computers also improve social skills. Jane Smith, resident here in town, says, "I love using computers because I can talk to my friends whenever I want, and I feel like it really helps us communicate." Who wouldn't love a machine that provides a service like that? These computers can even improve your mood. In a test done by a local university in 2022, one hundred people were put in separate rooms with personal computers for one hour. Afterwards, seventy-five percent said they felt an improvement in their mood. Computers are great because they allow you to talk online. Finally, computers allow you to learn about other places. Virtual tours are becoming more and more common today. In fact, at VirtualTours.org, you can take virtual tours of over fifty different countries, including France, Japan, Italy, and Brazil. You can also learn about other cultures and their traditions through online videos at youtube.com and articles at wikipedia.org, the free encyclopedia. You can even learn new recipes. Celebrity chef extraordinaire Martha Stewart not only posts all her recipes online at mstewart.com, but she even finds some of them online! In a recent interview by Food magazine, when asked where she's found some of her best recipes, including her famous triple chocolate cake, Martha Stewart admits she found most of them online, saying, "It's a powerful resource that more people should use. Al Gore currently owns the world's best cookbook!" It is because of this that computers allow you to learn about other places. Thank you for your time, and I hope you take what I have said into consideration. It is for all of these reasons I strongly believe computers are beneficial to the community.

Dear local newspaper, I have recently saw that you think that people are spending way too much time on computers instead of exercising or hanging with their friends and family. Well I think the opposite of that opinion. People interact with people online if they want to. People can also learn new things. Plus computers help people make money. So read on to hear more. Most people that use computers are interacting with people someway somehow. Ninety percent of all people have either a Facebook, a Myspace, a Skype, or all three. On any of those sites you interact with people. We can meet new people on the internet. Like people on the other side of the state or country. Also we hear about what is going on in our big or small town. Like for instance if there was a missing child we know the description, so we could help find him or her. Not only do people interact but people can research useful information. For an example, one day I was told to do a project on teen mothers. I went straight to the library I took some books out and whatever I couldn't find in the books, I went to the computer for. Also we can learn about faraway places like Paris or Tokyo. My mom always says, "Clean your room or I'm going to give your stuff to people in need." The first time she said that to me I went to the computer to see how other people were having to live. Some were in good, nice, big houses but then others lived in boxes and trash cans. That changed me big time, I felt really bad for those people. Lastly computers help people make money and support their family. Seventy percent of all people found out about their job on a computer. They can go to websites to find good safe jobs that makes good money. Plus if you have a computer you can easily work from home. Some people don't have the money for babysitters so they have to watch their kids all day and therefore have to work from home to make money. Finally people can apply for jobs or even community service online. My sister, Sarah, got her first job by going on the City Museum's website and applying right there on the computer. Therefore computers are good. I say this because people can interact with other people online, people can research useful information, and finally computers help people find jobs and make money. Do you use computers for any of these reasons?

Dear Newspaper, It's a small world after all - and growing smaller as computer usage becomes more and more widespread. Thousands upon thousands of sites and applications are now at your fingertips. I firmly believe that the effects of computers are overwhelmingly positive. For one thing, they increase hand-eye coordination. For another, they are a great means of communication. Finally they are a very powerful research tool. Some critics say that computers are lessening time with family and friends, but I don't agree. Computers help us stay more connected than ever! The computer is not evil - quite the opposite! First of all, computers are great for increasing hand-eye coordination. In a recent study by Dr. Evans, he noticed a significant increase in motor skills of children aged three to five when they used educational computer programs such as a popular learning game for just half an hour, once a day. Children who did not use the program were seen to develop motor skills at a much lower rate. Hand-eye coordination is a skill needed from birth to death, and should be encouraged as much as possible. I know that this skill greatly helps me in my daily life - and probably you in yours as well - from the most basic tasks of eating and brushing my teeth to typing, drawing, and playing piano. As you can see, hand-eye coordination is very important. Second in my reasoning is that computers are brilliant communication aids. People can't always be reached by phone. An email could be waiting for them online whenever - and wherever - they check their inbox. Also, documents can be sent over email that would be near impossible for a home phone and difficult for most cells to process. Revolutionary video-conferencing programs like Zoom can even allow us to talk to people around the world, practically eye to eye. I use my computer to keep in touch with family on the East Coast. How about you? Last - but (at the risk of sounding cliched) definitely not the least - computers are very powerful research tools. Everything from the schedule of the local zoo (thus preventing toddler meltdowns when one arrives only to find it closed) to the average life span of the African elephant (seventy years). Rather than skimming book after books for a single piece of information, plug your query into any of many search engines, from Google to Bing, and find answers instantly. Find about the Great Pyramids without the expense of a plane ticket. See photos of the Northern Lights - a sight most people would never get to see without the internet. The computer can take us anywhere. In conclusion, computers are a great resource that are often wrongly portrayed in a bad light. Computers teach and improve valuable hand-eye coordination. Also, they help greatly with communication. And finally, they are a powerful research device. Computers are often shown as the bane of society. This is simply untrue. They are an excellent tool for all ages. Technology is not our enemy. Don't treat it like one.

I have realized that there has been a disagreement about computers and their positive and negative effects on people. Dear Readers of the local community, in this time almost everything in our modern world revolves around technology, from communication to entertainment, with the internet changing our lives so quickly. Do we still have time to stop and smell the roses? People are no longer outdoors looking at the distinguished leaves in the fall or at the park or playing sports or baseball, but instead sitting on a chair watching a video online or playing games for hours. In our community, health problems have become an epidemic! Why? Because rather than enjoying the fresh air and open fields our town has to offer, people are enjoying their screens and devices! As a resident, I have seen the obesity rate climb significantly over the years. That is more of our community affected! What other rate is going up so increasingly? The number of homes that own computers and the amount of time each home uses them! A local doctor found that in the last several years the number of type two diabetics has almost doubled! A researcher at a university wrote an article. In his article he exclaimed that a large percentage of households own more than one computer per household! Technology companies are all doing very well in this economic slump, while sporting goods, books and exercise equipment are not. Experts see this as a main cause for the growing lack of exercise and increase in time on home computers. Also just as important is how all this time spent on computers is effecting children, with many kids spending a significant portion of their day on a computer. It has become apparent that children are spending less time playing sports and more time on their amazing laptops playing video games! I am a young person, and I have been playing sports in my town for many years. When I was younger, the travel team used to have so many people try out it was difficult to get on, but now so few people play that we barely need to try out! When I grow up I am most likely going to end up in a job somewhere working for some big business where I will probably be working on a computer, so for now I want to enjoy being a kid! We should not let kids waste these years on video games; they will waste enough of their lives behind a computer later in life. We are talking about the health of our future! Our future, the children of tomorrow, do we want a world where everyone has diabetes and lives on their computers? Through the rapid changes in technology, we need to keep one thing the same no matter how difficult it is. That is we need to go outside and help keep our community in good shape, and we cannot do that from behind a computer screen. Thank you for your time and consideration of this important matter.

Dear editor, Computers are one of the best things that have ever happened to the human race. They benefit society in every way imaginable, and have numerous positive affects on people. Computers improve hand eye coordination, allow people to learn about many subjects that books do not give them acess to, and allow millions of people every day to talk and communicate with friends and family. The most important use for computers is learning. Using computers, billions of people gain knowledge that they never would have been able to learn before. Many people like myself check the weather on the computer daily, making sure we are prepared or dressed appropriatly for the weather. Without computers, I would not be able to do this. Also, on days when it snows during the night, I always check the school's website when I wake up in order to ensure that school is still on. This is a helpful resource and I don't know what I'd do without it. Another thing computers allow us to do is check the news. With the click of your mouse, you can check to see who won the presidency, or what shows are on tonight. Another amazing aspect of computers is that they improve eye-hand coordination greatly. This not only benifits my mom who checks her email five times every minute, but my little three year old sister who loves to move the mouse around, and type in random letters on documents. It could entertain her for days, but most importantly, it helps improve her eye-hand coordination every second she sits in that chair. This improved skill will help her enourmously in her future when she soon begins to play sports, and ride bikes. Finally, computers allow millions of friends and family to communicate daily at no cost. If classmates forgot to write down homework they can email the teacher instantly, and know exactly what the homework is and even open the sheet that the teacher attached, and print it out. A couple of weeks ago, my dad went to @LOCATION1 for thirteen days, and it was outragously expensive to talk to him on his phone. So, every couple days, he video chatted with me instead so I could talk to him. hear what he was doing, and even see the view of @LOCATION2 from his window. This was very special to me and could not have been done without computers. As it is so plainly clear, computers help us in so many ways that we forget about like educating us, improving our eye hand coordination, and allowing us to communicate with friends and family. These are just a couple of the positive affects and benifits that computers provide us with, making them an indispensable part of our lives.

I personally believe that computers do benefit society in a lot of ways. It can give you all the information you need with just a click of a button, entertainment is easy to find by searching the internet, and most importantly, it improves communication between people. One way computers benefit society is by making it easier for everyone to get information about something. This is needed, especially in school, where students can quickly access online encyclopedias and educational websites to help them get their information about the person they are writing about in their report. Getting information easily on the internet can also help people in other ways. What if someone needed to get the hospital's phone number in case of an emergency? He can use the computer to help him find that phone number quickly and reliably. Another way computers benefit society is by allowing us to get any form of entertainment easily. This is what the majority of the people in our society rely on. A lot of people use the computer to play games, listen to music, and watch online videos on various platforms. If someone was bored right now, he or she could use the computer to play fun games. What if that person thought it was a little quiet in his or her room? He or she could then use the computer to listen to music from a vast online library. Without computers we would probably be really bored for the rest of our lives. Finally, and most importantly, computers help improve communication between people. This is probably what everyone uses the computer for. Now you can send electronic mail to your friends in just seconds, post and view pictures of your family or relatives on social media, and you can even use an instant messenger to write to your friend and get messages from your friend in the fastest speed possible! Without computers, communication between others would be very hard and much slower. As you can see, computers can give you information easily, entertainment is not hard to find, and it can even improve communication between people around our society and the world! Computers are very helpful to us and improves everything about the way we live and connect with one another.

Dear Local Newspaper, In my opinion I support the advances in technology. Advances in technology helps us get information on things we need to get information on, we can chat with friends and family online and it can help our reading and hand-eye coordination skills. One of the reasons why I support advances in technology is because computers and phones can help us get information on things we need to get information on. We need to know what is going on around us, all the time, from local news to global events. We need to know what is happening and what is happening with other people in our lives through social media updates and news feeds. We need to know the weather and traffic conditions for our daily commute; if you have children you need to know if the school is open and if you work in places that use computers for information, you need to check if your boss or co-worker sent you anything important that you need to know about for your job. The second reason why I support advances in technology is because we can chat with friends and family online through video calls and messaging apps. We can chat with our family and friends on the other side of the world who have a computer or a smartphone. Most of us want to know if our family and friends are ok and healthy, even though we can't see them in person, and technology bridges that gap. I, for one, know this is fact because my family and friends keep in touch with each other online regularly. Staying communicated with our family and friends keeps our bonds strong over time and distance. The last reason why I support advances in technology is because computers can help us with our reading and hand-eye coordination skills through interactive activities. Computers can help our reading skills because if we don't have time to go to the bookstore to get a book, we can read the book online for free from digital libraries. It can help our hand-eye coordination because it can help our fingers move faster on the keyboard and help us do things faster and more accurately. I stated all of my reasons why I support advances in technology. Computers can help us get information on things we need to get information on, we can chat with friends and family online and it can help our reading and hand-eye coordination skills for a better and more connected life.

Dear newspaper editor: We are all living in the age of technology. There are many useful devices that help us live our every day lives. The computer is a major help. We can talk with relatives from different areas and you can surf the internet to learn new information. Furthermore, you can play games with people from around the world. The computer is a great device. Almost everyone has a relative that lives in another state or country. Well, you never see them because they live far away, right? With a computer you can talk and even have a face to face conversation with them. This can bring your family closer together. For example, my family just got a new computer and we have relatives that live in Florida that we almost never see. With the computer my dad talks to them almost everyday. Some people that I have talked to said that they are excited to see their relatives or friends more often. It has brought them closer together and made them better friends. The internet is a wonderful place where you can look up information for a school project and learn about different topics. When kids are doing a project in school and the information they need is not in the class book they can search for it online and this saves time. A large percentage of kids said that when they are doing a project the best thing to use would be the internet. Furthermore, it helps the kids work faster so they can spend more time outside or hanging out with their friends. Another thing you can do is learn about recent events. For example, most local newspapers have a website that you can visit. Even if your local paper does not you can go to other websites like "CNN". They have recent events that happen around the country and around the world. The internet is useful in many ways and can help you with your every day life. Every kid gets bored when it's a rainy day. So they can play games with people from around the world using a computer. There are many websites that have fun games that are fun and enjoyable. You can also become friends with people from other countries. My friends John and Sarah play on the computer and they have a lot of friends from other countries. I think that it's cool that you are playing the exact game with another person in Japan or Germany, and most of the games are safe and fun to play. Another thing is that you can connect and play with your friends in your home town. I have many times played games with John and Sarah. It's a fun thing to do during a boring, rainy day. In conclusion, the computer is a useful device that benefits us and helps us with our everyday life. It allows us to connect with family in far away places and surf the internet for new information. Furthermore, you can play games with people from around the world. It's a wonderful device and let's start using it.

Dear local news, As more and more people use computers, people ask if computers actually benefit society. In my opinion I think computers do. They provide entertainment, access to daily uses, and have many websites for social interactions. I think computers really do benefit society and here is why. Computers provide entertainment to people. Many people will want to watch funny videos or their favorite television show on the internet. One of the most popular websites for watching videos is YouTube. Another great source of entertainment are video games. People buy video games at their local store or play them on websites like Miniclip. You can see entertainment on the computer has a much more variety compared to the television, where a program is shown at a certain time instead of whenever you want. Another benefit computers bring to society is access to daily uses; the internet provides services that can tell you your local weather. Instead of waiting for the local news, you can immediately access it on your computer. Furthermore, you can access encyclopedias and dictionaries at websites like Wikipedia, which provide an easy, immediate tool for daily uses. One last example towards the benefit of computers is social interaction. There are many websites that you can use. One of these websites is called Facebook; it lets you upload pictures of people or family events for people in your network. You can also video chat with people over the internet and see the other person's face. You can't do that on a telephone or with texting on a cell phone. Many experts believe that computers are taking away time with family and friends but with websites like Facebook it is actually adding time. In conclusion, these reasons support my opinion that computers benefit society. They provide entertainment, easy access to information, and have many websites for social interactions. Without them, society would be a lot harder and this is why I think computers benefit society.

Dear Editor, Having a computer is a benefit. They help us in so many ways. It is very helpful, and it could make someone's life easier to handle. You could keep in touch with old friends or family. It would be easier for work, and when you're bored, you could play some fun games. It's very hard to have family you can't see and keep in touch with! With a computer you could send messages and photos to interact with them. You wouldn't have to worry about ever losing communication with them. You could also meet new people. Get new friends from anywhere in the world! Have friends from all different races and cultures. Computers are a great way to interact with others, whether it's family or friends. It's always hard to do work when you have no clue what it's about! If you're ever having trouble on something you could always look up information about it. You could learn how to do things or learn more information about a certain item. When you have homework and don't know the meaning of a word, you could always look up the definition of it. They also hold your information. For example, instead of carrying a ton of papers you could simply just save it in your computer. Then you could print it out whenever you need it. Computers make work easier and help you organize better. Computers also amuse you as well. When you have nothing to do, you could play a lot of fun games. You could also watch music videos or funny videos to get you laughing. They have practically anything you want to play. You would hardly ever get bored! As you see, computers are a benefit to people. It's always helpful when you could keep in touch with anyone, have help with your work, or simply keep yourself entertained. Without computers life would be harder and more boring!

From Facebook and Myspace to classic films like "Gone with the Wind," computers create a relaxing entertainment opportunity for everyone.

Do the members of this well-known and captivating newspaper think that the effects of people owning a computer are good or bad? Well, if you think negatively about computers and how they effect people, I would like to politely disagree. I'm certain I could sway you to agree with me too. Computers are positive for many reasons. The internet and other resources can be used for school, work, and other questions, the computer gives people something to do when otherwise they have nothing, and it allows people to talk to others online. There are many great effects computers have on and for people. Everybody has questions, wouldn't you agree? And more often than not, people don't know the answer right off the top of their head. Research is the key to answering questions. But who has time to go to the library and spend hours searching for an answer that would take a matter of seconds to find on the computer? Not every student, employee, or other person can spend that time looking for an answer. There are far too many other things to do! The internet on the computer allows people to find an answer quickly and efficiently. This can actually improve people's knowledge, and their performance at work or school. You can see here the positive effects of a computer. Have any of you ever been bored? I'm certain that you have. Everyone gets bored. Instead of sitting around doing nothing, people can go on the computer and do many activities. Contrary to some people's beliefs, this can be an excellent way to spend, not waste time. There are all sorts of educational games and mind-buggling puzzles to do on the computer. I'm certain you can see how much better these things are than sitting in front of the television. The effects are positive, because your brain is challenged, and your boredom has vanished. Also, hand-eye coordination can be greatly improved by doing these activities. These are so many positivities about the computers effect in people's boredom! People have friends, and it is only human to want to keep in close contact with them. But what if a close friend moves away? You don't want to lose that friendship right? People can write letters to each other, but that can be time consuming, and slow to delivery and response. And the positive effect of a computer is it allows you to keep in contact online with friends and family through instant messaging and email, both great resources for talking with others. Computers can keep friends together and save families from drifting apart. It is also good for couples or parents to keep in touch with their partner or children if they are away on a trip. These are all positive effects don't you agree? As you can see, I feel strongly that the computer has positive effects on people. It's good for research, it's something to do when someone is truly bored, and it enables friends and family to stay close via online communication. I strongly urge you to change your opinion from negative to positive about the effects of computers. Everyone can choose their own opinions, but I know you'll prove wise and agree with me!

Dear, Newspaper People should use less time on the computer because it effects their lifestyle. First of all computer's can bring a lot of obesity to the community because it bring lazyness and it makes peole not went to exercise. People should go green and start recyling and not worrying about what somebody said on "myspace" or "facebook". Also if we started recyling and worring about nature a significant portion of the earth would be greener. My last reson being their should be more friendler family time enstead of computer time. Computers just make you break away from your family and friends because your worrying whats happening on the internet. A large percentage of people should just get of the computer all the time and just chill with your family and friends.
