Dear editor, I think that people are spending too much time on the computer. Because of this, people are getting less exersice, they are not spending enough time outdoors and the dont spend as much time with their family and friends. Exersicing is an important part of one's daily schedued. I have a friend who exersices everyday. She is the healthiest person I know and rarely spends anytime on the computer. But, she knows someone who is almost her compleate oposite. He hardly ever exersices and spends several hours on the computer each day. He has also been diagnosed with diabeties and is obese. These are the type of health problems that are faced because of lack of exersice and too much computer time. Experts say that people should get at least thirty minutes of exersice every day. But, because more and more people are spending time on computers, this is almost impossible. Studies done at a major university show that a high percentage of kids under the age of twelve are obese or at the risk of becaming obese because they are not getting enough exersice. You don't want that number to increase do you? There are other problems that people face because of too much time on the computer. People are spending less time outdoors and more time inside at a desk. My friend Sarah spends way too much time on her computer and not enough outside. She failed a science poject because she was on her computer, rathern than outside comparing the leaves from different trees. Doctor James is a child phycologist and when he asked kids if they would rather play outside or be on a computer, a majority of them said computer. This shows that people on computers are not only young, but they want to be on the computer more than be outside. This is a number that, in my opinion, is too high. Lastly, there is the problem of people not spending enough time with their family and friends. By this I mean face to face time, not just video chatting with your friends on facebook. This has caused tension in relationships. My friend Emily didn't go to her family reunion but stayed at home on the computer and at the next family get together, she was ostrisized because she didn't go to the reunion. High school guidance counselor Mr. Davis says that many out of ten friendships are ruined because kids dont spend enough face to face time with their friends but are on the computer. These are all god reasons why less time on the computer and more time exersicing, outside, and with family and friends will make your life happier and healthier.

Dear Editors of The Local Newspaper: As students are promoted to higher grade levels, more teachers will require research papers. In my opinion having a computer helps me complete my research paper and the contents in it are the best it can be. What makes students and parents more happy to see high marks on their child's paper? Advances in technology. there should be advances in technology because they teach hand-eye coordination, it gives the ability to learn about far away places, and people, and even allows people to talk online with other people. To begin there should be advances in technology beacause it teaches hand-eye coordination. In a recent poll seen in TIME magazine, it showed that a high percentage of people who use computers had a large increase in their coordination, people were not as clumsy and poorly coordinated. John Smith, a professional tennis player stated that, "Before I started using a computer, I always, would play tennis for living and it was a bad choice because I was poorly coordinated. I always missed the tennis ball in matches. So I decided to stop. Then I started to use the computer more and my coordination improved. Now I barely miss any tennis balls." Therefore, having advances in technology will improve and teach hand-eye coordination. Another reason there should be advances in technology is because it gives people the ability to learn about far away places and people. Jane Doe a writer from National Geographic stated that, "People like to research a place before they go on vacation or a buisness trip because they would like to know more about it." Not knowing anything about your vacation destination is like not knowing what's for dinner tonight, it is clearly unreasonable. Recent studies show that the more a person knows about their vacation destination the more enjoyable it is. Thus, the more vacations they go one which is profitable for airplane companies. Also knowing about the different cultures of the people in far away places gives people a better perspective of the world they live in. Thus, having advances in technology will give the ability to learn about far away places and people. Furthermore, having advances in technology will allow people to talk online with other people. Mark Zuckerberg the creator of Facebook stated that, "Having online chat programs will help people communicate with each other. Facebook has been beneficial to everybody. For example, it helps people re-connect with their former friends. It is also very beneficial to students because if they forget a homework assignment they can log onto Facebook and ask a classmate." A recent article found on the internet, showed that online chat programs helped people communicate with each other. Therefore, having advances in technology will allow people to talk online with other people. In conclusion, having advances in technology will improve hand-eye coordination, teach people about far away places and people, and allows people to talk online with other people. When voting on this decision please take part and support advances in technology, it will be beneficial to everybody. Thank you for your time.

Dear editors of the Daily Times, Every morning, my sister wakes me up to go to school. She uses her cell phone to set an alarm. A few years ago, my mom would come in and tell us it was time to get up. Now, we have one small device that we carry around with us to do our work. Most everyone has cellphone now, and it does much more than allow people to talk to one another from two different places. Now we can play games, go on the internet. These advances in the technology are making us very selfish. I, for one, do not approve. For starters, all of these new and improved gadgets are time consuming. With all the things to do in the world, we could all be doing something helpful, fun, or productive. Don't you agree? I mean, if you consider the idea that we all could be hitting the gym or studying for school tests and quizzes, then most teenagers would be in much better shape, physicly, and mentaly, for sure. My aunt an former physisist, said. The rate at which most students and kids grow increasingly more obese, partly because of these new ideas involving phones and i-pods are completely sickening. The more time we spend using these items, the more we oppose the idea of being active? You can clearly see how we are growing less energetic, and much more careless of our time. Furthermore, the advances in today's society are pushing on the boundries at internet safety. Sure, people might claim that they can block out other people, but sometimes when someone posts something on the web, they don't always hide it well enough. They could have blackmailed one of your friend into commiting a crime, right? That happened to one of my cousins, just last year. The police took a long time to find her after she had been kidnapped, because the person who kidnapped her hid the evidence by a chain of blackmails. Do you see how important it is to spend less time on these silly computers? It sucks us into a virtual world that is sometimes 'bloody' or 'war-like? My brother learned swearing from the new & advanced game of Battlefield. It's a fighting game indeed! I implore your company to make the righty decision and write to help pull us off of our butts and get us up and going strong again. I hope you take my advice, and i thank you for your extremely valuable time and effort to consider this important matter.

Dear Local Newspaper, I'm sitting at the couch thinking about what I should do for vacation. I know I definitely want to take a trip somewhere to do some creative writing, but my notebooks are all scattered, I don't know how to quickly contact someone who could help and I have no idea about the country that I plan to visit. I take a last look at my notebooks strewn about the closet looking very much like a tornado swept through and I find the solution on the highest shelf: my laptop. First, I highly agree with the people who think computers are useful. Three effects they have on people who use them usually are fantastic. Compare a person with a laptop to one without. The person with a laptop might be a busy business person and have to converse with many people from long distances apart, so they use email and video conferencing. They travel places with people at their fingertips. However a person without a laptop could be busy moving from place to place just to meet these people. Their schedule could be chaotic. Conversations over a chat system are fast and effective. Take my story for example. My mom hates wasting, so instead of me driving to a friend we video call. Saves money and time! In addition, I happen to be a writer who writes often everyday in many notebooks. I've written so much over the years that my notebooks are piling all over my room. What organizational tool could help me in this situation? Why a laptop of course! One laptop or computer can store a bunch of files and makes editing a breeze. Anyone who works with data and writing would be crazy not to have a computer! Would you prefer a room full of notebooks that you have to buy more of, or a single, sleek computer with tons of space and back up? You tell me. Computers encourage users to be more organized! Respectively, computers are a resource for millions of pages of information. They're similar to libraries. But think about a library and then imagine a computer. One you have to walk around to seek your information and with the other, knowledge is merely a click away. Some might argue that computer websites are not entirely reliable I beg to differ. There are specific websites on computers with suffixes like '.org' and '.gov' and even '.edu'. These websites contain proven factual information and more great resources for research. By using computers I have acquired greater knowledge and have found computers beneficial. They have effectively made me more intelligent as a person. In conclusion, it's my strong opinion that those who use computers gain nothing but the positive effects, and these include money/gas-saving conversations through video calls and email, better organization, and increased intelligence from reading. I've decided to take my creative writing on my laptop and in doing so learned to weather the storm.

Dear Local Newspaper, It has come to my attention that you have asked people to tell their opinions on the effects computers have on people. In my opinion computers do not have a good effect. The reason I think that is because kids are on the computer instead of doing their homework, people do not exercise as much because they are always on the computer and they do not spend as much time with their family and friends. There are many kids that go on the computer all night and never get to doing their homework. I read an article that said, "Computers are the number one problem for kids not doing their homework." People get so distracted on the computer that they never end up doing anything else. Eight out of ten kids say that they sometimes don't do their homework because they get distracted on the computer. I interviewed a student in the eighth grade and she said, "Our class instantly gets all homework done but sometimes we forget when we are on the computer. That is really the only reason we don't do it." So computers are not a very good electronic if kids are not getting their homework done because of them. But that is not the only bad thing about them. Since people are always on computers they don't get out and exercise as much. Instead they sit and play games on a computer. I found this quote in an article I was reading "Ever since I started spending a lot of time on the computer I have gained weight because I am not out exercising," Exercising and going outside is a very important thing to do but people cannot do it if they are always on the computer. Nine out of ten people say that ever since they started going on the computer a lot, they have not gone outside or exercised in a while. I interviewed a woman and she said, "I had to not go on the computer for a while because I realized that it was not good for me and I needed exercise." People get so distracted on computers that they never go outside to exercise anymore. There are still some reasons why computers are not very good. Spending time with your family and friends is a very important thing to do, but with computers people do not do that much anymore. In a magazine I read it said, "People are not spending time with their friends and family because they are on the computer instant messaging." Computers are keeping people from spending time together. Nine out of ten families say that they have realized they don't spend as much time together because of computers. I interviewed some kids and they said, " I don't spend a lot of time with family or friends. I am mostly on the computer instant messaging." Computers are definitely not a good thing for families. Those are the reasons why I think computers do not have a good effect on people. Kids are on the computer and don't do their homework, people do not exercise as much and they don't spend as much time with family or friends.

Computers are really cool. Do you know my website is CoolSite1.com? We need to limit our time on them, let's mention it. I truly love the computers. We need to remember that computers are great machines. They help us play and learn new things every single day. We should use them wisely and make sure to also play outside. Computers are a wonderful part of our modern world, and we are lucky to have such amazing technology to use for fun and for schoolwork. We need to make sure computers are used in a positive way for everyone.

As the people of the world are starting to use the computer more and more, I think it has an extremely positive effect on people. Computers are not all fun and games they help with other things as well. For example, some of the amazing things the computer does are; teach hand-eye coordination, give people all over the world a chance to learn about the places, people and culture from far away places, and last but not least, it is another way to allow people to talk online with their friends. Now let me explain more about what a positive effect the computer is for the millions of people that use one. The computer today is such a great thing to have in your house. It is not for just games and playing video games on, it is also very helpful in the education of young children, teens, parents, and even grandparents. When you use the computer there is so much you can learn. For instance lets say you have a project in your social studies or history class about a country or a city and you don't know a thing about it. What do you do? You should log onto your computer find a reliable website and boom you are learning facts about France that you would have never known until you logged onto the computer. The computer is also a great way to practice and get better using your hand-eye coordination. First you need to learn about the layout of the keys and where they are positioned on the keyboard. After you have that skill, you should try to look at the computer screen and not be looking down at your fingers on the keys. Not only is that not helping your hand-eye coordination, but it is causing you to type much slower than you would if you were looking at the screen. The computer truly is unbelievable. Are you one of those people who's parents don't let you get a phone because of how much it costs without even the cost of texting? Well if you are, the computer can help you out with that problem as well!! There are bunches of different ways to talk to your friends and family on the computer. For example, you could use an instant messenger to chat with your friends or facebook to learn more and more about somebody. The computer is so handy! So lets recap on what we learned! The computer helps people learn about different places all over the world, helps with hand-eye coordination, and lets you talk to your friends! I think the computer is a necessity in every household.

Dear Editor, many people say that computers can have a bad effect on people. I came to disagree; computers make our lives so much easier. We can talk to people that we have not seen in a while, we can read and see other places we thought we would never know about; and instead of having to hand write that book we can type it up. I find these are reasons that show that computers don't have a bad effect on people. Imagine you are on Facebook and you type in your best friend from high school's name; she pops up and you are connected on the net. The next day she is online, happy you are connected. That's the kind of thing that happens everyday; people reconnect, and this not only happens on Facebook, but all over the internet! Reconnecting with friends and family, talking to your boss next door, you can even send a picture of your new born baby to your mother who lives in another state. Having computers really allows us to reconnect to those we have lost. Other cultures are very important. But what if we know nothing about other cultures? Then what would life be like? With computers we can instantly learn about other countries, unlike having to go to the library; all you have to do is type in the place and pick the site you want to look at, all with using computers. Long ago people would have to write out everything word by word, letter by letter. Not with computers. So don't worry about that long paper, you can just type it and with some software, you can even get your paper edited right on the spot. This is great for not only school children but adults too. That business proposal can be done quickly and easily with computers. Many people say that computers can have a bad effect on people. But with advancing technology, life gets easier, and the computer gives more time for other things. There is no bad effect of computers. The effect is just helpfulness for everyone in their daily lives.

Dear local newspaper, my opinion on the effects computers have on people is they help make every day life easier. First off, you can chat with people from long distances. Also, it makes homework, and finding information a lot easier as well. Last but not least when you have nothing else to do, you can play games, and watch videos from online. One of the best things about computers is going online and chatting with my friends. Even if they are across the country, you can still chat with them, for free, using various messaging applications! Also, if you can't get in touch with them, you can send them an e-mail, and as soon as they log on, they will get your message. Best of all, when you forget to write your homework down, you can go online, and ask one of your friends what it was. Besides talking to people, you can do your homework on a computer as well. All you have to do is make a word document, and type with the keys. Let me just say this is a lot better than having to write with a pencil, as mistakes can be corrected easily. Not to mention, typing a paper is a lot neater and more professional looking. Also, if you are doing a report on something, all you have to do is look it up on the internet, and you'll get endless information about it, all on your computer! Last but not least, you can play games on your computer. Whenever someone is bored doing nothing they can just turn on a computer, and play their favorite game. Not only is it fun, but it teaches hand-eye coordination as well. Some people say they don't have the money for games, but little do they know, there are millions of free online games, that any age can play. This is great on a boring day when you have nothing else to do. In summary, the effects computers have on people is they help make everyday life easier. You can chat with people from long distances, and it even makes homework much easier to complete. Not to mention it has fun games for people to play when they're bored, or have nothing to do. I strongly believe that computers have a positive effect on people, because of all the things they offer, and help us on. Thank you.

Dear Editor, I agree that computers had a positive effect on people. They teach hand-eye coordination, give the ability to learn about faraway places and people, and allow people to talk online with other people. More people should see computers as a positive effect on people. Spending time on a computer is a great way to enhance your hand-eye coordination. It also teaches you how to type fast. Typing is an important skill that you need for most jobs. It is so important that schools have throughout school teaching us how to type. We also use hand-eye coordination in computer games. You have to keep your eye on the screen and move your arms and hands to hit the correct keys. Computers are helpful in many ways. Have you ever wondered about what a faraway place looks like or what would be found on it? With a computer you can find out instantly. Computers give people the ability to learn about faraway places and people. You can get pictures of some important cities and places, and some knowledge on the people who live there. Yes, you could do this in a social studies book but it is much easier and faster online. Computers save time and make your life easier. Computers are learning more and more advanced everyday. They give you the opportunity to talk with people online whether they are across the world or down the street. In order to do this you need a webcam. They are sold in computer stores and some are already installed into the computer. Being able to talk with people online is a really great thing. It's a fast way to learn about that person and maybe about their culture if they are from a different country. It's almost like a pen pal lasting friendship through a computer. People are saying that computers have a negative effect on people. They say people are spending too much time on computer and not on exercise. They also say that they are not interacting with family and friends. All of these things should be considered. All you have to do is manage your time. Do not spend all day on the computer. If you do this then everyone will see that computers have a positive effect and are one of the best inventions created. I would like to thank all of the readers for their time and hope that you all support me and my ideas.

North County Courier, I would like to give you my opinion on the usage of computers. I am a person who supports the advances in technology and believe computers have a positive effect on people, they can benefit people in many ways. The three most important ways to me is that they help with hand-eye coordination, gives people another source to retain knowledge from, and lastly they provide another way for people to communicate. Hand-eye coordination is an awesome skill to have in our society. In a country, being the United States, that revolves around sports, hand-eye coordination really helps out. Using the computers really helps harness and train your hand-eye for sports such as baseball, basketball and many more. Using the computers for hand-eye coordination will really help the United States to develop some world class athletes. We also live in a country where their are so many drivers and cars on the road. We have a problem with bad drivers here in the United States so if they improve their coordination maybe the numbers of car accidents and fatalities involving automobile will decrease. Well how do computers help with hand-eye coordination you ask? I'll tell you how, by people using fun gaming sites, like lumosity.com, which is a website with games for brain training. They help with hand-eye coordination, concentration, memorization, and problem solving. They help your brain in all of these categories just by having cute and fun little games. As you can see in the United States we need improved hand-eye coordination and computers could do many positive things for the country. We can improve our skills just by using a computer. To retain knowledge about other cultures, places, people and miscellaneous things is amazing thanks to the computer we have for this information besides books. With the internet and computers you can know about what you want when you type in the subject into a search engine like google or yahoo. People can learn all of this wonderful and interesting information about things they would have never known before. They also help kids find information for reports and school projects. There are truly many things you can learn on the internet. You can learn about history or science. Maybe the difference between an element and a compound, or even just the definition of the word success that is a key to life. You can get so much knowledge from the computers and internet. Communication is another huge part of our daily lives. Most people have home phones or cell phones, but for the ones who don't they need a means of communication. On the computer you can use instant messaging or email; or use social media like twitter, or myspace as well. The computer gives people who don't have phones another way to communicate with others. Even if you do have a phone and someone you know is overseas, instead of wasting money on a long distance call just use one of the systems I've mentioned. The same thing goes for our military, they don't have phones to call home so they communicate via the computer. Communicating via computer is just another reason why the computer is so important. So as I conclude my letter to you, the north county courier, I shall restate that I do support technology because they do have positive effects on people. The positive effects that are the most major are they teach hand-eye coordination, help people with another source to gain knowledge, and lastly they allow another way to communicate with people. I will tell you once again computers benefit society and do have positive effects.

Dear Local Newspaper, I think the effects that computers have on people are bad, and should be stopped. I mean don't get me wrong computers help people, but a lot of people go on it everyday, some computers can get viruses, and there are much more activities to do other than on a computer. I hope to persuade you about the horrible effects a computer has on people. Do you know how many people use the computer? Well, according to recent studies over one billion people use a computer worldwide. The problem we are facing today is that too many people are on a computer, most of them are teens. According to a survey about seventy percent of teens spend most of their time on a computer. Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, and Twitter are the most common places to find teens. I would know that because I have a facebook myself. I've had one for almost a year, and you should see all the people who have one. My friend wanted me to get one because she said she had one and wanted me to get one too. So I did and then I found out that more then half of my grade had a facebook. In my own words I honestly think the computer can be addicting, especially when your on a worldwide account like facebook. There are many people on the computer and it must be stopped. In addition, another reason is computers occasionally get viruses. According to a tech website, the average adult gets about five to ten viruses a year. My friend was on his computer typing a report, and then his computer shut down. Then a few seconds later the computer said you have a virus. The next day he told me he didn't have his report because the virus wiped out all his information. About half of viruses can cause a computer to shut down and it is hard to reboot it. Some places have made virus scans such as McAfee and Norton, but sometimes they can't catch the virus. Many people who say that a virus was caught by the virus scan they have, their computer freezes up and you can't delete the virus, viruses must be terminated, so the computer can work properly. Thats another reason to why computers affect people in a bad way. Furthermore, people think that the computer is their everything. They're wrong! There is a lot of activities that they can do other than be on a computer. According to a health report the average person between the ages of ten and twenty spend more then seven hours on a computer. There are many other options of activities like call your friends and get together, that's why they invented the cell phone, play a sport, read a book, spend time with family for goodness sake! Don't spend all your time on the computer. About a quarter of teens who are on the computer alot tend to get into lower colleges later in life. That is my final reason of the bad effects a computer has. In conclusion, computers can cause a bad influence due to viruses, too much time on it, and not doing other things. I hope you can see my point to this and please send me a response as soon as possible.

Dear Editor, I believe that computers are not necessary. Some believe that they help us learn, but I just say so do books. Some people believe they can help to be more hand eye coordinated, so does playing catch. Most believe that internet teaches about people in faraway places, I say why not visit those places then you'll know more than what was typed in a computer. If it was computers against books I definitely would concur with whomever roots for books. A good book is healthy. To me, reading a book on the computer is one of two things, unhealthy and unethnical! You can't read a book on the computer and even if you could it is not as fun as turning the pages of a beautiful paperback or hard-covered book. I Believe that you can learn so much from what you read in a book, (A real book)! When you type on a computer, do all that, "clickety, clickety"!, you say that it's learning because you learn to type without looking, hand-eye coordination. I say no! that is not natural. Why not go out side and throw a ball to one another? That's a real way to show hand-eye coordination. It's a fun game and it's easy, plus it teaches hand-eye coordination. Most people will say no we are not, but you offer a nine year old to play on the computer or, oh say go outside! You would be ignorant to think they would go out to play. People want to move forward but can we not make a compromise between technology and a healthy, active life?

Dear Local Newspaper, The question everyone is asking is if computers benefit society? Dear Editor, If you believe that the advances in our technology are not good for our society you must be misunderstanding; computers have a positive affect on the people in our community by giving us well-developed hand and eye coordination and giving us the ability to seek and find information to learn. It can also allow people to communicate online with others, bridging distances. Hand and eye coordination is an important thing that helps us everyday. With new technology such as computers, can help us with that skill, we should use it. A researcher of a leading university says, "Computers do help us a lot; almost eighty percent of active computer users do improve their hand and eye coordination just by using the computers for a small amount of time everyday." Knowledge and education are essential, especially now; the more you learn, the better salary you get. With this new technology, you can earn degrees and learn in a short period of time. My aunt got her business degree online about six months ago, and just because of that, got promoted at her job. Gaining valuable knowledge online doesn't just go for adults but children as well. If they have a report on a historical event or need some help on their homework, these new technologies are one of the most effective, fastest ways to learn and find information. A noted psychologist, a doctor that specializes in human emotions/feelings says in the latest journal last month that, "in this new millenium, preteens and teenagers simply love the new advances in technology, and if we want them to learn, then we can take this tool and have them use it." Computers are also a great way to communicate; it's fast and easy. I have an uncle who lives in another country, and we rarely get to see each other due to the distance, so we catch up by messaging each other by social networks or emails. It's even free, unlike the costly long distance calls. The communication is also great for businesses. A company can reach out and contact their customers to reschedule an appointment, give receipts, advertise and many other things efficiently. Computers are essential and effective technology that are used by people around the country and world. They improve hand-eye coordination, allow people to gain knowledge and education, and gives people opportunity to communicate with others, making this another great and useful step in our communities around the world.

There are many reasons that computers are a good thing for the world. They let us learn about far away places without us even having to leave our homes, accessing a wealth of information instantly. Another reason why computers are so important is we can talk to our family without having to even travel if they live in another country or another state or even if they are your neighbors, making communication effortless. Lastly they teach us hand-eye coordination that is a much needed skill that can help you get through life, improving dexterity. The fantastic thing about computers are that we can learn about far away places without having to leave the comfort of our home. People of all different countries may be inquisitive about where they came from. They may also wonder how other countries are doing government wise or even economically with stocks. All of this is possible and much quicker then watching the news or weather channel. Computers allow us to search the web and arm ourselves with knowledge at our fingertips. The marvelous things about computers is the speed of them. You could be waiting for a stock update on the news channel and wait maybe ten or even twenty minutes. However if you go on your computer and use the internet it makes your life much easier and the faster you can look up some piece of knowledge the faster you might be able to make dinner or even enjoy a nice walk outside and breathe in the nice icy crisp cold air. Also radios and television stations might be a little off with their accuracy. Maybe a minute later there is a suicide bombing that you might like to know about or the stock might go up one-hundred points or go down one-hundred points. This is all valuable information that people would want to be one-hundred percent accurate and timely. Secondly you can stay in touch with your family even if they live in a different country or in a different state. With webcams that are attachable to some computers or some that are embedded within the computers you can talk to them face-to-face. My grandma was in the hospital once and I wasn't allowed to see her since I was to young. Since the technology of webcams were invented I was able to see her on the screen instead of seeing her in real life but at least I was able to see if she was doing okay, which was a great comfort. Webcams are a good way also in discussions to see facial expressions. Such as you and your friend are joking and she says something you think is rude but you can't tell that she being sarcastic you might get into a fight. If you have a webcam you can talk to each other on the computer and see if she is being sarcastic or not, preventing misunderstandings. Technology may be one of the greatest inventions that has come forth and may be the best one that will ever be made. That last important thing that you need to know about computers is that they teach you hand-eye coordination. Hand-eye coordination is an important skill that is acquired through practice. This is an important skill because it allows you to succeed in life such as having to write clearly. This skill is also important if you have a job that involves computers because you need to know how to type and move your fingers fast if you want to succeed in this well paid job. This skill also helps provide a wide range of other successful jobs in the world, from surgeons to artists. Computers in the long run are magnificent machines that makes life a lot easier and fun in acquiring knowledge. If you don't have a good hand-eye coordination you should get a computer because it will help a lot through regular use. However if you get a computer you must update it regularly so your computer will not become slow and start crashing on you, ensuring its longevity. In conclusion computers are the best thing that has been introduced to man kind so far in this world. It allows you to do many things such as check news and see how the world is doing globally and how the economy is doing globally. Also it allows you to stay in touch with your family no matter how far you live or what country that you live in. Lastly computers teach you the important skill of hand-eye coordination. Everyone in the world should be able to have a computer so that they could obtain the knowledge that they would need to succeed in life and stay connected.

Dear School Board Members, Some people these days rely too much on technology. Everywhere you go you usually see somebody on a phone, texting, on a computer or plugged into an ipod. These people are not necessarily bad, but they are under the control of technology, which dictates their daily routines. Computers for example, are in the eyes of most people, fast, easy and fun, but they also pose as a problem. Even though it seems like everybody has a computer, not everybody does, creating a digital divide. Also people become way too dependent on such machines that they can become addicted to them, needing them for every task. Computers may also seem like they work ninety-nine percent of the time, but they can also be very unreliable, crashing at the worst moments. Just off the top of your head, how many people do you know that use a popular messaging service or social media site? A lot I'm sure. Now multiply that number by itself for all the people they know and multiply it again and so forth. That number shows that, indeed, over a hundred million people use these. Now what are the chances that if you sent a friend a message on one of these programs that the server will be one hundred percent reliable and your pal receives the information he needs? My point is that, what if something important came up that required your friends help, and you could not reach him because of a fault in the system? What would happen? You could be at a hospital waiting for a ride home for an hour longer than it should have taken, causing unnecessary stress. Another problem is what if you needed a computer, and you specially needed him/her? If they did have one then you have you did it in five minutes but how else could you contact them? You could try to call, but what if they are outside and are playing with his/her dog and don't hear the phone? Also these days if you are really grateful for something you go on google and type in virtual thank you cards. If the person gets it then they will be happy, but probably much more so if in the mail they got a handmade real thank you card, which shows more personal effort. My final reason that computers hurt us more than they help is addiction. Like I said in my first paragraph, everywhere you go you see somebody wired into an electronic device. People no longer go outside and play cowboys and Indians because now all they have to do is hit play on a video game. I will admit I too use my computer quite a bit but at least I budget my time so I can also go outside and play a while, which is healthier. Obesity also branches from overuse of electronics along with many other health products, making this a serious societal issue that needs addressing.

Has a computer ever helped you answer a hard question or type up an essay for school or for work? I know a computer has helped me for years, so why would I terminate it or want it gone? Here's the controversy: many experts believe computers don't benefit society, but people, such as myself, believe the exact opposite. There are many benefits to owning a computer, such as they're always a source of information, they allow you to talk online with others, and they can help people with their school and job loans. No matter what the problem, don't you believe a computer is always a source of information that could help? A computer has endless information on any topic, unlike books, which are limited by what is printed. This is because everyone, from the most to the least intelligent people, can share their opinions, ideas, and hard facts on a computer on the web. I once watched a movie of a man who despised computers and new technology. Thus, for most of his life, he wandered the world with no hint or clue as to where to go in search of a rare artifact called the diamond. He never found the diamond, but his son, who searched for it on the internet, found out the root "geo" from the name meant "underground" in the ancient culture. Due to a computer, he found the diamond underground, beneath the ancient temples. Therefore, I believe if people would embrace technology such as computers, they would find many things that they never thought of. Also, computers give you the ability to chat online with family and friends. Many people use computers to stay in touch when they have no available phones; with a computer, you could chat with your friend down the street or your family member on vacation in another country. No matter where you are, a computer can always be an available form of communication. For example, the only way many of our soldiers fighting wars stay in touch with their loved ones back home is by talking to them online with a computer. One thing I know is no matter how old you are, probably from a young age, if you have a job or go to school you have used a computer to help you with work. Whether it was getting an answer to a homework question or researching a person for a project, we all use computers. Computers even have the ability to help you make brochures or pamphlets. This can greatly help you advertise if that is something you do at work. Also, many people don't have the neatest handwriting, so they type their essay or letter to their boss; you can even choose what type of font it uses. No matter the case, with work a computer always helps. Yes, I do believe computers benefit society. Although some experts do disagree with me and believe they can become an addiction, I still urge you to take my suggestions seriously and continue to use your computer. Remember, it is always a source of information, you can chat online, and it helps with work and school, making it an indispensable tool in our modern world.

I believe that computers are a great invention. It lets people interact with people from very far off places, bridging distances that once kept families apart. It has lots of fun games you can play, offering entertainment for all ages. And it is also a great way to learn information on topics and places very far off, bringing the world's knowledge to your fingertips. Being able to talk to relatives from far away places is very important for maintaining close family bonds. A significant percentage of experts say that having a close-knit family will give kids a greater chance of going to college and succeeding in life. I understand why some people think, "well why doesn't the family just use the phone?" I grew up in a big family and just the whole day the phone was getting used, but a computer offers so much more. The computer has a lot of fun games that you can play, from simple puzzles to complex adventures. I see why you might think that the computer is why kids are over-weight, but isn't the real issue the hour spent sitting? It's often about eating habits and a lack of other activities. Studies show that computers are used in the winter two times as much as in summer, likely due to the weather. Going on the internet to learn new information is a great way to use your resources wisely. Just imagine this: a straight A student comes home for the weekend about to do the biggest project of her life but forgets to bring home the most important book. She is flipping out, looking all over the place and hyperventilating. But if you had a computer, your daughter would be able to get the project done and go to the college of her dreams. But since you didn't buy a computer, she is going to fail her class, not get accepted to Harvard, and settle for the local community college where maybe one day she will be able to transfer. So I've given you reasons to go out and buy a computer; you just need to go do it. Do you want your kids to interact with Aunt Sally who lives many miles away? Also, it is a great way to play games safely at home. And lastly, you want your daughter to go to Yale, or do you want her to fail? I have given you the facts; the rest is up to you to make the right decision for your family's future.

Dear committee, I do believe that computers can be positive. If you think about it, they can actually help you learn with all those different educational programs they have available. Say you need tutoring or advice on a difficult subject; you can basically find all that on a computer. Even if you have a little kid, I'm absolutely sure that they have websites and programs for them, and trust me, they're fun and educational! You know how people are complaining that computers are taking away time from exercising and interacting with family and friends? Well, what if you have family living somewhere else? You can chat with them online! And you can also find exercise routines and videos to follow while on the computer. I'm sure if you keep reading you'll know why I think they're positive. Having trouble in school? Are people blaming it on computers? Well, we can change that! If we're able to prove to people that computers can help us learn and are educationally valuable, then people might actually think that computers aren't bad. With all of this technology that we're coming up with these days, it isn't that bad. I'm pretty sure that they have some sort of tutoring program for every subject; they even have college courses online! Now there's something to look into. Do you have a kid, a younger friend, or even a younger brother and sister? Are they always looking for games to play? Well, I'm sure that they have fun learning games and websites on a computer! So, while they're having fun, you can just think of how much they're learning now! It's a real fun way of learning! You can just imagine what they're learning and how well they're doing in school because of it. Do you have family who live far away that you don't see much? Well, if you all have a computer, then you can possibly stay in touch easily! You guys can chat with each other, check up on each other, and see how everyone is doing. It's a perfect way to stay connected. Want to know what would also be a good way to connect? A webcam! You don't have to have one, it's just a suggestion. So that way, not only do you get to talk to them, but you can see them too. Isn't that cool? I don't know about you, but I think so. Well, now that you've heard what I've had to say about how I think computers are positive, I hope you think the same too. If you really think about it, they aren't bad at all. They're actually very helpful in many aspects of our daily lives, from education to family connection.

Dear Editor, I think that computers affect our country in a positive way. Three reasons why I think so are communication, news, entertainment, and jobs. One of my favorite things to do is talk, and when one of my best friends moved away and I lost his phone number, I thought we had no way of doing it. One day he requested me on Facebook, and from there on we have been communicating on websites like Facebook, Myspace, and Skype, which has kept our friendship strong. My second reason why computers benefit our society is news. At my dad's house I do not have a television, so I rely on the internet to keep me informed on what is going on in the world. A website was the first to announce a major celebrity's death before anyone even suspected it. Stories like that often break first on the internet, making it a vital news source. The third reason why computers benefit our society is entertainment. You can watch videos, play games, listen to music, and communicate with friends, all from one device. The last reason why computers benefit our society is jobs. Many jobs in our community require computer skills, such as an accountant, a manager, a software designer, and a computer programmer. The computer makes jobs and work more efficient by correcting mistakes, providing a visual aid, and allowing for fast typing. These are the compelling reasons why computers affect our community in a positive way, enhancing how we connect, stay informed, enjoy ourselves, and earn a living.

Dear Local Newspaper Editor, there is great concern about computers and whether or not people spend too much time sitting in front of the screen. I believe that people should be more aware of the time they are on the computers. Instead of ruining your eyes, you should be exercising, enjoying nature, and being with family and friends. Exercising is a major part of every person's life, and if you don't get enough of it, you could become obese. Obesity can cause people to not like you or think that you are a slob. Although you might say that you don't care what others think, in the long run it might be a mistake if you think this way. Exercise will most likely rid you of almost any type of discrimination because you will look no different or even better than the average person. If you ever get the chance, get a telescope and set it up in a spot where you can see the stars at night. Instead of keeping your eyes glued to the computer on a nice, sunny day, go for a walk in the woods. As you can see, nature is much more beautiful than hundreds of tiny dots of colors forming an image of nature. If you find an image of a beautiful plant, why not go and see or feel the plant in person? Many programs are now available on computers that let you see people, but wouldn't you rather talk to him or her in real life? I sure would, and I think most other people would as well. A large percentage of the population said that they would much rather talk to friends or relatives in person than on a computer screen. I feel that however possible, you should always talk to people in person and not through cameras and wires. I hope I have made myself clear that exercising, experiencing nature, and interacting with people in real life are all much better options than being in front of a computer for the rest of your life, and we should strive for a healthier balance.

Computers are today a common household item and some people think it's bad for society when in reality it's our most useful tool nowadays. It supplies an easy access to information along with preparing skills for future generations, and giving relief from life's sometimes too cruel days through gaming. Before computers, the world spent hours in books to find what they were looking for. The computer solves this. This is known as simple as typing what you need to know and hitting the enter key. This improves grades for children and life for adults, solving an issue without leaving your home and allowing news like yourself to spread at the moment it's known. It also creates an interactive place for anyone in the world with things like forums and question and answer sites; this allows us not only to ask opinions and compare responses but to get statistics that help us make life-altering decisions. Not only does it supply info, it also prepares our youth for the world. With things like educational software, children around the world can improve social and decision-making skills. It also teaches them skills like web and graphic design as well as simpler things like file management and tougher things like business planning. Along with all that, though, it gives love and comfort. Online video gaming is today a huge market which allows people not only to explore new worlds as they do anything from dance, build, fight, smith, tailor, and so on. And this, in fact, a majority of games are for all ages. It also improves at the same time hand-eye coordination. So when you have a rough day, gaming tends to bring people happiness. So computers are a necessity and put your mind to hard work but they can help you achieve your dreams with a little well-placed effort and limits.

It has come to my attention that there is an argument about whether or not computers have a positive effect on people. I think that computers do have a positive effect on people because with computers people can get needed information that could be used to help them, it lets people talk to friends and family around the world and also computers teach people new things. Therefore, computers have a positive effect on people. Students, whether it be at college or elementary schools, almost always go to a computer when they have to do projects for their classes; without computers students wouldn't be able to get the information that they need and it could cause them to get a bad grade on the project which could result in grades getting worse and worse. Adults use computers often for work and planning, so if there weren't any computers then it would mean thousands of people would lose their jobs and could forget scheduled plans that could be important and could result in causing families to lose money, not have enough money to pay bills and could result in losing their homes causing them to live on the streets. Every person has at least two or more friends or relatives that live in a different place in the world that is not easy to stay in contact with so it could result in having to use long distance calling which could waste a lot of money. However, with computers people can talk to friends and relatives from around the world without having to spend any extra money on phone calls to their friends and family members from around the world. Also if something happens to a family member or somewhere around where a relative lives we could use the internet to check in with them to see if everything is ok. Many parents are using computers to help teach their kids at an early age so they are ready for when they go to school for the first time. Also computers are used at schools mainly to teach the students about things that they need to know for the future, as a result computers become very useful to people when they are trying to learn how to do something whether its for school, college or a job; computers are often used daily for important things that we need to learn for our lives in the future so we won't need any extra help trying to learn how to do something. Also we would be able to help people when they needed help if we already knew what to do. As you can see computers do have a positive effect on people because people can use computers to help them gain the information they need for school or work, it lets you check in with friends and family from around the world and finally computers help teach us very important life lessons. In conclusion, computers have a positive effect on people and it could save a person from losing things that are important to themselves or others.

To the school board, Computers are a benefit to our society. These computers are an advantage to our learning and knowledge. By using computers students can get their work done quicker and more efficient. While typing your report on the computer you might spell a word wrong; well every computer has spell check. Also you might need to look up a word because you don't know the definition; all you have to do is go to a dictionary website and type in the word and automatically you have the definition. You might have been given a book report so you can go online and copy and paste, though teachers do not want you to, but if you had a piece of paper and your pen you could write it down. A computer has made the life of a school student so much easier. You might need a job but can't stand, walk, or talk well; you could get a job working on a computer. Computers allowed more jobs to be made and replaced. Without a computer how would teachers get mail sent to them without wasting paper? Sure a computer uses electricity but paper wastes trees. Anyway you think about it, the computer is a good thing to invest in. Going to college, not everyone has enough time in a day to drive to school, well with your computer you can go to school right online. So if you don't have money to buy a back pack you don't need one; your materials stay right where you left them. So a computer is a good invention. It has made life quicker, eco friendly and even has saved trees. On the brightside it has even produced many jobs. Last minute things can even be done online. Each computer bought has given someone else a new opportunity.

I believe that computers are helpful, and useful to us. They provide us with a wealth of entertainment, enable us to communicate with one another, and even help us learn. Today, if it's raining outside, or its too cold to do anything, you can go on to the computer, you can watch movies, play games, and webchat. The computer is a great machine, and health experts say "computer usage is fine so long as it's limited to about an hour or hour and a half a day". Some people complain that people aren't getting enough exercise because of computers. But its not really the computers fault that they aren't exercising. In todays modern world, you can call someone, text someone, or page them; with computers though, you can do even more, with a webcam, you can video chat with people, and send each other videos. You can also connect with your friends on facebook or myspace. Sociologists say that more and more people are connecting to social websites, and talking with their friends. "Social websites are great," one also said, "they enable you to talk with your friends when they're far away, or you just can't see them. However, nothing beats real connection." Computers also help us learn. They can answer almost any question you have, and have information on a lot. Today, most people don't rely solely on books. Some people still might think that computers are bad for you, and they cause lack of exercise, but I believe people have the choice to make friends. They choose to over use the computer, and too much of any thing is a bad thing. Computers today are an invaluable part of life, and are irreplaceable.

Dear Editor, As you know, more and more people are starting to use computers. In my opinion, I think the computer does benefit society in many ways. One positive effect it has on people is that they can communicate. Through the computer, people are able to send messages to each other. If someone doesn't have a phone or car, they can simply go online, write a message, and click the send button. This is an easy way to communicate with someone who lives half way around the world as well. If you have family members who live far away, you can also send them pictures of yourself, friends/family, and places you've been to. They can receive them and also send pictures back. Another positive effect computers have on people is that they can learn new things. The internet allows you search different topics and basically has everything and anything you could ever think of. If you go on a search engine and type in a word like 'dog,' you'll see a bunch of websites that will take you to other websites that are just about dogs. You can find a list naming types of dogs, how old a dog can live up to, where most dogs are found, how to care for them well, etc. The internet lets you explore new things and help find ideas. You name it; they got it. The computer also comes in handy when you have nothing to do. If you're bored and can't play outside because the weather is bad or you broke your leg, you can play computer games, listen to music online, or write your own story on a word document. Playing computer games can teach you techniques to help play a game better, as well as keep you busy. If you want to listen to music to keep yourself entertained, you can go on music sites or other sites and find any song you want to hear. It's better than listening to the radio because sometimes you don't like the song that's playing. If you're also in the mood to write a story, you can open a word document or if you just want to type whats on your mind. As you can see, I think the computer is a fascinating tool to use. You can communicate, learn new things, and keep yourself entertained if you're not able to do something active. Just remember, whenever you can, go out and play or hang out with friends and family.

Dear local newspaper, Technology is an important part of everyday living; even some people's lifestyle without technology, more specifically, computers, mankind would be lost. Do you like learning about faraway exotic lands and animals? Are you good at sports but would like to be even better? Do you ever miss your family that lives in other states? The computer can help you with all of this but is it bad for you too? In my opinion, kids and adults should use the computer. When people are on the computer they can learn about interesting far away lands. When you're on the computer you can look up some of the natural disasters. For example, people could google earthquakes and learn all about the people that have lost their lives. Then, the people that learn about it might donate some money to the poor or to children living on their own. They can also learn about all the wonderful beautiful lands that are out there waiting to be explored. Everyone I know likes to see the beautiful birds and animals. In the world, they will be able to do this on a computer. There might be so much more in these lands. Having a computer will also let you talk to people that are not easy to get ahold of. With having a computer, people will be able to talk to their family that live in other states. I have an uncle that lives in Florida. I only get to see him rarely because it costs a lot of money to come. Somewhere on the computer, it is easy to just send him a message that says how I'm doing. With a computer you will be able to talk to your friends who you can't talk to on the phone. For example, what if your friend did not have a phone? She cannot talk on the phone, so what do you do? This can help you talk to her. The last reason why we should have a computer is for hand-eye coordination. If you play video games for short periods of time then it will help you with hand eye coordination. This will help the kids that play baseball. They will know where the ball is at all times and they will most likely catch the ball more often, so playing a little bit of video games is not bad for anyone. Using the computer is good to do; not using the computer helps people be able to interact with people that are not so easy to talk to. So if you are completely against using the computer, then get up and use it right now to see its benefits.

As more and more technology is being invented, people use the computer to do work and to learn. But more time on the computer is not necessarily a good thing. People do not exercise enough, strain their eyes, and have less interaction with real people. One reason computers are having a negative effect on people is because they no longer get enough exercise. Take my friend John for example. He was a triathlete, who trained everyday so he could be in the Ironman triathlon in Hawaii next year. But then he got his computer. John had suddenly lost interest in exercise and spent his whole day checking his e-mail instead of training. But he is not the only person who has become unhealthy because of computers. Experts say that children with computers at home get only half of the exercise children without computers get. Children with computers also were more likely to be overweight and choose chips over an apple in a study performed at the National Institute of Health. Dr. Smith, who headed this study said, "Children are taught by society that computers can do such wonderful things and educate them. However, they are not taught how bad they can be for your health when used too much." Clearly, computers are a problem to our health. Another reason computers are a problem is because they strain your eyes. When my school had disabled people come and talk to us last month, there was a blind lady named Mary, who lost her sight because she was a workaholic and spent too much time on her laptop. But she is not the only one to lose her vision because of computers. Scientists at the Vision Lab in California said that one out of five regular computer users lost their vision within two years. One of these scientists, Dr. Evans, reported, "As more people begin to use the computer, more people seriously hurt their eyes or even lose their vision. We estimate thirty percent of this next generation will be legally blind before age forty." Therefore, this new technology is harmful and very damaging to our vision. A third reason people should not use computers is because they stop interacting with real people. My uncle, Robert, lives in Texas. We used to see each other from time to time and talk on the phone about once a week. That is, until he found out about the chat rooms and virtual worlds on the internet. Now, I haven't seen or talked to him in almost a year because he has created a new family on the computer and spends the whole day pretending he is a warrior and fighting dragons on the internet game Dragon World. But he is not the only person with this issue. It is proven that seventy percent of people who go into games like these or chatrooms lose interest in friends and family and their social skills worsen. Professor Johnson had this to say about how this is affecting children. "Too many children are finding out about these sites and getting hooked. They stop caring about school, sports, even their friends. It's alarming!" What reason could you have to use a computer after learning how bad it is for you and your children! Computers will bring nothing but grief to humanity. They are extremely dangerous for our health. They cause us to stop exercising and gain weight, permanently damage our eyes, and deny us of the proper socialization that all people need to be happy and healthy. Is this what you want for yourself and generations to come?

Computers are very popular these days. Many people use computers for research, jobs, shopping, homework, and more. Although some people think computers take up too much of our time and that it prevents society from interacting with friends and family, this is not entirely true. What's great about computers is that you can chat with your friends and family online or even have a video chat with them. So, you're never really avoiding your friends and family; you are connecting with them in a modern way. Another thing that is great about computers is you can research anything you need to for projects, jobs, homework, and things for school, etc. The top websites people use for resources are Wikipedia.com and NationalGeographic.com, etc. Computers are also great for typing out reports, making powerpoints for jobs and projects, and so much more! Anything you could think of is most likely found in a computer. As you can see, a computer is so helpful and is a great resource. Having a computer at home is much better than taking a trip down to the public library; it saves time and money from taking all those trips and you get your own personal library by getting a computer. You never know what new technology could bring, making life even more convenient and information more accessible for everyone.

Everyone will agree that using computers is also a good choice because you do meet people you don't know. Also you learn more stuff you don't know about the world. Not only that but you can also learn more about technology itself. Most people would say that meeting people online is good because you can have fun talking and getting to know new people. Also, people would want to learn about other people's cultures and traditions. Some people would want to know some personal or business information about people they meet. Even people want to know where some people are from originally. People like to know these details to build friendships and understand the world better, and computers provide a wonderful window for such discoveries and connections.

Dear Members at the Medical Association, a letter to Dr. Ray, "Computers have helped me further my medical research. I can search up so many things to help a patient and keep all my important information organized." How can you question a leading doctor? I agree with Dr. Ray and say that computers are good use in society today. People were already becoming lazy because of television. You can't blame it on computers. With websites such as Facebook and Skype, people can keep in touch easily. They can make plans with one another to go for a walk in the park or go dancing. These things can keep people healthy, active and in tiptop shape. Computers help people keep in contact with others. "My patients can email me to schedule an appointment and let me know if they think something's very wrong with them," says Dr. Jane. With computers, you can email distant family and friends to learn if there are problems quicker. Most people tend not to pick up the phone if someone calls during a crisis. You also don't have to worry about running up your phone bill; you can just video chat with a bud instead of using up an hours worth of minutes. You can learn so much more information faster. How would you feel if no one called and told you your best friend died or your mom, and you had to find out by reading the newspaper? You'd be extremely upset. I know I would be. With email, you and your family can stay in touch with old, new, and now friends. So if anything bad happens and a person didn't know how to tell you, they could email you. It's so much easier than telling a person that their mom died by calling them on the phone. To hear pain in a person's voice will make you want to cry; you feel their pain. So, now do you understand that computers are a great benefit to today's society? You can't blame computers for people becoming lazy, since television was already doing that. If a person wants to be lazy, then that's their decision. You shouldn't go around blaming others and things when it's no one else's fault but that person's. This is a great way to keep in contact with others. Plus, think of all the information you can learn, not just about family and friends, but the world too. Thank you for taking the time to read my essay and I hope you can see things my way and recognize the positive role of computers.
