Dear town, as you know, computers are a part of our lives, but is their influence positive or negative? Computers can be a great thing; they can show you different parts of the world and breaking news, and they can help you decide your next vacation. They could help you talk to family and friends. What would our lives be without them? Well, our lives without computers could be difficult in some ways. However, computers do have negative sides, like spending lots of money on them all the time. They often need to be fixed, which is costly. People can use the computer too much and they forget to exercise. That can lead to weight gain and health problems. Also, you can waste lots of energy using them. A bad part about the internet is chat rooms; if you talk to the wrong people then you can be in serious trouble. Overall, computers are a key part of our world and they can help decide our next vacation trip, but they can also contribute to making us fat if we are not careful.

Many people think computers are bad or that we spend less time outside because of them. But are they as bad for individuals to use as people say they are? In this instance, a sense of moderation would be helpful. When you think of computers, what comes to mind? Games? Social networking? What if computers are doing more than that? Last year, a computer helped diagnose a concussion of mine and helped figure out I've had several others. Not to mention the computer did it quicker and more efficiently than a regular human could. An expert says that computers diagnose anything, not just concussions, much more accurately than doctors. Even social networking has a positive aspect. This has let people, who haven't seen each other for a long time, reconnect and become good friends again. With the positive aspects there is always a negative. Computers have started to make kids obese. This is a problem in the country because if we become lazy then we could ruin our health. In addition, if we become too reliant on computers for diagnosis, what happens when they get faulty? These are problems that are very real and aren't being addressed adequately. If we can't deal with these problems first then computers will turn out to be a bad thing. Lastly, moderation could be extremely helpful for us today. For example, instead of using social media for friends next door, go outside and play a game with them. Social media was made to reconnect with friends far away, not across the street. Similarly, instead of totally relying on computers to diagnose problems, have them and the doctor work together to find out. Doing this will get great results and keep doctors prepared if the computers don't work. These are just a few examples of how moderation could be very helpful to everyone. In conclusion, having no computers wouldn't be a great idea because of how much they help society, although being totally dependent on them is a bad idea too because overuse does not have that much benefit.

Dear local newspaper, have you ever wondered... scroll... did you know that only the male coqui is the only coqui that sings? Some facts are easily found on the internet. The computers make researching easier; just imagine not having to drag home those gigantic books home or having to constantly find information in them. First, the computer teaches us hand-eye coordination. Second, we can learn about faraway places. Finally, we can make friends from all over the world. When the ball goes right out of the park! The plastic object with a screen, computers, teach us hand-eye coordination. It teaches us this by making our eyes stay on the screen, while our hands are on the hard, smooth keyboard. Children need hand-eye coordination for ball-playing sports like baseball, basketball, soccer and more. When you're in high school and play sports well, you might get scholarships to go to college. College is important because it has a big role in our life so we might earn great jobs. Learning about faraway places like Paris, Tokyo and so on is very interesting, unless you are learning about it through books, which can be dull and boring. The internet has taken over our research and it is relentless and without hesitation. The internet takes less time than going to the library and checking books out. Also, skimming through paragraph after paragraph on the computer is much simpler and faster.

Dear school board, my personal opinion on computer technology is that it is extremely bad for you, and we need to take precautions and worry about eye protection, virtual harassment, and that there are dangerous people on the internet. Eye protection is important. Although computers are useful, they are hurting our eyes by the screen being too bright and causing strain. Also if you look at the screen for too long it could make your eyes tired. I can tell you from personal experience that glasses are un-cool and some people get picked on for it, and that could happen if your eyes get hurt so you cannot see as well as you did before. It could lead to needing glasses or even risking going blind. Virtual harassment is another thing to be aware of. Over the internet you could be cyberbullied by kids you may or may not know. For example, one day you could be on a social media site and be talking in a chat room and kids could make sexual, homophobic, or even just plain rude remarks. Which brings me to the issue of sexual harassment. Sexual harassment is extremely damaging and can make people feel unusually bad about themselves. Kids take pride in calling others bad names regarding their race, their gender, or even the gender they like. So take extra precaution when seeing sexual harassment. Sexual predators are a parent's biggest fear for their kids. Sexual predators are everywhere, on various websites, apps, and social media, or even your neighbors, and while kids are running around town looking and acting the way they do, they are extremely unsafe. This is why you should never put any personal information on the internet; not your address, not your birthday, not your cell or house numbers, nothing, not even your town. Also sometimes it is a little dangerous to put your last name. So be very careful on the internet. When you see sexual harassment, or someone being followed by a sexual predator, report them and be safe.

Dear Newspaper, I strongly believe that computers do not benefit society. I believe this because when you are on the computer you spend less time exercising. Secondly, computers make you forget about enjoying nature. Finally, interacting with family and friends is important, and when on the computer you don't do much of that. Please read on to find out what I have to say about computers. Using a computer has a lot of downfalls, but one of which is the lack of exercising while on the computer. As you may know, many countries are becoming obese because of the lack of exercise. Computers are no help to this problem. The only exercise computers contribute is for the hands and fingers, but even that is bad because if you are typing and on the computer for too long you will get carpal tunnel in the fingers and hands. An expert on health said one in three people go on the computer for more than one hour a day, which could lead to obesity. This leads to my next paragraph. When on the computer there is no enjoying the outdoors. Enjoying nature is important to every man or woman's schedule. On a computer it's impossible to enjoy nature because all the computer is is a time-consuming, brain-washing thing to do. Nature helps save the brain. Without that then you'll be very exhausted all the time. Did you know a small percentage of kids go outside every day? That means a large percentage of kids are inside on the computer. This leads to my final topic. The computer may have sites where you can talk to friends, but that is nowhere as good as seeing them in person. Your family is important so you need to spend time with them. My family always does stuff together like board games and what not. With computers there would not be any time with your family because everybody will be on the computer playing games instead of spending time with your family. In my conclusion, computers have an extraordinarily bad effect on society because it exhausts time for exercising, also limits time to enjoy nature, and finally people spend too much time on computers and too little time interacting with family and friends. Thank you for reading my paragraph on the many effects of computers.

Dear Editor, My name is John and I am concerned that people around the world use computers too much during the day. Some computers are bad because there are glitches in the computer, and everyone has a Myspace, and Myspace has viruses that leave a virus in your computer, causing it to shut down or go slow. Also, people can hack your computer without you finding out, and everything that was on your computer can be sent around the world. People can know your most sacred secrets and more. Finally, you can get caught making movies on your computer and go to jail, and your business will be out for everyone to see. These are serious dangers that come from using computers too frequently and without caution, which is why I feel it is important to share my concerns.

Dear Editor, Computers have really made an impact on society. Some people think they have made a good impact while others think the opposite. I believe that they are a good thing in our lives and have made a drastic, but great impact. Some reasons that support my opinion are that computers are basically what helps us keep in touch with people, they make it very easy to find needed information, and they make our school lives faster and much simpler. First of all, computers are pretty much how people keep in touch. There are many ways you can keep in touch over computers. There is video-chatting, e-mail, and chat websites such as Facebook, Twitter, and Skype, etc. There are many people that really enjoy having the ability to keep in touch this way. It is a step up from talking on the phone. On the computer if you are web-chatting, you can not only talk to them, but you can see them! When it comes to chatting websites such as Facebook, there are millions of people who belong to this incredible website and love it. Kids and adults really enjoy having access to something like this. For me, since I moved to another state and had to leave all my friends behind, the computer has saved some of my relationships that I thought I would lose but didn't want to. I can e-mail my friends, and even see what they look like and how much they have changed on Facebook. Computers are a very helpful piece of technology that have helped me, and so many other people keep in touch. Another important reason computers are a wonderful technology item is because they make it so easy to find needed information. From what a word means, to the directions to get to a specific location, the computer can help with all of this. I talked to my mom and she said, "Computers just make finding all of the information I need to know about your brother's diabetes so easy." Finding information in books can take so long. You have to go to the library or a bookstore, find the book you need with the correct information, and then you have to read through the whole book to find the information needed. On a computer, you can just Google what you need to find, and read the article or map, etc. Computers have made finding information a breeze and everyone loves how simple it is! The last reason that supports my opinion is that computers make our school lives faster and much simpler to deal with. In school, there are times when we need to write a very lengthy composition, and it will take forever to write. With a computer, typing up the composition would probably take around half the time of writing the composition. I took a survey of three kids that typed a composition and three kids that wrote it. I asked each of the kids how long it took them. The kids that wrote the paper said it took them around two hours. The kids that typed the composition said it took them around an hour. Also, when things are typed, they are usually easier to read which makes it easier for teachers to grade, and won't take as long. Computers make school easier for students and teachers. The opinion that computers are not a benefit to society just doesn't make sense. Yes, I know that there can be some disadvantages. But think of all the advantages compared to the disadvantages. There are a lot more good than bad things. Without computers, people would be incredibly stressed, and have a hard time making life easier. Computers are an amazing benefit to society. Everyone should agree with this because people stay in touch because of computers, computers make it very easy to find information that is needed, and they make our school lives easier and faster for students and teachers. Computers have made an extremely large impact and changed our ways of life for the better!

Dear Local Newspaper, I have become concerned because lately a lot of people have been using computers a lot. My concern is that they haven't been exercising much, they aren't enjoying nature, and they aren't spending much time with their family. This is not a positive way for their life. In my opinion, exercising is a very, very, very important thing to do. This is because you need to maintain a healthy diet to stay healthy and you need to exercise. Some people I know don't exercise and they are either overweight or not healthy. People are "busy", as they say, using the computer to do all their work because they just don't like using the old-fashioned way, which is going to your job and doing your work. Everything is different now and people have become lazier than ever before. Would people be lazy if computers weren't around? Of course they wouldn't be. They would have a happy, healthy life. Now-a-days, people don't go out and explore the world much; they just go online and they search a place up on Google. They don't see the real thing though. They see pictures and everybody knows that seeing the real thing is way, way better than looking at a picture. But I guess everyone forgot about that. Computers have everything online, no wonder people don't want to leave their homes, and if they do leave, don't worry they have a laptop with them. Computers are even portable, so wherever they go they're still going to go online. People have also spent less time with family because they could talk to them online in a chat room. This isn't a good thing because what if you were talking to your "mother", well at least you think it is your mother but it is someone else, and you're talking about something private and that person on the other computer will know about that and can cause problems for you. You know what I mean? Like if you were talking about your credit card and that person asked you for your credit card number and you gave it to them, then they could cause problems. Online isn't a safe place, that's why you should talk in person, not on a chat room. Well I hope that you put my letter in the newspaper so people could exercise, see nature, and be with family, like they were when they didn't have computers around.

Dear Newspaper, Have you noticed that nowadays more and more people are becoming overweight? Well it's true. People say that it is because of eating a lot of fast food but I think that since we are always on the computer and not exercising, it helps contribute to it. Also as the technology is getting better it is keeping people from going outside and enjoying the beautiful nature. Sitting in front of the computer isn't going to help our environment. Lastly, kids aren't getting out of their house to interact with friends and family because technology has been able to let us communicate without leaving our house. I'm not saying that we should downgrade our technology, but we need to find a way to limit it. To start off with, technology has a role in the increasing rate of obesity. Some @MONTH1 say that people choose not to exercise but if we limit things then they won't have to choose. As a kid myself, I love to be on the computer. My parents are always trying to get me off the computer and take the dogs for a walk and I always say "I'm busy" and it's true; I don't really like to go outside because I have a computer to play games or talk to friends and to be honest exercising to me seems important but I don't do it because I'm always on the computer. I think that other people could feel this way so that's why we need to limit the computer. Secondly, global warming is occurring right now and people would rather be inside on the computer than go outside and enjoy the nature. Sure, you can look up ways to stop global warming, but does it mean you are going to really do it? Some might not because they could just stay on the computer and keep "looking up" ways to help. Another thing is that when we use our computers, we use electricity, which adds to global warming so if we limit the use of computers then people could go enjoy nature and not destroy it. Lastly, internet sites like myspace, @CAPS4, @CAPS5, etc have allowed us to communicate with friends and family but we are still not able to get out and interact with them. When we get out and interact with our friends we gain skills like communication, teamwork and respect; friends and family can teach you this in person, but through the computer they can't. Also interacting with your family and friend might let you go to new places that you haven't been before and on the computer you can't go there. Interacting with friends & family is better than talking through the computer. In conclusion if we stay on the computer then we won't get exercise, enjoy nature or interact with friends. So we need to act now and limit computer usage!

Dear Newspaper @CAPS1, I think that people spend way too much time on the computer these days. They get less exercise, don't get to enjoy the nature around them, and they don't get to interact with their family and friends! If people stop spending so much of their day on the computer, then they wouldn't be having too many issues. People need to spend less time on computers and spend more time exercising! You don't tend to want to get up or do anything else when you're on your computer, right? Well that needs to change. Dear local Newspaper, As you know, many people are starting to buy and own computers. Some experts say this is a bad thing and that we should spend more time outdoors. I disagree with this statement. I'm sure being an amazing newspaper company, you could use a way of easy communication. Finally, communication with friends. These are many programs for this, such as Facebook and Myspace. Also, if you need more info on something, you could look it up online. Like if you are writing an article on dolphins, you could learn more about them. In conclusion I think computers are good things. They help with everyday life, they are good for communication, and last they help at school or work.

Dear local newspaper editor, Don't you love having the internet at your finger tips? Recently, it has been bought to my attention that some experts are concerned that people are spending too much time on their computers. I firmly believe that this is correct. My three arguments are its not healthy, the friends you meet up there are cyber friends and bad things might occur. First of all, being on the computer too much is not healthy. This reminds me of my friend named Becky. Becky used to be humorous, outgoing and play a lot of sports. One day, her mother bought her a laptop. This laptop was blue and white-her two favorite colors. She was on it all day and all night. She took it with her everywhere she went. Well, it got to the point where she stopped the sports, gained some weight and the sadness crept upon her. She was in a depression mode. She went to the doctors and they told her that she had to give up the computer and play with it for only two days a week for five hours only. She listened to the doctor and it took her about three months to get back to the fun Becky she used to be. Being on the computer too much can harm you and the people around you. Second of all, the friends you meet on the internet are called cyber friends. You don't know who they really are, where they really live, or their real age. They can tell you anything they want because they know that that's a little fantasy world. That is mentally not healthy. It is very important for human beings to be socially active. Being on the computer too much can harm your brain also. Third of all, bad things might pop up. If you are the type of person who is on the computer every chance you get like Becky, it is not good for you or the device. Being on the computer can harm even the computer itself. Well, you've read my arguments and ideas. Please take them into consideration for the well-being of our community.

Computers, Computers, Computers! That’s the first thing a teenager does right when they get home from school. Teenagers just can't wait to chat with their friends on Facebook and instant message. There are a lot of positive and negative things about computers. In these paragraphs below I am going to give you my opinion, tell you how people can manage their time better and the effects it can have. My personal experience with computers is that they have so much information but sometimes it can be too much. Today, a lot of children and teenagers are getting bullied. People can send horrible messages to someone. They rather do it on the computer because they don't have to say it to their faces. That is one thing that I don't like about computers is that people can get harassed. Other than that I think the computer is a great resource for learning about things and also connecting with people from your past. Not a lot of parents want to see their child coming straight home from school and go right to the computer. Parents have to be strict with their child when it comes to computers. They need to manage their time so they can also do their homework, after school activities etc.... Studies have shown that children who go on the computer every single day for more than two hours are most likely to see their grades drop. That's why if you mange your time it wouldn't be a problem. You want your child to have a balance in their life, so manage the time where they are not on it all day long. There are positive things about the computer and as well as negative things. The computer is a great way to research people you are learning about in school and find people from your past; for example, Facebook is a great way to stay connected to your old buddies. Google is also a great tool because you can type in anything and it will give you a hundred websites to chose from. A negative effect about it is that people are likely to say things on it to other people that they wouldn't dare to say to their face. It also prevents you from doing other things because you get so consumed about the computer you forget your main priorities. In these paragraphs I gave you my opinion on computers and how there are positive and negative things about them. I also explained how it can take up your time with your main priorities in life and how to manage your time wisely. The computer is a great tool but don't take too much advantage of it because it is not a priority.

Dear Newspaper, I think that computers have a good effect on peoples' lives. You can do a lot of stuff on the internet that costs too much to do without it. You can study different foods and cultures around the world. If you play games online you can get better hand-eye coordination skills. There are also things you can buy to video chat with family or friends. The computer is very convenient and useful. If you are interested in a place in the world you can type in the name of the place and get facts about cultures, foods, and more. Instead of buying an airline ticket to see France, you can go online to learn the language. You can also study foods that people eat and the clothes they wear. You can also learn sports and games. If you play games on the computer you can get a better hand-eye coordination. Most games you can download are free. There are puzzle games that challenge you, action games that are fun and take rapid button pressing, and adventure games that let you explore new lands. And in a lot of these games you can talk to people and make friends. There are other ways to talk instead of games. There is email, chat rooms, Facebook, Twitter, and video chat. With any of these things you can talk to friends or family around the world or in your state or country. All of these you can either download, go on the internet for, or buy them. You can talk to old friends or you can talk to family you haven't seen in a while. With video chat you can see each other, with Facebook you can share pictures and in chat rooms you can talk with multiple people. In conclusion computers are very convenient for our society today. Whether it's studying the world, having fun, or talking to people you know, the computer has many wondrous things for people.

What is technology? Technology is defined as anything that helps enhance our way of living. Technology is all around us. Our beds, houses, televisions and even chairs are all forms of technology. There is one form of technology however, in my opinion, that has revolutionized modern day living as we know it. This form of technology is called the computer. My outlook on the effect the computer has had on our society is quite positive. Just think of all of the things we rely on this device to do. There is one thing, however that really sticks out in my mind; communication. The computer is perhaps the greatest form of communication the world has ever seen. E-mail is basically sending a letter to a friend without the hassle of mailing it out where it might get lost or stolen. E-mailing is two simple steps: typing and sending. Not only does it lower the risk of the letter not getting there, but it is also much quicker. You hit the "send" button and before you know it, a new letter is sitting in your friend's inbox. Another method of computerized communication is my personal favorite, instant messaging. Instant messaging allows you to have a conversation with someone that could be miles away. And it's okay if you decide to go get a soda while you are instant messaging because unlike a real conversation, that isn't rude. These are just two methods of communication that the computer enables us to have. There is a variety of others that, much like these two, enhance our way of life. I believe that the main reason the computer has enhanced our life so much is because of one giant thing: the internet. The internet makes everything we do on the computer possible. If I want to go on the computer and do research on a topic, the internet takes me where I want to go. With millions of different websites, the internet has endless possibilities. If I'm interested in arcade games, I can go on the internet and play them. If I have to write a science report, then I can go on the internet and collect research. If I want to listen to music, then I can go on the computer, look up a song, and listen to it. And guess what? If I'm looking for a funny video just for a good laugh, then the internet can find me one! The internet is perhaps one of the greatest things ever invented. It's just another reason to love the computer and the incredible convenience it brings to our daily lives.

The computer is able to do so many things. I think computers have positive effects on people. But some experts believe they don’t, which is why I'm writing this paper so that I can explain the positions from both sides. Did you know most everyone who has a house, their chances of having a computer is just as likely as having a telephone. Computers, believe it or not, help us in life whether it is to keep information, talk online, find a good recipe or whatever it is we need. That is why computers are so positive. If we did not have computers there would not be any of the technological advances that we have today, making the computer one of the most important devices. Let me share my experience. I had a job interview, right? Well, I could not find that street so I went on my computer and it gave me the directions. I made it to my interview. That's why I think computers have positive effects. Now the opposite side says people are spending too much time on their computer and less time exercising, enjoying nature, and interacting with friends and family. Well, I think some people spend too much time on their computer, but that is completely their own choice. And those are people who usually don't have a lot of self control. And exercising? Who said that everyone needs exercise? If the person is already skinny, what do they need to exercise for? For the interacting with friends and family, you can still do that. I mean, how long can a person look at a computer screen? So in conclusion you can see that computers are good, but with self control they can be enjoyed with no bad side effects. So next time you are on the computer, enjoy it but remember your friends, family and your health are more important and deserve your time and attention as well.

Dear Future Employers, I, as a computer user, think computers are helpful in many ways. They help get new information. They help function machines. They help people learn new things. All the machines that we have to use and had to run by hand now run by computers. That is good in some ways and bad in another way. They help make more product in less time. Today more cars are being made in less time; if you've seen scenes of car factories you saw the assembly line with mechanical robot hands putting them together and that is using computers. Dear School Administration Committee, The effects computers have on people can be hurting our society or it can also be helping society. As a middle schooler growing up, I believe using computers can be beneficial at some point but it is also damaging our society. First of all, the internet is full of inappropriate content. Illegal uses are involved and can draw in anyone with just a single click of a mouse. Anyone in the world can use the technology we have today to "hack" or trespass someone else's computer. Anybody can download songs or documents illegally for free, rather than paying for it themselves. In fact, not only can someone download inappropriate content right onto their screen, they can also be inflicted upon with graphic words or view a website that involves videos with drug use, criminal acts, vulgar language and more. A recent study on internet use from the Center for Internet Safety includes that "cyber bullying" has a history of a result to suicides or depression in teens. Cyber bullying is a form of bullying where someone can chat or instant message someone and hurt their feelings. Not only is cyber bullying an issue, however, people can now talk to strangers on the internet. Think about how awful it would be if your child had given out their private information online and a man who said they were the same age as your child received it and lied about their age, sex, appearance, and location. Now that man can track your child down and possibly kidnap or hurt them. Secondly, the internet can also be very unhealthy and can create you to become less social. According to a recent study at the National Institute of Health, a significant percentage of children or teenagers that result to internet use can create a weak relationship with friends and family members if they use the computer too much. It can be very unhealthy for someone, and not just teenagers, to use the computer for an extended amount of time than they should. People can gain the effects of laziness, little brain effort, and lose interaction with the outside world. Finally, my foremost reason on how computers can be negative is how addicting it can be. From my own experience, I used to stay up late for hours using websites such as social media because everyone else was using it. Sure, it can be entertaining and fun but using the internet won't be so much "fun" when your academic grades are at risk and you stop communicating with the outside world. Addiction can draw anyone in against their willpower. My own brother became so addicted to computer games that he played one game straight for twelve hours straight. You can get addicted to one subject until you lose everything else you have. The internet can be great in moderation, however it can be inappropriate, unhealthy, and addicting. If technology becomes too powerful in our civilization, how can we learn to interact with our humanity? More and more people become involved with technology and frankly it can be quite horrendous in my opinion, so we must learn to use it wisely and with caution.

Dear Local Newspaper, Computers are used everyday by millions of people. I believe that the technology of computers have a positive effect on people. I think computers have a positive effect on people because people use them for research, such as for school projects or learning new skills. People use computers to communicate with people far away, keeping in touch with family across the country. Computers are even used as a news resource, providing instant updates. In my opinion, computers make things easier. Computers have a positive effect on people because they are very helpful. You can use computers to research different things. If you have a computer, you can learn new things about places you never knew existed. For example, if you have a homework assignment, you don't have to use a book to get information, you can just use your computer. So, for those reasons, I think computers have a positive effect on people. Computers are always being used for several things. However I think people used computers the most for communication. On a computer you can communicate with friends and family members that live in other states. Instead of sending letters to people by mail, now a days people use e-mails and instant message. You can talk to people faster this way and it's much easier. Computers have a positive effect on people. It makes some things in life much easier. I don't understand why they would have a negative effect on people. It's the year 2024, and computers are used for basically everything. Remember how we used to have to read the newspaper to find out about breaking news and important things? Well, since we have computers a lot of people don't read newspaper. On the computer you can read the whole newspaper, and even find out more about things that happen in our world. So what's the point of even reading the newspaper, if you have a computer? I believe computers have a positive effect on people's life because you can do anything on the computer. You can research information, communicate with people, and use it as news resource. Doesn't that make life a lot easier? So why do some people think computers have a negative effect on people? The benefits clearly show their positive role in our daily lives.

Dear Local Newspaper, Using your computer daily can be a waste of your life. Your computer time can take away from your time spent exercising and enjoying nature, distract you from human nature things such as communicating, and can also waste tons of energy. Picture yourself, sitting at your desk, talking to some friends online. Take away your computer and all you're doing is sitting there, not burning one calorie, or exercising one muscle, except your fingers of course. Don't you think you should be doing something more useful in your life? Such as taking a walk and enjoying nature? That's what I thought. Nature is beautiful. So why enjoy it through a window next to your desk? Obesity is a problem in America. A significant percentage of adults are considered "fat". Why would you even think about spending your day simply sitting in a chair? Go to the gym and lose some of that extra body weight! Communicating through instant messages is so over-rated, people can't express their emotions! All they can do is send a smily face or happy face. Communication with only your friends can cause you to miss out on things. For example, lets say there is a cancelation at your work place on the news, but you didn't see it cause you were chatting with your friend. LOL? Many people don't even "laugh out loud" when they send that to their friends. Plus you might even go to your friend's house and instead of laughing, you'll say LOL. And instead of gasping, you say, "OMG!" I mean come on people, get out and really "communicate" face to face. So, you bought one of those new lights? Too bad you're not even saving any energy by using that computer of yours daily. Using that machine, uses about the same amount of energy in as several regular light bulbs in a few hours, so is that light really saving you that much money. Haven't you heard? The economy is bad, which means we don't have a lot of money which means YOU playing online games is wasting energy, which is wasting money. Someones going to have to work overtime this week, and it's not me. I don't think hair spray is the cause of the layer being destroyed... Computers are bad, and don't have a good enough reason to be used. They take away enjoying nature, reduce your communication levels, and not to mention, waste a lot of energy. Therefore, my point is made that their negative impacts are significant.

Dear local newspaper, Imagine staying inside on a beautiful sunny day, people inside on their computers instead of enjoying the weather. This is what could happen if people are using them. As I mentioned, everyone who is using a computer on a daily basis, will drop their communication skills. People enter chat rooms not knowing who they are talking to. For example, if I logged onto a chat room, someone might ask for personal information such as where you live, your phone number and your name. This could lead to things such as kidnapping and even rape. Also, interactions with family members and friends may decrease. You can be playing a computer game, online, or going on youtube to watch random videos of people. YouTube is said to be a dangerous site for younger children. Kids could go under history to go to a website they were recently on when click the wrong one bringing them to an inappropriate website. Finally, teenagers and adults go onto facebook and twitter. Some might say these sites may change the social interactions, but it really isn't. Kids and adults are constantly getting addicted to it. Also telling people what you are doing every moments of your day everyday is kind of unreal. People don't need to know when you do things in your day I have keep up this our communication skills are sure to decrease. Secondly, exercise is a problem. Doctors say that a large percentage of their patients are obese or over weight according to health organizations. Kids just sit at home and play computer games such as Sims 4 and video chat with their friends instead of hanging out with them. No one really goes for walks any more either. Also, people don't go out and enjoy nature like they used to. A state representative from Colorado in the US said, "each year the number of people are getting fewer and fewer. Pretty soon all parks are going to have to get closed down." We don't want this to happen, do you? I know I would not. Our generations are just becoming more technology enhanced. Finally, more and more people are becoming unhealthy. A person's eye sight is most likely to drop if they are on the computer everyday. My aunt is required to use her computer everyday at work. She went to her eye doctor because her vision was becoming weaker. One of the first questions he asked was, do you use a computer on a daily basis? she answered yes. He said she would need cataracts eye surgery. This was all in result of using a computer. Finally, you could get arthritis in your hands and fingers from typing and using the mouse all the time. Many people at the age of forty are probably going to need hand surgeries from all the work they do, like typing! As you can see technology is harming your communication skills, exercise and your health. I bet you don't want your future generations like this. So take a part and contact your local newspaper today to voice your concern.

Dear Editor, I believe that computers have a negative affect on peoples lives. Computers occupy a lot of people's time which could be used for other matters. The internet also contains a lot of inappropriate content that children should not be viewing. But above all, there are too many pedophiles online preying on young children. These are all ways that computers have a negative affect on peoples lives. Computers occupy so much valuable time that could be used for other, more important matters. The childhood obesity rate in America is climbing. There is no doubt that electronics play a huge role in this event. For example my brother plays on the computer everyday, so he barely goes outside. He has allowed the computer and the internet to occupy his life, leaving no room for anything else. Also there is a lot of harmful content. Ranging from a song to websites containing pornography. Most sites don't even alert you that you need to be eighteen or older to view the content, and very little actually ask for proof. There are millions of sites containing such content. It really is a pressing matter and needs to be deal with. Above all else, there are millions of creeps on the internet, preying on children and young teens. Its truly disgusting. There are millions of chat sites in which people can meet and talk. Pedophiles go on these websites under an alias, pretending to be teens and children. Their motive, to lure young teens into meeting them in a secluded location, and to commit rape. Some victims are brave enough speak up but sadly, most are too afraid or ashamed to do so this is all made possible through the internet. For these reasons I say that computers have a negative effect on people's lives because while some positive aspects exist, sadly the cons outweigh pros such as the before mentioned occupation of time, harmful content on the internet, and the danger from online predators. I truly believe that the planet would be better without computers.

I think we can all agree that computer usage is a very controversial issue. In my opinion, I believe that computers have a negative effect on people. For instance, it's not safe and children can get into all sorts of things on the internet, from inappropriate content to interacting with strangers. Also, people spend too much time in front the computer nowadays; it's a major distraction and also a negative effect on kids' school work. It's now or never! Do we decide that computers have a negative effect? You decide! Isn't every parent's biggest concern the safety of their children? When on the internet, kids are capable of accessing anything and everything. Sometimes kids don't even look for bad things, they just pop up as unwanted ads or links. Would you want your child viewing things that you have no control over? Also, websites like social media platforms are one of the greatest concerns when it comes to internet safety. Although you are supposed to be at least thirteen to have an account, most kids lie about their age. Did you know that a significant number of social media users lie about their age? And it's not always a twelve year old saying they are sixteen, it could be a forty year old saying they're fifteen! Not only do people lie about their age, they lie about who they are and their intentions. Is this the kind of internet exposure you want for your children? Put a stop to this right now! More than a third of children are overweight and unhealthy. This is another negative effect computers have on people. It's a gorgeous summer day. Bright blue skies, cotton candy clouds, the sun is shining, and there's a nice warm breeze. Perfect day to go out and get active, right? Wrong! Many people would rather be inside on the computer. Instead of going for a walk, people would rather spend hours on Facebook. This is a serious concern to our health. People don't exercise enough as it is, and then when you add computers, people will never get active! Instead of playing video games online, people need to be reminded that turning off the computer and playing a fun neighborhood game of baseball is just as fun and much more beneficial. This is just one step families need to take to get a healthier lifestyle. Wouldn't you agree? Did you know that kids that spend more time on computer are more likely to do poorly in school? Surely, if nothing else will convince you of the negative effects of a computer this will. Rather than coming home and doing homework, more time is spent in front of the computer. As a student, I will admit that the computer is a very tempting distraction and can easily pull a student away from their studies. You can't expect a child to make the right decision and tell their friends they have to go because they need to study. So you must! Take action now, or your child will definitely suffer. The time has come to decide. Do you believe computers have a negative effect on people? It's clear that the computer is not safe. Not to mention, too much time is spent on the computer instead of being active. Most importantly, computers will negatively affect children's grades. Don't wait another minute! Let's agree and do something about this!

Dear Sarah, Computers are very helpful in daily activities, but computers have a bad side. Some users are addicted to their laptops or smartphones; they are away from friends and family, and they are not exercising. It is fun to use the internet but you should not use it too much! Some people are almost addicted to their devices. I can't blame them; they can charge their iPod, tweet, listen to music, play games and much more all at the same time! Computers are great, but using them too much can make you miss out on tons of activities. People almost feel, and some do, that they HAVE to go on Facebook to harvest their crops in FarmTown, or control their virtual restaurant on a game. They get so wrapped up in it that they miss out on their important daily activities. It shouldn't be that way, but it has become an epidemic; everybody is being sucked into their computers! People who are on their computer all day are away from their friends and family! They think, "Oh, I haven't talked to him since his surgery; I wonder how he is! Let's see!" They go online. You can talk to someone in just a click! Talking to someone on Facebook or Twitter is not the same as talking to them in person! It's like people think computers are a substitute for real life. Devices take people away from their friends and family and they talk only on Facebook. When people are on the computer they become lazy! A person who is a computer addict will say, "I'm supposed to go to the gym but let me check my Twitter first!" Two hours later then they go to the gym! People don't exercise as often as they should! When people are going to lay on the computer for thirty minutes it takes three hours! They have to sign in, chat with their friends, check their mail, look at their tweets, look at their restaurant, check out videos on YouTube and do all other kinds of things! Computers are good but have side effects: getting addicted, being away from friends and family, and not exercising. Computer addicts should minimize their time on the computer to lead a more balanced and healthy life.

Dear Newspaper, Many parents are worried that people are on the computer way too much and don't spend enough time outside enjoying nature or exercising. I wrote this letter to tell you that there are some good things about going on the computer. First, kids and even adults can talk to their friends online. You're probably thinking that the kids already see their friends at school, but what if their friend moved? They could have moved to a different city, state, or even country and the only way to connect with them is by computer. They can't call each other if they are really far away; that would be a pretty big phone bill. Seventy five percent of people talk to their friends through a computer. About half of the people are talking to friends who live in another state or country. Do you really want people to lose their friends? Next, people can actually make new friends on the computer, like pen pals. Pen pals are people you write to, but they don't live in the same state as you or sometimes not even the same country. It can be an assignment at school, but you can do it on your own. If your pen pal doesn't live in the same country as you and doesn't speak fluent English, you can teach them English and they can teach you their language. Finally, there's a way for kids to go on the computer without overusing it. You could set a limit on their computer time. If someone wants to play a game on the computer instead of going outside, you can play on the computer for a set time. If the child wants to go on the computer the next day and throws a tantrum, the parent should take the computer away for the next day, and so on. Once your child finally cooperates, they will get the privilege to use the computer. As you can see, there are many things to do on the computer, from talking to far away friends to making new friends, all while maintaining a computer schedule. Thank you for taking your time to read this letter and consider a more balanced view.

Dear Local Newspaper: Did you know that over half our nation owns home computers? Recently, though, some experts have been concerned whether or not computers benefit society. I have been asked to state my opinion and I believe computers have a positive effect because they are mandatory for work, allow online socialization, and expand traveling opportunities. After reading this, I am sure you will agree. Firstly, computers are mandatory to have for work and school. Students keep their essays, study guides, and homework updates on files in the computer. Offices would not be able to function without computers; workers rely on the internet email system. An interview with a student from the local high school says, "I use my computer for everything; I would not survive the workload without it." When asked why, he replied, "It keeps everything organized, and is an easier way to research topics." A lawyer said, "You cannot support a client if you don't have the right tools, and a computer is one of those tools." Clearly, without computers offices would crumble and students' grades would drop. Could you imagine writing a newspaper without a computer? Secondly, internet access allows people to meet new people. Many websites such as 'Facebook' and 'Twitter' allow people to reconnect with old friends and make new ones. A large percentage of the nation owns accounts on socializing websites, and a majority of the nation says their friend groups have expanded to online groups, according to a poll taken. A psychologist explains, "Some people are too shy to meet new friends in person; they bloom online." Without the internet, citizens in our town would know little about other countries' people. My next reason, however, is even greater. Lastly, without the internet, people would do far less traveling. The internet allows citizens to research places they would like to visit and buy transportation tickets to their destination. It also is an easy and effective way of booking where the tourist shall stay. A poll taken by major airports shows that most travelers book their flights online and without online ticketing 'the wait to book your flights would be unbearably long; or stop travelers completely,' according to a quote from a worker. My people and I went to various airports and train stations across the country and interviewed numerous people. We inquired about how they bought their tickets and a vast majority of them said online. "What do you mean, how? On the internet of course! No one could get anywhere if we stood in lines all day!" said a person interviewed. Airports make money for the local government, and without the internet fewer people would travel. Therefore, computers are mandatory. Computers have a positive effect on owners since they allow easy organization and research, online socializing, and better ways of booking transportation. Without computers and internet access, our businesses would crumble, and then the economy would follow. I know you agree with me on the essential role of computers.

Dear Editor, The advancing technology is showing a very negative effect on people. Because of computers, people are spending too much time on the computer and less time doing things that are better for them. First, spending too much time on the computer can be bad for your health in many ways. For example, looking at a bright computer screen for more than thirty minutes at a time is extremely bad for your eyes. The brightness damages your eyes and can lead to severe loss of vision over time. Also, if you spend all of your time indoors and on the computer you will not get the exercise you need. Editor, were you aware that for every hour you are on the computer you should spend some time outside? It is very important to get fresh air, sunlight, and exercise for your physical well-being. Moreover, another problem with computers is that you don't get as much interaction with people. With online chatting you can't know what the other person is feeling like, Editor, or if you are even talking to the person you think you're talking to. It is much better to interact with people in person, face to face. To have good social health you need to hang out with friends, and laugh, and have a good time, not sit in a dark room and talk with online friends. Editor, people need to interact with real people to develop meaningful relationships. Furthermore, computers can be very distracting to many people. Dear Newspaper, Computers have advance a lot since they were first made. Some people see computers as a way to rot your brain, while others see it has a learning device. Although computers have a negative effect when it comes to children, they have more of a positive effect because they give people the ability to learn about far away places and allow people to talk to each other online. To start off, computers are bad because they can be used as a way to babysit a child. When you're on the computer you're just sitting there staring at a screen with pictures and words on it. Some parents use the computer as a way to keep their kids quite, instead of taking the time to go outside. By growing up in an enviornment like that the children only know how to play on the computer. Kids have a lot of energy, and they need to do something productive, not play computer games and talk to their friends. All school day they talked to their friends, they need to be with family doing something to keep them fit and healthy. By using the computer as a babysitter, you as a parent are leading your child to obisity because all they do is games, and they aren't properly taking care of their body. On the other hand, computers give people the ability to learn about far away places and people. If your teacher gave you a last minute writing essay on ancient Egypt that was do in a week, what would you do? You can't fly to Egypt and ask the local people what you want to know. That would be a waste of time and money. And if you go the library and they don't have any books, then you're in trouble. But by using the computer you can find endless information about ancient Egypt, and you could finish that essay in a day if you wanted to. Also, if you were going to Japan, but you knew nothing about the country you wouldn't be very confident about going. And you would feel like a tourist. But, if you went online and searched for Japan, you could find the traditions, the clothing, and so much more. Lastly, if you wanted to know more about a famous person who isn't around anymore, you could go on the computer and find pictures and what they did, how they became famous, and so on. Finally, computers allow people to talk online with other people. Say your grandma lives in Florida, and you can't call to often because your phone bill will get to high, what do you do then? You talk online since you both have computers and it won't cost you to call. For example, my grandma and grandpa both live in another state. When we call there it costs a lot because they're so far away. When they got a computer, we each bought a webcam and called them everyday on Skype. Now, not only did we talk to them, but we also get to see them too. If your friend didn't have a phone and you really needed to ask them for the homework, you could go online or on aim or facebook and ask them. You know you can always get an answer because everyone is always on the computer at some point of the day. Although computers have a negative effect when it comes to children, they have more of a positive effect because they give people the ability to learn about far away people an places, and they allow you to talk online with other people.

After reading all the facts surely one would agree that a computer is a great tool that should be used. It lets people communicate, helps in educational decisions, and you can learn many subjects such as math, science, and language. I strongly believe that all people should use a computer.

Mom!!! Did you know that the human body has only one liver!!!, Mom I didn't, where did you find out, on the computer. I recently heard that some experts are concerned that people are spending too much time on their computers and less time exercising, and enjoying nature. I don't think that they should be concerned because the computer leaves people with an open mind and teaches people new things. So the computer does a lot for people, gives them the chance to learn new things, a chance to chat with friends far away, and also expand your mind of travel. Computers can do a lot for a person's life of knowledge. Just yesterday I found out that the human body can not survive without its liver. The computer also helped me with my struggles in math, even though that's what the teacher is for she is not always there, like when I am home or away on vacation and I just want to remember some things in math. It also helps people who want to know new languages such as Spanish, French, and German. So you see a computer has a big affect on a person's life. Two days ago I did a video chat with my grandparents back in Italy it was great. After six years not seeing my grandparents they really changed, and I was starting to forget what they looked like. I never knew that a computer could do a video chat from so far away I was surprised. I don't know why you experts are so concerned about computer taking away people's lives look what it has done for my family. I know that if one of you experts family member went away for a long time you would miss them and want to talk. Some people love to video chat like people in the army because they get the chance to see their love ones. A two-way ticket to Hawaii, to see all those beautiful sights and taste their wonderful foods look at that waterfall where is that, In Jamaica, wow now I have to go there. The computer has shown me places that I have never seen before. The computer is a wonderful thing. So don't be concerned about us and what we do on the computer. In conclusion don't listen to the experts they don't know what they're talking about, for all we know they use the computer more than we do. The computer can teach you new things, give you the chance to chat with family and friends far away, and open your mind on travel. The computer is not a bad thing all it's doing is making life a little better step by step.

Dear Editor, I believe that computers are a good source of technology. The reasons which I am fighting for tell why, kids are in school more than half of the school day. Parents should be limiting their childrens use and what they do, and computers are a way of contact and research. To begin, kids are in school more than half of a school day. How could children stay on the computer when they're in school learning? They can't. In school you get a lot of exercise because you're always moving around. After school kids usually do homework or go out with friends. Computers don't have a bad effect on people, if anything it makes them smarter. Secondly, if children have a computer at home their parents should be limiting the time and what exactly they could do on the computer. The people who support advances in technology are correct, computers open up imagination, and learning. Parents of the children that have computers should be more worried than anyone else and if they are, they should just take the computer away. Parents should also take their kids places more often so the child will not have to go online. Lastly, computers are a way of contacting others. If you don't have a phone, you use a computer to go on your email, or personal websites. Also people need computers for school work and for their jobs too! Another thing numerous people use a computer for is research and reports. We need our information! To conclude, my thoughts are very important to consider because, many other people would be shy to write this and get it published in their local newspaper! I would like to say computers are not interfering with family, friends, nature or anything of that sort. We as a whole need computers to do daily life things, without being able to go online, or save files we would be lost! So I will say again to consider my ideas. Thank you.

Dear Editor, I have several reasons on why I think that advances in technology are harmful to our society is because it opens doors to strangers on the outside world. It also takes you away from family and friends. Lastly it also takes you away from enjoying life outside of the internet. One of my several reasons on why I feel advanced technology is harmful to our society is because it opens doors to strangers for teens, adult's and etc. The problem with this is that you never really know who's on the other side of that door, that chat room people can misguide you into thinking they're someone who they're not. For example there's a show called Dateline. This show is about how young teens put themselves online and grown or young men click on a picture of you and that opens up a chat line or as I say opening a door, you don't know who's on the other side of that door. So these men online make these teens trust them and make them feel safe then they ask "hey can I come over sometime?" and this young teen thinking that's your friend says yea sure. Don't forget you don't see his picture so he comes over and most of these men are looking for a quick fix. If you know what I mean. This is what goes on during Dateline t.v show just imagine how many other kids or teens are out there doing the same thing the difference is they don't get caught. Secondly on why it is harmful to our society is because it takes you away from your family and friends. It takes you away from your kids and family because they will start to feel as if you love that computer more than them. It takes you away from friends because they might say hey let's go out to the mall or for a drink you'll probably say you need to check up on somethings online. This will slowly move people away from you, all over a computer you will start to lose the people most important to you. My last reason on why you can harm society with technology is because it takes you away from living your own life and doing things you wanna do like online is a bunch of stuff that everybody else says is cool. Do what you think and feel is cool. For example if someone posted something saying five guys London is so cool you gotta go there but you've always wanted to go to Paris, another thing is that you don't get to have enough air outside and your skin will get pale and icky and this is why I feel that way. In conclusion although some people might think that advanced technology is good well clearly they're wrong because they open doors to danger, take you away from friends and family. Also it takes you away from what life has to offer.

Do adults and kids spend too much time on the computer? Well I don’t think they do. Sure they use it a lot but still it's for entertainment. Kids need to use the computer because it's another way for them to communicate with each other. Texting is good but it costs money, so does talking on the phone. If someone doesn't have texting they can go on Facebook or something to make plans to do something with a friend. What if it's a rainy day outside and there's nothing to do? Well that's what a computer is for. Kids use the computer for entertainment. There's tons of games to play. All on different websites of course but that's beside the point. There's MMORPG or RPG those are two type of games I can think of. Computers are like a kid's own virtual outside world. Computers are also needed to do research for school projects. Also to get pictures. Sure there are books but they don't always have everything you're looking for. You can't cut pictures out of books. You need a good grade on a project. Therefore computers need to be used a lot for communication, entertainment, and school projects.

My opinion is that people should have computers in their homes. Computers should be for important things like searching for jobs and managing household finances and other things. People can do their work in the computer. It is also useful to teach your children how to use a computer or let them go on the internet so they can search for kids stuff. However, people shouldn't spend all their time on the computers and spend less time with their families and friends. I think people should spend more time with their families and their friends then spending it on the computer. But a lot of people use computers almost everyday. Probably your family are worried about people spending their time everyday in the computer. They can show their friends how to type in the computer and teach them some stuff about the history. Do you think that people should allot more time with their families and be happy about it when they are spending time with their families. I think people shouldn't use the computer when they have a visitor over their house; they don't want their visitor to think you are attracted to the computer. They should give people the ability to learn about faraway places and to learn things about the internet. But not everyone agrees that people should use computers because people can get attracted to it and people don't want that to happen. And families are concerned about that a lot of people use this kind of stuff. Other people think that this is a great idea to use a lot of computer and spend more on it then their families. So do you think that people should spend more time on their families and friends then paying attention to the computers. It is a question that each family must consider for themselves to find a healthy balance.

Dear readers, I think that its good and bad to use the computer to much. On the good side, computers help us with many tasks and provide a lot of information. They can be very useful for work and for learning new things. On the bad side, using the computer too much can mean we spend less time with the people around us. It can become a habit that is hard to break. Some people might even forget to go outside or to talk to their family because they are so focused on the screen. Therefore, while computers are powerful tools, we must be careful not to let them control all of our time and to remember the importance of real-world interactions and personal connections.

Dear Local Newspaper, I agree that computers are good for society. Without computers a lot of things couldn't be done. Computers are sometimes the easy way out, and that’s why I love them. Computers almost make anything possible. Now say if you're an elderly person and you can't get up and your body is really bad, well all you need is a computer. You can pay your bills online or you can get a job online or even shop online. All you need is a computer. Computers are also good if you're lazy. You can just lay in bed all day and go online to work or to the mall and order things; all you'll have to care about is personal hygiene. Sometimes computers take a lot of stress off you. No more ignorant co-workers or no angry boss; everything is a-okay. Computers are also swell because it's the easy way out. But you have to make sure you get a good computer, not an old one because it can breakdown. That's one reason why computers aren't so good. But as I said, computers are very good; they might be a little pesky but once you get the hand of them everything is gonna be alright. Remember, you can do almost anything with a computer, making life more convenient in countless ways.
